name: Zauber-Zoff
description:
Zauber-Zoff is a fantasy card-game best played with 3-4 players, about a kingdom falling apart Each player is playing one scoundrel trying to amass as many riches as possible by winning battles (rounds).
Since most of the 100 cards are unique and have interactions with other cards, each game is very different - and new situations arise every time you play. Since everybody draws from the same pile it might seem that it is more about luck than anything else, but a good player will probably best his mediocre opponents in three out of four games.
So summon Elves, Goblins, Kings, Princes, Ogres and Dragons to loot Rings, Treasure or take the royal family for ransom.
Playing in rounds, you either aim to win a round, just screw things up for the one who does win and/or try to just get as many new cards as possible for a whole gang of critters for you to play in the next.

—description from the designer

name: The Everrain: The Under God
description:
Description from the Back of the Box;

This expansion introduces The Under God, the architect of the Everrain, to be used as an optional replacement end game boss to the Avatar of The Under God. The Under God comes with its own unique set of Elder One boards, with a host of new dark powers and abilities to combat. From unfathomable depths, the nameless one finally comes to finish its work...

As the Avatar heralds its arrival, it was only a matter of time before the Old One itself arrived on the earth to claim its prize! Upon a great creature it rides, nestled in it's stone throne where it has sat for time immemorial.

The Old One offers a new boss to try and beat when playing the Everrain. The Old One behaves differently than the Avatar and has its own unique objectives to defeat it!

The Old One token begins the game at the end of the Discovery Track, and it represents how close the Avatar is to rising from the sea and destroying the world! Ordinarily this token rarely moves, but if enemies begin to gain the advantage and are allowed to run amok, the token will begin to descend down the track. If the Enemy and Old One tokens ever meet, then the Avatar awakens and appears on the game board!

The Avatar has its own board, which describes the effects that it has on the game. These are things that players must be wary of doing, because each time that the player triggers one of these effects, it brings the Avatar one step closer to arriving in the world.

For players to have a chance at winning, they have to trigger the endgame. This is done in one of 2 ways:

1. Reaching the end of the Discovery track - If players can do this, they have gathered enough knowledge to now attempt to subdue the Avatar. This is known as the Slumbering Objective

2. Defeating the Avatar - If at any point the Avatar is summoned, the end game immediately is triggered and players must defeat it somehow. This is known as the Arisen Objective

In both cases, once the endgame has been triggered the Avatar board is flipped, and the player's objective is revealed
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Four Against the Titans
description:
A stand-alone solo/coop pen and paper adventure game based on Greek mythology.
—user summary

Four Against the Titans is a pen and paper adventure game designed for solitaire or RPG-lite co-operative games. Set in ancient Greece in a time of myths and legends, players choose heroes from ten different character types to complete mighty quests and battle creatures such as centaurs, harpies and maenads, all in an attempt to defeat the titans and forestall the destruction of Greece.

Based on the Four Against Darkness series of dungeon delving adventures, Four Against the Titans is a standalone game. You don't require any other rule sets to play this game.

—description from the publisher

name: Infinity: Third Offensive
description:
A new book for Infinity. In it we can find all the details of the Third Offensive. Is Paradiso on the ropes? What’s the new threat to the Human Sphere? Enjoy the new rules, new Sectorial Armies and Fireteams.

This book covers the events that took place on the planet of Paradiso and makes clear that the alien threat is becoming very tangible and real. The Combined Army is not going to surrender, and Paradiso is only a bump on the road towards conquering the entire Human Sphere. In terms of where it lands within the Infinity narrative, it takes place directly after the events of Campaign Paradiso.

Paradiso lives up to its namesake: an astonishing paradise full of exquisite flora and fauna. In the past, this planet was inhabited by an alien race, though not much is known about the native sentient species. Their presence still lives on by the way of vast construction sites that can be found all over the planet, known as cosmolitos. It’s widely believed that these structures were the treasure that first caught the attention of the EI.

The high commanders of the various factions of the Human Sphere are trying to stop the EI from entering their systems by installing sophisticated blockades, but the Combined Army is managing to overcoming them with increasing frequency. In Third Offensive, you can read how they’re managing to smash through the different blockades and jeopardize the human hegemony on Paradiso.

The real objective of the EI will be also unveiled in this book.

What’s in the book?

As already stated, a lot of new background material that develops the narrative of the Infinity Universe, and it also provides several new locations to set the stage of our favorite wargame.

In addition to this, two new sectorials will be added to the roster of new releases - the unyielding Invincible Army of Yu-Jing and the Varuna Intervention Division for PanOceania. These will join the new armies most recently added with Operation Coldfront (Tartary Army Corps for Ariadna, and Operations Subsection for ALEPH)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: New York Slice: You're Full
description:
You're Full - Place this on a stack of eaten slices. That player may not eat any more slices.

Given out during the 2018-2019 New York Slice convention tournament series.

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #39 – Vehicle Pack #4
description:
Warfighter WWII Pacific - Expansion #39 Double Expansion of the Korean War Vehicles! - Adds 112 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This is a Vehicle Soldier and Hostile pack with new Hostiles Vehicles and Soldiers Vehicles to play as. (South Korea, U.N., North Korea and China)

Cards included are:

10x S Korea Vehicle Cards
12x N Korea Vehicle Cards
10x UN Vehicle Cards
12x China Vehicle Cards
15x S Korea Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
18x N Korea Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
17x UN Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
18x China Vehicle Hostile - Elite Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Infinity: Spiral Corps Army Pack
description:
Spiral Corps is a mixed mercenary company with a core of experts and professional troops from the Tohaa Trident as well as a contingent of human mercenaries offering their experience as alien hunters.

This set contains the miniatures, rules and terrain you need to start collecting a Spiral Corps Sectorial Army and introduce you to the Infinity universe.`

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Second Sun Control
description:
Pre-made deck for Magic the Gathering, intended as a starting point for players who want to play Standard and/or Friday Night Magic. Part of the 2020 Challenger Decks set. Similarly to other pre-made decks, it includes 60 cards. Differently from other pre-made decks, Challenger Decks also include a side board made of 15 cards.
The Second Sun Control deck includes white and blue energies. In the tradition of Control decks, it focuses on negating the main maneuvers of the opponent in order to win the game in the long run.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Esquire
description:
So, you want to be the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court? Well, that is long road for a lowly First Year law student. You will need climb the partnership ladder, schmooze clients, and . . . well, win some cases, of course. All you need to do is advance 11 Levels, through 11 increasing areas of Practice, while engaging in 22 different Cases and acquiring up to 15 different Skills. Sound like a lot to track? Nonsense! It is all contained on ONE page. You roll. You write. Hopefully, you advance . . . or at least survive another Friday . . . on second thought, better dust off that resume. This takes the One Page In A Life Series (OPIAL Series) into the realm of reality . . . sort of . . . .

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Servants of the Abyss
description:
An Abominable Intellect rises in the Blackstone Fortress, attracting more hostiles from their dark hiding places. Are you ready for the challenge?

These models were originally released in Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress. They are perfect for use as hostiles with the Abominable Intellect cards, which increase the difficulty level of your quests in the Blackstone Fortress, or as models in a Warhammer 40,000 Chaos Army. Rules for using these models in Warhammer 40,000 can be found in Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress.

Contents:

2 Chaos Beastmen with a choice alternate torsos. Supplied with 32mm round bases
1 Chaos Space Marine with a choice of a bare or helmeted head. Supplied with 32mm round base
1 Rogue Psyker with a choice of two alternate bodies. Supplied with 32mm round base
2 Ur-Ghuls. Supplied with 32mm round bases
2 Negavolt Cultists. Supplied with 32mm round bases
2 Spindle Drones. Supplied with 25mm round bases
7 Traitor Guardsmen. Supplied with 25mm round bases


—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: 18NYC: The Great American Subway
description:
18NYC is an underground railroad building and investment game set in New York City, New York. 18NYC is a game in a series of loosely-related games collectively known as 18xx games, originated by Francis Tresham with 1829.

Unique to 18NYC are three corporations with their own colors of track. There is also a government railway, the New York City Transit Authority (NYCTA), that may form as well.

Each phase color also has a deck of event cards which are drawn from at the start of each OR.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Necromunda: The Book of Ruin
description:
Rebellion is a poison that runs deep within Necromunda. Each time it bubbles to the surface, industries wither and populations perish, corrupted by false promises of freedom and power. Only the iron will of the Imperial House maintains a semblance of order.

Delve into the dark nooks and crannies of Necromunda where insurrection festers. Learn about the Corpse Grinder Cults, Helot Chaos Cults and Genestealer Cults and their plans to wrest control away from Lord Helmawr for their own insidious ends. Discover new Hangers-on and Hired Guns that can help you with your plans for sedition. The book also includes six alternate Uprising Campaigns and a whole suite of arbitrator tools to help with the running of a campaign and ways of enhancing individual scenarios.

This 128-page hardback book contains:


Rules and background for the various cults, both alien and heretic, that have taken root across Necromunda
New Hangers-on: Cadaver Merchant, Heretek and Agitator
18 scenarios that reflect subversive forces taking control of a hive
6 multiplayer scenarios
A collection of tools to help an Arbitrator enhance players’ experience of scenarios and campaigns
Updated Trading Post
Rules and background for these Hired Guns: Queen Lorsha, Eightfold Harvest Lord, Abomination of Badzone 12, Hermaphage Magos, Alice Shivver, Jorth Slither and Vandoth the Fallen


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Tramways: Busan/Halle Merseburg
description:
Expansion for Tramways:


Busan map with an airport and special rules for the parks (green areas)
Halle Merseburg with a long already printed line that each player can use to cross the city.

name: Village Attacks: Convention Exclusive Organised Play Pack
description:
The Convention Exclusive Organised Play Packs were available to purchase at Grimlord Games booths or their website during conventions. These packs contain:

10 new missions
Printed copies of all crossover material for Dark Gate Games' Dark Ritual
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Widget Ridge: The Ghost that Stole Lightning
description:
Widget Ridge: The Ghost that Stole Lightning, a Story Pack for Widget Ridge, adds new card types to the game.

Characters: allows players to start as a character from Widget Ridge with unique abilities and starting cards.

Locations: These cards are shuffled into the Marketplace deck. When a Location is revealed, it remains on that space, and a new Marketplace card is placed on top. The Location card acts in every way like a blank space, except it has an additional effect. If a Location appears on top of another Location (in the same space), discard the oldest Location. Location cards cannot be melted unless a card or effect specifies.

This pack contains 11-cards:
2 x Character Cards (Amelia & Maximilian)
2 x Custom Beloved Widgets
4 x Custom Gadgets
2 x Location Cards
1 x Goal Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction

name: H.D.P.: Religiones y otras Supersticiones
description: Thematic expansion focused on "Religions and other superstitions".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: H.D.P.: Política y otras Estafas
description: Thematic expansion focused on "Politics and other scams".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Vs. System 2PCG: Webheads
description:
Vs. System 2PCG Webheads is the final story arc for the 2020 The Verse storyline. This expansion brings spiders from the we-known to the obscure. Superior Spider-man, Spider-UK, a spider-powered Gwen Stacy and more! You’ll get 3 new Main Characters and 8 new Supporting Characters. These cards will support the Spider-Friends and Sinister Syndicate teams.

Expand and upgrade your decks with characters from across the Spider Verse today!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
description:
The Space Marines are numbered amongst the most elite warriors in the Imperium. Created by the Emperor himself from the genetic material of the demigod Primarchs, they are the ultimate soldiers for a cruel and terrible age. Inside this 208-page hardback codex, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Space Marines in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

The history of the Space Marines, with a look at how these genetically engineered warriors annihilate the enemies of the Emperor with terrible force
A Space Marines bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
Rules for Space Marines units that are available to every every First Founding Chapter, their Successors – including more diverse Chapters such as the Space Wolves, Blood Angels, Dark Angels – and the Deathwatch
Rules for creating your own Successor Chapter Tactics
Rules for upgrading your Characters to members of the Chapter Command – Chapter Ancient, Chapter Champion, Chief Apothecary, Master of Sanctity, Master of the Forge, Chief Librarian, and Chapter Master
Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Litanies of Battle, Psychic Disciplines, Chapter Relics, and optional Secondary Objectives that define the ways that the Space Marines wage war
Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Space Marines
And more!


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Into the Lion's Mouth: The Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 -1849
description:
Following the British victory in the First Anglo-Sikh War (1845 – 1846) the Lahore Durbar, the Sikh Government of the Punjab, effectively came under the control of the British East India Company. In April 1848, two British officers were sent to the prosperous south western city of Multan to take over the running of the province from its governor, Diwan Mulraj Chopra. They were murdered by soldiers of the city’s garrison, apparently acting spontaneously and without the prior knowledge of the startled Mulraj. Nonetheless, after some prevarication, he supported their actions, and thereby found himself the leader of a rebellion against the British.
There were few Sikhs in that part of the Punjab: the garrison was mainly Muslim, and the Mulraj was a Hindu. Because of this, the East India Company regarded the uprising as a purely local affair and sent troops to lay siege to Multan in the expectation that this would quell the rebellion. These included a large body of Sikhs, supposedly loyal to the British, under the command of Sher Singh.

It is now late October 1848. Coming to sympathize with the Mulraj’s grievances against the British and to appreciate how these are shared by the Sikhs, Sher Singh has changed sides. His men have withdrawn from the siege and are marching north east towards the Punjabi capital, Lahore. Sher Singh’s father, Chattar Singh, has also rebelled against the British and is besieging the fort at Attock which guards the road to Afghanistan. Inspired by the defiance of Sher Singh and Chattar Singh, anti-British disturbances have broken out in towns and cities across the western Punjab.

In response, units of the British East India Company are assembling at Firozpur where they will become the “Army of the Punjab”, under the command of Lord Gough. Gough plans to march against Sher Singh before he is reinforced by Chattar Singh. The monsoon season has ended. Campaigning can commence. So begins the Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 – 1849.

Into the Lion’s Mouth is a two-player beer-and-pretzels game which gives players the opportunity to replicate the British success in re-establishing control over the Punjab, or to re-write history by leading the Sikhs to victory.

—description from the publisher

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – Skeletor on Panthor
description:
So, you already have that muscle brained buffoon and his furball feline? They are no match for me, the Lord of Destruction, and my trusty companion Panthor. Myahahahha!

Skeletor on Panthor Miniature Set is compatible with the up and coming Masters of the Universe: Fields of Eternia Board Game. This 32mm scale miniature is a one-piece resin model (no Glue required) and comes with an in-game rule card in English.

Model comes unpainted.
Item is available in Europe only.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action/Event, Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Team-Based Game

name: Yankee ASL Nor'easter Pack II
description:
3 New ASL Boards and 15 scenarios designed by the Yankee ASL'ers, a group of ASL players in the Boston area. This scenario pack has no particular theme and stretches from a Polish scenario in September 1939, through the Korean war in 1950, and the French Indochina war in 1954.

This is a follow on to the 20th Anniversary Scenario pack which was produced in 2016 for tournament play, but this time the pack was produced and sold by Le Franc Tireur.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Champions of Midgard: Polyhedral Dice Promo Tiles
description:
Military and economic promo tiles that were sold with a limited-edition custom made complete polyhedral dice set.

The two promo tiles are:

Varangian Guard: Roll the die on this tile and collect Viking dice based on the result. Every round this tile is not selected, replace the die with the next larger polyhedral die. (The Varangian Guard was a Viking military unit that served as personal bodyguards to the Byzantine Emperors.)

Taflkast House: Roll the die on this tile and collect Glory equal to the result. Every round this tile is not selected, replace the die with the next larger polyhedral die. (Taflkast is a Viking dice game.)

name: Skellington
description:
Skellington is a may-follow trick-taker played with dominoes. The relative strength of the suits may change from trick-to-trick but the players’ choices will dictate how the strength will change.

You can play any tile you wish, in whichever orientation is best. Each tile is worth the difference from its highest number to its lowest number (e.g., a 6-1 tile is worth 5 tile points).

There are 71 tile points to capture each round (a bonus tile point is awarded to the last trick winner). However, only the side that takes the majority of these points will score victory points.

name: Trigahex
description:
Summary:
- Trigahex is a strategic abstract card game for 2-6 players.
- Play individually or in a team.
- Suitable for ages 8+.
- Players can choose the length of play by deciding how many Hexagons win the game (1, 2 or 3). Approximately 10 minutes - 40 minutes.

The Playing Cards:
Trigahex includes three Triangle coloured decks of cards (54 x Red, 54 x Blue and 54 x Green).
Each player or team chooses a colour to play with.

The Object of the Game:
The first person or team to create the winning number of Hexagons wins the game.

Win a Hexagon by placing 6 of your cards together to create a Hexagon shape. All the cards in the Hexagon MUST have your chosen playing card colour in the centre of the card.

Before you play:
Decide how many Hexagons to play to win the game (1, 2, or 3).

The first player places a card in the game area, Players then take turns to place a card adjacent to the card/s placed. The colours on the edges of the cards MUST match the edges of the cards they are placed next to.

Try to create your own Hexagon/s or stop your opponent from creating their Hexagon/s.

If a player places a card that has a White Triangle in the middle, they also pick up an action card.

The 'Trash' action card:
A player trashes a card from the game area and it is returned to the bottom of the draw stack.

The 'Replace' action card:
A player replaces a card from the game area with a card in their hand. The edges of the card must match any cards in the game area. The replaced card is returned to the the bottom of the draw stack.

The 'Stack' action card:
A player stacks a card from their hand on top of a card in the game area. The edges of the card must match the edges of any cards it is adjacent to. The card underneath remains and is stuck in the game area.

-description from designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Matching, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game

name: An Adventure on the Card
description:
Roll and write that tries to diver a dungeon crawler solo game experience that fits in the back of a business card.

The player tries to defeat a monster, fighting or running away each turn. But, as he fails the attack or decides to run, the stress increases since there are limited options to do this. Decisions can be hard, although the game is very simple. Push your luck mechanisms and dice rolling provide uncertainty and deliver simple and meaningful choices.

This is a free-to-play roll-and-write game. Print the file or draw the squares and play it immediately. The author developed this idea during a conference when waiting to deliver his communication. Because he had no card to give when he attended Essen Spiel 2022 as Press. An Adventure on the Card is an example of how analogue games can be applied to anything and anywhere.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Goblin Vaults: Chaos & Order Promo Card
description:
The Chaos & Order Basic Goal Card was given to the purchasers of the first edition via the Thunderworks online store.

Chaos: Score each chamber and each tier with cards of different values.

Order: Score each tier with 4 cards whose values form a sequence in ascending or descending order.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Promopack
description:
Pack of 3 Promocards for:

2 for Dodos Riding Dinos

"Dodorado Götze: Füge zu Beginn jedes Rennens die Fähigkeit eines anderen Läufers zu deiner hinzu, bis zum Ende des Rennens. Wähle in jedem Rennen einen anderen Läufer."

(At the start of each race, add another Racer's abilities to your own until the end of the race. Choose a different Racer for each race.)

"Identidätskrise: In dieser Runde müssen alle anderen Läufer entsprechend ihrem Geschwindigkeitswert zurückgehen, anstatt vorzurücken."
(During this round, the other Racers will move backwards based on their speed values, instead of going forward.)

1 for War for Chicken Island
"Leeroy Chicken: Dein Hühneranführer erhält +2 Stärke and +2 Rüstung während er auf dem Gebiet eines anderen Spielers steht."
(Your leader gains +2 Strenght and +2 Armor while in the territory of another player.)

name: HeroQuest: Knight Fall
description:
In Knight Fall, detailing an important event that launches into motion the events that will take place in Rise of the Dread Moon. This thrilling quest is packed with exciting twists and turns – you won’t want to miss it! We recommend you play this quest before embarking on the adventure contained within the Rise of the Dread Moon expansion. Enjoy!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Grid Movement, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Role Playing, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: tummple mix
description:
A highly challenging version of Komarc's award-winning tummple! This time there's 3 different size bricks (6 different sides), yellow tumps, white tumps and now RED tumps.

In addition, there's a new Brick Shuffling Mobile App with timer and point calculator. Download to your phone and press START! The Shuffler App will indicate what brick to grab and what side to place, or what tump to use... the timer begins automatically... only 3 to 9 seconds to make your move! Quickly make the placement before the time runs out! If you hear the alarm before you're able to place the brick, keep the brick, lose your turn, and tap the X (fail) on the App. If the placement is successful, tap the check mark (success), and points will accumulate automatically... the longer you play the more points you get with each successful placement! If the tower falls at any time, take the fallen bricks.

Deduct any fallen bricks from your point total. Highest points is the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: High Frontier 4 All: Promo Pack 2 – Achievements
description:
High Frontier 4 All promo pack 2 Achievements is a a homage to some of our favorite fictional space themed books, boardgames and movies. The promo pack includes 12 cards.

Some of the cards have module requirements indicated in the top left corner of the card.

—description from the publihser

name: Nickelodeon Rugrats: The Meanie of Chanukah
description:
As the first night arrives, it’s time for the Rugrats to learn the story of Chanukah. Dreidels, gelt, and latkes await—but will the “Meanie” of Chanukah spoil the holiday? Bring old rivals Grandpa Boris and the mysterious Shlomo together, and they will shed light on the real meaning of Chanukah!


Your favorite Rugrats characters come to life on the table, capturing the spirit of the acclaimed holiday special!
Engaging tile-matching gameplay uses your memory to build beautiful Chanukah candles!
Dozens of original illustrations showcase classic Chanukah imagery and tell the beloved Rugrats story.
Build your candles higher to score more points – but make sure to light them in time, or they won’t score at all!


—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious

name: Östergötland (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
It's time to take the "Östgötapendeln" commuter train between Norrköping and Linköping, sail the boat along the Göta canal and take the bus to Finspång in this local version of Ticket to Ride! The train routes are based on current and historical train routes, with some modification to maximize playability. Boat routes and bus routes have also been added to get the best gaming experience "Östgötaslätten" has to offer!

Apart from the regular tickets, there are also city-to-province tickets and province-to-province tickets (similar to those in the Switzerland map). These make up a super fun and flexible addition to your ticket hunting game. The boat routes can give you some more points and the bus routes can give you quite a few extra cards through a push your luck mechanism.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: World Order
description:
The year is 2010, and the world is drastically changing. While the once-unrivaled influence of the United States is beginning to wane, other major powers are eagerly stepping onto the stage, ready to claim their piece of the geopolitical pie. In the East, Beijing is rising to become a global powerhouse. Simultaneously, Moscow is entangled in an intricate chess game with Washington, ready to counter its every move. And amidst these tumultuous waters, the European Union is trying to carve out its identity and role in the international stage.

The world is undergoing a drastic shift, while power is being redistributed on a global scale — but who will take the lead in this rapidly changing world order?

The board game World Order simulates modern international relations, with players taking control of one of the four dominant global powers of the 2010s: the United States of America, the People's Republic of China, the Russian Federation, and the European Union. Utilize your diplomatic power, economic strength, and military might to expand your influence across the globe. Form regional alliances, entice other nations through clever economic dependencies, or become the military juggernaut no one dares to mess with.

World Order blends academic theories with thrilling gameplay, creating a never-before-seen experience of international relations! Join the fight and show the other powers that a new era is dawning!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: WitchDraft: Academy
description:
Take the next step in your career as an apprentice. The Academy offers 3 new modules that you can add to your game individually or in any combination. The teacher cards offer tasks, the magic grid cards reward optimal placement and the colorful companion cards allow a certain amount of flexibility in planning.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Company of Heroes: 2 Player Set
description: The 2 Player Set contains everything needed to play Company of Heroes with only two players. The set contains the American and the Wehrmacht factions. This set can also be mixed with the core set.
categories: Miniatures, Video Game Theme, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Eat or Run
description: A light and very quick shedding game for two. Players take turns exchanging cards with the deck to improve their seven card hand. But, in a game of chicken, either player can jump-start things by “running” and starting the race to play combos to shed all their cards.

name: Forum Trajanum: Honorary Citizens Promo
description:
Forum Trajanum: Honorary Citizens Promo is a promo pack that contains 8 new Colonia tiles with 2 honorary citizens in each player color and 1 “Construction Crane Scoring” board.

In this mini-expansion, the construction cranes take on additional significance. Each time a player scores a crane during the game, he will receive a special bonus – for example extra points for buildings next to cranes, more building space, or honorary citizens.

These honorary citizens can be used either as envoy to be sent to the Forum Trajanum in Rome immediately or as special citizens that give the player one of the 6 citizens’ special abilities for free for the rest of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module J2 – Advanced Fighters
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

Module J2 includes new warships, fighters, weapons, and systems: Oversized Fighter Squadrons are launched by Patrol and Interdiction Carriers. Scout Carriers and Area Control Ships pave the way to the PFTs that followed. New ships include Federation Fast Carrier and F-111 carriers, Klingon FWE and D6Y, Romulan NovaHawk-B and Vulture-V, Kzinti DDE and CLE, Gorn Emergency Carrier, Tholian Dreadnought-Carrier and War Cruiser Carrier, Orion Slaver-Carrier, Hydran Pegasus-Carrier, Lyran Medium Carrier, ISC Light Fleet Carrier, and more.

Bombers, huge shuttles bristling with weapons, defend planets from invaders. Megafighters are enlarged standard fighters: faster, meaner, tougher! Remote-controlled fighters keep pilots alive to fight another day and have faster launch rates but lack the range for independent strikes and cannot survive dogfights.

Advanced versions of many shuttles, heavy fighters, and plasma fighters. New weapons include Stonefish Drones, Heavy Drones, and type-K Plasmas. Andromedan Small Support Units and Mobile Weapon Platforms (their version of fighters and PFs).

Seven scenarios, 83 SSDs, charts, and annexes complete the package.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Task Force Games

name: Dinner Time
description:
An easy party game that can be played with friends or family.
The player will be secretly assigned a role. Normally each player will be on a cockroach team or a rat team. If you are the cockroach team you must help the team to find food. On the other hand, the rat team needs to find poison. During the game, players take turns to look, reveal, and identify the team. They also use special abilities from the card to swing the game and build the path to victory.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game

name: Berlin: Fall of the 3rd Reich
description:
BERLIN - Fall of the Third Reich / Berlin Final Days / Berlin: Final Victory / Berlin I is a detailed Historical Module for owners of BEYOND VALOR covering part of the battle for Berlin in 1945.

The street-level map at 50-yards scale
Map: two 24 x 36 sheets (covers the Reichtag area north, west and east.)

Counters are included or not depending of module version.

Can be combined with Tyrant's Lair.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Powerrails
description:
Powerrails is an 18xx game which uses no regional setting like other games of the series, but eleven small (A4-sized) mapboards with only a handful of hexes and a small set of special rules for each of them.

The players are seeking to make the most money by buying and selling stock certificates of up to eight railroad companies (depending on the scenario played). The player with the most stock of a particular company in his possession acts as the president of this company and is responsible for track laying, the placement of railheads (which are necessary for train runs), route selection and train acquisition. Running trains earns money and this money is either divided by the shareholders or kept in the company's treasure for further investments (like buying better trains or constructing track). This decision influences the value of the company's shares - and not the player with the most stock or the most beautiful constructed track wins the game, but the player with the most riches in terms of cash and shares.

The subtitle on the box is "Quickies for 1830 players". It uses mostly elements from 1830 and 1835, but introduces two new features: There is a ‘purple phase’ after the ‘grey phase’, and the ‘grey phase’ introduces city tiles with only one token space (tokens from the replaced brown tiles are all returned to their respective owning companies for future use).

All maps are playable in 2 to 4 hours, and most of them are especially tested for a 2-player game (in case of a 2-player game, the usual 60% holding limit in a company is lifted, if you buy additional shares from the bank pool).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Human Body/Synapses
description:
The second pair of the AoS Team 2015 releases.

When the first map takes place in the human body with two cycles of O₂ and CO₂; the organs are becoming blue or red, changing the players' strategies.

The second map takes place in the brain with synapses.

ONLY for experienced players!

name: Pizzachef
description:
Pizza Chef is a strategic family board game where you deliver pizzas.

La Casa dello Chef is an authentic pizza restaurant at an ancient Italian village square. The pizza chef retires and as deliverers you compete against each other to be the next pizza chef. Whoever earns the most money can call himself the new pizza chef. By creating a delivery plan you can earn a lot of tips, outsmart the other delivery drivers and become the winner. There are many different ways to earn tips, so it's important to look carefully at what your strategy is going to be.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Contracts, Deck Construction, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hidden Movement, Interrupts, Market, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Resource Queue, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Os Desejos do Sultão
description:
From time to time, the great and benevolent Sultan of the Realms of Cockapoo hosts a festival to promote his new Grand Vizier – someone of his utmost trust, who will be able to influence him to take important decisions, either personal or regarding the whole Sultanate.
In order to be awarded that title, the applicants and their aides will take part in an entertaining audition, in which they must show both their productiveness to fulfill the Sultan’s wishes and wisdom to stir the Local Market efficiently. Even though each applicant is very well rewarded with Gems, only one of them will became the Sultan’s Grand Vizier.

The Sultan's Wishes (Os Desejos do Sultão) is an easy, fun and strategic game where players are tasked with fulfilling the Sultan's Wishes by dropping Cards on the board or applying their effects.
- Fulfill the Sultan's Wishes and receive Gems to acquire valuable Wares.
- Earn chant by performing Extra Tasks for the Sultan and get ready for a nice reward.
- The player with the highest score at the end will be the big winner and the one chosen by the Sultan!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Shou Ba Yi
description: Shou Ba Yi is a trick taking game played with a standard deck of cards, which is very similar to Tichu and Chinese Poker.

name: Jet Set: Jumbo Jets – Expansion Set 2
description:
Jet Set: Jumbo Jets – Expansion Set 2 is another set of five expansions for Jet Set:

Jumbo Jets — €10 per plane instead of €5; jumbo kicks off any planes already on link, refunding money (same player/bank split, or you must pay all of it?) to other players; do not remove jumbo when you claim flight; other players use your jumbo as their link by paying you €10
City Bonuses — Every city starts with a bonus ring; collect them for claiming links to (and through?) those cities; spend them immediately on bonus tiles.
Hotels — Start by drafting up to 4 Hotel cards in reverse turn order; claim hotel by discarding a Flight card; hotel starts with 1 resident + 1 per marker on the Flight card + 1 per Flight card [you still have?] depicting the hotel’s city; each resident = +€1 Income and +1 point.
Charter Flights — Each charter plane (black or white) has a current destination; claim the destination if you can make all the hops to get from plane’s current city to the destination, which gives you a one-time payment according to the number of hops: 1: €20, 2: €35, 3: €50, 4+: €60; then discard the destination card and replace it from that plane’s deck.
Flight Cards — Additional Long and Short flights, plus new easier and harder Final Flight cards.

name: Crimson Company: Wildwood Tales
description:
The Wildwood Tales expansion adds a new set of mystical creatures to the Crimson Company roster. It also includes a 5-card set of vanilla cards without effects to make it easier to introduce new players to the game.

In Crimson Company, two opposing players take on the roles of adventurous noblemen in a cut-throat fantasy world. In a battle of wits, they assemble armies of sellswords, from hardened warriors and shady merchants to mythical creatures as old as time.

Your goal in a match of Crimson Company is to conquer two of the three castles in the center. You conquer a castle by amassing more strength than your opponent in the castle's lane by the time that lane is scored. A lane is scored once a player owns at least four cards in it.

Cards represent a large variety of characters, all of which have specific strength values and unique effects. The latter are either one-time instant effects that happen when a card is played, or they are triggered in specific phases of the game. Four randomly drawn cards from the character deck are "on offer". You may bid coins on only one of those at a time. Then your opponent decides to either pay you off, doubling the coins you bid, or pass and let you play the card.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dungeon Twister: Room P1
description:
Arch-Mage Treasure Rooms
(Rooms P1, Goodies 2004-2005)


The number of VP necessary to win the game is increased by 1 VP for each face-up Arch-Mage Treasure room. For example, if the game is being played to 5 VP and both Arch-Mage Treasure rooms are visible, the game is now played to 7 VP.


Giant Grinders:

The Giant Grinders work exactly like rifts.



A flying character (Wizard, Ghost, Specter, etc...) can fly over a Giant Grinder during his movement, but cannot stop there.



Characters who can move over pit traps, like the Thief or Elf Scout, cannot more over a Giant Grinder square.



A character carrying a rope can move over a Giant Grinder or stop there as long as there are two valid attachment points available. However, his movement must be from one valid square to another valid square.



The Giant Grinders are obstacles.


Pipes:

Pipes are not normal floor squares.



Pipes do not block line of sight.



Pipes are obstacles for characters with a combat value of 3 or more (only the unmodified combat value on the character counts).



Characters of combat value 0,1,or 2 (only the unmodified combat value on the character counts) can use Pipes like normal ground.



Characters of combat value 0,1, or 2 can stop on Pipes.



Characters of combat value 3 can move over Pipes like normal ground. Characters of combat value 3 cannot stop on Pipes. If they do stop on the Pipes, the Pipes break (place a broken marker) and the character falls into the giant grinders, which causes immediate death.



Characters of combat value 4 or more can use Pipes, but as soon as they step on them, the Pipes break and the character is killed.



When Pipes break, only the square where the character was standing is broken (not all of the Pipes). That can lead to a strange situation (but legal) where a piece of Pipes is all alone because the Pipes on each side were broken.


Arch-Mage Treasure:

A character standing on an Arch-Mage Treasure square can pick up the treasure for 1 AP. Place a Treasure token under the character.



Each Arch-Mage Treasure square can only offer one Treasure per game. Pace a broken marker on the Arch-Mage treasure square to indicate that this square was already looted.



If the Disciple "forgets" this room and it contains a looted (with a broken marker) Arch-Mage Treasure square, the broken marker is withdrawn. The square will provide another treasure once the room is discovered again.



The Arch-Mage Treasure squares are considered to be normal floor squares only with regards to movement and line of sight.



The Arch-Mage Treasure squares are not obstacles.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement

name: Elemental: the card game
description:
In this fantasy cardgame, players take role of ancient elemental mages. Creating powerful Talismans, acquiring different spells and gathering elements to cast them, players try to finish their rivals power down to zero.
Each turn players refresh their hands of elements up to seven cards, then they can either announce a power clash and enter a auction for an open spell, or they can have a random talisman card from the talisman deck. When players have spells on their spellbooks (gathered from auctions) they can cast them as many times as they like, as long as they have enough elements to cast them.
Players lose power (starting with 50) in power clashes, in talisman creation and with damages they suffer from opponent spells. First player to reach zero life loses game.

name: Kobayashi Maru: A Test of Character
description:
Description from the designer:

Kobayashi Maru - A Test of Character is a fan production inspired by Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan (but knowing the movie is not necessary to play).

The game is distributed digitally and it is 100% free. No one is allowed to profit from it in any way.
Players only need to print 3 sheets of paper and add some basic game components like dice and cubes.

In the game you play the role of the captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise. You just received a distress call from the freighter Kobayashi Maru. Will you respond? If so, will you dare enter the Neutral Zone and face a confrontation with the Klingons?

Each turn is divided in 4 phases:

An action phase, in which you can perform actions such as move, fire, repair shields, or use the tractor beam.
A bridge phase, in which you determine events taking place inside the Enterprise.
An enemy phase, in which the Klingons attack.
A reinforcement phase, in which the Klingons replace their lost battle cruisers.


The game continues until you rescue the Kobayashi Maru, or the Enterprise is destroyed.

Remember, this is more than a game: it is a test of character!
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Square Grid

name: Fireteam Zero: Fireteam Echo Male Hero Pack
description:
Six new heroes for your Fireteam Zero missions:


Gregor "Wolf" Korzhev
Jozef "Hammerhead" Sokolof
Oswald "Oxford" Leeds
Roland "Spectre" Dubois
Hans "Turncoat" Krupp
Eddy "Cipher" Hamilton


Contains:


6 Miniatures
6 Hero Reference Cards
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mistfall: Hearthfire Inn Mini-Expansion
description:
This is a mini-expansion, available at conventions and via BGG Store.

This is an alternative Haven Location. It starts the game revealed and Safe.

This Location is always Safe. After a Hero rests, the player may discard up to 2 cards from their hand, and draw 1 card for each card so discarded.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Total Party Kill
description:
Total Party Kill is a fast-paced and merciless game in which 2-4 players build and level up their parties of heroes, recruit mercenaries, and use spells and artifacts to fight and gain the upper hand on the other players in order to explore and conquer dangerous territories infested with monsters.

Total Party Kill comes with four different faction decks based on the comic world created by No Lands Comics.

name: Siege Storm: Styxia Faction
description:
The legion of destruction from the dark realm of Styxia is a perfect place for anyone who enjoys the salty taste of enemy tears. This faction employs many abilities that force the opponent to discard or wreak havoc on his battle lines. And since Styxian minions are expandable, you get many, many opportunities to sacrifice them for greater evil.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Trolldilemma
description:
In this fantasy card game, the players play troll bandits competing for the most COINs.

Each turn, a player reveals as many cards ('TRAVELLERS') as there are players. Each traveller has an initiative score and will be assigned to each player - the player with the most SKULLs (see below)receives the highest priority card, and so on.

Each TRAVELLER either gains or costs their player coins, or introduces a new mechanic into the game. The higher the priority, the higher the rewards of a TRAVELLER card, but the higher the chance the card will be negative for the player.

Before each card is assigned, players can assign SKULLs to other players, themselves, or no one at all. This happens simultaneously, and after the cards to be assigned cards have been revealed. I.e. if the highest card is costing you a lot of COIN, and you have the most or are tied for the most SKULLs, you will want to give your SKULL to another player and hope you won't get any more, so the highest priority, negative TRAVELLER card doesn't go to you. On the other hand, you don't want to have much less SKULLs as anybody else, as you will constantly miss the high COIN value TRAVELLERs.

There is also a randomised item shop where players can spend coin for one-time or permanent rule changes (redistributing or removing SKULLs, changing priorities, lessen the impact of negative TRAVELLERs, and so on).

The game ends if one player starts and ends a turn with eight or more skulls, as they get to much attention to stay robbing people.

-description from designer

name: Ahau: Eclipse
description:
The first official expansion of Ahau: Rulers of Yucatáns adds 14 Eclipse cards, 6 additional role cards, 5 building tiles and 10 special pyramid tiles, to enhance your Ahau experience. The Eclipse event cards provide more opportunities and challenges for scoring, resource conversion, summoning, and strategic gameplay in each round.

Eclipse introduces us to the history-shaping, cataclysmic and mythical events of the Classic Period.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Call to Adventure: Epic Origins – Heed the Call Promo Card
description:
Promo Card for Call to Adventure: Epic Origins originally available as an Early Backer reward. Later available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign and then in pack Archer from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

You may journey for free. If you gain a trait or attempted a challenge revealed this turn, gain 1 experience.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Storytelling

name: Krosmaster: Wild Realms
description:
Krosmaster: Wild Realms is an expansion of 16 new figures for Krosmaster: Arena and other Krosmaster titles released exclusively in the form of blind boxes. Each Display case of 12 figurines comes with 4 random rares and one each of the 8 commons.

The list of figures in the set is as follows:
-Bwork Archer
-Bwork Warrior
-Bworker
-Snoowolf
-Boowolf
-Moowolf
-Ko-Fang The White
-Groarg Gamel
-Medor Thraki
-Raspberry King
-Lemon King
-Mint King
-Strawberry King
-Missiz Freezz
-Grougalorasalar
-Dragon Pig

Each of the jelly king comes with a figure of jelly it can summon.
categories: Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: What's The Point?: The Cactus Card Game
description:
What’s the Point? is an exciting, family friendly, and cacti-loaded card game! Your objective is to match and collect sets of cacti to earn points. Using a variety of action card to gain an advantage over your friends. Such as unleashing a SEE AND STEAL, allowing you to look at another players hand and steal any card of your choice. Protect yourself from harm by playing a STOP card, forcing any action to stop in its tracks. What's The Point? is a simple strategy game you'll be stuck on!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Viktory: Terror in Europe
description:
Fast-Paced Strategy Game that Allows You to Play as a Terrorist Setting Bombs Off in Europe or Operatives Trying to Stop Him...

A terrorist is wreaking havoc in Europe. Every time the terrorist leaves a city there is the possibility he has left a bomb, trap, or recruiting cell. If Interpol does not find the bomb before it detonates, then the terrorist makes progress toward his goal of instilling fear across Europe.

The job of Interpol is to coordinate the efforts of Secret Agents, Bomb Squad, Special Forces, and an Informant Network to stop the terrorist from accomplishing his goal. It will take the combined special abilities of each Operative and the Informant Network for Interpol to win.

During the game, one player plays as the terrorist and tries to elude the operatives chasing him. With hidden movement cards, traps, bombs and recruiting cells to use, he tries to outmaneuver his opponents and stay one step ahead of them. The operatives goal is to catch the terrorist and defeat him in combat. Along the way, they want to avoid traps, defuse bombs, and defeat any recruiting cells the terrorist puts in their way. But the operatives have to be careful. If they get too spread out, the terrorist might attack and defeat them while they are isolated.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Blue Max
description: This is Japanese edition of Jim Hind's Aces High/Blue Max combined. Very beautiful map, photographing a miniature terrain. Also includes nice counters for nearly every model of aircraft (not generic).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War I

name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects: Deluxe Edition – The Whims of Cleopatra
description: During the action "Visit the Quarry", if you build the part of the Palace which matches the die, you randomly draw 1 face-down Bonus tile. Immediately reveal it and earn the indicated bonus. After earning the bonus, roll the die. This will be the Queen's next wish.
categories: Ancient, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Enclosure, Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Warfighter Shadow War: Expansion #23 – Syria Tabqa Airbase
description:
Each Shadow War Mission Pack is a real-world location. Shadow War Mission Packs put you in command of SpecOps teams running missions in real-world countries in the facilities you see on the news. Contained within each pack are Mission Locations, Objectives and Hostiles relevant to each unique location.

This expansion offers 56 cards including:


5 Night Missions
4 Night Objectives
5 On the Grounds
3 Equipment
3 Skills
15 Night Locations
21 Hostiles


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Le Bois des Coua2sous
description:
In Le Bois des Coua2sous, you have a forest to cross to find lots of hazelnuts, and the first player to find five nuts wins the game.

On the table, you have a grid of 3x3 forest cards. The backs of each card are identical, and on the front they feature one of three images — mushroom, leaf or stone — in one of three colors: yellow, red or blue. In the twelve spaces adjacent to this grid are placed cards showing 1-3 hazelnuts.

A player starts: he puts his boar card before a row/column of his choice and cross it by announcing out loud what he thinks on the back of the forest card. It begins with the first card, the player announces for example "leaf" or "yellow" (according if the elements or colors are in play) then turns the card over and compares the guess to the actual picture. Initially, we discover, that the cards are random. If the guess it correct, the player continues the path to the hazelnuts that await us on the other side. If it is wrong, it stops there, and the next player start.

If the next player starts on the same row/column, he already knows what there is on the front of this card, unless he remembers more since it was the visible item at the beginning...!

Players play with colors or the elements: initially it is them who choose. But as soon as a player has reaches a nut, everyone changes: those who played on the elements switches to colors and vice versa. One must therefore be remember everything and well remember what others reveal!

name: Arkham Horror: Yig Promo Card
description:
A new, official Ancient One card, given to attendees of the Arkham Nights event on 12-14 October 2012.

Consists of a new card for Yig, with alternate abilities and art to the one in the base game.

name: Munchkin Curses
description:
Description from the publisher:

Admit it. You love that moment when your enemy kicks down the door, and the card they draw is – a Curse! Almost as much as you love playing Curses on your enemies yourself. Whether it means losing items, skipping turns, or stumbling across a duck imbued with pure doom, a Curse always brings in an element of gleeful mayhem.

That's why the Munchkin Curses booster contains twelve new Curses, two new monsters, and one Curse Reverse to shuffle into your Munchkin game!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Nguyen Hue '72: The 1972 Easter Offensive in Vietnam
description: Grand Strategic treatment of the 1972 campaign with aircraft and armor, artillery, infantry and helicopter minis, two big beautiful maps at 10 miles/hex, event cards every turn, weekly turns, ZOC, terrain and supply effects, US airpower, airmobile and amphibious movement, a real mystery unit dynamic, and max replay-ability. 1975 campaign 275 scenario included!

name: Maki Master
description:
As a master sushi chef, you've studied your craft for years. It took diligent training to perfect specialty maki like your All-Day Breakfast, Octopus's Garden, and Squid Salad Sandwich, but now you face your toughest challenge yet: Friday night dinner rush!

In Maki Master, you compete with your fellow chefs to complete the most valuable orders. You can concentrate on short and simple orders to get bonuses quickly or take your time to make complicated masterpieces for big rewards!

Each turn, add a new ingredient to the shrinking kitchen space and try to arrange them for the orders you're working on. Complete a scrumptious recipe for points or take an action card like Chop!, Stack!, or Switch! to help with future turns. Don't forget to collect spicy wasabi to complete orders with style! At the end of the night, the chef who has earned the most points by completing their recipes wins!

Maki Master adds new mechanisms, streamlined rules, and fresh art by Claire Lin to the Wasabi! design from 2008.

name: Silent Death Annex: Space Junk
description:
From the back cover:

ONE PERSON'S JUNK...
The wormhole blossomed to starboard as Keom's ship passed Dagon's moon. He swung his Salamander around, heading straight for it.
" What are you doing?" yelled Falkirk from the gunner's seat.
" 1 know what I'm doing. Just keep those Vipers off our butt."
" But that thing's unstable! Are you absolutely nuts? It'll smash us to bits-or snap shut and trap us in limbo!"
" Listen, Falkirk," Keom said as the Salamander's nose crossed the wormhole's outer edge. "Would you rather take your chances with a wormhole..." He jerked his thumb back at the small moon.
" ...or with them?" he finished, as a whole fleet of Death Winds and their supporting Warhounds rose up from behind the moon, weapons blazing.

Space is still silent, but it's no longer empty! Space Junk gives you every-thing you need to fill your Silent Death games with junk from black holes to mine fields, outposts to nebulae, and wormholes to satellites.

Space Junk includes rules for:
• Satellites
• Outposts
• Mines and minesweepers
• New rules for asteroids
• Black holes and their cousins
• Wormholes
• Nebulas
• Comets
• Nova/supernova effects
• Starfighter combat in atmosphere
• The Solar Worm
• Plus scenarios featuring each of these battle-altering phenomena
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask – "Reta Bigbad" Promo Card
description: Promotional ally card for Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Mummy's Mask. Increases combat check for another player or enables an extra exploration on your turn with a combat bonus.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: SiegeStorm: Wild Fairies
description:
This expansion adds an additional basic solo/co-op faction and contains 27 new cards, including new 3 boss cards.

You thought Goblins were hard and decided to swich your nemesis for lovely Wild Faries? Well, sorry to say that but if Goblins kicked your ass, Faries gonna do the same but even harder. Battle Bettles with infinite DEF value, instant storming and evolving little bastards becoming bigger and angrier bastards very fast with some healing abilities on the top... Good luck going into that forest buddy!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: DreadBall: Pelgar Mystics
description:
DreadBall: The Futuristic Sports Game is the hyper-kinetic sci-fi sports game of unparalleled speed and ferocity – a fast, fun and tactical miniature sports board game written by Jake Thornton and created by Mantic Games.

Two coaches compete for victory with teams of beautiful miniatures on a stunning sci-fi pitch. The game is easy to learn, yet challenging, with carefully orchestrated plays and counter attacks hinging on positioning and the mercy of the dice gods.

This expansion adds an additional team made up of Judwan Miniatures, the Pelgar Mystics.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports

name: MERCS: Recon – Critical Extraction
description: Critical Extraction adds MERCS from the USCR faction to MERCS: Recon. Included are five USCR MERCS and their corresponding player boards and special rules. In addition, the mission pack contains new missions and a new tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Planet Apocalypse: Lord Procrustes
description:
"Procrustes, a new Demon Lord of complete evil and destruction!"

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

1 Lord figure (Lord Procrustes)
1 Lord Sheet


A Crossover from Planet Apocalypse officially published by Petersen Games makes this miniature compatible with Cthulhu Wars.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Swords around the Throne
description:
Swords around the Throne allows two players to reenact the Napoleonic Wars (1805-15) on a grand-strategic scale, with France, her dominions and allies pitted in a titanic struggle for Europe against Great Britain and assorted Coalition members.

The players operate as heads of state and commanders-in-chief, not generals or even marshals. Their tools are diplomacy, politics and war. They direct military campaigns, not battlefield tactics.

Setup instructions are provided for “full” games to start in 1805, 1806, 1809, 1812 or 1813. Flexible victory conditions for the full game make it possible to start in any setup year and finish in any year thereafter (though a minimum of 3 years, including the setup year, is recommended). The longer the time frame chosen, the fuller the experience. Substitute victory conditions are offered for "mini" games covering only 1805, 1806, 1809, 1812, 1813-14, 1814 or 1815.

Complexity is medium, and play time ranges from 30 minutes to a few hours, depending on the type of game chosen.

Solo rules are available in the files section.
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Negotiation, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Battlecrest: Pavl – Hero Set
description:
How about some more heroes? With more heroes you can get a lot of variety out of your games. You can also play them in solo (either as or against them) and even play 3-4P team games.

Pavl is a vicious snowman who commands the ice and snow to attack. This is the fourth additional hero for Battlecrest and the first to be designed by a guest designer, Mike Berg.

Components:

Pavl Hero set.
Pavl AI Sheet: for solo play, requires Imperator expansion.



What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Sine Tempore: Motherfang
description:
Faun live for the hunt, the glory, to win over the respect of their own tribe. Primaevus V offers fauns challenges worthy of their abilities as hunters, which is precisely why they made it their hunting reserve.
Among the terrible creatures living on the planet, there are beasts that manage to instill fear even in the most undaunted hunters.
The Primaevi call them ThunderTooths.

Their fur is the colour of the tempestuous blue sky, recalling the electric blue of their pulsing veins, while the bulging bones running up their spine and strong horns have snapped more than a few hunters’ blades and just as many lives. And if you happen to think that their obsidian claws and sharp fangs are the only weapons at the disposal of this terrifying beast, you’re seriously mistaken.
ThunderTooths are true to their frightening name, thanks to their unique ability to generate terrifying high voltage bolts of electricity.

“According to an ancient Primaevan, an outcast Hunter once made his way to the ravine of the striking beasts, in an effort to restore his honour. The cave before him was glowing pale blue and pulsing, Krags was an expert hunter and despite being far from his tribe, would never have forgotten how to use a lance. Nothing was ever able to rattle his nerves of steel, except what he saw that day.

As he continued his descent into the depths of the earth, his sharp ears perceived a constant and muffled cry. And so it was that he reached an enormous grotto, where tens of fauns stood immobile like statues, with weapons in hand, all facing the same direction.

The cry was coming from the clamped mouths of the paralysed hunters, their eyes moving frenetically as if to warn Krags of the imminent danger. The countless trenches leading to the grotto were swarming with ThunderTooths.

They were babies, prey for young fauns seeking to become hunters... but where there were babies, there was bound to be a mother. A terrifying roar shook the entire cave, while from a dark tunnel the largest MotherFang Krags had ever seen emerged. Step after step, the enormous beast loomed towards him in a show of force, destroying the hunter’s nerves, who for the first time in his life... ran.

While Krags ran panic-stricken, the MotherFang opened his jaws and struck the hunter with a bolt of electricity, instantly paralysing him. Krags couldn’t move a single muscle as the ThunderTooths began making their way towards their immobile prey, drooling and famished. The fauns were perfectly conscious, but they would have preferred not to be, to avoid having to watch what was about to happen”.

Content: 1 Motherfang, 5 Thundertooth, 1 Thunderthooth Pet, 4 Enemy cards, 1 Pet card, 2 Wounds cards, 10 Token, 1 Nemesis mission card, 15 Prey action cards, 1 Tile.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Tiny Ninjas: Original – The Void Expansion
description:
The Void adds 12 new ninja cards to Tiny Ninjas.

Including all new characters: Queen, Skeleton, Mystic, Zombie, Dragon and also introducing YELLOW DAMAGE to the game!

—description from the publisher

-- Second Edition --

The Void Expansion adds 12 new Ninja Cards to Tiny Ninjas: Original

Includes: Queen, Mystic, Dragon, Zombie Solo, Zombie Archer, Zombie Master, and Zombie Panda.

Also introducing YELLOW DAMAGE to the game!
Yellow Damage can only be defended by a Yellow Shield.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Marvel Dice Masters: Squirrel Girl Promo Pack
description:
Flavor text:

Kick Butts, Eat Nuts

Card Text:

While Squirrel Girl is active, at the end of your turn, add a squirrel counter to this card. During your turn, when you may use a Global Ability, you may remove a squirrel counter and place a squirrel token with 1A and 1D into the Field Zone. You may have up to 4 Squirrel tokens in the Field Zone at once.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Rivals for Catan: Heiko the Master Swimmer
description:
Heiko the Master Swimmer is a 2015 special Action card for The Rivals for Catan.

This card was given out by Klaus Teuber at the SPIEL' 15 in Essen.

It's limited and was only available at the SPIEL'15.

Ability of the card:

If the event is Celebration: Heiko wins the swimming contest and gets your settlers excited. During your build phase, it costs you any 2 resources of your choice less to build 1 road, 1 settlement, or 1 city.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Snowdonia: Seasons
description:
Snowdonia: Seasons is a promo pack of six cards that were printed-on-demand for the UK Games Expo 2016:


01-Spring thru 04 - Winter -- Four new contract cards (a couple of Start Player manipulators / use Iron Ore directly as Track / buy a Train cheaply)



Seasons -- Two double-sided cards depicting the Months and Seasons of the Year; each Season modifies a main element of the game (Surveyor movement, the Build action and using your 3rd worker) as well as applying new Weather rules!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Call of the Wild
description:
Call of the Wild is a short, fast-paced action game of trust and betrayal in which players make mythical animal noises instead of talking.

Each player takes a pack of 10 cards and draws 2. Any and all players may then place one of these cards face-down on the table and make one of the 5 animal sounds. If two players are both making the same "call" they may choose to meet and reveal their cards. If they were both being honest, the animals mate and each player scores 1 point. However if one player has an animal other than the one he was representing (he was "hunting"), then he may eat the other player's animal and score 2 points while the other player scores 0.

There are two primary counters to a player who is hunting. First, you choose whom to meet with and whom not to. If a player has lost the trust of the other players she will have a hard time getting them to meet with him and cannot score. Second, you can "double-cross" a player: if you think he is trying to eat you, play the animal that eats his animal!

When one player has used her last card the game is over. Whoever has scored the most points wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Deduction, Prisoner's Dilemma, Race, Real-Time, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading
publishers: Play All Day Games, Rather Fun Games

name: Catacombs (Third Edition): Goblin Mage Expansion
description:
The Goblin Mage is a new Catacomb Lord for Catacombs (Third Edition) that has the ability to summon clones of himself. Choose which clone (blue, purple, or green) is placed during the setup phase.

Features two variations of the Stromm Catacomb Lord, with the second version intended for more experienced players. There is also a monster version corresponding room card where he is featured.

The summon Stromm shot is like a normal summon shot except it allows the overseer to summon up to two additional clones. All clones in play share Stromm's collective pool of remaining health points.

Each clone takes his own turn, performing one of the shot sequences listed on the rules card.

When damaged is inflicted on a clone, the piece is returned to the Overseer and Stromm's health track is reduced by the amount of damage inflicted. A minimum of one clone must remain in play.

Clones may be summoned repeatedly during the battle phase. Once Stromm's health track is reduced to 0, all his clones are defeated.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builders Pack.

name: Not Alone: Sanctuary – The Promo Cards
description: Pack including the stretch goal cards from the Not Alone: Sanctuary kickstarter. Features 4x The Mists location, 4x The Drone location, 2 Hunt cards, 2 Survival cards, 2 Survivor cards, 3 Evolution cards, 3 Avatar cards and 1 rules clarification card.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection
publishers: Corax Games, Geek Attitude Games, Stronghold Games

name: Catan: Het Duel Big Box
description:
This reimplentation of the Catan card game includes both expansions so you can build your principality and undergo the hardships and golden times that the settlers from Catan encountered on their path.

The basic game also includes three theme sets with extra cards, which offer many options for variable strategies. So you make a trip through three eras: "The Golden Age", "A time of conflict" and "The great progress". In the end all cards can also be used together in the ultimate version of the game "Duel der princes".

In the box you will find the expansions "Age of Darkness" and " Age of Enlightenment".

Age of Darkness
Three theme sets provide even more variety: "A time of intrigue", in which the religious struggle between supporters of modern and conservative religions is central, connects to "The Golden Age". "A time of merchants" comes chronologically before "The great progress" and "A time of barbarians" afterwards. This last theme set introduces elements from the board game expansion "Cities & Knights".

Age of Enlightenment
With the three theme sets in this expansion, we continue our journey through the history of Catan. "A time of discoverers" takes place between "The great progress" and "A time of barbarians". In this theme set, the residents of Catan explore the archipelago within the reach of their new ships. In "A time of the wise" other aspects from the time of "The Great Progress" are discussed. The history of Catan ends chronologically with "A time of prosperity": the barbarians are defeated and the independence of Catan is assured. Time to look after the interests of the residents of Catan and to lead them to golden times.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Medieval, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Claim
description:
Claim is an abstract tactical game for 2, 3, or 4 players (two teams of 2), age 12 and up. A typical game usually last about 30 minutes. Players take turns placing their fence pieces on the 8x8 grid. The grid starts fenced in by neutral gray fence pieces. The goal is to enclose a square so that you have more fence pieces surrounding it than any other player.
