Once this occurs, you place your color stone on the square and then replace the surrounding fence pieces with neutral gray fences (this may now trigger scoring of adjacent squares). The game ends when no more plays are available. The winner is the player or team with the most stones on the board.

The basic grid size of the board is 8x8 squares.

name: Legends Of Football
description:
From the ad:

LEGENDS OF FOOTBALL provides the greatest-ever players permitting two football fanatics to create the dream football games of all time! Using a double-blind system, position your all-star defense in an attempt to stop Jim Brown, Barry Sanders, Jerry Rice, Lance Alworth, and Dan Marino. Do you crowd the line of Bob Lilly, Deacon Jones, Joe Greene, and Reggie White, with Dick Butkus and Ray Nitschke? Or do you have Night Train Lane and Deion Sanders play deep? Team members, alignments, and play calling are in your hands! The laminated game boards with over 100 player cards from 1916 to 2003 permit a very accurate portrayal of your favorite players in the football match-ups of a lifetime.

For more information, contact: raysmith@kuhncom.net
mechanics: Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Summer Storm: The Battle of Gettysburg – The Devil's To Pay
description:
The Battle of the Yellow Breeches/Dillsburg, July 3,1863 - An Expansion module for Summer Storm: The Battle of Gettysburg.

The body hung limply from the roadside apple tree, as General Buford and his staff rode by. "Well, gentlemen," Buford noted grimly," I guess that's one more report that General Lee will have to do without!"

The Gettysburg Campaign remains a source of endless interest to both historian and wargamer, in part for the many ways in which small acts of fate worked to shape the course of larger events. THE DEVIL'S TO PAY explores a little known, but quite plausible, alternate chain of events turning on one such small incident.

Longstreet's scout Harrison ends up swinging from an apple tree, festooned with one of John Buford's famous 'let him hang for 7 days' notes. Bereft of the knowledge that the AoP is NORTH of the Potomac and hot in pursuit, General Lee simply continues as before for a few days longer, with his 3 Corps following the orders that he had already historically given them. Ewell attacks the Harrisburg defenses, which fall after a day or so. The bridges are burned, but with the shallow water and fords, the city itself is taken a couple of days later (helped by Jenkins' taking of the Rockville RR bridge to the north). However, the Pa Reserves (Crawford's Division) have been rushed north from the Washington defenses, and with their help Couch has drawn a defensive line along the Swatara Creek, a few miles to the east of Harrisburg. Early moves north from York along the Harrisburg Pike, which follows the river from York Haven. Hill, and then Longstreet follow Ewell down the Cumberland Valley (to the NE) towards the Pennsylvania capitol. By July 2nd, the Confederate Army is badly strung out; Ewell has two of his Divisions (Rodes & Johnson) across the Susquehanna, with the third (Early) holding the West Shore. Hill is a couple of miles west in Mechanicsburg/Shiremanstown with Anderson's Division, while Heth and Pender's Divisions are ranged to the south holding the wide 'gap' at Dillsburg. Longstreet has two Divisions in Carlisle (Hood's & McLaw's), while Pickett is still a few miles to the west guarding the ever-lengthening supply line running south to Virginia. Jenkins' coup de main has resulted in the immense Union supply base at Harrisburg being captured almost intact, and every wagon that makes it west over the shallow ford means another day of supplies for the ANVA in the fall and winter to come.

With the Confederates now further to the north, the AoP continues to move forward on the Gettysburg/Hanover/Manchester line it had reached by June 30th. By the evening of July 2nd, Buford's Cavalry is skirmishing with Heth's troops in the Franklintown area. Reynolds has passed Petersburg (York Springs) and is moving forward with the I & XI Corps, with Sickles' III Corps and Merritt's Reserve cavalry Brigade in position to threaten the Mt. Holly Gap a few miles to the west, on the direct route between Gettysburg and Carlisle. Spurred on by the fall of Harrisburg, the rest of the Army of the Potomac is steadily marching north as well, it's concentration greatly aided by the convergence of all the main roads north at Dillsburg. The Union intelligence arm has been working overtime, and General Meade has been handed an opportunity bigger than that which faced McClellan at Frederick nearly a year before. The Confederate Army is stretched over 20 miles, from west of Carlisle to east of the Susquehanna; if he can get the Army of the Potomac through the gap at Dillsburg in force before Lee can concentrate, he will split the ANVA in two with a good chance of cutting the bulk of it off, 100 miles north of the Potomac.

Stuart has continued to bounce off of the right flank of the marching Union Army, and has finally followed Early over York Mountain and back into contact. Lee now knows the true danger of his position, and hurriedly orders Ewell to get his troops back across the river while the rest of the Army rushes to reinforce the troops holding the vital gap. Apprised of the situation, Couch endeavors to maintain contact, using Crawford's veteran troops to slow Ewell's withdrawal as much as possible.

Essentially, this scenario is very similar to the Battle of South Mountain in '62, except that the 'gap' is far wider and less defensible and the stakes, if anything, are even higher! A desperate defense/attack, coupled with wildly variable reinforcements should make for a game with quite a bit of replay value! The Union player must mount a furious attack with his arriving troops, regardless of casualties, knowing that he has a chance to strike a war-winning blow. The Confederate player must form a desperate, collapsing defense on several fronts, while trying to extricate both Ewell's troops and as many supplies as possible from his foothold on the east shore of the Susquehanna.

THE DEVIL'S TO PAY Contains:

1 full color 22 x 34 tactical map covering the critical gap at Dillsburg, Pennsylvania.
2 identical 8 1/2 x 11 Op/Maps covering the battle area, as well as the operational area surrounding it.
1 8 - 12 page booklet detailing the scenario set-up and conditions, as well as a 'historical' article giving the background leading up to the battle.


You must own Summer Storm: The Battle of Gettysburg to play The Devil's to Pay.
categories: American Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: ASG Pro Basketball
description: A tabletop basketball simulation game from the 1970s.

name: Brick Battles
description:
Take your Lego men, drop them onto the Warhammer 40k battlefield and you get Brick Battles.

Each game turn is divided into movement and combat. All players move at once, then everyone resolves combat with a d6.

Figures are modified by the actual pieces that make them up.
publishers: Blank Shield Press, Just This Side of Arrogance

name: Fantasy Warriors Companion
description:
Fantasy Warriors Companion is a supplement for the Fantasy Warriors Miniatures Base Game. The supplement includes color counters and covers:

The Undead
Giant Creatures
Battlefield Equipment
Sneaky Tricks
Mercenaries
Dwarven Cannon
Goblin War Giant
Dragons
Paladins
Amazons
Revised Army Lists and more

Expands:

Fantasy Warriors
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Big Mouth
description:
Big Mouth comes in quite a large box (15" x 16" x 3.5").

Each player is given a large 14" red plastic fork and a paper plate on which there are 6 different plastic food items and a green bug. A thin piece of cardboard is placed over a plastic bowl. The cardboard is designed in the shape of a cute clown with a hole forming the entrance to his oral cavity, which is formed by the bowl.

A spinner directs gameplay. There are 7 equal segments on the spinner, representing each food object & the green bug.

If a food object is spun, players race to be the first to feed it to the clown with their fork. Losers replace their food object on their plate. If a player has already successfully fed that particular food object to the clown on a previous turn they instead try to feed the clown the green bug. If successful, opponents cannot feed the clown the food object that was spun on that turn and the bug is retrieved from the mouth of the clown & returned to its position.

If the green bug is spun, ANY food object may be placed in the clown's mouth.

The first player to feed all the food on their plate into the mouth of the clown is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Humor, Real-time
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Uncle Jim's Question Bee
description:
Game contains questions and answers in 4 different subjects: History and Mythology, Literature and Art, Geography and Travel, Catch questions and Miscellaneous. Each player is required to answer 2 questions in each subject. Questions are timed and percentage tokens are given based on right or partially right answers. When all players have answered their 8 questions, the player with the highest percentage wins.

There are at least six separate editions of the board game, each designated on the box lid: The original game, Series B, C, and E (each labeled "Latest Edition") and De Luxe versions of Series A and B.

name: Bethesda Church
description: ACW battle game on the fighting around Bethesda Church.

name: Fazenda
description:
Fazenda (Portuguese for Farm) is basically a card-based, bidding game with a few added elements. Players use cards to bid over Cows, Pigs, and Hens which appear in random combinations each round of play. Points are scored based on the number of animals a player has in his farm at the end of each round.

The strategy lies in knowing which animals will start paying off early and in capitalizing on the "Haystack Cards" which allow for various bonuses depending on the characteristics of your farm at the end of the 8 rounds of play.

Players may also plant fields which can pay off really well as long there's no drought.

name: Look, Sarge, No Charts:  WWII – Innovative Rules for Battalion-Level World War Two Miniatures Gaming
description:
Look, Sarge, No Charts: WWII is the first offering in a new series of wargame rules that seeks to enable players to play miniature wargames without charts.

For the WWII rules, each stand is 1 platoon, with some sections as HQ, machine guns, or mortars represented. The game scale is 1"=50m and one turn about 15-30 minutes.

The standard basing is 3" wide stands and depth as deep as necessary. The authors recommend using two vehicles or guns per stand and about 12 infantry figures.

The game turn is divided into two phases. In the first phase, each company, battalion and brigade HQ rolls a six-sided dice, which represents when each formation may activate. In the second phase, a player draw cards from a deck composed of values 1-6 (with each card represented twice: one black suit and one red suit) plus one joker, which ends the turn and causes the cards to be reshuffled. When that card appears, all units of both sides with HQ die rolls matching the current card may act: move, fire, conduct indirect fire, assault, etc. There is no simultaneous action. In the case of multiple units having the same die roll, the stands must roll for first activation.

Many of the chartless systems (e.g., morale) rely on the use of special dice for effect.

In each section of the rules there are optional rules and designers notes.

Yahoo Group: http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/looksargenocharts/

name: Santa's Workshop
description: "Card game for 2-4+ players. Each player is one of Santa’s Elves helping to make toys for Christmas. The Elf who makes the most Toys by games end wins. Game End: The game ends when there are no cards left in the deck, and all player’s hands are empty. Victory: The player with the most points worth of cards in his Toy pile at the End of the game wins."
categories: Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play

name: Tenzor ar roue Korrigan
description:
The king of the Goblins left. He left behind him only these words: “My friends, I need a holiday. I separated and hid my treasure in the four corners of the Large Forest. He who would find the greatest part of it will become king in my place.”

Each player directs a tribe of Goblins. During the rush towards the places where the treasures are hidden, players will have to use their Goblins, in order to find the greatest number of parts of the treasure.

When the 5 parts of the treasure are found, the player which finds the greatest number of it is declared King of the Goblins.

name: Historia Romana
description:
Historia Romana is a Strategic level free print & play board-wargame on the ancient Roman Empire from I century B.C. to VII century A.D.
Scenarios included:
- The Rise of Sulla, 85 BC
- The Third Mithridatic War, 74 BC
- Caesar Vs Pompey, 50 BC
- The Year of the Four Emperors, 69 AD
- The Crisis of the Third Century, 260 AD
- The Imperial Restoration, 268 AD
- Alaric at the Gates, 407 AD
- The Scourge of God, 451 AD
- Heraclius and the Last Persian War, 622 AD
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Star Games with a Space Adventure
description:
From back of book:

Join space adventures Lyra and Vac as they battle the Evil Ones deep in space!

Use your Galactic Computer for precise hyperspace jumps, for pinpoint laser blasts and for breaking the enemy's secret code.

Trek across the scorching sands of the desert planet, see the underwater marvels of the planet Aquan.

Team up with Quas Starbrite as you rocket across the Terran Stellar Republic fighting the deadly invaders.

Escape from the escape-proof orbital space prison.

Help Lyra and Orion crack the mystery of the Dark Horde.

Come face-to-face with the "Evil One" as you fight with deadly computer accuracy the last desperate battle to save the Galaxy.

This is a book game designed to teach basic space trivia and concepts, along with simple math and cryptography skills, to children.

The "Galactic Computer" is a spinning disk in the front cover of the book with key windows to reveal codes and calculations.
categories: Book, Educational, Maze, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Trivia

name: Railway Rivals Map L: France
description:
A map for use with the Railway Rivals game.

The map covers France, with connections to Spain / Italy / Switzerland / Germany / Belgium and, via buildable ferry links, to England. The Eastern part of the map is hilly, but the map is reasonably accessible to beginners. There are special runs to foreign locations after three normal runs. All players start in Paris, so there is a mad scramble in (literally) all directions at the start.
publishers: Fairmount Gaming Simulations Co., Rostherne Games

name: L'inafferrabile U-BOOT
description:
L'inafferrabile U-BOOT ("The Unseizable U-Boot") is a game that emphasizes skill and intelligence.

The ability to see enemy movements constitute the most valuable help to gain the victory.
The gambling behavior is not random, but determined by the navigation tools used according to the tactical thinking of the players.
The game represents the various stages of a battle between a German U-Boot and three Allied destroyers.
The U-Boot player wins entering the Base of destroyers, after covering all six areas that comprise the board, or sinking three destroyers.
Destroyers players win by sinking the U-Boot or if the U-Boot does not re-emerge within the set number of moves.

name: 'Nam '68
description:
(from Introduction)

This is a simple game of strategy for two players, simulating man-to-man combat in the jungles of Vietnam in 1968. One player controls US soldiers and one player controls North Vietnamese (NVA) soldiers. There are five scenarios.

Published in Panzer Digest #9, Summer 2010

name: La Bataille de Leipzig
description:
From the publisher:

The biggest Napoleonic game ever, for the largest Napoleonic battle

The battle of Leipzig was the largest battle of the Napoleonic wars and the largest battle in Europe until the First World War easily ranking as one of the largest battles in History.
Leipzig is a huge battle, as the battlefield is more than 15 km wide, and a very long battle, as the events spread over 6 days between October 14th and October 19th, 1813. The French eventually gather around 190,000 men, against 350,000. It is a succession of ferocious and quite independent battles. The Allied plan, although inelegant, proved to be successful as the odds allowed them to attack everywhere and keep the advantage. Even though using the interior lines, Napoleon was rarely in a position to take a serious strategic advantage while winning almost every of these battles because a 1:2 odd can not lead to a decisive victory against determined enemies.

However, you are now in charge of the army, and things can turn very different...

"Vive l’Empereur!" is a series of simulation games using a standard rules system and a set of exclusive rules specific to each battle. These particular rules include an historical commentary and the victory conditions for each scenario.
The aim of this system is to refight at the regimental scale the numerous battles fought during the Napoleonic Era in Europe, between 1805 and 1815. It uses a map on which the players move counters representing the combat units involved in these battles.

name: Trash
description: Don't attract flies! Trash is a light trivia guessing game where you have to dig to discover whose trash can you're in! All clues in a trash can lead to a celebrity or character. Uncover a clue, make a guess, but be careful -- if you guess wrong you'll attract a fly. Correct guesses earn points and get rid of nasty flies. The first player to reach 15 points wins!

name: Feed the Beast
description:
Have you ever wondered what happens underneath an evil counts magnificent and sprawling castle?

Welcome to the dank and stench-ridden basement of Count Hogarth's Castle, a large empty cellar which houses the Count's greatest secret, The Beast! A huge monstrosity held in its tomb only by the walls of the ancient cellar. Did it come from another world, the depths of the earth or is it the Counts long forgotten father? Either way the only thing keeping from breaking out and devouring the world is feeding it plenty of sewer Critters. And what unlucky fool gets this job you ask? Why you of course! One of the dozens of hapless servants that work under the Counts rule.

Feed the Beast is a simple and fast-paced dice game of gambling and luck. Players compete against each other to fumble in the sewers for Critters and then feed the gigantic Beast in a Medieval setting.

On a players turn they roll dice to move, search for critters or feed the Beast. Play continues until one player manages to give the beast his fill of Critters, that player is then the winner!

name: Nuts! Second Edition: Stalingrad – Heroes All
description:
Stalingrad: Heroes All is a supplement for NUTS! 2nd Edition. Although intended to be played from the German side, Stalingrad: Heroes All plays just as well from the Soviet side. It can also be played solo, cooperatively with all players on the same side or head to head.

Packed with 22 linked scenarios, this book covers a variety of small-unit and medium-sized actions from lunges across the Russia steppes during Fall Blau, to short sharp fights in the rubble of the Rattenkrieg, to desperate struggles for survival during the Kessel. This book also introduces several new unit types, hero characters and morale advantages.

Stalingrad - Heroes All is not a stand-alone game. You must have the core rules, NUTS! - Europe 1944, to play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Reta-les
description: Get the biggest pattern of the same color, and gain points with all color combinations. To do this, lie different bi-colour tiles at the same time as your partners, and "sew" them with a button. The faster, the better. When all the tiles are in the pattern, stop the game and count the points. You also win extra point for being the fastest, or having the biggest pattern from the same colour.

name: Draconian Wars
description:
Draconian Wars is a game of combat, resource management and battlefield tactics. The battlefield is the lands and skies of Hyperborea, an exotic continent rich in natural resources, with a wide variety of ecosystems and full of amazing and terrific creatures.
During thousands of years Hyperborea has been under the uncontested control of the Draconians, but now the Technocrats have arrived to the shores of the continent and they claim what once was theirs. The control of the land is what will bring victory to one or other. The Draconian extract their magic power from the earth, consuming the live and the natural resources around them. On the other hand, the power of the Technocrats comes from carbon and steel, both equal abundant in Hyperborea.
A battle for supremacy over Hyperborea has begun and one thing is clear, no matter who wins, the scares in the lands of Hyperborea will last for centuries.

Draconian Wars is a Non-Collectible Card Game where each player selects their deck of 50 cards in secret. Then, players take turns trying for their opponent to run out of resources. They can accomplish this by controlling as much areas of hyperborea as they can, or just crushing the opponent in battle.

Players have a mixture of ground and air units to spread terror across the lands of Hyperborea. Also, they have a lot of surprises that can change the fate of any battle.

The core set will include all you need to play, all the cards, all the challenges and all the fun you expect from a strategyc card game.

Future expansions will include new cards (units, actions....) new challenges and more escitement to your games.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Babylon 5 Wars: Coming of the Shadows
description: The younger races have taken matters into their own hands, and are battling the First Ones head-on! Who will clench victory in the ultimate battle for the very future of the galaxy? Inside you'll find the most requested (and most powerful) ships to date from both the Shadow and Vorlon fleets, plus the Shadow-modified Omega and even the ships of the Ancient Ones! The final word in the battle between the Forces of Light and the Shadow threat! Includes full color rulebook, separate ship book, and color countersheet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Stern Wissensquiz: Die siebziger Jahre
description:
Quiz game for 2-4 players or teams.
Questions are all about the seventies.
Be the first/best after 20 rounds.

All players including the player who asked the question put a token (with the answer they think is the correct one ==> multiple choice) in the middle - the less correct answers the more you can move forward - if you were right.
Special (red) questions for additional moves:
Die is used to determine the year - make a guess if the requested event happened earlier, later or during that year.

Content:
200 cards - with 4 questions per card
4 large & 4 small meeples (scoring positions month & year)
10-sided die
1 board
24 answer cards
1 rule sheet & solutions
No extensions were published - but different editions regarding other decades.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Whack & Slaughter
description:
Whack & Slaughter is a fantasy skirmish game, where each player uses one miniature that represents his character on the battlefield. A player may use any miniature he already possesses, as the system allows to configure the character however he wishes.

Similar to role playing games, before a game begins, each player has to create his Hero by buying levels in the traits defence, melee, ranged combat and magic. Depending on the choice of traits, a Hero gets access to a certain amount of skills. Currently there are 15 schools of skills available and - if a Hero uses 1 or 2 traits only - he may pick skills from up to two schools. Each school features 10 common skills as well as 5 elite skills - skills with superior effects. Only Heros having specialized in one trait receive access to elite skills.

The five dice a player brings along not only serve as randomizers, but as life counters and a measurement of movement as well. So each time a Hero takes damage, he will become slower and less efficient. Gameplay takes place on comparatively small "maps" (a term derived from video game language), forcing the Heros from the beginning into close quarter combat. A couple of scenarios are given in the rulebook, such as the classic "all vs. all" (also available as "team vs. team"), capture the flag, king of the hill, bombing run, a treasure hunt and even a snowfall scenario allowing players to duke it out in a snowball fight. Also, players are encouraged to create their own scenarios if the given ones do not suffice.

Also do try the companon app, allowing you to create Heros and read through the skill library, while you're on your way:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.boardnaut....
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Hoops on Fire
description:
"Hoops of Fire" is a print-and-play* two-player card game in which you coach a basketball team. The goal is for the game to be enjoyable both for basketball junkies who are new to card/board games, and for gamers who have little idea about basketball.

Draft your players and defensive strategy, then control the line-up throughout the game as exhaustion and fouls pile up. Stick to the shots that your star players are most comfortable with, or set up a pick and roll to see how the defense reacts. Finally, steal an unlikely away victory with that buzzer beater!

Example of play video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nmLNsrNt4ts

* - that being said, Quique (oladola) developed a beautiful Tabletop Simulator module (http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=493360...;searchtext=hoops+on+fire - let us know in case you'd like to try it out), while Pedro (torontoraptors) is currently working hard on an Android app!

name: Day of the Rangers: Somalia 1993
description:
From the publisher website:
"In the early 90s, Somalia was a country in chaos. As civil war raged, warlords carved out their own territories, enforcing their will through militia gangs, while famine compounded the situation. As a joint US–UN mission struggled to maintain order, the warlords began to unite behind Mohamed Farrah Aidid, who was to proclaim himself President of Somalia and embark upon a campaign to force the peacekeepers out of the country. Operations against Aidid and his strongholds intensified, culminating in the famous Operation Gothic Serpent, and the rescue mission to save a downed Black Hawk helicopter carried out by US Rangers and Delta Force operatives."

Day of the Rangers, the latest companion for Force on Force, provides wargamers with all the background, orders of battle, and scenarios they need to immerse themselves in the epic battle for Mogadishu.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Coffins and Tombstones
description:
(Taken from the back cover...)

Strap on your six shooter and prepare for one hell of a ride. Coffins and Tombstones is the fastest, meanest, gosh darn spaghetti western this side of Dodge City.

Inside you'll find all the rules you need to make your posse. From Annie Oakley to Wyatt Earp, this book is filled with western heroes and more than a few western legends. Go head to head against other players, create a campaign and shoot your way to the top.

Coffins and Tombstones is powered by the Spectrum System, a dice set that will bring your western shootouts to life as you make all of the tactical decisions. You choose when to be careful and when to get risky. Each cowpoke has the ability to be improved over time by learning new skills, gaining new abilities, and increasing their stats, that is of course, if they can avoid all the Coffins and Tombstones.

Coffins and Tombstones is a Hollywood style shootout skirmish game with 3 to 10 characters a side. It features an in-game experience system and features scenarios that award bounty for the hiring of cowpokes and townsfolk.

name: It Came from Beyond the Still
description:
A Word from Grandpa McCoy
“It all started when Junior spotted something strange over in the cornfield. Ma grabbed Sonnie boy and Suzy got the shotgun and out we went. Me and ol besty was ready to be good close personal friends with whoever was breaking into the still. We heard some noises by the still and that’s when Drunk Bob got that look in his eye that he gets when he goes out on his weekly Men in Plaid meetings. The look that says I’m going to kick the crap out of some varmints. He was madder than a hornet stuck in molasses.

So there we were looking around in the still and at first we thought it weren’t nothing noways but then outta the corner of my eye I could see the varmint! It were grayer than the night is before a bonfire and had big blue green colored eyes like the Hatfield’s above ground swimming pool. I swear there’s something livin in that thing. Anyway listen here the thing were an alien surer than it were anything else.

We were scared but we grabbed our lead and went out for the glory. Drunk Bob tossed a cocktail at them and the thing lit up one of them like roman candle. Sonnie Boy had his potato cannon and he fired at that robot thing they had. Well the taters bounced off but some of them got stuck in its feet and sure enough them mashed taters caused it to trip over into the catfish pond.

We had them alien varmints on the run but they left shooting and kept trying to probe one of our cows. That’s when we heard the sirens of them revenuers. The authorities are always trying to come and steal our shine. It makes me madder than a tick on a bull’s rocky mountain oysters to think of them government types. Anyway if they come back we’ll be ready for them – the aliens and the revenuers."

You hold in your hands the ultimate game of hilarious aliens versus hillbilly combat. It Came From Beyond the Still is a skirmish-level tabletop miniatures wargame in which two or more sides engage in mortal combat for life, liberty and the booze. So tell your kin to be prepared and to play responsibly.

It Came From Beyond the Still is a stand-alone game that is playable in about an hour.

name: Escoffier
description:
You as a chef you're opening a new restaurant in Escoffierville, but you soon find out that other chef are also opening a new restaurant, who's going to have a 5 stars restaurant first? Can you take the heat of the kitchen?

You have to manage 5-8 of your workers and send them to do different areas in some of the different buildings to receive different advantage.

The chef has to create new recipes, buy produce, do an actual service (new cool mechanic) collect cooking book, manage a cellar,
Manage worker schedule and help you're worker future career by sending them to Europe for a training in some of the world best restaurant.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Dice, Economic
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Wojnacja Kroniki Imperium
description:
Wojnacja is a non commercial tabletop miniature game.

Each player creates a warband consisting of a few unit cards and corresponding 8-20 miniatures (depending on faction). There are 10 playable factions : goblin villages, Nemezis daughters, beast lords, rebel knights, orc clans, dwarf kins,bastards of Helheim, savage elves, free merchants, Kyrian empire. Each with different skills, abilities and army configuration. The game has scenario and free play victory conditions. Wojnacja uses any 28 mm scale fantasy miniatures it even supports both round and square bases.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Czechoslovakia Defiant
description:
From the rulebook:
What might have been

To avoid the threat of another Great War, the major powers of the West have early this morning decided among themselves that Germany shall be given our border areas, the so called Sudenten land, including much of our nation's industry.

I have therefore ordered General Krejci to complete the mobilization of our armed forces and proceed with the defence of our great republic on the assumption that we shall stand alone !

Historically Czechoslovakia’s President Benes accepted the terms of the 1938 Munich Agreement and handed over the Sudenten zones and with it the republic’s best hope of remaining independent. This game gives the players the opportunity to fight out this key 'what if' campaign using an adapted version of the Fall of France system.

The political rules allow for the strong possibly of initiating a regional war as neighbouring countries are dragged into the conflict. Numerous optional rules are also included to allow players to customise play to players tastes.

name: Colorfast
description:
Colorfast is an abstract game where players each represent a primary color. On their turn, players will either place a cube of their color, or convert an existing cube to another color that is one away from the current one on the color spectrum (red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple). The object is to get five cubes in a row made of your primary color and any derivative secondary colors (e.g. red, purple and orange). When (re)placing cubes, players may not choose a space that is adjacent (orthogonally or diagonally) to one of the last two pieces played on.

Rules are changed slightly for the 2 player game, having each player also take a turn with a neutral color (yellow).

name: Crootle: A Card Game of Kaleidoscopic Proportions
description:
Crootle is an abstract game that entails matching colors. There are 112 Color Tiles in a standard deck, along with 20 Corner Tiles. Each tile in the deck is 1.375" square. Crootle uses four colors, red, green, blue, and yellow. Each Color tile is divided into quadrants, each quadrant one of the four colors. A Color Tile may have each of its quadrants a different color, or they may be all the same, or a combination. Because there are four colors, there are 256 color combinations possible, 112 of which have been selected to make this standard deck. A Corner Tile is the same size but is solid in color. A set of Corner Tiles consists of one of each of the four colors in Crootle.

The object of the game of Crootle is to connect two corners of the playing field together. Each game the Corner Tiles are randomly set, and each player randomly selects their path, or rather their two corners to connect. Four players could feasibly be on the same path as each other.

Through timed turn play, each player draws Color Tiles and matches them side to side, trying to connect, or block their opponents from connecting, their two corners.

Fun for anyone who sits down to play. Playing head to head with players of equal ability can prove to make a challenging game. Test playing has found audiences in children 7+, adult party games, senior players, and even some autistic and other mentally challenged persons have enjoyed the task of connecting Color Tiles.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Cine-vilzation
description:
The player is the CEO of a movie studio during the golden age of Hollywood (1927-1955). Competition for talented people is fierce, and the public's tastes in movies change all the time. The player has to manage and hire new people, and approve the right films, so that the have as much Fame (victory points) as possible, at the end of the game.

Created for the 2013 Solitaire Print and Play contest, Cine-vilzation uses six small containers to manage the production and payout of film genres. Players have to do their best to predict when films will become popular, as timing a film release correctly will earn the player fame and clout in the film industry, which can help produce even more films.

Twelve film types are grouped into three genres centered around the resources that make Hollywood run, capital, acclaim and power. Players keep track of these resources, using tokens, dice and cards. The tokens can only be used once, and may need to be held to pay upkeep costs at the end of each round. Cards can be played to help pay for a film, but holding on to them will generate tokens. Dice can be used multiple times, but cost tokens each round. Dice also control an invisible opponent, who tries to get cards before you do, and speeds up the end of the game.

Players will have to evaluate their supply of resources, the popularity of films, and how much time remains to try to make the best films they can. When resources are dedicated to a film, they get placed into a container, and will be unavailable for several rounds. The containers shift during upkeep, with any dice inside the first container getting rolled for the AI.
categories: Civilization, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Mage Wars: Selesius, the East Wind Promo Card
description:
This promo card was given as Gen Con 2013.

Selesius, the East Wind

Creature
Cost 21 Mana
Health 13
Armor 1

Quick Attack: Halberd

Melee, 4 Dice, Piercing + 1

Full Attack: Great Winged Wind Blast
Ranged 0-1, 2 Dice, 7+ = Push. Sweeping, Unavoidable, +2 vs. Flying, Ethereal

Non foil stamped version was released in the Forcemaster vs Warlord Expansion (2 copies)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Agri-Cup: The John Deere Farming Game
description:
Farm development and trading board game.

The first player to: Repay the loan, build a farmhouse, build Livestock sheds, build Produce sheds, install electricity and water and buy a tractor is the winner.

- acting by turns -
Each player is given a piece of land, provided with a Government loan, and through wise buying, productivity and selling, has to develop his farm.

Roll the die and move forward; depending on the space you reach you may/have to buy, sell, get, pay...

Notes:
Similar approach to Monopoly, with a guidance for agricultural business.
Quite comparable to Agri-hazard.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Stellar Supremacy
description:
Millions of years ago our ancestors a nomad race known as K'wertz S'teratz (“The Firsts”) reached our galaxy. They establish they colonies four planetary systems and gave birth to our people before gone. We lived centuries of peace and prosperity. But as it was predicted as the eras passed we became divided into four deeply different societies, four enemy factions. Our became starving for power, obsessed for domination. We started to insanely hate each other and now we only thing our once united societies thinks is about conquest. Each one built their own starship armada and declared war. Dreadful times came to our galaxy...May the K'wertz S'terats have mercy of our actions. Go to war my sons but remember: in the dark and cold space only death prevails.

Stellar Supremacy is a space combat game where 2 to 4 players struggle to domain the galaxy.

There are four ways to win the game: Map area control, Home Worlds Control, Victory Points or opponents elimination.

The game brings to the players strategical and tatical levels of action and the ability to combine game elements to implement them.

name: Mice On: Impossible
description:
The Alley Cat strives to catch those annoying mice. They sneak into the cube to eat garbage. And the dog just wants to be left alone resting, but of course can bite, so watch out. Everyone must hurry to reach his goal before the pipes are opened and water wipes out the street.

During the game each side in alternating turns, moves one of his pieces (the cat or a mouse) and also the dog. The aim of the mice is to make the most of his pieces jump into the garbage can. But the cat will try to thwart this, because his goal is to devour most mice, and avoid being eaten by the dog. Both sides push the garbage can as one more piece to take advantage or thwart your opponent. Furthermore, both sides control the slow movements of the dog. This movement acts as a timer that, at mid-game, causes the disappearance of the mice that have not been put into play and the arrival of reinforcements and, on reaching the 31st turn, triggers the end game.

Spanish description:

El gato callejero se afana en atrapar a los molestos ratones. Ellos se cuelan en el cubo de la basura para comer. Y el perro sólo quiere que lo dejen descansar, pero por supuesto puede morder, así que ten cuidado. Todo el mundo debe darse prisa para lograr su objetivo antes de que se abran las cañerías y el agua acabe barriendo la calle.

Durante el juego cada bando en turnos alternos, mueve una de sus piezas (el gato o uno de los ratones) y además al perro. El objetivo de los ratones es lograr que la mayoría de sus piezas salten al interior del cubo de basura. Pero el gato tratará de frustrar esto, porque su meta es devorar a la mayoría de ratones, evitando ser comido por el perro. Ambos bandos empujan el cubo como una pieza más para favorecerse o perjudicar a su rival. Además ambos manipulan los lentos movimientos del perro. Este movimiento se comporta como un temporizador que, a mitad de la partida, provoca la desaparición de los ratones que no se han puesto en juego y la llegada de nuevos refuerzos y que, al alcanzarse el turno 31, desencadena el final del juego.

name: Deadzone: Enforcer Faction Starter
description:
Deadzone is a skirmish sci-fi miniatures game where players lead their strike forces into quarantined cityscapes on alien plague-infested worlds for profit and glory.

The Enforcers represent cabalistic human Corporate interests, an elite strike force of power-armored soldiers equipped with the finest weaponry and armor that credits can buy.

The Enforcer Faction Starter includes 12 unpainted, unassembled resin plastic miniatures including:
1 Enforcer Peackeeper Captain
1 Enforcer Sniper
1 Enforcer Engineer with 2 Sentry Guns
1 Enforcer Specialist with Missile Launcher
2 Assault Enforcers
4 Enforcers with Heavy Rifles

The starter set also includes all bases for these miniatures and a 54 card Enforcer card deck necessary for fielding this strike force. The card deck includes mission cards, unit stat cards and battle cards to help boost your troops' performance and to derail your enemy's plans.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Alfred the Great: War in the West Country 876AD
description:
Mark Sheppard extends his coverage of this famous monarch with his game on Alfred’s decisive 876 campaign. Not only were the Saxon king and his followers contending with more Viking incursions, but with a rebellion among the native Britons, who sought to take advantage of the King’s woes by seeking to carve out their independence amidst the mayhem. Players familiar with the first volume of the series will be able to quickly get into this game. Each copy of Alfred the Great, Volume II is composed of the following:

One 11 by 17 inch hex map
Two sheets of 286 single-sided, un-mounted counters
Three cardstock Battle Boards (one Briton, one Saxon, one Viking)
One Players’ Aid Sheet
8 pages of rules
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Red King Games

name: Letter Tycoon: 2015 Coaster Set Expansion Powers
description:
A promo at Gen Con 2015 was a 7 card coaster set consisting of 6 random letter "cards" and 1 bonus dual sided coaster featuring the first preview of Tycoon powers from an upcoming expansion.

If used at the table, the coaster power visible is ACTIVE for that game of Letter Tycoon.

Side A (orange):
IN GAME: Pay $1 to discard and refresh all the community letters at the start of your turn.

Side B (green):
END GAME: Earn $1: Score per patent if you can form a valid word. (minimum 3 patents)
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Die Feuermoore
description: Die Feuermoore (The Fire Moors) is a blank map for Chada & Thorn, with a start, end, and two middle stages. The moors lie between the forest and the mountains on the island of Narkon. You may add your own movement values and effect icons to the paths on the map.

name: Splitters!: Någon djävla ordning ska det va i ett parti
description:
Splitters! is a card driven game about the left wing political movement of the 70s. The players take on the rolls of ideologists struggling to have the movement embrace their separate interpretations of socialism. The game either ends when a player successfully achieves three secret goals or when the last card is drawn from the deck, in which case the player who controls the most party members wins.

In the beginning of the game the whole movement is united in the "Party", but during the course of the game the players break out groups of members to form new parties. Each member tile has three opinions, each in different categories (colour, symbol and background). Playing an action card the player combines an action with on of these opinions to rearrange the members on the board - creating new parties, taking control of existing ones or transferring members from one party to another.

Inspired by Monthy Pythons "Life of Brian" Splitters! is a chaotic and humoristic game, which still leaves room for tactical depth.

Description in Swedish:
I Splitters! tar spelarna rollen som ideologer i 70-talets vänsterrörelse för att utkämpa en bitter kamp om vilken tolkning av socialismen som är den rätta. Konsekvensen kan bara bli en: Splittring! Kämpa för din övertygelse i försöken att genomdriva ditt politiska program och samla medlemmar i en miljö där partierna har en tendens att föröka sig like amöbor - genom delning.

Splitters är ett kortdrivet spel där spelarna försöker ta kontrollen över de medlemsbrickor som ligger på bordet. Spelet kan sluta på två sätt - antingen genom att en spelare lyckas uppfylla tre hemliga uppdrag (så kallade Övertygelser) eller när det sista kortet dragits ur högen och segern går till den spelare som kontrollerar flest medlemmar.
Vid spelets början är alla rörelsens medlemmar samlade i "Partiet" mitt på bordet, men under spelets gång bryter spelarna ut grupper av medlemmar som bildar nya partier, med allt längre och allt mer sekteristiska namn.
Varje medlemsbricka har tre åsikter i olika kategorier (färg, symbol och bakgrund). På sin tur kombinerar spelaren ett handlingskort från sin hand med en av dessa åsikter för att flytta runt medlemsbrickorna på bordet: skapa nya partier, ta över befintliga partier eller flytta medlemmar från ett parti till ett annat.

Inspirerat av Monthy Pythons "Life of Brian" är Splitters! ett kaotiskt och humoristiskt spel om 70-talets vänsterrörelse, som trots slumpfaktorer ändå har taktiskt djup.

name: Rinkside Hockey
description:
RINKSIDE HOCKEY by FTP Sports Games is a full stats-based simulation of the fast-paced game of hockey. The game engine is designed around a hockey player's ability to make the plays that will determine the outcome of each game. Hockey players are rated individually on such traits as goal scoring, passing, defense, checking, and several others. Goalies are also rated on their abilities to make saves, avoid giving up rebounds and more. Game players will resolve action either by printing out fast action cards or using the Microsoft Excel Game Center, which is included in the game. All player cards, the fast action deck and more are available as PDF downloads.

The game flows similar to an actual hockey game and is broken up into the three main zones of a rink: Offensive Zone, Neutral Zone and Defensive Zone. You can either pass or skate your way from one zone to the next and the fast action cards (or Game Center) will determine the result. Once your player makes it to the offensive zone, then you decide to shoot or pass again.

The hockey players’ ability to draw and dish out penalties is also very evident in the game. There is even a momentum tracker which can help teams as you track big hits, goals, great saves, etc.
Several hockey seasons are available.

name: Tanks: Panzer IV Tank Expansion
description: The Panzer IV was the only German tank to remain in production throughout the war. Continuous upgrades to its armour and weapons allowed it to counter new threats as they appeared on any German front.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: No Blank Left Behind
description:
Description from the publisher:

No Blank Left Behind !is an adult party game inspired by such games as Cards Against Humanity, Nasty Things and Say Anything. We loved playing Cards Against Humanity, but felt too constrained by the predefined white cards. So we created a game where with the use of whiteboards the answer could be anything your filthy mind could think of.

On the surface No Blank Left Behind appears to be just another Cards Against Humanity clone with a few seemingly minor differences. First players have four statements/questions on each card to choose from. Second rather than be provided a hand of cards with a predefined responses, No Blank Left Behind instead utilizes whiteboards and dry erase markers allowing players to come up with their own responses, limited only by their individual imaginations. And lastly who wrote what answer is not kept a secrete from the judge or as it is know in No Blank Left Behind “The Dictator”. This allows players to lobby for their answer and explain why theirs is obviously the best.

What does all this mean? Well, it means you should never have to ask a lame question. You are never stuck with answer cards that don't fit the question. In-jokes or even the players themselves can become answers and the same answers can be used over and over leading to some very funny running jokes. Which in the end leads to a ton of laughs, many groans and possibly a few gasps. No Blank Left Behind may seem like another Cards Against Humanity clone, but the minor differences makes it a new unique and hilarious party game.

name: Бестиарий Сигиллума: четырехпутье (Bestiary of Sigillum: Quadrivium)
description: Second expansion for Bestiary of Sigillum. Includes 9 new characters and new map for team play. Expands player count to 4.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Honeycomb Weaver Expansion
description:
The Honeycomb Weaver expansion comes with 2 forms. The 10 year version is a node 1 monster that can be fought lantern year 1 of the campaign! The 100 year form is a node 3 monster that provides a much more powerful set of armor and weapons.

Contains:
1 20-30+ pages rulebook
1 x Honeycomb Weaver 100 Years miniature (50mm base)
1 x Honeycomb Weaver 10 Years miniature (50mm base)
2 x Large Nightmare Bees miniatures
2 x Steel-wax Armor miniatures (30mm base)
2 x Rawhide Wax Hybrid Armor miniatures (30mm base)
80+ x game cards
1 x Settlement Event cards
60 x gear cards
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Enterprise-D Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for the "Yesterday's Enterprise" episode Organized Play event. It is a Federation Galaxy class ship and provides an alternative Enterprise-D to the starter set version.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: La Caída de Hispania
description:
La Caída de Hispania ("The Fall of Spain") is a game for 2 to 4 players.

Every player takes the role of one of the factions (hispanoroman,Visigoths, Suevi and Barbarians)to get their historical goals.

Factions coexist, fight and interact in the final era of the Roman Empire represented by the marker of the fall of Rome.

Players get victory points occupying "conventus" (geographic areas).
To get the victory every player has a group of "huestes" (armies) on the board and a treasure trove of "mites"(roman coins) to negotiate and gain advantages.

The turns are developed with a card engine, generics for all players and specific for differente factions.

At the end of the game, the faction with more Victory Points will be the winner and the prize will be to rule Hispania.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Open Drafting

name: Panzer Grenadier: 1940 – The Fall of Luxembourg
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

1940: The Fall of Luxembourg gives you the entire order of battle of Luxembourg forces in the Second World War in Panzer Grenadier format. That adds up to a whopping 16 counters, including leaders, plus four more markers for the curious Luxembourgeouis (Luxemburger? Luxembourgian?) defense strategy: stop the Germans by closing big steel doors across the roads. Maybe if we turn out all the lights they’ll get the hint and go home.

You even get scenarios for them!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Nomads: Gift Promo Tiles
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for Day 22.

Rules are in English only.
Tiles are language neutral.

Setup

Shuffle the 6 Gift tiles with the other tiles.


Then form 8 stacks of 14 or 15 random tiles. Place each stack on one of the 8 square-shaped spaces.

A - Listen to Stories

If the player takes a Gift tile, he places it in front of himself.


End of Game

Score one point for each Gift tile you collected.
Score one additional point for each pair of the same Gift.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Unicorn Blood
description:
Promo from the kickstarter for the The Red Dragon Inn 6: Villains

You may pay 2 gold to the inn.
If you do: -4 Alcohol -1 Health
Otherwise, discard Unicorn Blood and drink the top card of the Drink Deck instead.

The promo is unusual in that it is a holographic foil card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Hegemony: Shadows of Power
description:
In "Hegemony, Shadows of Power”, powerful leaders struggle to make their Cause prevail in a re-emerging fantasy world. Manage your power, negotiate, form alliances and bluff to make your way to supremacy.

Players begin the game with different initial powers. In each turn, a Challenge is revealed, and Leaders choose to take part in it or not. Players who dispute the Challenge try to negotiate and convince others to join their alliance. Alliances dispute the prize by betting face-down Power cards and reinforcements; and leaders may bluff with their bets. Once the bets are revealed, the Alliance with the most power is declared the winner and obtains the Challenge's reward (Cause points). Gather 10 or more Cause points to win the match.

(publisher info)

name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Grelrok Expansion
description:
Grelrok is a Vampire Elder that can be used with the Order of Vampire Hunters game in any standalone Hunt or campaign. This expansion includes:

1 highly detailed plastic miniature
1 Vampire ID card
A rulesheet

The sharp protruding bones, thick hide and bulging muscles send a clear message, Grelrok is here to fight. Grelrok is a misshapen beast that uses its whole body as a weapon. It does not matter if its prey remains in one piece, what matters is that it’s dead.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: The Battle of Grumentum, the Italian Campaign, 207 BC
description:
Eleven years have passed since the outbreak of the Second Punic War between Rome and Carthage. Both sides have become exhausted after long years of battling and campaigning across the Mediterranean Theater. From Spain, Hasdrubal Barca marches toward Italy to join his brother Hannibal. Together they seek to bring this long, hard conflict to an end.
Rome is aware of the overall Carthaginian plan and therefore strengthens its legions. If, after so many years of war, Rome has been unable to defeat Hannibal, what will happen when a new member of the "Lion's Brood" reinforces his brother in Italy? The result of the Second Punic War, possibly control of the Western Mediterranean,is at stake.

- 3-page historical background article (pp. 11-13 within C3i #21 magazine, 2008).
- Scenario set-up instructions (pp. 14-15 within C3i #21 magazine, 2008).
- 2 new leaders counters

(from the publisher)


SPQR module from C3i Magazine #21, 2008.

name: Byczyna 1588
description:
Game covers battle at Byczyna, fought 24 January 1588 near Byczyna at Silesa. It was the deciding battle of the 1587–1588 War of the Polish Succession, which erupted after two rival candidates were elected to the Polish throne.
Game uses Husaria system.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Type S Scout Deck
description:
A Ship Deck comes with 81 cards:


1 Ship Card
20 Adventure Cards
60 Captain's Cards


Each deck is distinct, containing its own list of cards, though some may be common to multiple decks.

Scout and Free Trader are also part of the Traveller Customizable Card Game: Two Player Starter Set.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: LunaTix: Star Trackers
description:
STORY
While players are travelling around planet Earth, they need to collect enough stellar navigation knowledge (Ticket points called ‘Tix’) to face a trip to the Moon (Luna). Tix can be earned by travelling to different continents, using different vehicles and by observing the Moon, the planets (expansion) and the constellations of stars. In the endgame the Tix are essential to overcome the obstacles to the Moon. The first player reaching the Moon with sufficient Tix covering those difficulties during the trip wins the game. When playing solo, a time restriction is added to win the game depending on the difficulty level.

OVERVIEW MECHANICS
The game board shows in the top left corner that each round, called a month, consists of three phases:

Ecliptic phase: when the new first player shifts the Sun on the star map, lays out new observation cards in the observation area and initiates the first choice of the planning phase.
Planning phase: each player in counter clockwise order, starting with the first player, chooses a vacant lunar phase (1 of the 4 weeks in a month) to plan an action by placing his meeple accordingly.
Activation phase: Beginning with the first week (new moon), the planned actions are being executed. In a game with more than 4 players the direct observation takes precedent of travelling, then saving an observation card, ending with observing a saved observation card.


The star map shows the Sun with new background stars, forming a zodiac constellation, each month of the year. A day light card will cover the constellations present during the day. This dynamic alters the visibility in horizontal fashion, according what astronomers call Right Ascension (RA). The sunset and sunrise drawn on the daylight card forms the observer’s western and eastern horizon.
A map of planet Earth shows the continents you can travel to and can result in a visibility change as an observer according to the latitude change after each movement. The latitude correlates with the highest passing of the stars overhead; called zenith. The visibility in vertical fashion is expressed in what astronomers call Declination (DEC). Blocks underneath an armillary sphere will indicate your northern and southern horizon.
The observation area contains a freshly laid out combination of observation cards that can be scored when visible according to the time of the year and the place the player is on Earth. The lunar phases are scored according to the right week of the month that they appear in.
The end game unfolds once a player reaches the launch pad for a voyage to the Moon. Once launched the player must tackle certain difficulties (Diff) by keeping the Diff values under their acquired knowledge and observation points (Tix). Special abilities, hidden agendas and lunar phase abilities can mitigate the values to be absorbed by your knowledge as a navigator.
The game invokes an elegant choice between efficient observation, puzzling travel routes, playing out opportunities with abilities and some courage to risk a rocket launch as soon as possible.

WHAT'S UNIQUE?
LunaTix: Star Trackers offers a highly educational chance to get in touch with a real star map and to learn its link with our location on Earth. The knowledge of our planet’s position and movement around the Sun, forming our seasons in time and climate regions in latitude, will provide you with a deeper insight on how people came to divide time and space as we know it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Educational, Print & Play, Racing, Space Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: BATTALIA NCBC: The Order of the Half Oracle
description:
Dishearter - She is tough and she is pretty, but cold as a stone and fully committed to her pledge. She belongs to the Order of the Half Oracle and would always try to "turn" you. Dishearter will charm you first and try to convince you to follow her path... but if you reject... She would take your courage away, consume your faith and moral and leave you wretched and miserable. She is able to do that... The main rule of the Order teaches: If you are not with us, you're against us!

Truth-squeezer - Are you willing to tell the truth? Dare you to hide it? It's your choice, just always be prepared to meet the Truth-Squeezer ... Do you believe you're ready to face him and listen to him, hissing in your ear: Knowledge is power, but the truth could be your weakness... I know how to squeeze it from you.... The Order will prize my efforts, since I always hear their call: Remove all obstacles!

Challenger - Large and very detailed miniature of a fanatics challenger, another great NPC, which offers new style of adventures... Meeting you, he will challenge you, will always try to seduce your natural born greed for success, he will play with your moral and conscience and finally he will let you no choice, but to make one very hard decision.... It's always about the same old dilemma: Victory or Defeat - and are you willing to pay the price for it?


NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basically competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replaya bility and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Catan: High Priests of the Inkas
description:
A mini scenario for use with Catan Histories: Rise of the Inkas. Or you can use this scenario with your Catan game.

Place the 5 high priest cards face up beside the game board. As soon you have placed the 1st settlement of your 2nd tribe on the board, choose 1 of the high priest cards and place it face up beside your culture board.

Each of the priest has a particular advantage described on the card. You can use this advantage on your turn. But only once per game.

After using the high priest card, put it back in the box.

Contents:
- 5 High-Priests cards
- 1 Rules card
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Folding Space
description:
Take command of your very own pirate ship, and blast off to the rings and moons of Saturn! The high seas are no match for the adventures that await you and your crew as you race against rivals, and battle for resources and treasures. You'll need split-second planning to outmaneuver and outwit the other captains if you want to claim this section of space as your own!

Folding Space is a highly approachable game for 3 to 6 players, ages 10 and up, that takes approximately 30-45 minutes to play. The game features an innovative infinity board for all players to give orders to their crew simultaneously, and those players will pillage resources, acquire treasure maps, and battle their space pirate rivals on a modular tile map.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Modular Board, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift Scenario Pack
description:
A mini campaign for the acclaimed dungeon crawler Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift.

This four part campaign is specifically designed for new players with the possibility of increasing the difficulty settings for experienced players.

The heroes will find themselves delving into the abyssal rift looking for children abducted by the cult of the insectoid god.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Dreamescape
description:
Where even dreams may die!

DreamEscape is a card game hybrid of choose-your-path style narrative adventure and Cthulhu novella.

Great Cthulhu has trapped your sleeping mind in the Dreamlands. Your dream-self has shattered into multiple fragments, scattered throughout the dream world. It is your task to recover these lost fragments, unravel the story secrets and survive long enough to find the correct key and matching gate to escape and wake up!

To win you must avoid, adapt or overcome the many dangers of this nightmare world. In this solo RPG-like survival horror game you must carefully manage your pool of skills and resources, find rare items, gain secret knowledge and wield two uniquely powerful abilities - Deja vu and Lucid dreaming - to stay ahead of the minions of Cthulhu.

Explore many hundreds of unique story encounters on your quest to recover the mind fragments and find a Dreamgate to let you wake from the nightmare. Failure will lead to insanity, locked forever in a dream within your own mind!

Dreamescape is a narrative exploration game driven by story card encounters. Each encounter offers roleplay-like choices that drive the game in divergent directions so the game evolves differently each time you play. Repeated play rewards your play experience as you will uncover different parts of the story puzzle. The chances of success is based on your skills, equipment and lore you have gain so far, your memory of previous games guiding you towards success!

There are 6 asymmetric Dreamer characters to choose from, each with their own backstory to unravel. ~400 encounter cards, ~100 Items and Lore cards to discover combine to provide a highly varied narrative experience.

The game offers multiple levels of interwoven story arcs and plot lines to keep you occupied and guessing each time you play. There are many hidden puzzles, traps and lore locked away in the game waiting for you to uncover... but all knowledge comes at a price. The more you experience, the greater your chances of being driven into insanity!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Middara: Casual Remi Resin Kit
description:
Middara: Casual Remi Resin Kit comes with a single model, an art print, a 5x6 Card, and two Standard Euro sized Cards.

The model kit is unpainted and must be assembled using your own glue and supplies. The cards that come with the figure are additional game content that can be used in the Crawl Mode or shuffled into their corresponding decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Gloomspite Gitz
description:
Cruel, cunning and treacherous, the Gloomspite Gitz infest the dank places of the Mortal Realms like a mouldering fungus. Though anarchic creatures by their very nature, when they unite under a common cause they are capable of wholescale destruction.

Spread anarchy and mayhem across the Eightpoints with this Warcry card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set allows you to command a warband of anarchic Gloomspite Gitz in your skirmish battles. An abilities card allows you to use deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Boingrot Bounderz, Squig Hoppers, Stabbas, Shootas, Squig Herders and Cave Squigs.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Ghostel: Legendary Guests expansion
description:
An expansion for the Ghostel board game, including Legends of the horror genre.

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Stormcast Eternals
description:
Forged by Sigmar from the souls of heroes, the Stormcast Eternals are the foremost champions of Order and some of the deadliest fighters in the realms.

Bring your Vanguard Chamber Stormcast Eternals to the battlefields of Warcry with this card pack! Combined with the Core Rules and your miniatures, this set allows you to bring the brave scouts and outriders of Sigmar’s armies to your games. An abilities card lets you unleash deadly in-game tactics and powers, while a set of fighter cards provide profiles for Vanguard-Hunters, Vanguard-Raptors and Gryph Hounds.

This set contains an abilities card in English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, and Russian, as well as several fighter cards. Please note that a copy of the Warcry Core Book is needed to use this set.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Nothing Personal: Scenes of the Crime
description:
Scenes of the Crime introduces location cards to Nothing Personal which allows your family to exert their influence on some of the city's most infamous places.

Includes 5 oversized location cards and 1 rule card.

Location cards are compatible with both the Revised Edition and the original version of Nothing Personal.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Songbirds: Promo Cards
description:
A two pack of promo cards originally available via the Tantrum House Season 6 Kickstarter.

Includes:
Owl - During game play, when you play the Owl card from your hand, you must remove a songbird from any space in the forest and place the Owl in that space. Then, place the songbird your removed back into the forest using the standard placement rules.

Shrike - During game play, when you play the Shrike card from your hand, you may swap the locations of the Berry tokens in the Shrink's row and column.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Bomb Brigade
description:
Bomb Brigade is a tense, high-stakes game of chance where players must rely on their quick reflexes and courage to survive. There is really only one rule: don’t blow up.

SETUP:
Connect all the Blinks together and long press one, sending them all into setup mode. In setup mode, Blinks display a slowly shifting rainbow. Arrange the Blinks into a starting arrangement, then double-click a Blink to turn it into a Bomb. All neighboring Blinks will automatically become Shields.
Starting arrangements can be simple, as shown above, but can also be larger or more complicated and include multiple bombs.

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns ‘sparking’ the Bomb by pressing it once. With every spark, there is an increasing chance that the Bomb will explode. In addition, each time the Bomb is sparked the spinning gets faster and faster.
Sparking the Bomb

If you can time it correctly, you should try to only spark the Bomb when its light is facing a shield. If the bomb explodes into a Shield, that Shield takes damage.
Bomb explodes, damaging Shield

Damage is indicated by a Shield changing color from green to yellow to orange to red. A Shield that takes 4 damage is destroyed, and displays a flashing rainbow pattern. Destroyed Shields should be removed from the board.

If the Bomb explodes on a side with no Shield, the player who sparked the Bomb ‘blows up’ and is out of the game. Double-click the exploded Bomb to reset it.
Bomb explodes on an empty side

WIN CONDITION:
The last player remaining after all others have been blown up is the winner.

This game is played with Blinks, the world's first smart tabletop game system.

—description from the publisher

name: D-Day Dice (Second Edition): Inside The Bunker
description:
This expansion for Airborne in your Pocket allows you to combine 2 different games: AIYP and D-Day Dice.

How does it work? Easy: when you play D-Day Dice and your unit enters the bunker, you must play a mini-game of Airborne in your Pocket to see what happens inside!

Also includes cards that can be added to either game:
AIYP: 43 dice-based cards, including a new set of events, new scenarios and many items and Special Ops
D-Day Dice - 12 Airborne-themed awards, items and Specialists.

Do you dare find out what is inside the bunker?

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Die Icon Resolution
publishers: Giant Roc, Maldito Games, Word Forge Games

name: Aventuria: Schneidermeisters Poltergeister
description:
The Dugon di Montarazzo tailor shop is haunted! Brave heroes are needed to get to the bottom of this!

This Beginner's Adventure with 4 pre-built Beginner's Hero Decks allows you to introduce a group of up to four newcomers to the exciting world of Aventuria Adventure Card Game.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Castles in Hungary (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The rules of the German Castles can be applied to the Hungarian Castles with the difference that the tiles are mixed with the others and not distributed to the players.

7 Tile Mini-Expansion

name: Age of Dirt: Firepit Promo Card
description:
A new card for Age of Dirt! It reads:

Discard this card to either
... avoid an event OR renew the To-Do-Wall.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Builder Pack.

name: FunkiFruit
description:
In this fast-paced fruit card game - FunkiFruit. You are searching a juicy crate.

Collect fruits, throw rotten tomatoes at your 'friends' and use actions to amass the most impressive platter. Beware, the starving insects bite: think Biker Slugs and Viking Ants!

There is something here for everyone, with classic 'take that' elements and good luck that rewards strategic planning. It's time to sharpen your memory and bring your inner 'Angry Farmer' to the table.

FunkiFruit can be enjoyed by players of all ages. You can customise your experience with our included fruit menu, to keep your game ripe and fresh!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That
publishers: Clever Unicorn Games, Wall Capital Games

name: Monster Farm
description:
Monster Farm is a Drafting, Bidding, and Resource Management game.
You take the role of a Monster Farmer and decide which monsters you want to feed. Then you get to bid on Monster Fruit to feed them in the Open Market. If you need more fruit, you can go to the Black Market to get more. Also, you can use a Monster Thief to steal fruit for you. All the while, Seasonal Events will cause you to adapt to new conditions on the farm. Do you have what it takes to be a Monster Farmer? (Please say yes! The monsters are really hungry and need someone to feed them.)

In Monster Farm there are 5 phases to the game

Phase 1
In phase one, everyone gets 5 five Monster Cards, then you pick one and pass the others. Each Monster Card has the fruit required to feed it listed below. Overall, the more points a monster is worth the harder it will be to feed it. You keep doing this until you have drafted your farm. In this stage, you might be trying to draft easy monsters to speed up the game and get a blitz win. Or maybe you go with a few big, harder monsters hoping that if you feed just a few big guys, you can pull it off. Or maybe you do a balanced draft. It is all up to you and the monsters you draft will affect the way you play the rest of the game.

Draft 5 monsters for your farm!

Phase 2
In phase two, a Seasonal Event happens; this will cause all farmers to adjust their strategy. It could be gaining a monster, losing a monster, or maybe gaining some random fruit and more. Things will change and affect your strategy. However, this is an environmental change and it affects everyone. It is not just one player becoming lucky or unlucky.

Phase 3
