In phase three, there is an Open Market bid. You are bidding on a bundle of three fruits. Each player bids on the market starting with the first player for that round. Each player must bid higher or pass. If you pass you are out of the bidding round. This becomes quite tricky. Maybe you really need only one fruit or you may need all the fruit. How much should you bid? It could also be that you don’t need the fruit but you buy it so that you can prevent someone else who does need it from buying it. Do you bid it up and hope you don’t get left with it? A lot can happen here. There are various fruits, some will help you feed you monsters others will give you a permanent income bonus. At the bottom right of each card, you can see how many of those there are in the deck.

Also once per game, you can play a Monster Thief to steal the bid! It is like a tactical nuke. You only get to use it once during the game so play it wisely.

Phase 4
In phase four, you are buying fruit on the Black Market. The fruit is random and you can even get a rotten fruit which is completely useless. Since it is the Black Market, there is no quality control. Remember the Monster Gems you spend here means that you will have less when you go to bid on the Open Market.

Phase 5
In phase five, you collect your base income of 3. If you have purchased Fruit Stands or Monster Cafes from the Open Market or Black Market, your income is increased. For each Fruit Stand, you will receive an additional 1 Monster Gem added to your income. For each Monster Cafe, you will receive an additional 2 gems during this phase. You keep these cards until the end of the game.

Winning the Game
Repeat phases 2 thru 5 until someone has fed all of their monsters. The first person to feed all their monsters receives a Monster Egg for an additional five points. All other players finish playing the rest of that round. Then each player adds up the points on their fed monsters and the one with most points wins and is now the “Master Monster Farmer!”

In Monster Farm, you get an amazing 2 to 6 player game that the whole family can play in about 30 minutes. I have been playing board games for quite some time but often much of my games go unplayed because they just don’t fit the number of players, or they take too long, or they just don’t fit the ages/abilities of the players. I wanted to make sure that the game would be fun for both adults and kids. I wanted it simple but yet have a good depth of strategy. Also, I wanted a game where you don’t just play for 5 minutes then wait 15 minutes until it is your turn again. This game passes the Smore Games QualityTest, which is, after people play the game once, they want to play it “Smore!” I want to thank all my playtesters and the feedback they have given. This is an OUTSTANDING GAME! Have fun!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Economic, Fantasy, Farming
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Closed Drafting, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Welcome!
description:
Welcome! is a card game from Japan. Players are trying to be the most successful mayor, attracting new businesses to their town, or lose the next election! The game turns on being able to build up a company and also be the only player appealing to that company. Players do this by card drafting and bluffing, openly or blindly, until a final reckoning.

The game has a simple deck of 80 cards and a start player marker. Played over two rounds, each round has four turns, and players take simple actions to improve their chances of re-election.

The deck has 8 Tourist cards (orange), 12 Software (yellow), 12 Hotel (purple), 12 Merchant Ship (green), 16 Airlines (blue) and 20 Motors (red). Each card shows the number in the deck, so all the orange Tourist cards say 8. With three players, the yellow cards are not used.

On the back of each card is a handshake. Players are trying to convert company cards they collect into handshakes. Most handshakes collected by the end is the winner.

The deck is shuffled, a line of 5 cards is dealt up, the companies players are trying to attract. Players are dealt 9 cards each, and each selects 3 to pass to their neighbour once. The neighbour looks at them, and the passed cards then go into a deck shuffled up. This Round deck goes next to the line of companies.

Now players choose two hand cards in secret and place them face-down. When everyone has chosen, these Appeal cards are turned face up. At the end of the round, after four turns, these Appeal cards will divide up the company cards evenly between players, turning them over into handshakes. So the players are trying to place Appeals such that they are the only mayor attracting that company at the end of the round. If more than one player has the same Appeal card out, the cards are divied up by proportion.

During the round, players may add one only Appeal card (limit is 3), or make swap a new Appeal card in (face-up or face-down) sending the old card to the company line, or may turn one card horizontal as a Challenge. Once each player has taken one action, three cards are dealt up from the Round deck to the line. If a player had chosen a Challenge to match any of these, their Challenge card becomes a handshake for them. If it didn't, it is discarded from the game. The start marker moves on and play continues with another action.

After four turns, all Appeal cards are shown, and the line of companies is divied up. Collected cards become handshakes, uncollected remain for the second round, with the Appeal cards being added to the company line.

The second round is played over in the same way and the player with the most handshakes at the end is the winner.

The first edition was home-made by the designer in only five copies. The second edition was a full edition and the 3rd edition was only a straight reprint, although marked in the rules as a 3rd edition.
user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Industry / Manufacturing, Political
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Age of Fantasy: Regiments
description:
Age of Fantasy: Regiments is a miniature wargame set in a dark magical world, which is played using 28mm miniatures.
The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging regimental fantasy battles for new and experienced players alike.

This rulebook adds lots of extra content to the core rules, providing you with countless hours of epic regimental battles that you can customize however you like.
The rules are written to be concise and to the point, and come with beautiful illustrations as well as helpful example diagrams.

Here's everything that's included in this rulebook:

Core Rules
Advanced Rules
Terrain Placement
Deployment Styles
Extra Missions
Side-Missions
Extra Actions
Solid Buildings
Random Events
Battlefield Conditions
Terrain & Objective Effects

Total Conversions
Fog of War
Brutal Damage
Command Points
Fatigue
Phased Battles
Multiplayer Games
Small-Scales & Multi-Basing



Note that all of the army books are available for free on the publisher website, and are not part of this rulebook.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Skytear (Kickstarter edition)
description:
Skytear is a card-driven miniatures game inspired by MOBA video games (like League of Legends) featuring 24 heroes from an original fantasy universe.

Get started drafting your team of champions with their unique skills, personalities and ultimate powers. Choose them from four asymmetric factions with unique game-play mechanics and flavor.

Then, group up with your waves of minions on the side lanes to push toward the enemy Nexus and crumble it.
And if you feel brave enough, enter the Dome to tame The Outsider: the huge elemental made of Skytear energy that can be directed toward your enemies… or toward you!

Unlike most miniatures game, Skytear does not have dice but rather Power Cards: special moves that your heroes can do anytime, even during the turn of your opponent, and make for surprising and exciting matches.

—description from the publisher

This entry is for Kickstarter Hero Pledge, which includes:
24 Hero miniatures (38mm tall)
32 Minion miniatures (25mm tall)
3 Monster Miniatures
249 Cards (63x88mm)
1 two-sided board (50x70cm)
100 tokens and markers
High Quality Custom Inserts
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: The Clash of Elephants, the Battle of Raphia 217 BC
description: "The Clash of Elephants, the Battle of Raphia 217 BC" is a free Print & Play wargame simulating the battle fought near modern Rafah between the forces of Ptolemy IV Philopator, king and pharaoh of Ptolemaic Egypt and Antiochus III the Great of the Seleucid Empire during the Syrian Wars. It was one of the largest battles of the Hellenistic kingdoms and was one of the largest battles of the ancient world. In the game, the Players command the actual forces available to the historical army commanders.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Animal Marche
description:
Fountain square located in the center of the city.
The player is the owner of the shop facing the square.
Let's attract as many customers as possible, earn income, and further develop the store!

The main flow of the game is to call in the customer in front of your store. When everyone calls in, you will get coins and wood according to the number of customers. Then you can use your employees to build or renovate your store.

After 5 rounds, and the player with the most points wins. Scores can be earned by achieving the personal goal card, constructing public buildings, and etc.
mechanics: Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Treasure Island Promo Cards
description:
2 extra island cards that have to be shuffled into their respective decks. The cards are marked ‘Treasure islands 01 - 02’.


01 Forgotten Treasure Island (Nearby Island)
02 Legendary Treasure Island (Distant Island)


Pack was one of the rewards during the Twist Gaming 2019 Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Nautical
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Stworze: Goście z daleka
description:
The Goście z daleka ("Visitors from afar") expansion pack introduces some of the mechanical solutions to the first edition of THE STWORZE game.

The add-on is compatible with both the basic version of the game and the add-ons: Forbidden Glade and the Beginning.

There is a new Creature in the game - Samodiva.

name: Funny Pages: A Comical Puzzle Game
description:
Use your wits, code-breaking skills, and real-world research to crack a series of challenges hidden in hilarious cartoon panels.

If you can uncover their mysteries and piece together the big picture, you may be able to smash open an enigmatic cold case of the missing cartoonist.

—description from publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Nine Ravens
description:
The crow glares from its gargoyle perch as crumbs of granite fall from the decaying structure. You hear the creak of the nearby door too late to dodge the hand that pulls you inside and presses you against the wall. The smell of the rotting timbers floods your nostrils. Your assailant removes her mask - It is the Muscle.
‘‘Once again you’ve been careless with your steps.’’ You say nothing.
‘‘The Baron refuses to leave Schloss Böse, so we must go to him.’’ She hands you a wax sealed envelope, then disappears into the darkness. You tuck the envelope, step back into the street, and disappear into the fog.

Nine Ravens is a deck and tableau building game for 2 to 4 players. Each players represents rival guilds of thieves, insurgents, and trouble makers known as Ravens vying for control of the city as the Baron’s grasp loosens. By stealing powerful artifacts and relics, each organisation hopes to emerge the victor when the moon disappears.

The game is played through five rounds where they will use their Raven cards to steal, claim and store items to earn points at the end of the game. At the end of five rounds, players will tally their points, with the highest number determining the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield Rebel Clash Expansion
description:
Rock out with new Pokémon! Crank it loud and blast the beat—you'll find rebellion, chaos, and punk attitude galore in the Pokémon TCG: Sword & Shield—Rebel Clash expansion, loaded with Pokémon V including Toxtricity V, Dubwool V, Boltund V, Sandaconda V, and more! You'll also find a handful of Pokémon VMAX, including the final Evolutions of all three first partners, plus Copperajah VMAX and Dragapult VMAX. Take to the stage and the streets with the Sword & Shield—Rebel Clash expansion!


Over 190 cards
Dozens of recently discovered Pokémon from the Galar region
15 powerful Pokémon V and 7 enormous Pokémon VMAX
More than 15 Trainer cards and 4 new Special Energy cards


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Star Fleet Battles: Shadow of the Eagle – Rulebook:  Captain's Module R4J
description:
Romulans Got Warp!

From the earliest source material, it was noted that the Romulans developed warp power later than other empires. This title explores five alternate timelines, each triggered by a singular event, that result in the Romulans gaining warp technology at the same time as everyone else.
This book has a detailed history, ship descriptions, four new scenarios, and the Master Ship Chart.
The ships include the “W” warp-refitted ships, “Y” Early Years ships, Middle Years ships, and modern ships (warships, Police ships, and National Guard ships).

This 46-page rulebook includes descriptions of dozens of new warp-powered Romulan ships and also has the following scenarios: Internal Security; External Intruders (Romulans and Orion pirates), New Neighbors (Romulans and Klingons), Practical Experience (Romulans and Tholians), and Supply Raid (Romulans and Gorns).

This product describes additional ships for use in Star Fleet Battles.
To fly the ships, you will need the SFB Module R4J SSD Book in either B&W or color. You must have the SFB Basic Set to utilize this material. Some of the ships require the Advanced Missions set or the SFB Master Rulebook.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Hero's Journey Home: Realms of Magic and More
description:
Realms of Magic and More is the second and final expansion for Hero’s Journey Home. Add more spellcasters to your party and equip them with new spells and gear, travel to new lands, and fight new magical monsters - now with the ability to cast spells of their own.

Along with these additions are all-new quest monsters, quest items, gods, and adventure card effects.

—description from publisher

name: Quiz Club: Science-Fiction & Wissenschaft
description:
Quiz Club is a tactical quiz game in which cooperative and competitive rounds alternate.

Science-Fiction & Wissenschaft is an expansion for Quiz Club with 120 themed questions to expand and personalize your game experience.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Activity Casino
description: The simple basic recipe of the classic game - guessing terms - is once again the top priority. Activity Casino does without a game board and game pieces. Instead, there is a starting capital in the form of chips that serve as bets, just like in a real casino. Each team gives a tip on how many searched terms the group of actors can correctly guess. If the players are correct, their bet is doubled, otherwise the chips are lost. The performing team is also rewarded depending on the number of tasks solved and the chips won can be used to increase the stake in the next round.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing

name: Picture Points
description:
Everyone knows what a guitar looks like. But who can draw it roughly? Don't worry, this game doesn't require anyone to be a master painter. Here it's all about quick sketches and certain details that earn you points.

How to play:
One player draws a card and reads out a term. Each player draws it as detailed as possible within 30 seconds. Then the card is turned to the picture side and a schematic representation of the term becomes visible. The players get points for certain details. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Nersha
description:
Nersha — A unique and customizable game of abstract strategy. Relive an ancient tale and lead your people home before they’re lost to the blizzard. 12 maps are included, with millions more to discover.

The goal is to lead 3 of your pieces home before your rival. Players take turns sliding 1 of their pieces across the board. There are no captures or jumps, but players' pieces will keep sliding on open tiles if they move in a direction until they would run into something. When you lead a piece home, that's one less piece on the board to block your rival. Every piece on the board may help or halt your progress.

While Nersha has several board layouts that ship with the game, players can decide to change the board or the number of pieces to play with, among other aspects. There are also seven different tile types that can add more complexity to mapmaking.

This game is designed to bridge between casual or abstract games you learn as a kid with daunting games like chess, bringing together all playstyles.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Multiple Maps

name: Grote wasjes, kleine wasjes
description:
Big washes, little washes is a game about washing clothes carefully. The right washing powder, the right temperature and the right speed. That is not easy because you can influence only one of those three factors, the others are determined by your opponents. On your turn, you determine one of those factors (i.e. washing powder) and play a card ( a piece of clothing). The others decide to join in (play a card) or pass. Then the next player determines another factor (i.e. temperature) and playes a card. Then, if also the spin cycle is determined the cards are turned and scored.

In Big washes, little washes you play 1 of 11 characters, each of which gives a different game experience. In addition, it has an expert mode where you can use your clothing cards in multiple ways and a solo campaign where you play all 11 characters, each with their own goal.

If you succeed, they can go clean in your wardrobe and you will receive your honestly earned points. But if your wardrobe is full, you have to make space by selling sets or outfits. Of course you also score points with that.

The game ends when the first player reaches 75 points. After that everybody can sell remaning sets/outfits from their wardrobe and the player with the most points wins.



Grote wasjes, kleine wasjes is een spel over het zorgvuldig wassen van kleren. Het juiste waspoeder, de juiste temperatuur en het juiste toerental. Dat valt niet mee omdat je zelf maar één van die drie factoren kunt beïnvloeden, de andere worden bepaald door je tegenspelers. In je beurt bepaal je een factor (bijvoorbeeld temperatuur) en speel je een kledingkaart. De andere besluiten mee te doen (door ook een kledingkaart te spelen) of te passen. Daarna bepaalt de volgende speler de temperatuur, speelt een kaart en de andere besluiten weer of ze nog meedoen. Als ook het toerental is bepaald draaien we de kaarten om en scoren we het resultaat. Als het lukt mogen ze schoon in je klerenkast en krijg je je eerlijk verdiende punten. Maar als je klerenkast vol is (er kunnen 8 stuks in je kast) dan moet je ruimte maken door sets of outfits te verkopen. Bijvoorbeeld een set van 5 paar sokken of 3 overhemden. Natuurlijk scoor je daar ook weer punten mee. Veel punten zelfs als het je lukt om bijvoorbeeld een complete zwarte of vintage outfit te verzamelen.

In Grote wasjes, kleine wasjes speel je 1 van de 11 karakters die elk weer een andere spelervaring geven. Bovendien heeft het een expert-modus waarbij je je kledingkaarten op meerdere manieren kunt benutten.

Het spel eindigt als de eerste speler 75 punten bereikt. Hierna mogen alle spelers nog sets/outfits uit hun kledingkast verkopen en de speler met de meeste punten wint.

Ten slotte is er solo-campagne waarbij je alle 11 karakters speelt die ieder hun eigen doel hebben.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Titan: It came from below!
description:
It Came From Below is an expansion for Titan that introduces a resident extra-terrestrial! Miners will have to deal with the Alien as it moves around the crater, performing a variety of helpful or disruptive acts.
Each turn, players will have the option of controlling the Alien and using its powers. However, exactly what it does is determined randomly at the start of each game, and how you choose to use it is up to you...

It Came From Below! brings new extraterrestrial elements to Titan which open up a wealth of strategic possibilities! Each turn, the active player will have the option of activating and controlling the Alien by performing a certain trigger action. They will then be able to move and act with it, using it as they see fit. As well as having its own specific power to use, the Alien can spawn Sprogs onto Rigs it is present on, which will interact with them in a variety of ways.

The expansion also introduces a new Rig type; Alien Pools; which produce their own mysterious resource called Alien Crystals.

The Alien itself and all of its related elements each have unique effects which are determined by the Alien Tableau. This Tableau is made up of the Alien tiles, which are drawn randomly at the start of the game.

The Brain Tile determines when the Alien is “Activated”, meaning the triggering action that a player must perform in order to be able to use it.
The Tentacle Tile determines the Alien’s special ability, which it can perform as an Action.

The Sprog Tile determines the effect of Alien Sprogs when they are spawned onto a Rig.

The Crystal Tile determines the properties of Alien Crystal Resources.

There are 5 tiles of each type, and the random generation of the Alien Tableau means that you’ll rarely come up against the same Alien twice! The effects can be good or bad, so you’ll have the choice of using the Alien to your own benefit, or turning it against your opponents...
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Pocket Watch: Set a Watch in 18 Cards
description:
Pocket Watch is a free print and play 18-card micro version of Set a Watch. It is posted with permission from Rock Manor Games.

Setting: The Kingdom is in grave danger. Powerful enemies are conspiring to resurrect the vile and powerful Unhallowed that your party has just slain. Now you, the mighty adventurers of the land, must visit these summoning locations and defeat the hordes of creatures behind this evil plot. It falls to four mighty adventurers, each of whom has a unique set of skills, to band together once more to vanquish this evil before the Unhallowed consume the world in darkness.

In Pocket Watch, a cooperative game for 1-4 players, you must clear out five locations to stop the acolytes from breaking the seals holding back the evil Unhallowed. Every round you will visit a new location and pick an adventurer to rest and take camp actions. The rest of the party will take watch and battle a line of monsters trying to make their way into camp using your dice and unique character abilities. Manipulating the creature line is essential to solving each round’s combat puzzle. It is a battle to stay alive and keep the campfire burning! Use your wits and skill to fight for the light…or all will perish in the darkness.

The game ends in victory if the heroes are able to defeat every monster by the end of round 5. If all heroes are eliminated, the game ends in defeat, and darkness has prevailed.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Pledge of Honor
description:
Pledge of Honor is an expansion for Heroes of the Nam bringing more tactical combat to Vietnam. Lock 'n Load Tactical squad-level Series, with its fast-paced, intense impulse system, drops you right into the middle of furious jungle firefights and all-out, building-to-building assaults. Pledge of Honor depicts the US Army, US Marines, the Army of the Republic of Vietnam, and ANZAC combat operations against the People’s Army of Vietnam, the North Vietnamese Army, and the Viet Cong, as they fought across South Vietnam.

Pledge of Honor Battlepack brings the forces from the Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN), the United States Army and Marines, as well as their valiant Anzac allies from Australia and New Zealand, take on determined enemies from the North Vietnamese Army (NVA) and the unpredictable Viet Cong (VC).

Pledge of Honor Battlepack includes 8 scenarios and 1 new map, bringing to life powerfully armed Squads are at the vanguard of all actions, spurred on by daring Leaders and other unique individuals such as Snipers, Medics, Corpsmen, Chaplains, Advisors and, of course, Heroes, whose unique skills and sudden appearance can alter the tide of any battle. Helicopters, tanks, and armored personnel carriers (APCs) also join the fight.
categories: Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Seasons of Arcadia
description:
Once every year, the high faerie lords of Summer, Autumn, Winter, and Spring gather around the first Stones at the heart of the mystical realm of Arcadia. Once upon a time, they worked in unison to temper Nature's fury. Now, capricious and vainglorious, they challenge each other to see whose seasonal power will rule for the next twelve months.

Seasons of Arcadia is a deeply strategic, yet very approachable game. Players assume the roles of powerful faerie lords, each attempting to dominate the entire year with their seasonal magic.

The goal is simple: Be the first to place all twelve of your lords on the board to achieve victory. Players take turns placing, moving, and jumping opposing faerie lord pieces on a hex board. Each season can both replace and be replaced by one other season, so defense is as important in offense in determining where you place and move.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Martini
description:
Martini is a trick-taking domino game for two to four players.

Players may play a domino from their hand, or choose a face up domino from their martini glass. As they drink their martini (play from their strawman), more dominoes are revealed.

The strength row displays the suits from strongest to weakest. The domino of the highest strength wins the trick, and the player collects their point tile.

The person who played the weakest domino may choose to Shake (shuffle and deal out the strength line) or Stir (move the winning suit to the lowest strength).

The winner of a trick leads to the next trick. The hand continues until all points tiles have been claimed.

name: Totem Hoarder
description:
Totem Hoarder is a fast-paced strategy card duel.

Two players assume the roles of rival archeologists and artifact collectors, racing to get a hold of magical Totems. By getting 1 card and playing 1 card each turn, both players assembles teams of creatures on the table in front of them.

On a player's turn, they normally draw 1 card from the common pile and play 1 card by putting it into their team - their respective side of the battlefield.

Most of the cards in the draw pile are creatures that can be played to perform various actions. But some cards are Totems and follow a slightly different set of rules: If a played Totem in interrupted with a Spooky Skelly, that Totem immediately switches teams! Totems are also "indestructible" - if you attack an opponent's Totem, move it into your own team instead of discarding it.

The first player to have three Totems (and no Spooky Skellies) in their team wins!
mechanics: Hand Management, Interrupts, Set Collection, Take That

name: For Science!: Kickstarter Extra Content
description:
Kickstarter content from the crowdfunding campaign. It was packaged in the same box as the retail edition but had a sticker added to the box front.

Extra content:

7 roles

Dr. Obvious
Mysterious Military Researcher
Grumpy Senior Technician
Press Mesmerist
Wrangler of Subcontractors
Melissa, Hunter of Grant Money
Award Winning Researcher


3 diseases

Virulent Yellowing
Virulent Toxicardia
Virulent Wheezing Tremors


3 alternative shape insight tokens

matching the insight track iconography


1 full set of monochromatic blocks

included monochromatic stars (if pledging for Sci Hard expansion)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Museum: Curator Pack
description: The Curator Pack contains all the goodies and additional content unlocked during the original Museum Kickstarter campaign, including 4 mini-expansions, player figurines, Solo Mode, new Favour, Patron and Headline cards, and more.

name: Um, Actually...: Trapp's Treasures Expansion Pack
description: This expansion deck for the game "Um, Actually..." includes 60 questions previously featured on the Dropout show, chosen by the creator and host Mike Trapp. These additional statements are integrated as a new topic into the base game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Escape Room: The Game – Duo Pack
description: A starter set of Escape Room: The Game! Have you never played an Escape Room? Then prepare for a completely new experience. Teamwork is the key to success in this challenging and unpredictable game. Work together to solve the puzzles and find hidden clues. It's always a race against the clock: you only have 60 minutes to escape. The Chrono Decorder counts down, indicates when you can use hints and checks whether the entered codes are correct. In this game you win together or you lose together. Unbelievable how quickly an hour passes in the heat of battle... Starter set finished? Then there is a whole collection of expansion sets available!

name: Grant Me Night … or Blücher!
description:
As Wellington’s line comes under pressure and starts to buckle, his prayer is answered. Not nightfall, but Prussian forces under Feldmarschall Blücher arrive behind the French and impulsively attack!

ATO Pocket Battle Game #29.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Rogue's Dare
description:
Rogue’s Dare is a push-your-luck bluffing game. Players try to outbid each other on how much treasure they can get from the dragon’s dungeon. As they do, they place down cards with these treasures and traps that might alert and wake the dragon. The most daring rogue will uncover these cards to take the treasure while trying to avoid the traps other players might have planted or else wake the dragon and fail.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Exploration, Memory
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Battle of Oriamendi Game
description:
1837. Cristino commanders plan an ambitious three-pronged attack to annihilate Carlist forces in the North of Spain and hopefully bring an end to the war. However, the planned concentration of forces goes awry. Carlist General Don Sebastian takes advantage of the situation with a lightning march to reinforce a Carlist force threatened bu a Cristino army of Spanish and British auxiliaries near Oriamendi. The stage is set.

—description from the publisher

The Battle of Oriamendi is a low-to-moderate complexity tactical game on the pivotal battle during the First Carlist War in Spain.
mechanics: Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Bandido: Agora Vai! (2)
description:
Have you always dreamed of beating Bandido but never managed to? Managed to win a match in 20?

Your time has come. Now go!

To give you a little help in your matches, the "Go Now!" they only have 4 exits (as opposed to the original game where there are 5 or 6 exits) and greatly improve your chance of capturing the bandit.

Use one of the 5 "Go Now!" as the starting card of your game, in place of the original card and try to win with this "little help".

Play with children? Use the cards to simplify your games!

Numbered from 1 to 5, these cards are dealt separately. Collect them all!

name: Not That Much
description:
In Not That Much one of the players chooses an item for sale, anywhere on the internet.

The others must guess the price, writing it on their card.

The three players to go closer to the real price win points... but the seller outwins if he can "bust" all the buyers, because you have to guess an amount, but "Not that much"!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Masters of the Universe: Battleground – Wave 5: Evil Warriors Faction
description:
Escape from Eternia

Webstor is a master of escape who uses his stealth and expertise to outmanoeuvre enemies and evade capture. He is always looking for new allies to assist him in his evildoings. And are there any better candidates than Hover Robots? After all, they are advanced technological marvels equipped with state-of-the-art sensors. Together, they could pull off the greatest heists, Eternia will have ever seen! Bring your forces to life with these three new formidable characters poised to shake up your strategy and keep your opponents guessing.

—description from the publisher

name: Made Up Movies
description:
Made Up Movies is a creative and entertaining party game that lets players create their movie titles, plots, and laughter using a set of pitch & prompt cards. The Studio Executives ask you ridiculous questions about your rebooted movie and you make up everything as you go in order to impress them and win all their budget! Think Cards Against Humanity meets Mad Libs, with a unique twist that will leave you laughing at all the endless combinations! It caters to both casual and serious gamers alike!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: This is Mine
description:
Uncle Howard has left us for good. An inveterate beatnik, he lived life to the fullest. Throughout his life, he visited many countries around the world and always brought back incredible memories and stories of his adventures. In his will, Uncle Howard was amused to propose that his heir nephews and nieces divide his estate between them through a game.

In This Is Mine! each player represents one of Uncle Howard's heirs, who receives parts of the inheritance to be divided among all. As the uncle lived with great artists, many of these objects belonged to famous musicians, poets and writers of his time, all very precious!

In each round, the starting player divides the revealed cards from the deck into lots. Each lot must contain at least one card, but the player can split it however they see fit. Then the starting player chooses one of the lots, placing his marker on it: "This is Mine!". Each of the other players must either agree or disagree. To disagree, a player must exchange the marker on the lot for his own and value one of the other available lots, adding money to it. When everyone accepts that the lot belongs to one of the players, a new round of claims begins, with one of the remaining players choosing one of the remaining lots.

Inheritance Cards bring different types of items, and each type of item has a set-collection scoring. At the end of the game, the player with the most valuable inheritance wins. So, players must pay attention when dividing and try to gather the best collection of items.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection

name: Furnace: Interbellum – Smiley Balloon Promo Company Card
description:
Additional Company card released via Spielbox Magazine 2023 Issue #3.

Compensation effect: Gain 1 money OR discard 1 money to gain 1 oil. The players may divide their compensation
transactions between these two options as they wish.

Basic delivery effect: Gain 1 Upgrade token once as soon as you receive the card in the auction (without waiting for the next card in the row to be resolved).

Upgraded effect: Discard 1 money to gain 1 oil up to 2 times.
mechanics: Auction: Fixed Placement, Auction: Multiple Lot, Auction/Bidding

name: Oranges & Lemons
description:
Oranges and Lemons is a worker placement game. Starting with just two workers, limited storage capacity and only able to transport what one person can carry the players must make the best they can of early 18th Century London, expanding their transport by acquiring first a hand cart, then a horse and cart and ultimately a ship and by visiting locations mentioned in and activities inspired by the Oranges and Lemons nursery rhyme.

Here they can buy and sell goods such as lemons, pancakes, bricks and pans, get involved in the money lending business, fulfil export contracts at the docks, try their hand at politics, invest in the early stock market or back risky but possibly lucrative expeditions to the East Indies. There are multiple routes to obtaining wealth and prestige. The winner will be the player who can best combine the available strategies to emerge as a Master of Commerce, with the city at their feet.

—description from their designer
mechanics: Market, Pick-up and Deliver, Turn Order: Role Order, Worker Placement

name: Preussisch Eylau 1807
description:
The game simulates the Battle of Preussisch-Eylau, East Prussia, on 7 and 8 February 1807, between Napoleon's Grande Armée and the Imperial Russian Army, who were reinforced by Prussians.

The game box also contains a few additional maps (and counters) for other smaller battles that took place at that time in that area: battle of Pułtusk 1806, Gołymin 1807, Bergfriede (Barkweda) 1807, and Waltersdorf (Włodowo) 1807.

name: Rebel Princess: Carmesina
description:
Promo card "Carmesina" with the ability "Reflection"

Quote:
You unlocked a special Rebel Princess bonus card: Carmesina. This princess appears in the 15th-century Valencian literary masterpiece Tirant lo Blanc.
Her power is: Reflection
Copy the power of any princess currently in the game. You can pick a different power to copy each round.

1 card with 3 language descriptions of the ability.

name: Nassau
description:
Nassau is the 7th game in the Stefan Feld City Collection series!

Take on the role of pirates going on adventures. Each of you has their own ship, that needs a competent crew armed to the teeth, lots of canons, ammunition, and provisions to thrive navigating the seas, conquering outposts, fighting sea monsters and plunder valuable goods. Tell your tales over a bottle of rum and impress your fellow pirates. Who will have the best tales to tell?!

In Nassau each player represents a pirate crew trying to earn the most points during the course of the game. Nassau is played over 4 seasons with each season broken down into 2 phases.

In the first phase players collect different items like: weapons, pirate pets, coins, rum, sails, and other stuff on the city game board to make their own ship stronger a prepare them for the second phase. You get those items by placing your pirates through a clever placement mechanism in the city of Nassau, that leaves enough room for tactical decisions.

In the second phase it is time to test how good your crew and ship really is by sailing the seas and take on different adventures. Each action costs you a provision and depending on where you sail and what you do, you need weapons, canons, and ammunition. But beware, each weapon and canon must be manned by a pirate, so keep your balance. Pirate pets allow you to use special powers that can turn the tide of battle. At last, you must return to your home base, but not without telling tales of your adventures and earning points. The better the tale, the more points await.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Totally Not T9
description:
Totally Not T9 is a set of two low-luck trick-taking games. Both games are nominally postal themed.

The first game, called Totally Not T9, is played over two rounds (or three rounds with the optional variant). Players draft their cards each round. As the trick play occurs, the deck will deplete, so there will be 11 tricks in the first round, but only 6 in the second round. Players gain cards into their score piles along the way, with the highest card taking the lowest card in the trick, and the lowest card taking the highest. At the end of the game, the player getting the closest to or reaching 40 points without going over 40 wins.

The second game, Stamp Out Bootleggers, is a one-hand trick taking game. The illegal speakeasies don’t want any particular letters (i.e. cards) traced back to them, so no player owns their hand of cards. On their turn, a player will play a card from any of the four hands of cards on the table. Each hand can only be played once into each trick. Players gain cards into their score piles for winning tricks, with each card being worth its face value in points. The player getting the closest to or reaching 40 points at the end of the game without going over 40 wins. But before final scoring, the postal inspectors (one suit) will make arrests of the bootleggers (the other three suits). For better or worse, this will keep those cards from counting towards a player’s score.

The name of the set is a joke. T9 was a 35 person trick-taking game played by mail; it was created for the T9 event. This was also created, in part, for the T9 event, but the name was already taken by the postal game, so this is called Totally Not T9.

—description from the designer

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught – Expansion: Sellswords 2 – Gold and Glory
description:
Bolster your Dungeons & Dragons: Onslaught games with exciting new characters for hire! Four new mercenaries apply their skills and offer up new options, abilities and tactics when assembling your party, and can join with any faction! New characters include a Wizard, a Sorcerer, a Barbarian, and Onslaught's first Artificer!

This expansion also unlocks the Sellswords as a playable faction on their own! Typically, when you assemble your party from one of Onslaught's other factions, you can also include any one Sellswords character. Now, if you have this and another Sellswords expansion with different characters, you can build an all-sellswords 5-character party!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Timer, Critical Hits and Failures, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: The Big Bad Wolf
description:
I'll Huff and I'll Bluff!
Get ready to build your house THEN watch it Blow Away while being deceived by the only person you thought you could trust!

The Big Bad Wolf is an exciting twist on The 3 Little Pigs! Secretly pass the "Big Bad Wolf" then Entice and Persuade players into flipping it, to Blow Down Their House.

Draw 3 then Pass 1 card Face-down to any player of choice.
Get in their heads! By adding face-up materials as incentives.
Chosen player MUST now decide to either flip it or pass it. Is it Materials(points) or is it a Wolf?...

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Grotten: 1-Bit Deeper
description:
Grotten is a minimalist dungeon crawler using physical tiles to generate and explore a dungeon, where you roll on random tables to fill the rooms with monsters, traps, loot, NPCs - and a final epic boss fight. The zine contains one-page rules and character creation, cut-out dungeon tiles and tokens, and lots and lots of random tables.

Grotten is perfect for both solo play, co-op, with or without a GM, as a quick and easy stand-alone game or to use as a dungeon in any fantasy system you are playing.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Horror, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Everything vs. Everything
description:
The horizon looms. Beyond it lies an unspeakable evil, a malevolent force seeking the destruction of everything. He bends wills. He corrupts. He is the director. All will succumb to his darkness. Already, he has bewitched the minds of a powerful few, and they have fallen under his powerful spell. He will be unstoppable!

You and you alone are the one force that can stand against him. You are the master strategist. Your battle skills and master planning have taken years to perfect. Allies have rushed to your side, willing to fight and die for your cause! You have only a few resources, however, which doesn't bode well. To prevail against this monstrosity would take an army, a legion — everything!

Everything vs. Everything plays like a simplified wargame with units on a field that maneuver and attack one another. The units are powered by special abilities, and you prioritize how and when to use those abilities.

Everything vs. Everything can be played solitaire or as a two-player head-to-head game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Cabbage Farm
description:
In Cabbage Farm, you collect and deliver cabbages to complete target cards. To do this, you use your worker to maximize the chance of collecting harvested cabbage. Players are allowed to steal coins and cabbages by using Lampy and Cukoo (that is, actions that allow you to move the chicken and sheep) to be placed in the same spot as another player.

Players play as cabbage farmers trying to collect the harvested cabbages on the farm according to the order(s) received from the Target Card. Completing each order will gain points. On each turn, players can play Action Card, place work on Move Card and Complete Target Card. Points are scored for each completed Target Card, a pair of cabbage accumulates 3 points while 1 cabbage equals 1 point (these points apply at the end of the game in must be present in your hand excluding the cabbages used for Target Card) and 1 coin accounts for 1 point. The player with the most points wins.

Cabbage Farm is an ward winning board game design competition in Thailand. It was published in 2021 by Aroi Games. Cabbage Farm is family board game where you can enjoy farming cabbages with children and adult.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Thanos Rising: Avengers Infinity War – Sanctuary-2 Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2019.

Ability: If Thanos is in this sector, add one Damage to the most damaged heroes in all sectors.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Alien vs Predator: USCM Sentry Guns Expansion
description:
From the Publisher:
Automatic and mathematically efficient - that's what matters most when it comes to automated Sentry Guns. They can be placed anywhere in matter of few minutes and will keep firing at terryfing rate with inhuman accuracy until there is no movement in their line of sight. If you are not friendly - you are dead.

Famous robot sentry from "Aliens" movie is finally available for AVP players as an add-on. Automated gun nests can be placed anytime in any place which extends game in whole new direction.

Box consits of:
2x resin miniatures
2x plastic bases
1x stat card
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Vive L'Empereur!
description:
Vive L'Empereur! is an exciting, solitaire wargame depicting the Battle of Waterloo fought on June 18, 1815. Controlling the French side as the Emperor Napoleon, you have conducted a brilliant campaign so far against not one, but two, Allied armies, defeating Field Marshal Blucher’s Prussians at Ligny and forcing the Anglo-Allied army under the Duke of Wellington to retreat from Quatre Bras. You have sent a wing of your army under Marshal Grouchy to keep the Prussians and the British-Dutch armies separate. Meanwhile, Wellington and his Dutch allies with 68,000 men have fallen back to a ridge line before the small town of Waterloo. On this rainy and muddy day, your 72,000-strong French army must defeat the Anglo-Allied Army before the Prussians can regroup, avoid Grouchy, and arrive on the battlefield at Waterloo. Are you up for the challenge?

Vive L’Empereur is a hex-and-counter war game that uses a chit-pull system to generate random force activations for both sides. The Anglo-Allied and Prussian forces (the forces of the solitaire side) move and conduct combat using random instructions from the game’s Activation Table.

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: White Ensign: A Supplement for Harpoon Covering the Royal and Commonwealth Navies from 1960 to Present Day
description:
There was a time when the sun never set on the British Empire. The sinews that kept the empire together were the ships of the Royal Navy, and later, those of the Commonwealth nations. Today, just like it was in the past, whenever those ships sail, one can see the White Ensign.

White Ensign discusses each conflict in which Commonwealth naval forces were involved from 1960 to the present day. These include: Yemen 1960-67, Borneo 1962-66, Rhodesia 1965-66, Iceland 1972-73, Falklands 1977, Desert Shield/Storm 1990-91, Kuwait 1961 (Operation Vantage), East Africa 1966, Suez 1966-73, Cyprus 1974, Falklands 1982, Adriatic 1993-96.

Perhaps the most comprehensive study of the modern Royal Navy outside of official publications and a valuable reference book in its own right, White Ensign is meant to be used as a supplement to Harpoon4 and requires the use of Harpoon4 rules to derive the maximum value from it. All ships, from carriers down to patrol/fast attack craft, as well as ships taken up from trade (STUFT) during the Falklands War are included in the ship data annex, as are all aircraft that were or could have been used in a naval environment. Also included is an extensive bibliography which includes official sources and internet sites.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: Universal Rule: Singularity
description:
The war rages on. Alliances are forming and breaking faster than you can decide which side to align with. The new themes of meanies (direct player to player aggression) will quickly help in your decision making. You can work on taking over the universe together, but in the end, only one can rule.

Universal Rule: Singularity is a standalone expansion to Universal Rule.

It can be played in one of the following ways:


Play Singularity all by itself.
Randomize 17 Planet cards and 1 Edge card.
Choose your favorite combination of 17 Planet cards and 1 Edge card.


In Universal Rule: Singularity, players battle for control of the universe in this pocket-sized 4X style game. You can colonize new planets, explore new areas on those planets, gain credits based off of the resources that the planet produces, or attempt to destroy other planets that threaten your existence. Other players can follow, but at a cost. The first player to show their true dominance through victory points wins the game.


Edge:

Deep Space Edge


Planets:

Dothater
Carnoxide
Wamous
Kryptotrix
Starvex
Icrillon
Oor's Landing
Bani Roma
Cucarro
Kellade
Prerette
Koxii
Echorum
Mado II
Interzino
Virania
Adwauld



Released in the April 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Special Ops Issue #2
description:
Special Ops Issue #2 includes the game Ukraine '44 and

Articles for this issue:
INTERNATIONAL GAME SERIES - An Introduction to Ukraine’44 - Soviet Strategy. By Adam Starkweather.
LEADERS IN THE EAST - Soviet Leaders in “Fury in the East”. By Iain Kanitsch.
BRAVERY IN THE SAND - An Overlooked Gem. By Giovanni Fazio.
THE MIGHTY ENDEAVOR - Short Invasion Scenarios for “The Mighty Endeavor”. By Jeremy Spahr.
ASL - The Winter Ofensive Bonus Pack 2012. By Chas Argent.
ASLSK - ASL Starter Kit sequence of play. By Chas Argent.
SOLDIERS OF ORANGE - A Dutch SASL Campaign. By David Meyler & Stephen Jackson.
STUART’S (AND SHERIDAN’S) LIEUTENANTS - Scouting the Cavalry Scenarios of the GCACW Series. By Johua Michael.

ASL scenarios:
· O3 A frosty morning (Pete Shelling)
· O4 Ain't running away (Ian Daglish)

ASLSK scenarios:
· S39 Use your tanks and shove (Chas Argent)
· S40 Island retreat (Ken Dunn)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tanks: Pershing Tank Expansion
description: Built with firepower, mobility, and protection in mind the Pershing was the U.S. army’s first operational heavy tank. The Super Pershing boasted an even bigger gun and additional armor plates that let it go toe-to-toe with the German Tiger heavy tanks.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Seize the Bean: City Celebrities Customer Expansion Pack
description:
The City Celebrities Customer Group is a mish-mash of other Customer Groups with diverse requirements and abilities; however, unlike the Quality Beasts and Board Game Media packs, it does not include Award and Upgrade cards.

To quote the "Snack Menu" Expansions ruleboook:
"The City Celebrities are a funny mixture of actually famous, real-life celebrities, fictional characters that are well known to many, and some obscure references that are dear to our hearts. The objective of the Group is to show that being famous in the mainstream is not the only way to earn yourself a fanclub!"

at least 10 customers, 1 customer award / cheat sheet card, 1 promotional card.

name: Caper Cards: Bells Hells
description:
In this cooperative card game, assemble the Bells Hells adventuring party of Critical Role Campaign 3 to pull off a daring heist. You’ll aim to play your Crew cards strategically as a team, hoping to exceed the value of the treasure you’re pursuing without going over 21. Each Crew card bears gorgeous art of the teammate, the card’s numerical value, and an ability, such as Chetney’s ability to be played as either a 6 or a 9. Play is quick, with gameplay lasting around 20 minutes, and you can play it with up to 4 players, including a solo mode.

The game comes in a compact box containing 24 Crew Cards (3 of each member of Bells Hells), 1 Risk Card, 10 unique Reward Cards, and a Player 1 Marker Card. With these cards, players can work together to plan and execute their heist.

name: Mars 04:45
description:
Mars 04:45
In Mars 4:45 each player is a Mission Director, racing to establish the first colony on the Red Planet. Mission Directors compete to construct all the modules necessary to start a Mars settlement, sourcing as many parts internally as possible to maximize profitability.

During game play, players will use their deck and tableau set up to add cards to the middle of the table. Players can start a new module or add to an existing module. All modules in the middle of the table are public and can be started or added to by anyone at anytime. Players are playing simultaneously so don't wait to play your cards or another player will beat you to it! When a unit is completed, it is added to a player's colony, waiting to be scored at the end of the round...that is.....if you were not sabotaged!

Mars 04:45 can be played by as many people as there are unique decks, 4-6 players works best. Mars 04:45 has a play time of 15-20 minutes. First player to 150 points wins the game and play can be adjusted depending on how many points the group sets as the goal.

name: Golem Arcana: Gudanna – Terror of the Steppes
description: Another chapter of Arcanum Gudanna stands revealed! Forged from the desert sands and the blood of the Great Khan's enemies, these mighty Golems and the Knights who command them are dreaded from one end of Eretsu to the other for their ruthless hit-and-tun tactics.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: For Science!: Sci Hard
description:
The For Science!: Sci Hard expansion adds new challenges and more variety to the For Science! base game, with the components consisting of:


6 wooden building blocks
6 monochromatic wooden building blocks
6 unique role cards
20 unique design cards
4 unique disease cards
4 unique event cards
4 unique mutation cards


--description from publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Medical, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Deadzone: Contagion – Campaign Set
description:
Contagion is an expansion campaign for Deadzone. It includes both a 32 page rulebook; Zombie Rules; AI Rules; AI Card Deck; 30 plastic miniature Zombies (require assembly/painting); and
4 sprues of Ruined Battlezones scenery to expand the terrain of your Deadzone games.

From the publisher:

Nexus Psi has been overrun by the Plague, and it’s everyone for themselves as the living dead wander the streets! Every faction must react to this new threat, fighting to free themselves before they are overrun. This supplement also introduces rules for solo play, enabling you to polish your tactics when no opponents are available!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Mystery Party in the Box: Solsticio Oscuro
description:
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

Once every ten years, vampires gather in a northern town during the winter solstice for their Great Gathering. Shortly before the official start, however, a charred corpse is discovered nearby: it can only be the remains of the second-in-command of one of the two contending factions of vampire society.

name: Surrounding Nobunaga
description: A Japanese wargame on an important campaign in Nobunaga's history.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – U.S.S. Thunderchild Expansion Pack
description:
The U.S.S. Thunderchild is a Federation Akira-class starship. These heavy cruisers were used throughout the Dominion War and, battled against a Borg Cube at the Battle Sector 001, alongside the U.S.S. Defiant, in a fleet under the command of Vice Admiral Hayes.
Star Trek - Attack Wing: U.S.S. Thunderchild Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 17 expansion packs from WizKids Games, and this expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

The Thunderchild is an Akira class starship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: FIEF France: Gameboard
description: A new version of the FIEF's gameboard including harbor's rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Negotiation, Political

name: Capital Lux 2: Mini-Expansion
description:
This mini-expansion comes with 3 different modules that can be played together or one by one, each of them compatible with both Capital Lux 2: Generation and Capital Lux 2: Pocket.

Modules:
Superpower Card
Postcard
Kingdom Card

name: Blytz
description:
In Blytz, your ultimate goal is nothing short of world domination. Will you rise to the challenge? Rally your forces, engage in strategic battles, and claim victory by controlling the nations across the globe. Prepare for an exhilarating journey where cunning tactics and calculated moves reign supreme.

Expand your control across continents by assembling powerful armies consisting of air, sea, and land battalions. But that's not all! Deploy your trusted lieutenants to bolster your troops' strength and assign generals to safeguard your hard-earned territories. To turn the tide in your favour, execute daring special-ops missions that will keep your opponents on their toes.

Unleash the game-changing 'Operation: sneaky-peeky' to uncover the hidden defences of rival players. Rain down a devastating storm of missiles with 'Operation: look-out-below' and weaken enemy forces. With 'Operation: switch-a-roo', you can even snatch another player's general, turning their own strength against them. Take advantage of trap cards to catch other player’s off-guard - commandeer their troops, fortify your positions with artillery defences, or set up deadly minefields to halt their advance!

Strategize, plot, and strike with precision. Launch daring attacks against other players to claim their countries as your own. Once victorious, 'Blytz' through to swiftly seize additional countries following a triumphant battle. As your power grows, aim to 'build an empire' by uniting your controlled countries across an entire continent. Possess all the countries of a continent and see your opposition tremble in fear!

Play the tactician, forge an unstoppable empire, and unleash the full might of Blytz to secure your path to victory. Are you ready to embrace the challenge and conquer the world?

—description from the publisher

name: El Plan, tú decides
description:
The objective of El Plan, tú decides is to be the player with most innovate business ideas after twelve rounds (1 year).

In the game there are:

3 resources: money, energy, workforce
3 processes: logistics, production and marketing
3 goods: raw material, consumer goods and services


Every player will receive a business card that tells him which his strengths are. With his abilities he will be able to produce 2 of the 3 kinds of goods the game has. They produce these goods by using processes to transform resources into goods.

The boards has several places where you can get resources, have additional processes, buy and sell goods, buy cards (which give new abilities) and others.

By the end of every year players can transform 3 good, 1 of each, into an innovate idea. This can happen as many times as they like, if they have the necessary goods. Also, innovate ideas can be used as a joker for money, energy or workforce during the game.
Since each player is able to produce only 2 of the 3 goods, they will be forced to buy the third one every time they want to create an innovate idea.

name: The Rivals for Catan: Gavin the Polyglot
description:
This 2013 promo card for the Rivals for Catan was given out by Klaus Teuber at SPIEL 2013 in Essen (and can also be bought in the Catan Shop). A limited English-language version was released during a Cyber Monday promotional at the Catan Shop on Dec. 2, 2013. Only 50 copies were listed as available to the public and a $50+ online purchase was required.

It is a unit/hero.
It costs 1 lumber and has 1 skill point.
It has a red "Base Game" back.

German text of the card:
"1 x in Ihrem Zug: Sie dürfen 1 Rohstoff einer Landschaft, in der Sie 3 Rohstoffe besitzen, gegen 1 beliebigen anderen Rohstoff tauschen."

English text of the card:
"1x during your turn: You may exchange 1 resource from a region where you have 3 resources for any 1 different resource of your choice."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Silent Death Expansion: Night Brood
description:
From the back cover:

A gruesome new menace stirs on the periphery of known space. Armed with devastating technologies and a thirst for mayhem, these Hatchling aliens (known simply as Grubs), burst forth from their hidden Clutch-worlds. Millions of them, including an overwhelming contingent of bio-mechanical starfighters, embark on a sector-wide rampage. In their path stand a few isolated frontier planets with a rag-tag collection of out-dated fighters and ordnance.

Emergency calls go out to Imperial garrisons hundreds of light years away. The Terrans muster their far-flung forces, but every delay brings the fall of another frontier world. The clock is ticking, the Hatchlings are gaining strength, and this crisis is rapidly spinning out of control!

Night Brood chronicles the events of the First Hatchling Scourge—the invasion of the Tau Albriton Frontier Sector and the subsequent Imperial relief effort.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Inside the Crease Hockey
description:
From the publisher's website:

Inside the Crease (ITC) hockey is a tabletop simulation of the fast-paced game of pro hockey. In keeping with the pace of the sport of hockey this game uses double-sided Fast Action Cards (FAC) to move the game right along.

From the first face off players will perform on the ice like no other simulation out there. Skater’s cards are broken down with four separate offensive columns based on whether your team is at even strength, in the power play, shorthanded or the column for rebounds and great feed passes. These cards don’t just tell you whether a player takes a shot but the quality of the shot as well. Some guys will be shooting at the twine with quality shots most of the time while others will just be putting the puck towards the net. The slick-passing skaters are not left out here as a good play maker on the ice can set up much higher shooting opportunities. Players are also rated on the frequency of giving away the puck. In ITC a bone-headed pass that loses the puck isn’t just a turnover it can be a chance for a breakaway for the opposition.

Defense is covered equally in depth with four separate defensive ratings to set players apart. The ability to takeaway the puck, block shots, check players off the puck and a general defensive ability all can force the action of the offense. You will be able to “see” a great defensive play stop a would be shot. Blocking a shot or forcing a shot wide with a defensive stop can be a goal saver. Controlling loose pucks can be a real game turner in ITC with this ability captured in the ratings as well.

No hockey game would be complete without the ability to capture the penalty aspect. In ITC the players are not just rated for penalty frequency but the type as well. Whether it be a minor, major or misconduct you will know when it happens. If a fight breaks out you will watch the two combatants head to the box. When a minor is called you will get an actual penalty name (elbowing, holding, etc) for added flavor.

The goalies are created with the ability to stop shots in the six different shooting categories. You will be crushed to watch a weak slapshot trickle through for a goal but be ecstatic watching your goalie thwart an excellent scoring opportunity. In ITC the ability of the goalie to control the action after a shot is also taken into consideration. You will see your goalie simply give up a rebound shot, hold the puck or be able to pass it off to a teammate.

If strategy is your game ITC delivers with a simple and unobtrusive way to handle your coaching choices. If you push more forecheckers up the ice for better scoring chances you are leaving yourself open on the back end. It is your choice how to play it.

name: Dungeon Twister: Zephyr, the Cheater
description:
Zephyr, the Cheater
(4/2) (Goodies 2007)


Zephyr, the Cheater can attack diagonally (only in close combat).



Zephyr, the Cheater can take part in group combat diagonally (in attack and defense) if the controlling player chooses.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Federation & Empire: ISC War
description:
This expansion adds the ISC, the Interstellar Stellar Concordium to the Federation and Empire game system. Anticipated for 25 years, ISC War adds the complete order of battle for the ISC forces. New rules include ISC Echelon formations, PPD ships, Tactical Reserves, and ISC Rapid Base Deployment. Scenarios include:

Gathering Winds, the ISC consolidate their outer provinces during the first 9 turns of the general war, amid Romulan and Gorn interference.

Driving Winds, the ISC launches their pacification of the galaxy at the end of the General War with rapid deployment of their pacification stations. They must hold the various neutral zone areas between the major powers to protect them from each other. This scenario is divided into various "cordons" similar to the sectorized scenarios in other products.

There are also scenario notes for using the ISC during the general war, and in a full scale war against the Gorns and Romulans.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tanks: T-34 Tank Expansion
description:
From it’s first encounters in 1941 the T-34 would become one of the most influential tank designs of the Second World War. The T-34 was continously refined over the years to increase effectiveness and decrease costs, allowing vast numbers to be fielded at once. Eventually, the T-34/85 variant was built to combat the appearance of heavy German tanks.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled T-34 tank
1x T-34 tank card
1x T-34/85 tank card
2x Hero card
1x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Commando 4 en action: Dieppe 1942
description:
"Commando 4 en action: Dieppe 1942" is a solitaire tactical wargame appearing in the French Vae Victis magazine #131 (special game edition).

It simulates the British commandos raid under Lord Lovat's command (Operation Cauldron) to destroy a powerful German battery (code name Hess) near Varengeville (in Normandy) during the famous August 19th 1942 Dieppe operation. During this operation, the British landed by Landing Craft Assault (LCA) on Orange I & II, were ordered to destroy the six 155mm guns battery, capture German soldiers, cut telephone wire and finally embark all in the waiting LCA.

The game is edited under ziplock and contains an A3-size map depicting Varengeville (close to Dieppe) surroundings (scale at 1/25000), 108 counters (the 2 formation of British commandos lead by lieutenant colonel Lovat and Mills-Robert ; German coastal defense, Luftwaffe guards, MGs, Flak, mines, wires, pill-boxes and part of 571th infantry regiment reinforcements ; activation and other markers). One typical counter unit represents around 10 men. The rules are included in a separate 16 pages A5-sized booklet. Very easy to learn and fun to play !

The duration of the game is 12 turns from 4:45 to 07:30 am. The player plays the British side first each turn and then the activated german units fight, move and get reinforcements in this respective order. Except for the coastal defenses, the German units are not represented on the map at the beginning. Instead, several randomly selected activation markers are deployed in specific areas of the map. The combination of proximity to British units and alert level may trigger an activation marker that may hide 0 to 4 German units. These activated units may then fight and move. German move is dictated by closest (in PM) and largest enemy stack or German stack. Combat - Fire and/or Assault - is resolved by comparing the strength of both adjacent stacks modified by the presence of an officer, the terrain modifier and 1D6 for the British and 1D10 for the Germans. Largest score inflicts one step loss to the other. Sniper and mortar section are represented with special effects on the game.
The British must score at least 10 victory points to get a marginal victory. More than 20 is a decisive victory. The historical score is 24 VP.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: EXEO Duo
description:
Description from the publisher:

Just you, your opponent and your pieces.
A battle of minds where the board is divided – and your game is actually two.

EXEO Duo is a strategy game for 2 players over the age of 12.
A game can take 30 minutes to play or an entire, captivating night.
The objective of the game is to exit your 4 pairs, all while attempting to stop your opponent from doing the same. The first player to exit all 4 pairs is the ultimate EXEO Duo master.

name: Warhammer 40,000: Index – Xenos 1
description:
Description from the publisher:

One of five books covering the range of Citadel miniatures used to play games of Warhammer 40,000, Index: Xenos 1 is an essential purchase for those wanting to play games of Warhammer 40,000, packed with updated rules and complete points values for Aeldari – Craftworld Eldar, Dark Eldar and Harlequins – or Necron armies.

It contains 124 datasheets covering the range of Aeldari and Necron miniatures, with overviews of each army. Updated abilities, psychic powers, wargear, weapon profiles and points values allow you to field your collection in games of Warhammer 40,000. There’s also a blank army roster and detachment roster, which you are free to photocopy and use when building a Battle-Forged army in Matched Play games.

Covered in the 128-page softback book:

Craftworlds

An overview of the Craftworld Aeldari (formerly Eldar);
A Craftworlds army list, with an explanation of the Craftworld keyword, the Runes of Battle and Runes of Fate psychic disciplines and the Battle Focus and Ancient Doom Abilities; * 45 datasheets for Craftworld Aeldari miniatures.


Drukhari

An overview of the Drukhari (formerly Dark Eldar);
A Drukhari army list, with an explanation of the Kabal, Wych Cult and Haemonculus Coven keyword and the Power From Pain and Combat Drugs Abilities;
32 datasheets for Drukhari miniatures.


Harlequins

An overview of the Harlequins;
A Harlequins army list, with an explanation of the Masque keyword, the Phantasmancy psychic discipline and the Rising Crescendo Ability;
8 datasheets for Harlequins miniatures.


Ynnari

An overview of the Ynnari (an Eldar alliance of followers of Ynnead introduced in the Gathering Storm);
An Ynnari army list, with an explanation of the Reborn keyword, the Revenant psychic disciplineand the Strength From Death Ability
3 datasheets for Ynnari miniatures.


Necrons

An overview of the Necrons.
A Necrons army list, with an explanation of the Dynasty keyword, Reanimation Protocols, Living Metal, and Powers of the C'Tan Abilities;
36 datasheets for Necron miniatures.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
