It is not a complete game: ownership of any boxed game in the Series: Infantry Attacks (Avalanche Press) series is necessary to provide the rules and markers, and maps are drawn from the following Series: Panzer Grenadier (Avalanche) games and supplements: Elsenborn Ridge, Road to Berlin, Battle of the Bulge, Kokoda Trail, Eastern Front and 1940: The Fall of France. There are 10 scenarios, each based on an actual battle or situation from the Spanish-American War.

To Hell With Spain is sold exclusively via .pdf download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game’s components.

name: blau - gelb - rot - ...
description:
The smallest memory game ever. There are three discs, each with a different color underneath: blue, yellow or red.
You roll a die (blue, blue, yellow, yellow, red, red).
You show the disc with this color and put the disc somewhere back on the table. If you choose the wrong one you have lost.
Surprisingly someone will make a mistake. Should be played really fast.

name: Zulu, Battle of Isandhlwana
description:
"Zulu, Battle of Isandhlwana" is a game that simulates the battle between British imperial forces and Zulu warriors on January 22nd, 1879 in Zululand, and area northeast of what is today the Republic of South Africa. This battle is known as the worst disaster suffered by colonial troops in a confrontation against native forces.

This DTP publication by Luis Carreño Joicey, deals with the history of the battle and includes a detailed simulation of the conflict which will help to better understand what happened.

One player plays the with the British side and the other with the Zulu side, if there are two players. Additional players may take command of individual Zulu formations (the "horns", "chest" and "loins").

The basic game serves only to as an introduction and to let players familiarize themselves with with the rules; players should use the advanced rules for a more complete game.

name: Stonehenge Darts
description:
Number of players: 2–5

Object of the game: The object of the game is to reach 601 points exactly. If players go over 601, their score resets to zero and they must hit 31 exactly. If they go over 31, their score resets and they must hit 31 again exactly. Player goes over 600 when their disk leaves the inner bluestone track on the side opposite the side it enters.
Getting Started

Equipment: Deck of all 65 Stonehenge card. One figure for player on outer track to keep track of 1-30 scoring, and disk of the same color to go on the bluestone track.

Game End

The object of the game is to reach 601 points exactly. If players go over 601, their score resets to zero and they must hit 31 exactly. If they go over 31, their score resets and they must hit 31 again exactly.

name: BattleTech Field Manual: Crusader Clans
description:
From the back of the book:

Nearly three hundred years ago, the Star League was torn apart when the lies and deceits of the petty House Lords launched the Inner Sphere into endless war. The Great Father Aleksandr Kerensky led our forefathers, the remnants of the righteous Star League army, away from that chaotic despotism. In turn, his son Nicholas forged us into the Clans: a society dedicated to becoming the greatest fighting force in all of history. We grew stronger with each generation, awaiting the day when we would return to the Inner Sphere to save it from itself.

Now is the time of the Return. Some among the Clans oppose the Crusaders' campaign of conquest, but we know that true enlightenment can only come to the misguided rabble of the Successor States through total subjugation. We will crush their honorless armies with our OmniMechs and plant the flag of the Clans on sacred Terra. Only then will the true Star League have returned to the Inner Sphere.

User comment:

The companion volume to the Field Manual: Warden Clans, this volume follows up on earlier books dedicated to the Clans and gives more detail on the seven Clans identified as being Crusader clans at the time of printing. More detail is given on the five Clans that hadn't been covered in earlier sourcebook at the time, and with those Clans comes detail on more new equipment, 'Mechs and Battle Armour not seen before in the Inner Sphere.

This sourcebook is out of print, and hasn't been released in electronic format by the current license holder.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Oktoberfest
description:
Created to commemorate the 20th anniversary of ASL Oktoberfest (ASLOK), a annual ASL tournament held in Middleburg Heights, Ohio every year.

The scenarios are very well done, and in color. The unit list is generic boxes with no artwork for the counters. The scenarios cover a wide variety of ground, the East and west fronts, Sicily, Africa and the Pacific and span from 1939 to 1944. For better or worse, many of the scenarios do feature German SS units.

In a departure from the typical 2 player scenarios, Scenario 7 - Slaughter at Shanderovka, has explicit victory conditions set up for 3 and 4 player games. Scenario 2, Bydgoszcz Coup, and German armed civilians trying to stage a coup, to take over a city to hand over to the invading German Wermacht.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Thunder at the Crossroads: The Battle of Gettysburg
description:
From the back of the box :

"On the evening of July 1st. 1863, George Gordon Meade mounted his horse for the short ride north to the small Pennsylvania town of Gettysburg. Fighting had broken out early that morning. Meade had shifted the assorted corps of the Army of the Potomac northward to that town. General Reynolds was reported down. Hancock had the field in hand (he hoped) and Meade was now moving his headquarters to that fateful field. In the few days since being thrust into command of the Army of the Potomac, Meade had gained full control and would now direct it toward what was to be its single most important battle.

Turning back R.E. Lee's second invasion of the North, Meade would end the Southern general's significant offensive capabilities. For the North. it was the beginning of the march which would eventually win the war."

Scale
Each hex on the game map equals 200 yards of real terrain. Each day-time turn represents 30 minutes, each night turn one hour. The vertical scale between contours is 30 feet.
Infantry and cavalry units are brigades, artillery units usually 16 gun battalions. A strength point of infantry or cavalry is 100 men. A gun point of artillery is roughly 3 cannons.[...]

Orders
Orders are the heart of the main command system of this game series. Players prepare orders in writing as instructions to the corps (generally) as to what they are to do. An order is not a hex by hex record of movement. It is the actual wording in the same form as the historical orders."

Re-implemented by:

Thunder at the Crossroads: The Battle of Gettysburg, July 1-3, 1863 (Second Edition)

name: Anima Tactics: Khaine D'Lacreu
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Khaine is the daughter of the legendary knight Rubedo D'elacreu of the sacred Order of Mikael. As with all her family, she is one of the beloved chosen of Azrael, the Lady of the Swords.

Warrior - Empire - Level 50

Divine Intervention (Magic, Reactive) - You can re-roll a die of any friendly unit-inside Khaine's Control Zone.

Sacred Attack (Ki, Attack) - Special Attack, +3 Attack / +2 Damage. Dark units suffer double damage from this attack.

Martyr Scrifice (Magic, Reactive) You can redirect the damage from a friendly unit inside your Contorl Zone to Khaine instead.

This pewter figure is unpainted and unassembled. Requires additional Anima Tactics figures to play.

name: The Golems of Ymhet
description:
The Golems of Ymhet is a 3-player strategy game (with a 2-player variant) that pits two players against one, but the two teammates don't know which of the other players is their teammate. A mix of psychology and strategy helps the story of the defense of the city unfold, all to be decided in epic combat.

Each of the three players acts as an enchanter, preparing his golem for battle. Two of the players are loyal to Ymhet and want to defend it against the invaders, but the other will fight for Bakonia. In the first part of the game, the players prepare their own golems and sabotage the ones belong to those they believe to be their enemies. Once the invasion force arrives, the traitor is revealed and the actual battle for Ymhet begins. If the loyal players destroy the enemy golem and all invading forces, the town remains in their own hands. If any of the invaders or the invading golem breaks through the city walls, they seize control in the name of the empire.

name: It is Warm Work- Age of Sail Naval Rules
description:
It is Warm Work is a set of easy to play rules for fighting fleet battles in the Age of Sail using miniatures or cardboard counters. The rules recreate the flavor of the period with a minimal amount of complexity. The rules were written with a focus on the period 1740-1815, but can easily be used to re-fight Age of Sail Battles from before and after those dates.

The intent of the rules was to provide for the ability for a single player to use a large number of ships and for the game to be concluded with a clear winner in a single 3 to 4 hour gaming session.

The end product is a balance between the reality and game. It is Warm Work strikes a fair balance between period flavor and ease of play. The system is pretty basic when compared to most rules for the period, but the rules give good solid results that reflect the period.

Available as a PDF (rules and markers). Scenarios, ship counter images and discussion available at the Yahoo Group ItisWarmWork.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Charioteer: Racing at the Famous Circus Maximus
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The trumpets blare and your horses are ready. The moment of truth is at hand as the Emperor himself signals the start of the race. You guide your chariot around the racing oval using all the skill, savvy, and if need be, savagery, in the quest to finish first. The quest for fame and fortune is on and none shall stand in your way. Welcome to the world of Charioteer!

Relive the glory that was Rome with this fast-paced chariot racing game. Charioteer includes two levels of play:

• Charioteer - As a Charioteer, you spend your entire time chariot racing, trying to gain experience and find work in the best of places, Rome herself.
• Patron - As a Patron, the head of a chariot Racing Faction, you buy and sell both horses and charioteers alike, then put up the money to enter the races, all with the hope of winning more fame and a chance to race in Rome herself.

In either case, you must learn your trade on the fringe of the Empire and work your way to your ultimate goal, racing at the famous Circus Maximus in Rome herself!

name: Triumph & Tragedy: Colonial Supplement
description:
This supplement marks an improvent in the "Triumph & Tragedy" game line. First of all the layout and the publishing quality is full-color and better by other points of view.
Many extended historical backgrounds is give with lot of details and accuracy.

ALso, the supplement takes a more history-centred step, putting the very good T+T system away from the pulp/adventure genre that has been conceived for.

Here we are infact in the colonial period, so the action is set in late 19th century and not the '20s and '30s of the 20th century like the original game and first supplment "Libertad o Muerte".

A lot of special rules are given to provide players with some setting specific mechanics, a great load of army lists have been furnished about the British Empire, its enemies and allies to recreate battles in Africa and Asia, from Egypt, to South Africa to India!

It more than just an army list, it is a real expansion and a full companion book that really expands and takes the base game to an higer level!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Quick Picks Pyramid Travel Card Game
description:
From the publisher:

Now celebrating 35 years as one of America's most popular TV game shows, The $1,000,000 Pyramid is a new version of the classic two-team word and category guessing game! Featuring 24 rounds of Pyramid and Winner's Circle play, The $1,000,000 Pyramid Quick Pick edition offers all the fun of the TV show in this convenient travel-friendly tin! Game Contents: 288 Cards with 24 Rounds of Play, Red Reveal Window, 30-Second Timer, Instruction Booklet
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Recon by Fire: Issue 2
description:
44 pages. Includes 10 scenarios, an APC player aid chart and a large (DASL) map, BF2.

8 of the scenarios are East front, with one west front scenario, and one end war Russian v. Japanese scenario.

The scenarios are:

RBF-9: Rolling Stones

RBF-10: Tip Off at Tauroggen

RBF-11: Gut Check

RBF-12: Sverdlikova Melee

RBF-13: Neubauer Battalion

RBF-14: Kampfgruppe Lang

RBF-15: Shumilinmo

RBF-16: The Bitter End

RBF-17: Third Hotspot

RBF-18: First Day at Fuchin
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Rogue Scenarios
description:
A pad with 10 scenarios for the Squad Leader series.

They are named "rogue" because they use substandard Squad Leader boards 9, 10, and 11, which are not an integral part of any Squad Leader gamette.

The pad includes the following scenarios:
R211: AULD LANG SYNE; January 1, 1945; Gerimont, France
R212: ON THE ROAD TO ANDALSNES; April 24, 1940; Norway
R213: TRAVERSE RIGHT ... FIRE!; June 23, 1941; somewhere south of Bialystok, Russia
R214: THE FRONT IN FLAMES; August 22, 1943; 20 km south of Kharkov, Russia
R215: HASTY PUDDING; May 27, 1940; France
R216: A SMALL TOWN IN GERMANY; April 8, 1945; Friesoythe, Germany
R217: THE WHIRLWIND; April 18, 1945; Aschaffenburg, Germany
R218: OPERATION SWITCHBACK; October 6, 1944; Holland
R219: SCHELDT FORTRESS SOUTH; October 25, 1944; Holland
R220: CLEARING THE BRESKINS POCKET; October 6, 1944; Holland
R221: VITALITY I; October 24, 1944; Holland
R222: INFATUATE II; November 1, 1944; Westkapelle, Walcheren Island, Holland
R223: NIGHT DROP; June 6, 1944; Cherbourg Peninsula, France
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Shingle's List
description:
This ASL scenario pack consists of 8 tournament sized scenarios, 2 pages of historical background material, as well as British and Italian SASL generation tables.

The following scenarios are included:


1: FACTORY FARMING; 25 January 1944; Aprilia, Italy
2: FORMING THE THUMB; 30 January 1944; south of Campoleone, Italy
3: TALLY HO!; 4 February 1944; south of Campoleone, Italy
4: A PRODUCTIVE DAY AT THE OFFICE; 16 February 1944; Aprilia, Italy
5: SPARKS FLY; 17 February 1944; Albano-Anzio Road, Italy
6: HERE COME THE BASTARDS; 18 February 1944; Albano-Anzio Road, Italy
7: EVERYTHING WE GOT!; 19 February 1944; Albano-Anzio Road, Italy
8: GET READY; 29 February 1944; Carano, Italy
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Operation Neptune
description:
Operation Neptune is an Advanced Squad Leader Platoon Leader campaign game featuring the assault crossing of the Seine in France 1944 by the British 43rd (Wessex) Division, opposed by the German 49th Infantry Division.

The game includes the Campaign card, colour overlays for the village of Vernonnet, historical notes and comments by a playtester. In addition to the counters, you need ASL boards 2, 7 and 19 to play this game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Ambush
description:
Contents
1 3D Playing Board(Battle Ground).
2 Spring Loading Guns.
10 Figure's.
2 Bullets.
Rules Are Printed on Inner Box Lid.
'The Blues and the Greys'.
Ambush is a Game of Strategy and Accurate Shooting. The object is to get your men to the enemy gun position to win the game.
The game is played on a three dimensional board. The soldiers need the hills to protect them from enemy fire, which is real enough, as you get to fire bullets at the advancing soldiers with your spring-loaded gun.

The winner is the first to reach the enemy's gun position.
categories: Action / Dexterity, American Civil War, Wargame

name: Objective: Odessa
description:
Campaigns in WW2 #2 Expansion Kit

As part of Army Group South’s effort in Operation Barbarossa, the Romanian 3rd and 4th Armies were tasked with covering the right flank of the offensive, clearing the area between the Dniester and Bug Rivers, and occupying the port city of Odessa. Axis planners hoped the badly outnumbered Soviet garrison in this area would collapse quickly, but the hastily assembled Independent Coastal Army managed to withstand 73 days of siege before being evacuated to the Crimea by the Black Sea Fleet, effectively gutting the cream of the pre-war Romanian Army in the process.

The Objective: Odessa expansion kit includes a map extension and additional units to cover the added area and forces that participated in this region during the campaign.

Note, Objective: Odessa is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Objective: Kiev to use this expansion kit.

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 7 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each unit is one German corps or Russian army, and each turn is approximately one to two weeks.

Game Components:

• Eight 5/8" square pieces
• One 8" x 11" map extension
• One Rules booklet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Spindizzy
description:
Spindizzy is a mind-boggling game for 3 players that can be played with the Series: Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 board, 10 red, 10 black and 10 white balls.



RulesThe board is initially empty.

Players choose a colour and start with 10 balls each.

Then each player passes 3 balls of their supply to the left neighbour, and 2 balls to the right neighbour. From now on, at all times during the game the players keep their balls hidden.

A player is selected to be the "master" of the first turn.

In each turn – at the same time – players secretly pick one of their balls from their supply and hold it – hidden in the closed hand – towards the other players. When all players made their selection, the balls are revealed simultaneously.

Now the colour of the master player’s ball determines which player (remember, each player is assigned a colour) must play the ball in their hand first. A ball may be placed on any empty hole of the board or on any 2×2 platform. Then in clockwise direction the other two players also place their balls.

Whenever a small 5-ball pyramid is formed, the player whose colour represent the majority (or, if there is no clear majority, the player who owns the top ball) scores 1 point.

The last player of the current turn will then be the master player of the next turn.

End of the Game

When the last ball is played and the point is scored, the game ends. The player with the highest score wins the game. In the case where 2 players are tied, the third player wins.

Included in the Shibumi Rule Book

Soft cover:

http://www.lulu.com/shop/cameron-browne-and-nestor-romeral-a...

Downloadable PDF:

http://www.nestorgames.com/rulebooks/SHIBUMI_EN.pdf

name: Special Ops Issue #1
description:
Special Ops Issue #1 includes the games Raphia and Savage Streets, articles and errata counters for MMP games.

Articles:
SHIFTING SANDS - To the Pyramids: Axis Automatic victory. By Michael Rinella.
FIRE IN THE SKY - “Firing” up student interest - Using FITS in the classroom. By Doug Bryant.
ASL - “Singling must be taken”. By Jon Neall.
ASLSK CORNER - A Look at This Issues’s ASL Starter Kit Scenarios, S37 and S38. By Ken Dunn.
THINKING “INSIDE THE BOX” - SCS Gazala and History. By Jerrold Thomas.
MICHAEL WITTMANN - “Rudel” On The Ground. By Jerrold Thomas.
MMP AT ORIGINS - A Day at the Origins Game Fair. By Bruce Monnin.
BALTIC GAP (OCS) - Seaborne Assault Option. By John Kisner.

ASL/ASLSK scenarios.

ASL Scenario O1 Go big or go home, Connage, France 14 May 1940
ASL Scenario O2 Breaking the Ishun line, Ishun, Ukraine 19 October 1941
ASLSK Scenario S37 Breaking the panzers, Rauray, France, 1 July 1944
ASLSK Scenario S38 Raiders along the wall, Schevenhuette, Germany, 22 September 1944


The first ASL scenario depicts a small Pioneer group with armor support assaulting a little French village.
The second ASL scenario portrays a heavy German attack on a Russian fortified position.
The first SK scenario depicts a Das Reich counterattack with heavy armor on a Scottish Battalion.
The second SK scenario portrays a German infantry counterattack on an American position.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Fire and Movement
description:
Tactical Second World War game simulating a British battalion attacking a reduced German battalion in 1943-45. Published in the book Simulating War. Components are also available from the author's website. The designer recommends playing with seven players in two teams.

The game is played on a 6x8 hex grid, each hex representing about 150 meters across. Units are platoons, divided into four British companies versus two smaller German companies. The British side also has a machinegun platoon. Both sides are supported by off-map mortars. Terrain tiles are randomly placed before play to make a unique map for each game.

Players take turn moving and firing with all their units. There are limits on cooperation between units from different companies. Successful fire attacks pin enemy units, preventing them from firing or moving during their next turn.

Victory is decided by elimination of enemy units. The British player also scores points for moving units to the opposite board edge.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Quick Quest: Hero Pack 2
description:
A new hero joins the fight, bringing with him new challeges to face and treasures to win!

Quick Quest: Hero Pack 2 adds a Ranger to your roster of heroes.

You have creepy Crawlers and the spider-bat Web Wings to fight. Luckily the Ranger's brought his Spider Bane potion to help!

Swap out one of the four heroes using the color coded dots and shuffle the new cards in or use five heroes and continue the adventure to dungeon level 12!

This is an expansion for Quick Quest. It is not a stand alone product.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dark Age: Evolution
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Evolution is your resource to field forces of either Forsaken: Saint John or The Brood in you Dark Age games. This is Evolution. This is not a book about biology or Charles Darwin. What you will find hereis something else, something darker. We introduceyou now to the bitter reality of the Southern Crusade. Its proud general is John, a giant among theSaints. While in the Forsaken homeland, ruthless politicians manoeuvre for spiritual and worldly power. They struggle against each other with intrigue, deceipt, and any means available. In this twisted version of a classic battle of man against beast, Saint John leads his forces against the deviantcreations of The Mere, The Brood. Their creators thought they could control them. They were wrong.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Enochian Chess
description:
Originally named "Rosicrucian Chess," this is a four-handed chess variant that can be played as a game, or used as a divination tool. (The divination version requires the use of a die and an additional piece.) The game was invented in the Victorian era by the adepts of the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn in England. Despite the existence of extensive original instructions, no surviving manuscript gives perfectly unambiguous rules for play, so different modern authors have published instructions that do not always agree in all details. The first published version was in The Golden Dawn (1941) by Israel Regardie.

There are four different 8x8 boards, corresponding to the classical elements, of which only one is used in a given game session. Setup configuration of the pieces depends on which of the boards is being used, with four further variations possible within that decision. Ordinary game play involves partners seated across from one another, with their opponents at right angles to them: air and fire vs. water and earth. Setup is on the right-hand half of the nearest two rows, so that pawns generate a sort of spiral motion on the board as a whole.

Each player has nine chessmen (4 pawns, knight, queen, bishop, rook, and king), and piece movement varies slightly from standard modern chess, especially in the case of the queen. Pawns are promoted only to the corresponding piece of their native file. Each of the 36 chessmen has a correspondence to a given Egyptian god or goddess, and all of the board squares correspond to letters in the Angelic Tablets of Renaissance magicians John Dee and Edward Kelly.

name: Pirate's Cove
description: Simple Game for boys and girls 8-12. Object of the game is to get from your Pirate Ship into the cove with as much treasure as you can while avoiding bad things that could happen to you. Roll and move type game, turn over hidden pieces of treasure or turn over skull and crossbones and find nothing.

name: ATS TT: Darkest December
description:
From the publishers website:

Moving images of the Battle of the Bulge often include German soldiers in their long greatcoat scuttling across the fields from their dark forest lairs, the men of the Volksgrenadier divisions. Now YOU can push cardboard around while you play out the epic stand at Hotton on three fully remastered maps that includes all the counters you need to play and a total of 20 scenarios in all. Darkest December for ATS TT includes all the combat counters and large markers you need to play, ships in a Ziploc® style bag, just bring your ATS rulebook and play aids and the standard small ½" marker counter sheet and you are IN ACTION in this new take on the Battle of the Bulge classic!

Darkest December covers the battles around Hotton in which American soldiers had to deal with the sudden German onslaught using the Advanced Tobruk System rules and new ATS TT counters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: The Candy Shop War Card Game
description:
The Candy Shop War Card Game is based on Brandon Mull’s pre-teen book series of the same name. It is a 2-player card and dice game that tasks players with collecting hidden Artifacts which are protected by nefarious Villains who will stop at nothing to keep you from what you seek. Luckily, you have been equipped with a deck of magical candy to fend them off and claim the treasure for your own.

On your turn, roll dice to create specific combos in order to activate your candies’ abilities and to accumulate Adventure tokens on a Location. The first player to get the necessary amount of Adventure tokens on a Location wins the Artifact hidden behind it and scores points. But beware the Villains that stand in your way! If there’s a Villain at your current Location, he can damage or incapacitate you. If your health falls to zero, you will lose points. If you manage to beat a Villain’s health to zero, you will receive Reward cards equal to its level. You only get to keep one Reward card, however, so choose wisely, whether it be extra points or potent power-ups. The first player to reach 15 points is declared the winner.

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Orenda Patisson Promo Character
description:
Orenda Pattison is a Dryaden - Witch.

The character package consists of a promo character board, 2 character cards and a metal miniature.

This character can be used as a normal character for every game.

This new promo character was released with a 150 pcs. print run.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Malifaux: Body Thieves
description:
This set expands the Malifaux universe by adding the Body Thieves crew. This unit includes McMourning (leader), Flesh Construct, Sebastian, 2 nurses.

From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki:

The 'good' doctor (McMourning) is very offensively focused, rivaling the offensive punch of Lady Justice and Lilith.

Though not as versatile as Nicodem, McMourning remains very capable of summoning "frankenstein" themed minions; typically starting with a crew of numerous "little" minions (e.g.: Canine Remains and/or Necropunks) which provide materials to "stitch up" bigger abominations (Flesh Constructs or the rare Rogue Necromancy)

Unlike the other Resurrectionists, McMourning doesn't suffer when facing non-living/ undead forces; able to collect "body parts" from a number of sources thanks to his abilities. He is impressively mobile, allowing him to swiftly switch between savage slayer to supportive summoner with some decent speed.

Generally he wants to be just behind the front line where he can apply pressure and aid his own crew.

Note: It is recommended to purchase this crew together with the Canine Remains, so that McMourning can evolve these low-cost minions into more expensive and deadly creatures (such as the Flesh Construct)

name: Malifaux: Ronin
description:
This expansion for Malifaux includes 3 Outcast mercenaries.

From the Malifaux Tactica Wiki site:

You've got to love these girls. Once viewed by many as the best 5pt model in Book 1, they were errata'ed to make them more balanced, but still a very strong contender. High mobility, resilience, strong in melee and a shooting attack for when melee isn't the best option, combine to make a model which has many strengths and few weaknesses. Nevertheless, although pretty much a must have in a crew led by the Viktorias, Ronin are rarely seen in crews led by other masters despite the fact that as mercenaries they can potentially be taken by all factions (albeit for the cost of an additional soulstone).
As a cheap basic crew which can be simple to pick up and play competitively then you can't go far wrong with the 2 Viktorias and a blister of 3 Ronin.

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Droséra Amis Promo Character
description:
Droséra Amis is a Human - Juggler.

The character package consists of a promo character board, 2 character cards and a metal miniature.

This character can be used as a normal character for every game.

This new promo character was released with a 66 pcs. print run.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Schicksalspfade
description:
The conflicts in Aventurien are as varied as the world itself. Now there is a new way to sort out these battles.

In Schicksalspfade rivaling groups of adventurers hired by warring rulers fight in miniature combats for power, honour and the right to claim their destiny.

Fight with the brave Stars of the Reichsarmee for the Empress, justice and the Empire, strengthen the influence of Al’Anfa with the Order of the Hand of Boron, loot and plunder with the tough Ottajasko or solve long forgotten secrets with the mysterious Tulamidian Riders of Fasar and get help from the different Heroes and Rogues of Aventurien who also want their part of the treasure. The secrets of Aventurien are yours to discover, so use your chance to wander the paths that determine your future and your destiny.

Schicksalspfade (Paths of Destiny) is a skirmish miniature combat game based on the RPG Das Schwarze Auge (The Dark Eye). The system is a standalone game in which you lead your party of adventurers into the battlefield. The Rulebook includes 28 characters from five different fractions that have unique abilities. Build your own party and lead it into challenging and exciting scenarios.
In a standard game each player has about 4 to 6 characters and it lasts about 60 minutes and takes ten turns.

Now available:
- The Rulebook which includes everything you need to play (Rules, maps and paper miniatures to cut out) except the 20 sided dice
- The Cardset which includes the maps, tokens and characters from the Rulebook printed on fine Cardboard
- Tin miniatures for each of the starting characters


Die Konflikte in der Welt von Das Schwarze Auge sind so vielfältig wie Aventurien selbst. Entdecke nun eine neue Art und Weise, diese Gefechte auszutragen.

Bei Schicksalspfade wetteifern rivalisierende Abenteurergruppen im Dienste verfeindeter Herren in Miniaturengefechten um Macht, Ruhm, Ehre und das Recht, ihr Schicksal selbst zu bestimmen.

Streite mit den tapferen Sternen der Reichsarmee für Kaiserin, Recht und Reich, mehre den Einfluss Al’Anfas mit der geheimnisvollen Hand Borons, raube und brandschatze mit der raubeinigen Ottajasko aus Thorwal oder entschlüssele längst vergangene Geheimnisse mit den mysteriösen Tulamidischen Reitern aus Fasar. Suche die Hilfe der zahlreichen Helden & Schurken Aventuriens, die ebenfalls ihren Teil vom Kuchen für sich beanspruchen. Die Geheimnisse Aventuriens warten auf dich. Also greif zu und begib dich auf die Pfade, die deine Zukunft, dein Schicksal bestimmen werden.

name: Resident Evil Deck Building Game: Nurse Rebecca Promo
description:
PR-009, Nurse Rebecca was included in the RE:DBG Mercenaries promo kits sent to stores. This is an additional character which, while it was released with the Mercenaries core set, can be used with all versions of the Resident Evil Deck Building Game.

Health: 70
Level 1 (1 decoration): At the beginning of your turn, you can select another Player and they can get +1 card. If they do, you can have a Player get +1 card.

Level 2 (4 decorations): During your turn, while Rebecca is Exploring, Rebecca deals an additional 10 Damage for each Player with more than 5 cards in their Hand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Crush at Nomonhan
description:
Issue game in Command Magazine Japan #108

The game covers the battle of Nomonhan from July to August of 1939 around Haruha river.

The map covers from border of Manchu to Komatsu hill.
Japanese player can win if one of his unit can reach the Komatsu hill. If this is not the case, the game is decided by each force's moral at the end of 8th turn.
Each player can choose the sequence between move then combat or combat then move.

name: Leathernecks '43
description:
November, 20 1943
Gilbert Islands, Tarawa Atoll

After hours of intense naval bombardment, the Marines of the US Second Division sat some 500 yards from shore, their landing craft impeded by the shallow reef. As the artillery ceased, it was time to take to the beach in what would be the deadliest 76 hours in the entire Pacific Theater of World War II.

Leathernecks ‘43 is a fast-paced dice game which mixes push-your-luck elements with important tactical decisions. You control a squad of Marines advancing up the beach towards enemy machine gun positions. Rolling the soldiers on your dice allows them to advance, but you might also roll machine gun fire which slows them down. Each suppressing fire result pins down one of your soldier dice and if you accumulate three suppressing fires in a single turn, your entire squad is pinned down and none of your soldiers advance! If you’re lucky, you can use smoke grenades to avoid the fire and push your squad up the beach. Your goal is to assault the bunker, but you also need to outpace your opponent’s soldiers! At the end of the game, you score bonus points if you moved your different soldiers farther than your opponents, so you need to pay attention to what they are doing!
publishers: (Self-Published), Chevee Dodd, LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: The Task of Ezrok
description:
The Task of Ezrok is a solitaire card game with a heroic fantasy theme. Adventurers in the world of Ezrok love their leathers & fur, and various factions of druids are everywhere; some good, some not so good. The following paragraph describes the undertaking that is at the heart of the game:

"The Chest of Seth has found its way into the heartland kingdoms. Fortunately, King Morem has ordered the destruction of this evil relic. Your aim is to oversee Ezrok and his companions as they transport the chest far away from civilization. This task will take you through the Swamps of the Black Dragon, the Hills of Vorkin, and deep into an icy wasteland where the chest must be destroyed in the Eternal Chasm."

This game uses a tile laying system to move Ezrok and his companions across the different regions toward their goal. The cards are progressively laid face up until nine rows of tiles are created. It is after this point that Ezrok can arrive at the Eternal Chasm to destroy the chest.

The Task of Ezrok includes 108 tile cards which offer a variety of encounters and obstacles. Also included are 8 history cards (enrichment material), 10 miscellaneous cards (playing aids, etc.), a pawn, and all the dice needed for tracking resource points.

name: Star Cargo
description:
You are a merchant in space, traveling throughout the galaxy looking for the best cargo to sell. The most sought-after goods come from the frontier worlds, for which the colonies back home will pay top price. But you’re not the only merchant in the business… your competitors are after those same profitable goods! As you race to get there first, the frontier itself is expanding, shrinking, and being settled into stable markets. Will you be able to haul the most profit before the final frontier closes forever?

Star Cargo is a simple pick-up-and-deliver race game playable with a poker deck, a few poker chips and player pawns.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Print & Play, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: AT-43 Hero Box: Captain H. Newton
description: Captain H. Newton is an officer and hero of the U.N. army. Aboard Number One, she has no rival. Besides no matter if she is on foot or aboard her Fire Toad, she can repair any armored fighting vehicle including her own. And destroying her strider is not enough to eliminate her: the miniature on foot is then deployed to carry on fighting!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Steel Tac Arms
description:
This Unit Box contains a unit of three steel TacArms: two standard TacArms and a TacArm leader, each equipped with two laser guns. One of them can be promoted Sergeant. Particularly resilient, the TacArms are also capable of piercing even the thickest of armor with their great laser guns. Showing exceptional accuracy and impressive attack rate, these weapons make the steel TacArms one of the most dreadful units in the White Stars army. For further tactical possibilities, one of them can become a Sergeant.

Contents:
• Box of 3 miniatures, 3 Steel TacArm, 1 Torso / kit leader, with laser gun x 2.
• 2 cards : Steel TacArm Sgt, Steel TacArm
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Honey Donuts
description:
Board & Pieces
3 pieces including one King, and the same 3 for blue and 12 white pieces are initially placed on a Honey Donut board.

Movements
Players move their pieces in their turn following the rules below:
Move a whole "straight line" of pieces which includes his/her piece(s) one square in either direction along the line. "Straight lines" are composed of either 2, 3 or 4 pieces. All the pieces in one "straight line" need to be moved always together.
With the move, one piece is pushed out from the board. The pushed out piece is placed in the square in which no piece is placed after the move. The King pieces cannot be placed back on the board as it is the end of the game when they are pushed out of the board.
Moving the line backward right after the opponent's turn is not allowed.
No pass is allowed.

Goal
The player who pushed opponent's King out of the board wins.

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Assault Medusa
description:
The assault medusas are autonomous combat systems based on a modified type 1 frame. They are meant to favor endurance and design. Slower than the golems, the assault medusas are ancient attack systems that were designed in the habitat of Thera. Engineered in the traditional way, associating ergonomics and resistance, their carefully programmed ranged combat procedures make them great support units. Due to their movement mode, they are most reliable when used as shooting platforms.

The standard equipment of the assault medusas, as .troops/range, is either sonic weaponry (sonic gun), or nanomunition weaponry (nucleus rifle).

Thanks to its exceptional toughness, the assault medusas can endure a lot of light weapon fire without suffering any losses and return fire with lethal accuracy. A great classic of Therian attack systems, the assault medusa will never go out of fashion!

Contents:
• 2 assault medusas. Armament: nucleus rifle
• 1 assault medusa. Armament: nucleus gun
• 1 assault medusa leader. Armament: nucleus rifle.
• 3 cards: Assault medusa.

name: Eselsbrücke
description:
In this fun memory game the player must find not only two but three matching cards. But all three cards are different forming the image serie.

Who gets the most triples at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Bulwark: Magistra Csenge
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

Csenge was identified as a precocious talent my mages from the Council at a young age. Unfortunately, she did nopt take well to the dsicpline and ,eventually was expelled. After a number of years developing her talents in her own way she became a formidable battle mage, much sought after as a mercenary. The Council decided it was better to have her inside throwing balls of fire out, than outside throwing them in. She is now a full member of the Council, much to the chagrin of her former tutors.

Welcome to Hard Mode

Magistra Csenge is a new Hero deck, fully compatible with the base game. It introduces a new mechanic, mana, that makes forcing combinations of cards more critical than ever. She also takes time to develop his deck, making her hard to manage for short Start Phases. She is recommended for experienced Bulwark players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Accusation
description:
Excerpt from the rulebook:

"Accusation is a card game in which players take on the roles of countries engaged in world events. Players use their country’s assets: military, intelligence, economy, diplomacy, and research to influence the outcome of world events and gain victory points to achieve world domination."

Players simultaneously and anonymously enact "world events" in the form of cards. They then bluff and use different abilities (each costing different sorts of resources) in order to further their agendas and gain victory points while trying to avoid bad reputation and resource loss, both of which make it more difficult to advance one's own agendas as well as accuse others of other actions.

The fast paced, primarily concurrent nature of Accusation makes it a high-intensity game. The only part of a turn in which any waiting occurs is during the turn-based "Accusation Phase" wherein players take turns attempting to call out others for playing cards.

Accusation is modern-themed and comes with 45 unique event cards, but it is designed to be highly extensible. New mechanics, new events, theme elements such as Cold War politics, and many other advances can (and will) be implemented in expansions.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Political, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dust Tactics: Axis Fortification – Heavy Laser Bunker / Strongpoint
description:
As the war grows ever deadlier, soldiers have come to rely on the safety that battlefield fortification can provide. This box contains a modular plastic kit designed to create bunkers and strongpoints that can be outfitted with either the Single or Dual Heavy Laser Guns.

Hold the line with the Axis Fortification pack!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: In the Name of Roma!: Actions of the 80 Roma Infantry Regiment on the Eastern Front – August to December 1941
description:
IN THE NAME OF ROMA is a wargame supplement that contains 30 company and platoon level scenarios covering the actions of the 80a Roma Regiment from August to December of 1941. You’ll follow the 80th from the open steppe to the Donetz industrial basin, including the amphibious attacks across the Dnieper, and the fateful decision of Column Chiarimonti to attempt to seize Nikitovka.

IN THE NAME OF ROMA includes:

• 30 scenarios divided in six distinct campaigns
• Historical background information and period area maps
• Italian and Soviet briefing for each scenario
• Formation information and stats for Early War Italians and Soviets
• Forward by Richard Clarke

Though primarily written for the Too Fat Lardies rules systems (I Ain’t Been Shot Mum; Troops, Weapons, and Tactics; and the newly released Chain of Command), the scenarios in IN THE NAME OF ROMA work equally well with Arc of Fire, Bolt Action, Flames of War or your favorite rules system.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Nation: A Mighty Spark
description:
"The spread of civilization may be likened to a fire; First, a feeble spark, next a flickering flame, then a mighty blaze, ever increasing in speed and power." - Nikola Tesla

Components:
63 Civilian Cards
12 Starter Civilian Cards
20 Worker Tokens
18 Map Cards
4 Starter Map Cards
20 Player Populace Tokens
5 Neutral Populace Tokens
8 Six Sided Dice
1 Rulebook

Nation: A Mighty Spark is a worker placement strategy card game that takes place on a planet where bugs have evolved into the dominant species.

Players place worker tokens onto a modular map, made of cards, that begin hidden but are revealed as they explore. For each worker placed one of five actions is chosen: The Battle action allows players to modify populaces and civilian cards on the table. The Build action allows placement of populaces onto map cards. The Develop action allows placement of civilian cards from your hands on to the table: providing food for more workers, building materials for populaces and military might. The Draw actions allow players to draw more cards into their hand. The Explore action allows for the revealing of face down map cards.

Players continue taking turns until the civilian draw deck depletes. Victory points are counted based upon the number of civilians in play, populace control and military might.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: DreadBall: Ukomo Avalanchers
description:
The Ukomo Avalanchers are an alien race of sentient dinosaurs (the Teratons) introduced in Season 3 expansion for DreadBall.

Armored hides make Teratons tough customers to begin with. Couple that with their in-borne defensive ability to teleport when attacked from behind or to move through obstacles as necessary and you can see why they're a popular team. Playing them takes finesse, though, as they field no strikers and are comparably slow against many other teams---even if they can teleport a limited distance.

The basic team includes 8 models:
4 Teraton Jacks
4 Teraton Guards

From the DreadBall Sports Network: "The Avalanchers haven’t been around for long, but their hard-hitting play style has already won them plenty of fans. The fact that they’re giant teleporting reptiles doesn’t hurt, either!"
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Abenteuerband 6
description:
The booklet Quest: Zeit der Helden - Abenteuerband 6 contains two solitaire adventures for Quest, both of which won an adventure design contest held by publisher Pegasus Spiele:


"Der Sammler der Lieder", a solo-scenario for the hero Talorien.
"Karomins Berufung", a solo-scenario for the hero Karomin.


Both adventures feature the start of the adventuring career of the hero mentioned and should be played with one player and one Questmaster only.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Pure Halloween
description:
Pure Halloween is a strategy game for two players in which the player who first occupies all nine regions of the Sudoku-type game board wins.

Players control a "team" of Halloween figures, with each figure having a unique way of moving. The rules are simple and easy to learn, but winning the game requires complex strategic maneuvers and well-planned tactics.

name: Engage: American Units
description: This expansion module includes the American plastic military pieces not included in the base game. These expansions add different components that do not come in the base game. The stats/rules of these components are different than the ones that come in the base game. The rules/stats for the expansion components come in the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Engage: Japanese Units
description: This expansion module includes the Japanese plastic military pieces not included in the base game. These expansions add different components that do not come in the base game. The stats/rules of these components are different than the ones that come in the base game. The rules/stats for the expansion components come in the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Engage: Russian Units
description: This expansion module includes the Russian plastic military pieces not included in the base game. These expansions add different components that do not come in the base game. The stats/rules of these components are different than the ones that come in the base game. The rules/stats for the expansion components come in the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Engage: German Units
description: This expansion module includes the German plastic military pieces not included in the base game. These expansions add different components that do not come in the base game. The stats/rules of these components are different than the ones that come in the base game. The rules/stats for the expansion components come in the base game.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Assault on Stalingrad
description:
From July to October 1942, in the area between the Don and Volga Rivers, the German army broke through the Soviet defense and rushed to Stalingrad. They aimed to occupy the important city facilities (such as Mamai Hill, tractor factory and grain silos). However, Soviet reinforcements poured in and fought back.

Urban warfare is expanded on the Stalingrad city mini-map.

Scale
Counters: division, corps
Hex: about 10 km (normal map) / about 2.4 km (Stalingrad city map)
Turn: 4 days

120 counters

name: Battle for Gettysburg: The First Day
description:
Battle for Gettysburg: The First Day

The game comes with one colour map (in two pieces about 22" x 17").

120 counters (mounted not cut), rule book and charts.

Formations (Divisions for the Confederates, Corps for the Union) activate on chit pull, each formation then may Fire, Move and Final Fire with Defensive Fire occurring at the completion of Movement. Artillery can fire out to 6 hexes. Infantry fire at adjacent units.

The unit counters are single sided and the step loss markers are double sided. Rule book is B&W but Play Aid is colour.

There is a set up sheet in B&W that shows the locations/areas where the units that start on map are placed.

name: In the Margins
description:
Heroes, Villains and Drawing Awesome Levels!

1-4 Players, 10-30min, Free Print and Play Game (one sheet double sided)


A dice-rolling, create-your-own-adventure game to rekindle those drawing and storytelling skills from childhood.

Choose a Villain, build some challenges, then take your Hero through them.

Spend your rolls on abilities, then roll a sum total to beat the challenge.

You will be trying to roll a sum total with 3 dice, then compare that to the 3 target numbers shown on the challenge.

Each challenge you attempt, will allow you to accumulate points.

However, you can only BANK those points when you choose to WALK AWAY and not attempt another challenge.

If you run out of health and are Eliminated while attempting a challenge, you will lose all the points you've accumulated so far at that difficulty level (on that Villain Card).

The player who survives with the Most Points BANKED by the end of 4 difficulty levels/rounds wins.


Download the PnP PDF below in the "FILES" section of this game page.
Hope you enjoy!!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck

name: Mage Wars: Staff of Storms Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized Play.

Staff of Storms

Equipment

Cost 7 Mana

Each Upkeep Phase place a Storm token on Staff of Storms up to a maximum of 4. Whenever you make a wind or lightning attack, during the Roll Dice Step you may remove any number of Storm tokens to roll 1 additional attack die, and gain +1 to the effect die roll, per token removed.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – A Zestaw
description:
In 2012 the Institute of National Remembrance published a game called “ZnajZnak”. The game is the history of Poland told with 133 symbols. Playing “ZnajZank” makes it unbelievably easy to remember the most important figures, dates, places and objects in Polish modern history.

ZnajZnak - Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak – Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Real-time, World War II

name: Dungeon Attack!: Adventurer Pack Expansion
description:
In this pack of 9 additional adventurers for Dungeon Attack! you will have the chance to take the role of one of these adventurers: the Heroic Paladin, the Shadowy Sorceress, the Deadly Archer, the Crafty Alchemist, the Brutal Brawler, the Primal Druid, the Martial Monk, the Shadow Hunter, and the Valiant Valkyrie.

In addition, four adventurer followers are included along with the optional rules card detailing their use in the game: the Torchbearer Peasant, the Mercenary Sellsword, the Dire Wolf, and the Nurturing Spirit.

name: Spacelords
description:
Spacelords (subtitle: "Infanteriegefechte im Jahre 4300" - infantry warfare in the year 4300) is a futuristic tabletop miniatures game.

It is set in the year 4300 A.D. when six powerful factions wage war against each other: the Cybertechs, O'Schilly's Partisans, the Phagon (a race of humanoid goat warriors), the Sarday'kin, the Mercenary Guild, and the Yoyodyne.

The game was produced by German miniatures company Hobby Products, with miniatures being sold separately from the core rules. The rules came in a large binder with six scenarios included:

"Durch die Sümpfe" (Through the swamps)
"Viel Feind, viel Ehr" (Many Enemies, much honor)
"Böse Überraschung" (Bad surprise)
"Höhe 912" (Hill 912)
"Mission: Rescue"
"Brückenkopf Delta" (Delta Bridgehead)


In addition to the rules the binder contained clear plastic templates to determine line of sight, targetable and hit areas, several cardboard data sheets for vehicles, two 20-sided and two 6-sided dice, as well as 120 plastic chits.

name: Harbour Bridges
description:
Harbour Bridges is a light network connection game featuring a double sided board of Sydney and Auckland Harbours.

Players take on the role of city planners and build bridges to connect cycle routes between harbourside suburbs and then race the other players to get their pawns on to their target suburbs quicker than anyone else.

Movement is by collecting numbered cards, and on movement turns players play down as many cards as they want as long as the cards are the same number.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Sangin Despatches No.1
description: This supplement includes additional scenarios and rules for the Skirmish Sangin miniatures game. The book includes four new orders of battle for Canadians, Germans, Afghan National Police, and the 611 Militia. There are seven new scenarios, campaign & character experience rules, a game play primer, and tactics articles from ex-military personnel.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare

name: Encore
description:
Roll the dice. Play the Perfect Show. Avoid tomatoes.

Encore is a Rock'n-Rollers dice game for one-to-four players.

- Each turn is a Performance. Each Act (player) rolls the dice to be the first to complete the necessary Show requirements and Perform an Encore, or be the Last Act Standing. Fail to score during a Performance, collect a tomato and face the feared Technical Difficulties! Too many Technical Difficulties and you'll Bomb the Show! Too many tomatoes and you'll lose the game!

- Each Act (player) takes a score card. There are various Show requirements in three stages of the game: General Admission, Backstage, and Gig Time. Acts must Perform these Show requirements by rolling the dice. All Show requirements must be completed before moving on to the next stage.

- Each turn is a Performance. On a Performance, an Act will roll six of the custom Performance dice. Set aside any 'keepers'. You can end your Performance to score at any time. To re-roll, a die must be discarded from the remaining dice.

- Show requirements are checked off the scorecard when they are completed.

- If an Act fails to Perform a Show requirement by the end of their Performance, they must collect a tomato and roll the Technical Difficulties die. After four Technical Difficulties, the Act will get two tomatoes thrown at them and miss their next Performance (lose a turn)!

- To win, an Act must be the first to Perform an Encore, or become the Last Act Standing.

name: Jushimatsu: Egg Expansion
description:
Jushimatsu: Egg Expansion adds eggs to the finches already present in Jushimatsu.

Components
1 set of 10 Finch tiles (1 Four-finches, 2 Three-finches, 3 two-finches, 4 one-finch).
1 set of 5 Egg tiles (1 three-eggs, 2 two-eggs, 2 one-egg)

Number of Players
If you use this expansion with a basic Jushimatsu game for 2 players, you can play this game with up to 3 players.
If you have 2 different sets of basic Jushimatsu, you can play it up to 5 players.

Eggs
Eggs are wild tiles. It was count as any color finch in the play.
At the preparing, each player get a egg tile secretly and enter it into the bag of his/her own without seeing with his/her all finch tiles.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Expansion for Base-game, Number

name: Rally Point Volume 8: Sons of the Rising Sun
description: A special study of the Pacific Theater of Operations. It includes 10 new scenarios from the Tampa ASL Group. This special study of the PTO is intended to compliment the ASL module Rising Sun by providing players with tournament-level scenarios designed with the modern-era style of ASL play in mind.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Soldiers of Glory: An Epic Game of Swashbuckling Adventure during the 1600s.
description:
BACKGROUND: Soldiers of Glory is an adventure game for 1-4 Players, where players assume the roles of young Soldiers of Fortune during the 1600s. Each Player creates a Hero Character in search of Wealth, Adventure and Renown. To survive and thrive in a land torn apart by Religious Wars, Intrigue, Piracy and Plague, the Player Heroes must seek employment from a variety of Patrons and perform Assignments such as escorting envoys, participating in Battles, dueling rivals, espionage, political intrigue, rescuing damsels, and assassinations. As your Hero gains experience and renown they can improve their attributes and status.

GAME OBJECTIVE: The Objective of each Player Hero is to Gain as much Renown Points (RP) to become a Nobleman. Game length is determined by the Nobility Title desired: Baron (60RP), Count (80RP) or Duke (100RP). In order to become a Nobleman, the Player Hero must complete Assignments to earn enough RP to purchase the various Titles.

GAME FEATURES: Soldiers of Glory features lots and lots of colorful game counters including Swordsmen, Cavaliers, Brigands, Soldiers, Assassins, Nobles, Femmes Fatal, fierce animals, and much more. The game is played on a 6 Sheet Map with Large Hexes and a variety of terrain. Game includes Duels, Skirmishes, Battles, Fortress Assaults, Combat at Sea, Pirates and more.

If you are a fan of the Three Musketeers, any Errol Flynn movie, Alatriste, and other swashbuckling tales, this game is for you.

ASSEMBLY TIME: This game, since there are a lot of counters, may take longer than the designer's other games. It took me about 4 hours at industrious pace.
categories: Adventure, Pike and Shot, Pirates, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing

name: War of the Void
description:
Two galactic forces, the Imperium and the Union, meet at New Mars for a discussion of peace. The Union sends their most brilliant leaders, ready to hammer out a contract that will mean tranquility and prosperity for years to come. But as the meetings are about to commence, the Imperium fleet arrives and bombards New Mars to a fine powder, evacuating Imperium leaders just before the destruction. War immediately erupts in star systems far and near, and the Imperium circles the chaos like a vulture, snatching up planets and enticing new allies to join them. The Union quickly gathers its forces as princes and vice-presidents take the helm in the sudden power vacuum left from the attack at New Mars. Will they be able to stand against the growing storm that the Imperium commands?

War of the Void pits two teams of players against each other in a struggle to control the galaxy through conquest or diplomacy. Each player controls his own alien empire, building up a deck of cards unique to his alien faction to perform actions. Players on the same team complete their turns simultaneously, resulting in action-packed, quick gameplay.

Players must work together to dominate systems by taking control of planets. Planets can either be conquered, which will increase a player’s income, or befriended, which will give the player a special ability. Players must build up a fleet of ships to defend and attack, choosing from many ship types with unique abilities.

War of the Void is a thematic sequel to Empires of the Void. It in an entirely new game set in the same universe. The game is for 2-4 players and takes about 90-120 minutes to play. A planned expansion will add components for a 5th and 6th player.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Outcasts (Wave 2)
description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box – Ten Thunders (Wave 2)
description: The fate of Malifaux is approaching a crossroads. Forces continue to vie for power, as new allies join the struggle. Contained in this Arsenal Deck you will find all the stat and upgrade cards needed to play the Guild characters and crews found in the Malifaux 2E: Crossroads book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Cosmic Encounter: White Dwarf Magazine Expansion
description:
User Description

The White Dwarf expansion for Cosmic Encounter has four new Alien Powers cards for the Games Workshop edition of Cosmic Encounter (2nd edition).

Published in the White Dwarf magazine, issue 78 with an article about Cosmic Encounter and its history.

All four of the Alien Powers cards were in Eon expansion sets (Grudge in #1, the other three in #3), and have been republished in a later edition of Cosmic Encounter.

The Alien Powers Cards are:

Reincarnator - Uses Powers not in the game
Changeling - Changes Powers with opponents
Warrior - Adds experience points
Grudge - Penalizes for refusing to ally

name: Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail
description:
Around the time of the Civil War and following, the American West was certainly a wild place. Although it was sparsely populated, many of the inhabitants were desperate and dangerous. The West had always been home to large groups of American natives, but now had been receiving various undesirables such as cattle rustlers, gamblers, vigilantes, and banditos. For the most part, those coming West were hungry for gold and were willing to do just about anything to get it. Many found it too tiresome trying to get rich panning and digging, and instead found it more convenient to steal or kill for it. As a consequence, it became the common practice not only for nearly everyone to carry a firearm, but also for nearly everyone to use one. Needless to say gangs, posses, and gunfights were common parts of every day life. Anybody with a gun had an opportunity to make a name and gain infamy in the great American West.

It is exactly this setting in which you find yourself in. You have the option of choosing one of seven notorious gunfighters of the old American West: Kid Rango, Chief War Wind, Pablo ‘The Pistol’ Perez, Walter Winston, Raging Arrow, Luther ‘The Lawman’ Hale, or Little Pancho. Besides the 7 posse bosses, Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail also comes with an additional 42 gunfighters. Each boss and gunfighter comes with their own mugshot and unique battle stats. With your posse boss, recruit a gang from the various cities to ride out to face your rivals. Dodge ruthless banditos, determined lawmen, and hostile natives to get to your next gig. You can knock off the Bank of the Nation, rustle up some cattle, or take on the Union Pacific Railroad. You can also track down the other gunslingers to collect the bounties on their heads. The way you stack your posse, the strategy you employ, and knowing when to strike will always give you the edge. Each boss comes with his own clutch skills that come in handy when the chips are down. No matter how many times you play, the scenarios are endless and the game never looks the same twice. The winner is the posse that bags the most gold, even if they end up in pine boxes.

With Gunslinger: Legends of the Dusty Trail, you get three distinct games in the Gunslinger series. You get everything you need to play Gunslinger Shootout (arena style combat), Gunslinger Showdown (mano y mano confrontation), and Gunslinger Roundup (recruit your posse, collect the bounties, and get the gold). Anybody can get lucky and be a hero! It takes one shot in the right spot.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Land Expansion Deck D
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Yellow deck has a Land based theme which also includes deserts, forests and remarkable cards such as Crossroads which dictates bunny attacks and Urban Plague which can empty your opponent’s cities immediately!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Animals Expansion Deck D
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Orange deck has an Animals based theme which also includes mammals, marsupials and incredible cards such as We Are The World which gives maximum Civ Point rewards for city building and Cruel Mule which can deflect an attack!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Vikings: Long Ships in the Mist
description: Vikings: Long Ships in the Mist is a Euro game with historical flavor, covering the heart of the Viking Age, 800 to 950 AD. Players must carefully balance the two primary options they have each turn: plundering for quick riches; or attempting to settle and control provinces on the map. Areas that are settled and controlled by a player produce income and are worth victory points.

name: Deadzone: Asterian Faction Starter
description:
Asterians are a mysterious elf-like race of aliens who rely heavily on androids and AIs to complete their mysterious missions within Deadzones.

This starter faction includes the following models, cards and bases:

54-card Faction Deck
1 Asterian Commander
3 Cyphers with Noh Rifles
3 Cyphers with Charge Gloves
1 Cypher with Fission Beamer
1 Black Talon
2 Weapons Drones with multiple weapon options
10 25mm bases
2 flying bases
54-card Faction Deck
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Zong Shi: Kickstarter exclusive cards
description:
Backing Zong Shi will allow you to acquire a number of exclusive game components that will only be available for this Kickstarter project. The first exclusive component is a representation of this project within the game, so you can help Zong Shi succeed both in real life and in the game! In addition to the project card you can also receive two additional Scrolls of Fortune not found in the game.

Both the project card and the Scroll of Fortune cards are exclusive to this Kickstarter Project and will never be reprinted again for any purpose.

name: Flames of War: Barbarossa – Germany's Invasion of the Soviet Union, June-Decemeber 1941
description:
From the publisher's website:
The latest book covering the early-war period of Flames Of War covers the much expected and anticipated German invasion of the Soviet Union in 1941, known as Operation Barbarossa. We decided to simply call it Barbarossa, as this iconic operational name would be easily recognisable for even those with a passing interest in World War Two.

The book covers the German and Soviet forces engaged in the fighting across this massive front and we have tried to pack as much into the book as we dare. In addition we will also be producing a bunch of supplemental Intelligence Briefings covering the German and Soviet forces we couldn’t quite squeeze into the book, plus briefings covering Germany’s Axis allies.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: The Ancient Wargame
description: A classic light 25mm miniatures wargame at roughly 1"=25' (10 paces) and a figure ratio of 1:20. Including battles covering Egypt/Assyria, Greek/Persia, Macedonians/The Successors, Rome/Carthage and Rome/Barbarians with rules and scenarios.

name: Top That Toast
description:
The party game Top That Toast consists of two decks of cards: 50 Tone Cards and 200 Topic Cards. All players begin the game by drawing 5 Topic Cards. The oldest player in the group begins as the "Facilitoaster."

The Facilitoaster begins the round by drawing a Tone Card, which determines the tone or style of the toast (some examples include "Humor," "Sincere," "Tearjerker," and "Roast"). All other players respond by submitting a Topic Card, face-down on the table. The Facilitoaster then reads the Topic Cards aloud and chooses the Topic Card that, in his or her opinion, best matches the Tone Card and deserves to be toasted. The player who submitted that Topic Card then delivers a toast and thereby wins a Tone Card for that round.

There are additional competitive aspects of the game. In the event that 2 or more of the same Topic Card is submitted in a round, the Facilitoaster has the option to call for a Toast Off, where the players who submitted the same Topic Card each give a toast. The Facilitoaster will award the Tone Card to the player who gave the best toast.

When the Top That Toast Tone Card is drawn, each player will give a toast based on the Topic Card that is selected by the Facilitoaster. Once all toasts are completed, the Facilitoaster chooses which player is awarded the Tone Card.

After each round, the role of the Facilitoaster rotates around the table. Once a player has won a pre-determined number of Tone Cards, that player wins the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling

name: Breaking the Chains: Supplements
description:
From the publisher:

Upset about the absence of the Russian Pacific Fleet in the BtC countermix? Fret no more. The BtC: Supplements package adds new counters and a new scenario, the East is Red, to your Breaking the Chains game to showcase the capabilities of the Russian Pacific Fleet. BtC: Supplements also adds projected Zumwalt class US destroyers to the mix as well.

Putin called last night. He was upset about the absence of Russian units in the BtC counter mix. He bragged about naval reforms, new missiles, and new ships. My eyes rolled, (he couldn’t see that over the phone) but he did make some good points. For example, Russian anti-ship missiles can outrange their U.S. and Chinese counterparts. He explained how missile technology is integral to Russian ship design by citing his aircraft carrier, the Kuznetsov. That CV allocates precious deck space to missile launchers. So, it carries fewer planes, but has an impressive anti-ship missile capability! Indeed, when the Chinese bought the Varyag from Ukraine they covered some of those missile slots to add deck space to support more aircraft. Hence, the Liaoning can carry more aircraft than the Kuznetsov even though those two ships are of the same class. And, Russian submarines are different too. Those Akulas don’t carry land attack cruise missiles (no LACM capability), but they have more torpedoes. The man reminded me that one of those boats patrolled the Gulf of Mexico for a full month before we detected it; they are quiet.

So we made new counters to represent Russia’s Pacific fleet as it might appear around 2020. WE also added some U.S. units such as the Zumwalt class destroyer; the press expects us to have three of them by 2020. Of course, we're also designing a new scenario, The East is Red, to feature these units in combat around the East China Sea although they can be also be used in the already existing campaign game.

Components:

One scenario: The East is Red
12 counters (5/8")
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Beresteczko 1651
description:
Game covers biggest land battle of XVII century, fought between the Ukrainian Cossacks, led by Hetman Bohdan Khmelnytsky, aided by their Crimean Tatar allies, and a Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth army under King John II Casimir. It was a battle of a Cossack rebellion in Ukraine that took place in the years 1648–1657.
Game uses Husaria system, designed for XVII century battles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation
publishers: not simple games, Taktyka i Strategia

name: Werewolf: Dystopia
description:
A setting twist to the popular role playing game, Werewolf. Villagers must hunt down the Werewolves before they become the hunted.

The game takes place in a dystopian future when modern civilisation collapsed, giving way to a new world order.

Based on the 80's game "Mafia" by Dimitry Davidoff, Andrew Plotkin used the same platform to create Werewolf. It's a great group role-playing game of 7 players or more. It's easy to learn and so fun to play. With the art from Jenny Donovan. New characters fit this post apolyptical setting like the seer, the doctor or the fighter.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Kalypto
description:
Kalypto is a fast-paced easy to learn quick two player card game. With a second copy of the game, you can make a bigger deck to play with more players, but you start with seven cards instead of five.

In Kalypto, players try to eliminate each other using armies of shadows. In the box you get shadows with a strength from 1 to 10 (4 of each number), action cards like seize, extort, rise and devour (4 of each) and one very powerful candle card. To set up, shuffle the deck and deal out five cards to each player and place the deck in the center. Each player chooses at least one shadow and places it face down in front of him, this is the start of Their army. If you run out of cards in your army or hand, you lose the game. You are now ready to battle!

On your turn, you choose two actions to perform between four possibilities: you can draw a card from the deck and add it to your hand, you can summon a shadow from your hand that you add to your army, you can use a power card from your hand and place it in the discard pile or you can choose one of your shadows and an opponent shadow!
