Reveal both cards and the lowest number is sent in the discard pile. If they are the same, they are both discarded. Each action can only be done once per turn. When you've done two of these actions, your turn ends and the next player begins his turn. There are four action cards that are self explanatory: seize makes you steal one enemy shadow and add it to your army face up; Extort allows you to steal a random card from an enemy and add it to your hand; Rise allows you to draw two cards or make your opponent draw two cards (but be careful! If a player has more than seven cards in his hand, he loses!); And finally, devour allows you to choose 1 card from an enemy hand or army and discard it (which is called the pit). The candle card always matches the power of the shadow it fight, and if a player steal this card, he loses the game! If a player draws more cards than there is in the deck, he loses! Play goes like that until there is a winner.

name: Chain Reaction: Man-To-Man Combat Rules
description:
From the publisher:
Welcome to the world of Two Hour Wargames!

Chain Reaction 2015 is an introduction to Two Hour Wargames. It’s a complete game – not a teaser – and is free. Chain Reaction 2015 is a set of man-to-man combat rules that can be played in a variety of periods and with any figures you may already have.

Chain Reaction 2015, like all THW games, can be played solo, cooperatively – all players on the same side – or competitively – head to head. Inside you’ll find:

The current Reaction System, used in all Two Hour Wargames, that allows you to learn one set of mechanics to play a variety of periods.
Quick game mechanics that yield realistic shooting and melee results.
Three scenarios that can be played over and over with no two games ever being the same.
Character advancement based on your success in each game.
An easy to use Campaign system that generates your next game based on how well you’ve done.
Ways to generate your characters and your opponents – Police, Gangers, Militia, Guerillas, and Military.
All this and more…


Chain Reaction 2015 lets you to learn the current version of the Reaction System used by THW without spending a dime. While our counterpart Swordplay is about hand-to-hand combat with sword and shield, Chain Reaction 2015 is about modern firearms.

Chain Reaction 2015 gives you a chance to see if you like the Reaction System, before trying one of our period specific games. Think of Chain Reaction 2015 as a preview of our other period specific games like 5150: Star Army, All Things Zombie – Final Fade Out, and NUTS!

Chain Reaction is updated every few years in line with the new editions of Two Hour Wargames other rules. Updates so far have been published in 2018, 2020 and 2023.
categories: American West, Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Say What?
description:
Similar to Celebrities, Say What? is played in three rounds.

Say What? contains dice, a minute glass and 160 cards with four things on each card.

Before each round each team rolls a die to decide whether they have to describe celebrities, characters, works of fiction or things. They then have one minute to describe as many as possible.

In the first round, you can say anything except any part of what's on the card!

In the second round, you can only say one word!

In the third round, you can only use charades!

name: Antarctic Fleet
description:
From Technical Term Game Company.

This is a game based on the Victory Games Fleet System of tactical and operational naval warfare.

Individual named naval ships, airplane squadrons, and smaller coastal patrol combatants fight out a future 2nd Falklands War, Argentina vs Chile conflict, and other battles in the cold Southern seas.

name: Flames of War: Atlantik Wall – The German Defence of France June-September 1944
description:
This is a book which describes the forces that opposed the allied landings from 6 June 1944 to September of the same year.

You will be able to field the charismatic 21 Panzer Division with its captured equipment or attack the allied beacheads with the fanatic SS Tigers with Witmann on the lead.

This book is opposed to the one called Overlord, which covers the allied troops.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Jack O' Lantern Promo
description:
The 2015 Halloween Promo Gear card was included with the 2015 Halloween Special Pinup Twilight Knight and available only during the 2015 and 2016 Halloween weekends.

The figure itself is not part of the game.

Gear Recipe
Cost: 1x Skull, 1x Scrap, 1x Organ
Innovation Requirements: Momento Mori
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Arcade: Reinforcements – The Minelayer Sidecar
description:
An expansion for Arcade by Néstor Romeral Andrés.

Situation: We need explosives to punch through tank armour.

Solution: Deploy the minelayers.

The minelayer sidecar is a new type of ground unit that moves around the zone at high speeds and deploys powerful explosives.

name: Kusukuma
description:
The publisher of KUSUKUMA is Lycée Classique Echternach. Kusukuma is the result of a student game development class (main game idea by Charel Bintz) under the guidance of Dennis Kirps (teacher) and the help of Christian Kruchten (prototype development). The class itself was originated by professor Carmen Schares.

The objective of the game is to push the opponent off the board by cleverly pushing the Kusukuma discs, so that the final player keeps at least one Kusukuma disc of his own on the board. However, as the die determines the colour of the next move, a player might have to push his own disc(s) off the board. The question arises: “Who will be left?”

PLAY
The active player throws the die and chooses exactly one of the following three moves:

1. If one of the four colours is cast, the player has to move one of the discs corresponding to the cast colour by exactly one square horizontally or vertically (not diagonally), even if said colour does not correspond to his own!
2. If the joker is cast, the player can push any disc, his own, his opponent’s or even the joker.
3. If the blank side is cast, the player cannot make a move, and it is the next player’s turn.

END OF GAME AND WINNER
The game is over when:

there is only one disc or discs of the same colour left on the game-board. The player representing this colour wins.
there is only the joker left on the game-board. In this case everybody wins.
in a game of two or three players, there are only neutral discs left on the game-board. In this case there is no winner.

name: Storms of Shambhala
description:
~The 25th King sits atop the throne of Shambhala.
An ancient prophecy comes to fruition.
The last great battle for the Earth is finally upon us!~
Gather the shards of the Cintamani Stone and defeat
the Lord of Deception to save the Earth from destruction!

-Rally mighty heroes and train them to unlock powers-
-Gain gold to construct buildings and recruit mercenaries-
-Forge potent artifacts to enhance your heroes-
-Unleash ancient magic to destroy insidious monsters-

Create a deck using mythological creatures, each with unique abilities that will bring you to victory!

Based on ancient mythology and the post-apocalyptic prophecy of Shambhala!
New game concepts never before used in deck builders!
Features multicultural historical world artwork dating back to the early 13th century!


Contents:
• 280 Playing cards
• 120 Gold tokens
• 32 Dice
• 40 Shards
• Rulebook
• 4 Spell charts
• 1 Medium Bag


Rulebook available for download.
Windows demo available to play at http://shambhala.mythosmethod.com/
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Helvetia Cup: Tournament Box
description:
In this box, you’ll find the necessary to organize Tournament
The box contains :

A second TOTOMAT.
2 more dice D20.
A time marker.
A memo to record your score and team progress.
A normal game board. At the bottom, you’ll find a tournament desk for the Cup and Tournament. You’ll be able to write progress of the Championship on it with an easily erasable pen.
Number indicator tags, to make the numbers easier to see on the field.
1 more balls.

name: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Set: Terran Alliance vs. Dindrenzi Federation
description: Firestorm Taskforce Starter Sets are an exciting way for players to start gaming spaceship combat in the Firestorm Galaxy. Inside this set are 14x highly detailed spaceship models (2x Medium, 1 of which can be upgraded to a more powerful design using modular components) and 5x Light Frigates. Also included is a Firestorm Taskforce fast play Rulebook, 15x Dice, Token Sheet, 2x Acrylic Movement Templates and 14x Flight Stands.

name: Above Snakes
description:
Sometimes in the west justice was met at the end of a gun or the end of a rope. Not in the mysterious town of Pioneer Springs. Here there is only one punishment, being thrown off a wagon in a pine box in the middle of the desert. The sun's blistering heat and the deserts dry cracked ground greet you as you climb out of your pine box. You and the other captured lawbreakers have been dumped in the middle of nowhere with nothing but the clothes on your back. To the west is a wagon that waits for any survivors the desert deems worthy to live.
Encounter wild stampedes , cross canyons and run from coyotes that try to steal what little you have found. Explore the Boons and Dangers the desert has to offer in this competitive survival card game. Try to succeed together or alone on a trail where other lawbreakers have failed.

Can you survive being left for dead?

Each turn players get the choice of moving their thirst or hunger down on their status tracker. Then they draw a card from the deck (the deck represents you trail to safety). These cards will test you by making you roll dice to complete a task. The cards will help you by giving you useful items. Or the cards will hurt you by taking away thirst, hunger or health and you must survive the whole deck to win. Careful though, other players want to win too and only one person wins but you can't walk this trail alone...
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: The Hobbit: the Desolation of Smaug Strategy Battle Game
description:
From the publisher:

The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug provides a wealth of supplemental rules, which recreate the thrilling events of the film on the tabletop with your collection of Citadel miniatures. This 64-page, full colour, softback expansion for The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey includes:


8 brand new scenarios recreating the action-packed events in The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug.
Rules for linking your games with Thorin’s Company into a dynamic narrative.
Rules for fighting in the realm of Mirkwood, and 3 new Points Match Scenarios.
A gallery showcasing several hobbyists’ collections of Citadel miniatures, inspired by the warriors of Middle-earth and the events of the movies.
An ‘Eavy Metal masterclass of Gandalf™ the Grey.
Profiles and rules for the Good and Evil miniatures in The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Body Shop
description:
Whether you’re a mad scientist, cult leader, mechanical genius, or just someone with a God complex, pull up a chair and prepare to build a better beast. By harnessing the powers of the occult, genetics, technology, and even the forces of nature, you’ll be creating you’re own monstrosity in no time. Of course, having your own personal “Igors” to gather bio-scrap, build some spare heads, and place a few wagers couldn’t hurt either.

So jump in, grab the best parts for yourself, and get ready to pound your pals into a pulp! Victory might only cost you an arm and a leg...

Build and battle unique creatures through a combination of card drafting, worker placement, and dice fueled combat in this game of monster melee mayhem for 3-5 players!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Don't Turn Your Back: Don't Be a Wick – International Tabletop Day 2016 Promo
description:
Don't Be a Wick promo for Don't Turn Your Back from International Tabletop Day 2016

Don't Be a Wick
All players in District 13 this turn gain 3 candles for each player who played a card in District 13 this turn.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Worker Placement

name: Table Air Combat: He-111
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately. This set contains the He-111, which was used in the Battle of Britain and the remainder of World War II.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Table Air Combat: Bf-109G
description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately. This set contains the Bf-109G, the most-produced version of the German fighter.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II

name: Blood Before Richmond: Beaver Dam Creek – Battles of the Seven Days
description:
Beaver Dam Creek is the fourth game in the Blood Before Richmond series, but the first battle chronologically.

The first major engagement of the Seven Days set the precedent for the fighting that would follow. You have a small contingent of Union soldiers occupying a strong defensive position; Lee's plan calls for multiple divisions to coordinate their assaults so as to outflank and destroy the enemy; one or two divisions do all the fighting, abandoning the plan and settling for costly frontal assaults. At least this time, Stonewall Jackson shows up - sort of, anyway: having just marched from the Valley with orders to attack the Union rear, he hears the fighting and promptly sets up camp instead, because of course he does.

The fourth game in our series goes back to the beginning. Though this battle has relatively few special rules, it's very challenging. It's much harder for the johnnies to activate more than a single division at a time, while the yankees find their line stretched precariously thin...
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Emma Frost
description:
From the publisher:

Emma Frost, once a supervillain and foe of the X-Men as part of the Hellfire Club, she has evolved to becoming a superhero and after joining them is one of the X-Men's most powerful members and a leader to the superhero group and an alternative love interest to Cyclops. She is a mutant with an enormous telepathic ability, which she uses to read the minds of her opponents and communicate with her team. But she can also transform into a diamond state or form, which provides her with enhanced strength and almost indestructible durability, but suppresses her telepathic abilities.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Gambit
description:
From the publisher:

A member of the mutant hero team the X-men, Gambit has the ability to mentally create, control, and manipulate pure kinetic energy. He is also incredibly knowledgeable and skilled in card-throwing, hand-to-hand combat, and the use of a staff. Gambit is known to charge playing cards with that energy and other objects and use them as explosive projectiles.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Sabretooth
description:
Description from the publisher:

Sabretooth (born Victor Creed) is a mutant who, has a number of animal-like abilities, such as retractable claws, enhanced senses, and a regenerative healing factor. Sabretooth is a formidable hand-to-hand combatant, having been trained by the Foreigner, the C.I.A., and many others. Sabretooth is also an extraordinary hunter and tracker.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Squabble
description:
A word game played with a set of lettered tiles. The basic idea common to all versions is that a common pool of facedown tiles are turned faceup one by one and players simultaneously compete to form words using these tiles (for example by calling 'APE' if the letters 'A', P' and 'E' were available in the pool). Points are scored for forming these words, but opponents can steal words by using those tiles to make another word, either on their own (an opponent could steal 'APE' by calling 'PEA') or in combination with common tiles (if 'T' was available in the pool, an opponent could steal 'APE' by calling 'PEAT'). The game ends when no more plays are possible.

Squabble is usually played with the lettered tiles from a Scrabble or Bananagrams set.

name: Battles Before Time
description:
Battles Before Time is a prehistoric fantasy miniatures skirmish game for 28mm figures (as well as plastic dinosaurs & giant mammals that more or less fit with 28mm cavemen). The game is set in an alternate prehistory where our Human ancestors – the Early Modern Humans, or Emohs for short – rub elbows with Neanderthals, Dino sapiens (dinosaur men), Florz (small Emohs), & other species. Dinosaurs, huge mammals, & monsters also roam the Earth, & shamans can use powerful magic.

The game consists of two parts. Part One is 24 pages long; it contains the rules (the core rules are only seven pages long) as well as a guide to the cavemen & creatures that will make up your warband. Warbands include cavemen or dinosaur men who can purchase special abilities, weapons, armor, cavepunk items, & spells. Warbands can also include heroes, dinosaurs, mammals, prehistoric “birds”, aquatic beasts, & prehistoric monsters.

Part Two contains detailed instructions on how to create your warband. Players can use one of the pre-made warbands provided, or can create their own balanced warbands using a simple point build system. Part Two is 63 pages long & includes templates, more than 100 unit cards, all the tokens you’ll need (though it is strongly recommended that you purchase cheap glass beads for the simple “stone draw” system that’s used to resolve actions), a terrain placement guide, & measuring sticks. You supply the cavemen, dinosaurs, & other prehistoric figures, & we'll give you a fun excuse to play with them on a tabletop!

So, stop shaving! Stop bathing! Grab a club, and let’s rock & roll!
categories: Fantasy, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Bankers and Robbers
description:
The bankers just received a call from the police of the Greenwick District. It appears there are robbers disguised as bankers for months now and are planning to rob the bank today!Will the banker stop the robbers in time, or allow the robbers escape freely with all the hard earned money from the citizens of Greenwick District.Bankers and Robbers is a social and logical deduction card game for 5-8 players, takes up to 30 minutes of game time and is suitable for players age 14 and above.The game is split into 2 phases.

(Phase 1) Each player will be given a character card. Each player will either be playing the role of a banker or a robber.In every game there will only be 2 robbers and the remaining players will all be bankers. Each player will be assigned a number from 1-8 and will take turns taking a number token from the token bag. Each player will be able to perform 1 of 2 actions to the player shown by the number token.They can either give the player a gun card or a key card.The turn sequence continues until the the end of every third round, whereby there will be a swap action performed.Any player to receive 3 gun cards will be immediately eliminated from the game.A Robber player can choose to use 2 key cards to reveal an identity of another player holding 2 key cards.Any player can choose to use 3 key cards to take a peek at a players card of his or her choice(if the role of the chosen player differs from their own character,take a gun card).Any player can choose to use 4 key cards to reveal a chosen players card to the public.Any player to receive 5 key cards will need to immediately discard all their key cards and gun cards.

(Phase 2) Each player will need to race from the start to the end. The player who reach the end point first will win the game.Each player moves by either choosing to use a move step card or by rolling a dice. At the end of the round,only 1 player will be shot for being behind another player from the opposing team.A banker player will be eliminated by receiving 3 gun cards in phase 2 of the game.A robber player will be eliminated by receiving 6 gun cards in phase 2 of the game.Key cards will act as gun cards in phase 2 of the game.

The bankers goal in phase 1 is to eliminate all robber players before they manage to escape to phase 2 of the game,hence win the game.The robbers goal in phase 1 is to find his or her partner by performing a reveal on another player and if successful, both robber players will escape to phase 2 of the game.The bankers and robbers goal in phase 2 is to have any player from their team reach to the end point first before the opposing team or to eliminate all players from the opposing team.Whichever team completes phase 2 first will win the game.

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – Black Stone Commandos Team
description: Rapid advances in cybernetics and robotics have brought about a fundamental shift in the approach to armed conflicts, particularly in tactics and logistics. However, it was the widespread introduction of the Human Interface that triggered a true revolution. The capabilities of cyborg soldiers for endurance, reflexes or pain tolerance far exceeded those of ordinary men. The ability to digitise the consciousness of the most accomplished experts was ground-breaking. The possibility of making a backup copy, as it were, put a new light on the questions of loss of life on missions and potential PTSD. But as life had it, theory and practice went their separate ways. The proper implementation of the Human Interfaces proved highly complicated and above all costly. It also spurred the rapid development of anti-cyborg weaponry, the most lethal of which was combat software, capable of disrupting the functions of a bionic body and, in the worst case scenario, taking total control over it. For politicians and the military loss of command of own soldiers was a nightmare turned into reality. As it turned out, an acceptable one. The benefits of the new technology simply outstripped the dangers by a large margin. That is not to say no contingency was put in place, a plan B was devised, so to speak. The Black Stone Commandos unit was to be such a contingency. A regiment-sized unit for reconnaissance, assault and counter-terrorism, it is employed wherever there is a risk of encountering cyborg soldiers. Its members are fitted with HIs, but their modifications are kept to a minimum in order to lessen the vulnerability to hacking. Thorough candidate selection, drawing on the highest Special Forces standards, harrowing training, and state-of-the-art equipment make for a further edge. The BSC work in small teams, their modus operandi being lightning fast assault aimed at catching the enemy by total surprise. They are also notable for employing hackers using sophisticated combat software. Following a number of spectacular successes, despite complete secrecy, the unit came to be a trump card in political struggle. For some they are a bargaining chip, for others, a valuable asset if expendable...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – RAID44 Police Team
description: RAID 44 (Rapid Action and Investigation Detachment 44) – was formed as a response to cyborg related crime the ordinary police could not handle. Heavily armed and armored, backed by combat hackers, they are very effective in battling the cyborg crime menace. The team was formed with haste after a few spectacular failures by the police force that resulted in a high victim count. At first taking cue from military shock troops the officers were handed heavy weapons and armor. Gradually the modus operandi changed into something more sophisticated. The utilization of high mobility, combat hackers backup and specialized investigators has shorten reaction time extensively and increased operational flexibility. It was necessary to counter the exponential rise in cyborg related crime. Although covering wide range of tasks RAID 44 remains an elite formation. It is a result of a strict selection process and high equipment cost. Only the best, highly motivated and very intelligent can measure themselves with a foe that has a reaction time of machine and no compunction.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – RAID44 Lt. Justine Clevel
description:
I’m writing to you in hopes that you will reconsider your behavior. You know I always have and will continue to support you, but let me speak my mind on your life’s choices. I didn’t protest when you entered the academy. I didn’t speak up when you chose to have cyberimplants to enroll at the unit whose name you forbade me from uttering. But I implore you, think this through. Your job is dangerous, of that I am aware. I also know you always strive to be the best in what you do, you’ve been like that since elementary. However this time, the price is simply too high.

I can’t tell whether you do this out of ambition or sense of duty, but please reconsider. Would you really renounce your flesh and all that comes with it? For me, as your father, it’s a terrible blow. Will you be the same person afterwards? The anxiety. I have just by thinking about it numbs me.

From a letter found in Lt. Justine Clevel’s private quarters during the RAID 44 verification procedure sanctioned by the Governor.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – Sylvia 'Dummy' Alvarez
description:
Independent mercenary hacker

Dear pack of corporate hyenas.

I’ve had it with you. After seven years of working for your greedy-ass corporation, I’m through! You’ve raked in millions off my code done for the peanuts you paid me. No extras ever, constant all-nighters, and interminable meetings that went nowhere. Add sexist jokes by both male and female directors for good measure. I’ve hit my head on the glass ceiling one too many times! It was me who built up the backbone of the protection system, it was my work that served as the basis for every product for three whole years. It was me who sniffed out and prevented dozens of illegal entries to our network. And what do I have to show for it? Employee of the month prize. A weekend at a spa. Those morons at the Human Resources are out of their frigging minds. As is that dumbass, my boss.

Now I’ll take what you’ve denied me all these years. Courses, upgrades, latest tech weren’t for me. I figure you’ve already found out about the budget database break-in and the large sum that’s evaporated from the representation fund. Yes, that was me. I did design the system, after all. I’m no thief, I’m just claiming what’s rightfully mine. Don’t go out looking for me. The full cyberbody I ordered is waiting for me. Finally, an end to this organic crap I was trapped in. There’s no way you can find me. But if you were to try, let me just say that half a year back I set up microcams in recreational rooms for managers on floor 27. Fun stuff. A tasty scoop for a couple infochannels, for sure.

I hereby terminate my contract with immediate effect. Bite me!

Sylvia Alvarez.

Sylvia Alvarez’s contract “termination”, found during investigation into the sex scandal at the Vello Mekanik Corporation
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Aflakló
description:
User summary:

In Aflakló the goal is to be the wealthiest player when the market cards deck is depleted. Players roll a die to move around Iceland and depending on the spaces they land on they can buy fish plants, go fishing, draw event cards or sell their catch. Event cards are played immediately, but players also have action cards which can be used when needed, usually to wreck havoc amongst the other players. When players buy fish plants (or land on existing ones) they can go fishing, and then sell their catch later. The price depends on the market cards in the center of the board which are changed when players cross the starting space.

Description from the publisher:
Aflakló is a revolutionary new Icelandic board game where players compete to expand their fisheries empires by sailing around Iceland, catching and selling fish and taunting each other. On every corner danger is near, in the form of changing government, Norwegian fishermen and Greenpeace. Players have to have steel nerves to withstand the pressures and have a chance to win.

name: EOD: Explosive Ordnance Disposal
description:
Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) is a cooperative board game for 6 players.

These days, terrorism has grown rampant causing great loss of lives and destruction of property. Terrorist organization “HIJACK” led by its mastermind "Jack" directs its target at Hong Kong, with a plan to deploy bomb attacks at densely populated areas (eg. schools, markets, hospitals and cultural centers) and strike fear among citizens.

Several years ago, the EOD Unit was infiltrated by a mole from “HIJACK” to steal intelligence and disrupt the order of the police force. EOD unit must fight against this threat by finding out the mole and defusing all bombs.

Who is the mole hidden in EOD? Where are the bombs? How to defuse the bombs safely? This game will bombard you with a series of questions while surrounding you in an air of suspense.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Fancy Animals
description:
Fancy Animals is a rummy-type card game where players choose one of four fancy animal portrait boards and use the material cards to make runs in order to acquire fancy clothing items.

On every turn players will either take a card from the draw deck or play cards from their hand to the table. They can make runs entirely from their own hand OR by creatively rearranging cards that others have already played. With each card being able to be played two different ways, players who are best at creatively out-thinking their opponents are sure to acquire the fanciest clothing!

If a player is able to make a run with the correct number of cards in the correct suite that player may take a piece of fancy clothing (corresponding to the run that was just made) and place it by the portrait board. Players will also be able to activate special cards that unlock the ability to break the rules in specific ways.

Different clothing types are worth different points and each animal has a specific clothing type they will receive bonus points for.

Once one animal has all four sides of its portrait filled with clothing all other players have one more turn before the game ends.

The animal with the most points wins!

If you like games like Rummikub you'll love Fancy Animals!

name: Dicey Goblins: Festive Choice Token
description:
Promo first available from Santa's Renegades.

When setting up, replace one of the regular goblin choice tokens with this token.

name: Epic Resort: Upgrade Kit
description:
The upgrade kit is for those with the first edition of Epic Resort to bring it up to speed with all the changes included in the second edition

It was originally offered in the Epic Resort: Villain's Vacation Kickstarter campaign. The upgrade kit was contained in the expansion box for those that backed at that level. There was a UPC sticker on the bottom of the box indicating it included the upgrade kit

The upgrade kit will be available from the publisher

Includes:
Workers - Bouncer (4), Journeyman (4), Squire (4), Versatilist (4)

Heroes - Ranger (2), Rogue (2)

Attractions - Tiki Hut (4), Dragonflame Tub (2), Timberline Trail (2), Street Parade (2), Gallery of Conquests (2), Canopy Zipline (2), Razorback Roast (2), Island Regata (2), Twilight Masquerade (2), Slaughter Coaster (2)

Other - Harbormaster Card (1), Attack! Cards (2), Monster Cards (30)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Traitor Mechanic: The Traitor Mechanic Game – Alien Spacecraft
description:
A single job card for Traitor Mechanic, shuffle into the Job deck at game start.

Originally a promo item included for backers of the Meta Games II Kickstarter
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Death Armor Expansion
description:
Can you manage to craft it in time to face to Gold Smoke Knight at the end of your campaign?

Made from the bones of only the greatest monsters, the Death Armor is worthy of making it your not-so-secret goal. Even better than just surviving!

Put a Bone Eater in one of these and watch things get nuts!

Requires pretty much all of your settlement bones to craft.

Contains:
2 x Death Armor Narrative sculpts
1 x Settlement Location
1 x 6 Page Rulebook
25 x Gear Cards
...and more!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Soldier Ball
description:
Soldier Ball is a tabletop skill and strategy game that can be learned in 60 seconds and enjoyed for hours.

How to Play:

Two dice are rolled to determine the number of soldiers and barricades for the game. Players are then allowed 2 minutes to arrange their home base as they choose using the determined number of soldiers and barricades. Players then take turns rolling the battle ball into the opposing army in an attempt to knock soldiers down. When a soldier is knocked down, it is removed from play. The player with the last soldier standing wins the game.

name: STOIKHEIA (ストイケイア)
description:
User summary
ストイケイア (STOIKHEIA) is a worker placement card game for two players with extended reproduction mechanism.

In this game, players are wizards who collect elements to create staves which grant you efficiency to collect more elements. But their capacity to store elements is limited, so they should increase the capacity by collecting vials.

Nine action cards are placed on the table in 3 x 3 grid. Each turn, you place your familiar on one of these action cards to perform an action, such as collecting or converting elements, gain victory points, create a staff, etc. When three familiars are placed in a row, you collect a vial and a special effect is activated.

At the end of the game, count victory points earned through taking actions and creating staves. The higher scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
「ストイケイア」は２人専用の拡大再生産型ワーカープレイスメントゲームです。
プレイヤーは魔法使いとなり、エレメントを集め、杖を生成します。
杖を生成すれば、１度により多くのエレメントを入手できるようになります。
しかし、持てるエレメントには上限があります。上限を増やすには、瓶を入手しなければなりません。

手番では、３×３に並べられたアクションカードに使い魔コマを置いてアクションを実行します。
使い魔コマを縦か横に３つ揃えると、瓶を入手し、さらに特殊なイベントが発動します。

アクションで得た得点と、杖による得点がより多いプレイヤーの勝利です。

name: Dorahuto Sengoku Daimyou (ドラフト戦国大名)
description:
User summary
ドラフト戦国大名 (Dorahuto Sengoku Daimyou) in English is 'Draft Sengoku Daimyo'. It is a historic strategy game, based on geopolitical simulation games like A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition) and the Japanese game Feudal Lord. Pulling in the trends of modern wargames, it lightens the gameplay by using a card driven system and card drafting.

Players become one of the feudal lords (Sengoku Daimyo) and struggle to dominate the country by employing warlords (Bushou). Players must also develop their land and expand territories.

The game is played over four rounds, each consisting of six phases. The player with the most Victory Points at the end wins.

Whilst the gameplay itself is straightforward, the large amount of Japanese text on the cards and game board may make the game difficult for non-readers.

Publisher's summary
『戦国大名』『ゲーム・オブ・スローンズ』などに代表される地政学シミュレーションゲームをベースにしつつ、近年のウォーゲームでお馴染みのカードドリブンシステムとドラフトシステムを取り入れ、プレイ感をライトにした歴史ストラテジ－ゲームです。

プレイヤーは有力な戦国大名の一人となって、武将を召し抱え、国を発展させ、領地を拡大して天下に覇を唱えることを目指します。

１回のプレイは６つのフェイズからなる全４ラウンドで構成されており、ゲーム終了時に最も多くの勝利点を獲得していたプレイヤーが勝者となります。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Area Around Fleet
description: A stand alone game featuring modern air-sea-land combat in the Mediterranean and Caspian Seas. Based on Victory Games Fleet system from the 1980's and 1990's, this game updates the forces for modern combat
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: DC Universe Miniature Game: Sinestro
description: This expansion to the DC Universe Miniature Game introduces Sinestro to the game. This white metal kit comes ready to assemble and paint.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: FourCuatro
description:
The Gateway to Card Gaming: FourCuatro is a 2-player competitive card game for teens and adults.
You cast spells to defeat your opponent and use defensive traps to counter their spells against you. There are multiple paths to victory.

The game includes complex decision making and layers of thinking, especially if you play the “draft” or “constructed” formats.

To play the basic format, you must shuffle the 66 card deck and pass out 33 to each player. Revealing the bottom card will show who goes first. On your turn, you cast a spell, and your opponent may or may not try to block it with a trap. Spells are placed based on mana energy available to the players. A player loses the game when they must draw a card, but they cannot. The complete instructions (including constructed format instructions) are found in the deck or on the website.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Panzer Grenadier: Imperial Marines
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

In this world where Woodrow Wilson negotiated an end to the First Great War in late 1916 and the great empires survived for another generation, Germany continues to rule northeastern New Guinea and has built a profitable colony there. Australian troops are pressing up the Kokoda Track across the Bismarck Mountains to capture the colony. The tough 1st Seebataillon of long-service Marines has climbed the trail to stop them.

The Dog Days 2016 Golden Journal comes with 24 new laser-cut and mounted Panzer Grenadier playing pieces representing the battalion: leaders, marines, machine-gunners, heavy weapons, artillery, a helicopter and an elephant. What game has ever given you a helicopter and an elephant?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: 5150: No Quarter – Mecha Combat
description:
5150: No Quarter - Mecha Combat
What: Mech specific Sci Fi military combat.
Scale: Mech on Mech combat. 1 model equals 1 Mech.
Your Role: Players can command from one Mech up to ten or more.
Playability: Designed for solo, same side and head to head play.

5150: No Quarter can be played in a variety of ways:
You can play as a Mech Pilot with one Mech.
You can play as a Team Leader with 3 Mechs.
You can play as a Squad Leader with 6 Mechs.
You can even play as a Company Commander with 24 Mechs.
You can play one-off battles.
You can play a full campaign with up to ten scenarios.

The bottom line is you can play it any way you like, with any models or counters you like.

Inside you’ll find:
Rules for Mech to Mech combat with stats and covering 5 different Races and Factions.
Ten Linked scenarios that form a pre-generated Campaign for you to play.
Fully compatible with Start Army and other 5150 games.
A minimal bookkeeping Campaign System that gives meaning to every game as the results of one will affect the outcome of the next.

name: Yugo
description:
IntroductionYugo is a finite territory game for two players: Black and White. It's played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board.

Each player must have access to a sufficient number of pieces of their own color. There are two types of pieces: pawns and kings. There's also one special token called button.



DefinitionsA player's group is a set of one or more orthogonally contiguous pieces of that player's color. Pawns and kings can be part of the same group. A portion of a larger group is not a group.

A liberty of a group is an empty point orthogonally adjacent to that group. A group without liberties is said to be surrounded.

A territory is a set of orthogonally contiguous empty points. A portion of a larger territory is not a territory. You own a territory if at least one point in it is adjacent to one of your pieces and no points in it are adjacent to any enemy pieces.



PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On their turn, a player must perform exactly one of the following actions:

a) Take the button, provided that none of the players has taken it before.

b) Pass, provided that the button is already taken.

c) Place a pawn of their color on an empty point such that the number of surrounded groups remains unchanged.

d) Place a king of their color on an empty point such that the number of surrounded enemy groups is increased, and remove all pawns from all such groups. In the resulting position, if there are any surrounded friendly groups, remove all pawns from them as well.

Play stops when both players pass consecutively. At this point, the players may agree which groups, if any, can be removed from the board without changing the scores that would result from continuing the game. If there is such an agreement, the agreed groups are removed, the game ends and the resulting position is used for scoring. If the players don't agree which groups should be removed, play is resumed. In this case, when both players pass consecutively again, the game ends and the current position, without further removals, is used for scoring.

A player's score is the number of empty points in their territories, plus the number of pieces of their color in groups with one or more liberties, plus the number of enemy kings in groups without liberties, plus half a point if they have taken the button, plus the value of komi (see below) in the case of White.

The player with the higher score wins the game.



KomiThe komi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides.



NotesYugo is a Go variant inspired by Mark Steere's Redstone.

Online Play


igGameCenter (real-time)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Enclosure, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Galactic Payload
description:
Description from the designer:

The goal of Galactic Payload is to be the first to colonize your home planet.

The players accomplish this by trading the resources their home planet produces with trading outposts spread out through six separate sectors across the galaxy. The trade conditions dynamically change every turn for every sector. Players may also spend resources to upgrade their ship and to build mining outposts that passively collect more resources every turn.

Every ship produces 'Powercubes' on every turn. These 'Powercubes' are then spent to move across the galaxy and then allocated to the players ship systems such as Shields, Weapons or Thrusters. These are used to protect the player from hazards such as Pirates and other players.

First player to return six units of each resource that their home planet does not produce wins the game.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Trading

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Bird of Bifröst Promo Card
description:
A promotional card offered by the "Toucan Play That Game - Season 2 Kickstarter".

This hero from Odin's Path costs 1 beer and 3 gold. When played, it gives you 1 victory point.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Beer Empire: Addon 2
description:
1 new type of beer
1 new character
2 new tiles
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Tanks: Tiger Tank Expansion
description:
Heavily armoured and mounting the massive 8.8cm gun the Tiger was something to be feared as no Allied tank could stand in its way. The appearance of the Tiger forced the Allies to return to the drawing boards and find new solutions to counter this heavy hitter.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Tiger tank
1x Tiger tank card
2x Hero card
1x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Pharaos Gruft – Four Game Boards
description: As you might guess from the title, Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Four Game Boards consists of four new game boards for use with the Das Labyrinth des Pharao base game.

name: Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 7
description:
Pathfinder Battles: Iconic Heroes Set 7 includes five all-new miniatures featuring legendary characters from the Pathfinder role-playing universe: Erasmus, Yoon, Mavaro, Estra, and a phantom!

Characters featured in this set list include:


Erasmus, human medium
Yoon, human kineticist
Mavaro, human occultist
Estra, human spiritualist
Honaire, phantom
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Panzer Witch
description:
This game is based on Izetta: The Last Witch, a Japanese anime television series.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Izetta:_The_Last_Witch
The game is an air fight between Izetta and Germanian air force.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame, World War II

name: Cry Havoc: Essen 2017 Promo
description:
Was given out with every buy of Cry Havoc at the Portal Games booth in Essen 2017.
It adds 3 new exploration tokens.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Watcher: The Baby Dragons Expansion
description:
The Baby Dragons expansion adds baby dragons to join the fun and add a new level of gameplay. There are two baby dragons included for each element.

Earth: Rock Wyrm and Moss Dragon
Air: Luck Dragon and Rainbow Wyvern
Fire: Lava Drake and Cooking Crumbler
Water: River Drake and Lake Serpent
Mystery: Ink Gremlin and Bone Speaker
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Manhattan: Promo Cards Mini-Expansion
description:
This small expansion consists of 10 cards as is for the game Manhattan (1994). An 11th card contains the rules of the game.

These cards are shuffled, placed face down, and the top card is drawn at the start of each round. They result in an additional fourth step in the scoring at the end of each round. Points will be awarded based on the conditions listed for each card.

Here are some sample cards:
FOUNDER - each player scores one point for each building he started, but doesn't own any more.

VILLA - each 1 story building with at least one empty adjacent space scores one point

FAKE NEWS - There is no extra scoring for this card. However, when scoring is about to begin, the next scoring card is revealed and that new card will be the scoring card for that round.

These cards are standard Euro mini-size.
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Hans im Glück

name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Husum
description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Ski the Mountain Card Game
description:
Ski the Mountain is simple to learn, fun to play and can be enjoyed by families and experienced gamers alike. An exciting game that will give you a ski fix without leaving your sofa.

Ski the Mountain is a highly competitive card game for up to 4 players, perfect for après ski. Players collect runs attempting to be the first to ski various combinations or visit mountain restaurants. Watch out though there are lots of obstacles and distractions that can heed or hinder your progress.

Game contains over 100 cards of 7 different type, with photographic illustrations of skiing and mountains.

The aim of the game is to maximize the points scored by collecting ski runs. Each turn players can take a piste cards. These represent blue, red or black ski runs and in combination or alone allow players to take a run card. Using these cards players collect ski runs that are shown on the piste map. Collecting the right combination of ski runs maximizes the points players score.

Points are scored by:
1. Using piste cards, players take a run card, each run has a varying score.
2. Across the piste map there are targets to reach, these are illustrated cards of mountain restaurants or skiing features. By collecting the right run card these targets can be completed to add to players point totals.
3. Each player has a Grand Tour card that accumulate points as specific runs are collected.
4. There are also combined special runs on the piste map, that players race to complete. The add varying amounts to players point totals
5. Finally there are the highly prized Bonus cards that add points for being the first to collect 3 or 4 blue, red or black runs or visit mountain restaurants.

During the game players will also be given Event cards. These cards depict skiing related events that give player advantages or can stop your opponent. Either way they add lots of fun to the game.

The game is fast and highly competitive with lots of laughter as players block or hinder each other, as they race to Ski the Mountain.

name: Wings of War: World War 2 – Hawker Hurricane
description:
Take your Wings of War game into the third dimension! Each historically-accurate, fully-painted miniature represents an aircraft from Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II. All miniatures come complete with maneuver deck and variable-altitude stand.

This British single-seat fighter aircraft earned renown during the Battle of Britain

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Quaterni Lapilli
description:
Year 700 A.U.C. (53 A.C.). The Roman Republic, strong under the lead of Caius Julius, is waging war over Gaul. His personal power is ever increasing, shaking the very foundation of the Republic, while Senators tremble in fear.
This is the time in which great men can show their value and fools their weakness.
But that is the front line, not here. You are somewhere away from glorious battles and sieges, reckless attacks and everything good that life can give to a soldier of Rome. Here, stranded in namely captured and loyal lands. Captured, but flow of supplies is not as safe as expected. Loyal, but tax collection is resisted. Your job is ensuring someone else can show off with well-fed, well-equipped and well-paid soldiers. At least for now.
Your long-time rival has recently arrived here, tasked with your same mission. A weak man may see a threat, but a strong man sees a chance. Prove your tactical prowess and bravery. Make a fool of him, running around chasing his tail. It’s time to outwit him and show your worth to the future Imperator. Get the promotion you deserve, strive for glory.

Quaterni Lapilli is a strategy game about tactical control of resources during Gallic Wars. The players are low-ranked army leaders, trying to outshine each other to get a field promotion. Using double sided and ever shifting tactic cards, they must seek control of supplies lines by deploying their soldiers where needed while keeping barbarians in check.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Le Shogi
description:
A small shogi variant on a 4x6 grid. Each player has exactly one of each type of piece from standard shogi (one pawn, one knight, one lance, one silver, one gold, one bishop, one rook, one king), conveniently for beginners learning the moves of shogi pieces.

Pieces that reach the back two ranks of the board promote as in shogi, and captured pieces can be dropped back onto the board as one's own. The object of the game is to either get the king to the promotion zone, or capture the opponent's king.

name: Disaster at D-Day
description:
Disaster at D-Day is a scenario for use as a variant for Mark Simonitch's Normandy '44 wargame (GMT).
It is based on Peter Tsouras' book: "Disaster at D-Day: the Germans Defeat the Allies, June 1944".

Contains 46 counters from the C3i #31 countersheet.


It is published in C3i magazine #31, 2017.

name: ATS: Leatherneck II
description:
The second in a three module suite for use with the Advanced Tobruk System, depicting small-unit actions in the Pacific Theater during WWII.

Leatherneck II expands Leatherneck I with four additional maps and eight new scenarios and requires ownership of Leatherneck I.

Gamers must also own the ATS System Rules and playaids to make use of these products.

name: Smash Molécula
description:
Smash Molécula is a card game in which chemical elements battle for supremacy. Each player holds three element cards at the beginning of a turn. Each element has a special power when you play it, such as drawing more cards or stealing cards from others. The cards have positive or negative values, and if you can play several cards with a sum of 0, you can draw a molecule card that will score points. Molecules, however, can also react to other molecules, so that your points aren't safe.
The first player to reach 10 points wins the game.

name: Time Arena: Kamikawaii
description:
Time Arena: Kamikawaii is an expansion set for Time Arena that contains four new characters. They may look harmless, but don't be fooled! The Kamikawaii Clan allows you to enrich your attack strategies by combining speed with brute force. Who cares about defense when your opponents don't have time to hit?

—description from publisher

name: Salvat Trivial Rock
description:
The Salvat Trivial Rock is a game based on questions and answers around the world of rock. It is played with a board on which some pieces move, similar to chess pawns, which we will call "receivers"; On each receiver, one per player, other pieces that we will call "gold discs" are inserted.

Players will move their receivers across the board using a die and as they respond correctly to the questions on the cards.

The first objective is to conquer six gold discs. Once this goal is achieved, the assault on the final objective can be attempted: the conquest of a "platinum disc".

The player who wins the "platinum disc" wins the game.

name: Expansion or Extinction
description:
Expansion or Extinction takes 2 to 4 players into a future where Sol, after colonizing many of the closest stars, succumbed to internal pressures and died in a fiery holocaust of future weaponry. Now earth’s colonies are recovering, and beginning to exert their own dominance on the stars around them. Based on the award-winning Triumph and Tragedy game system, Expansion or Extinction expands upon this proven and highly popular game system.

Expansion or Extinction begins as each of the player’s star systems have rediscovered the technologies which make space travel possible again. Players must explore the systems around them, and attempt to bring them into their sphere of influence. This can occur either peaceably through the play of Action Cards, or through military conquest.

There are three types of star systems in Expansion or Extinction. Those closest to SOL: the Core Worlds. These worlds have been settled the longest, and thus tend to have the highest population, but have consumed most of their resources. Those furthest out: the Outer Rim worlds, which were settled just before SOL’s fall. These tend to have low population but high resources. And between those extremes are the Green Worlds…where the players start, here there is a good balance of population and resources. But beware, these worlds are on the cusp of challenging for dominance on their own, and have the fleets to make their conquest a hard fought struggle!

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Ruby Roundup!
description:
Set in the Wild West gold rush era, Ruby Roundup! is a frantic race to grab as much treasure as you can while manipulating, denying, and stealing treasure from everyone else!

Game Play: A win condition is revealed - showing which treasures the players need to collect to win. Then the players each choose one of the two character cards handed to them to play with and return the other to the box. Then "claim cards" depicting treasures are placed on the board and the players take turns secretly playing cards on them in order to boost, trap, or manipulate them. Then each player takes a turn placing one of their special markers on the claim they want "locking" it away from other players, and when that is done all players reveal and resolve all hidden cards and gain their treasure. Each round new claim cards are revealed and played on until someone wins.

Game is fun, fast, and simple, - strategy comes down to an abundance of moves and choices - not just yours, but those your opponents can make, forcing you to always keep other player's potential moves in mind while optimizing your treasure gain.

—description from the publisher

name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Human Team Booster
description:
Human players are the best all-round Blood Bowl players in the Old World. They may lack the sheer strength of the Orcs, the agility of the High Elves, the toughness of the Dwarfs, the frenzy of the Dark Elves, or the speed of the Skaven, but they do not suffer any of these players’ weaknesses either. It is hardly surprising then that humans account for over 50% of all Blood Bowl players – so long as you include Skeletons, Ghouls and Vampires playing for Undead teams, and mutants playing for Chaos teams!

Expand, enhance, fill out and indeed boost your Human team with this booster pack! It contains 4 resin miniatures – 2 Blitzers, a Thrower and a Catcher – each covered in detail and posed dynamically, with all the heroic jawlines and manly stares you would expect from these glorious sportsmen…

These 4 resin miniatures come as 14 components, and are supplied with 4 32mm Blood Bowl bases. Human team rules can be found in Death Zone Season 1.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports

name: Pixel Glory: Light & Shadow – Sneaky Wizards Expansion
description:
A 4-player expansion for the co-op mode in Pixel Glory: Light and Shadow.

Sneaky Wizards adds a new Hidden Identity game mode where players have hidden objectives - some are even working for the Dungeon lord! Players earn fame for completing their objectives, and for successfully guessing what the other players roles are.

How to play: Each player gets a random role card. Each role has a secret objective(s). Players earn fame (victory point) for completing their hidden objectives - not from killing monsters.

At the end of the game, players guess what role each other player was (on paper). For each successful guess, they earn 1 additional fame.

Roles:

The Hoarder (Good Role)
End the game with at least 3 combo points - 1 Fame.
Survive the dungeon - 2 Fame.

The Nimble (Good Role)
End the game with the most health remaining - 1 Fame.
Survive the dungeon - 2 Fame.

The Proud (Good Role)
End the game without defeating a 1 fame monster - 1 Fame.
Survive the dungeon - 2 Fame.

The Traitor (2x, Evil Role)
The wizards are defeated - 3 Fame.

The Mercenary (Neutral Role)
Survive the dungeon, or be the last player remaining - 1 Fame.
End the game with the most fame from defeated monsters - 1 Fame.
End the game without healing any other player - 1 Fame.


Contains 10 Cards: 6 Role Cards and 4 Reference Cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Pokémon TCG: Rock Steady Theme Deck
description:
The Rock Steady Theme Deck is from the Burning Shadows expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, but also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Fighting and Psychic type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Midday Form Lycanroc.

Like other Theme Decks, Rock Steady includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Lycanroc deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: BATTALIA NCBC: Krampling vs Oracle Knight
description:
Battalia is the perfect land to live on with its beautiful nature on the surface... but down there, deep underground rules the Blight and Kramplings are dwelling in the tunnels. Now they want to crawl out from their forsaken wells, spoil the Stormgates and taint the vicinity. All living creatures and plants shall die or become weaker... All movements in their range will be harder and the worst part is - they fear no ordinary hero, but only the Oracle Knights....

... Only a few of them left during the years - not every man is able to bear this burden. Their life is not their own, their cause is the eternal pledge - they are the noble order of the Oracle Knights. Only they posses the secret formula, the power of the ancient spell, which heals the corruption and frightens the Kramplings to death. Their weapons were forged with a magic adjuration able to overcome the aura of the beasts and to destroy them... Eternal secret since the dawn of time...


NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basically competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replay ability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: ふるキャン△ (Furu-camp)
description:
A camping-themed dice-based "first to the mill" game by Kuro. Each round a camping site is drawn, that specifies which die results will give points. Players start each round with one camp member who has a special ability to affect the die roll, Each turn, players either choose to try to go camping (roll the dice and hope for good result), OR pick another camping member with another special ability.

Each camping site has several conditions for points, but most give more points for the first person to fulfill, and less points for the runners-up.

User summary

name: Intelle: Firewall
description:
An expansion to the game Intelle that allows players to play solo. The expansion adds a deck of cards, firewall cubes and an additional meeple, and all will fit in the original box! Solo play time is under 10 minutes.

—description from the designer

name: #SocialStar
description:
In #SocialStar, players climb the social media ladder to become the first player to gain 40M followers! Players perform challenges ranging from acting, art, dance, list, and singing. If they succeed they gain likes and followers. If they don't like a challenge, they can always dump it for a dare. Complete the dare and the player gains followers; fail and lose followers! Do you have the talent, or do you just know how to play the game?

description from the publisher
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Push Your Luck, Singing

name: Warfighter: Expansion #30 – Canada #1
description:
The Canada #1 expansion gives you Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Canada. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


8 Player Soldiers
6 Non-Player Soldiers
6 Squad Soldiers
14 Weapons
6 Equipment
9 Skills
7 Actions


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Warfighter: Expansion #31 – Canada #2
description:
The Canada #2 expansion gives you more Player Soldiers, Non-Player Soldiers, and Squad Soldiers from Canada. This expansion offers 56 cards including:


7 Player Soldiers
5 Non-Player Soldiers
5 Squad Soldiers
15 Weapons
4 Equipment
10 Skills
9 Actions
1 Location Marker


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Miremarsh: Kickstarter Exclusives
description:
Includes:
Coiling Python - Wandering Monster miniature and card
Toad Chef - Wandering Monster miniature and card
Fenlord - Wandering Monster miniature, card and four Courts Quest tiles
Monsters - box with 11 Wandering Monsters miniatures and cards
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement, Trading

name: The Curse of Dead Man's Hand
description:
There's an evil moving through the land, a curse. Communities large and small alike are being destroyed. Towns are being torn apart, people are being killed, and worse.

Each player plays chooses figures for an certain value of points. The winner is the last man standing, or who gains the objective.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame, Zombies

name: Folklore: The Affliction – Faery Wisp Promo Card
description:
This promo card adds a new animal companion to the game.

"+1 Search, acts as a light source. Exhaust to teleport up to spaces.
Animal (ranged)"

The card ID is C0#FX04
The promo card was available at Spiel 2018 in Essen.

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Virus!: Ladrón de Cerebros
description:
Promo print & play card released by Virus! designers.

Celebrate Halloween playing Virus!

Steal a BLUE organ (brain), from any player, even if it is immunized.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Print & Play
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Halbeard Promo Card
description:
A promo card exclusive to the Mutants Kickstarter Campaign. Also, included in the Mutants 'Deep Freeze' expansion which is available on the Lucky Duck online store.

Divine Favor
Hero
4 power + Draw a card. If it is a Unit, keep it in your hand. Otherwise, discard the card.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Mythology, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Route to India
description:
It’s spring 1530. More than 30 years have passed since Vasco da Gama found the sea route to India around Africa. By order of the King of Portugal, you embark on a mysterious journey following the famous explorer’s trail. If you want to win the monarch’s admiration and his favour, you must visit as many overseas ports as you can, bringing home the most valuable cargo. There’s only one problem. Some goods go bad really rapidly. This is why you have to store them appropriately in your ship’s cargo hold, to make sure most of them stay fresh when they reach the port back in Lisbon. Time to set sail. May the best servant of the King win!

Route to India is a family friendly game (which also has an advanced version of the rules) for 2-4 players in which the participants embark on a journey to India and back. The gameplay is divided into two phases, composed of a number of turns which the players take. In the first phase your ships leave from the port of Rastello. Sailing along, you will be moving your ships to the selected ports or colonies (different types of spaces on the board), purchasing goods for doubloons and placing them in the cargo holds (player boards). During your turn you can take move and trade actions, and each cargo tile you obtain is worth a specific number of points at the end of the game. The last ship that arrives at the port in India starts the second phase, beginning the journey back (with new goods available). The game goes on until all the players’ ships reach Rastello again, then you count the points and the player with the highest score is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Crazy Volley
description:
In Crazy Volley, you take control of a Volley team along one match. In the game, you have to sign Volley players to try to win the Volley match against other team.

The game is divided in turns: the first team that reach to win seven turns, scoring a point, win the game.
The game is composed by three kind of card:
Players, Who will be placed in field to play the match, doing their actions when the ball arrive in their field.
Referee, who can influence a turn.
Wtf card, that can change EVERYTHING!!!

But... in crazy Volley nothing is like it seems. In fact you can win the game also KILLING the players in other field...

—description from the designer

name: Les sortilèges de Goon
description:
Party game in which a group of players secretely pick a spell, which influences the way they can answer questions from the one player trying to guess what spell they have picked. By asking up to 3 rounds of questions, deduction is used to find out the mysterious spell.

—user summary

name: Cannae-Lite: The Battles of Herdonia, 212 and 210 BC
description:
The Battles of Herdonia, 212 & 210 BC, is GMT's Battle Scenario for SPQR, published in RBM's C3i Magazine Nr. 20.

After Cannae, most Roman generals accepted the wisdom of Fabius the 'Delayor'; against Hannibal, discretion was definitely the better part of valor. Fortunately for the historical wargaming community, two generals were foolish enough to accept Hannibal's challenge, both names Fulvius, and both on the field before Herdonia. As had occured at Cannae, both these armies were also envelopped and annihilated. Unlike Cannae, at the Herdonia battles Rome fielded only two, not eight, legions. So here is an opportunity to fight Cannae-Lite, two classic battles of envelopment, scaled down to one-quarter of Cannae's monumental size.

Contents:

Herdonia Setup Card.
21 new counters.


Expansion module for the Great Battles of History (GBoH) series game SPQR.

—description from the publisher

name: トマトラキュラ (Tomatorakyura)
description:
User summary
トマトラキュラ (Tomatorakyura) is a Japanese worker placement game with repuatation as a heavy Euro belying its cute theme and graphic design. The action plotting mechanic is drawing attention as possibly unique. The game title is a pun on the name Dracula; the publisher suggests 'Tomato-la-cula' but 'Tomatracula' is a closer match.

The publisher says:
Theme: In Dracula’s world, tomato juice is a huge hit! Players take the roles of Dracula’s minions vying to create the most delicious tomato juice before the banquet at the end of the game’s five rounds.

System: “Shift - Work - Plotting” At the beginning of each round players use the tiles representing the minions’ powers to plot which actions they will take and at what level of power they will take them.

Win condition: There are two scoring rounds and points are earned for the ripeness (number) and brand (color) showing on your tomato dice, card effects, and progress along the game track.

Publisher's summary
【テーマ】ドラキュラ界ではトマトジュースが大ブーム。
プレイヤーはあるドラキュラの使い魔となり、週末（5ラウンド後）の晩餐会で一番おいしいトマトジュースを作ることを目指します。
【システム】使い魔パワーと呼ばれる5つのコマをラウンドの最初に、どのアクションをどの強さで行うかプロットする、シフト・ワーク・プロッティング。
【勝利条件】決算は2回あり、それぞれトマト（サイコロ）の完熟度（出目）やブランド（色）、カード効果やトラックの進み具合で得点が入ります。
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Stock Holding, Worker Placement

name: Shadows of the Academy
description:
Shadows of the Academy is a cooperative card game designed for students in grades 4-7. Created as part of Alberta Health's tobacco prevention curriculum, the game has players take the roles of students in a mysterious academy, trying to defeat dastardly villains while keeping their friends safe. The students all have two unique ability cards that may be played once during the game.

Players win when they defeat 5 villains, but they lose if any player is unable to draw at the beginning of their turn, or if the deck of cards is depleted before all 5 villains are defeated.

Players may play cards from their hand to heal themselves or their peers, or to weaken villains. Harm cards lower hand size, so keeping an eye on each other is an integral part of the gameplay, as cards drawn at the end of a round could be helpful, they could be harmful, or they could be another villain to fight!

-description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Legion Atlantica
description:
Legion Atlantica is a Strategic level two player board-wargame set in an alternative history second century CE in which the Roman Empire discovered the New World 1300 years before Columbus. Game turns represent months, hexes are roughly twenty miles across and Strength Points correspond to approximately 500 men. The player who controls their opponent’s capital first or the player with the largest number of city points at the end of the game is the winner.

The Roman Player controls the Invading Roman forces attempting to establish “New Rome” and extend their control over nearby Mesoamerican city states. The Tikal player controls the principle Maya kingdom trying to stop them. Both sides may attempt to conquer or win the allegiance of other Mesoamerican city states that start the game neutral, these include small independent city states as well as larger regional powers.

The game features Leaders who command armies but are also needed to conduct negotiations. Roman fleets and Mesoamerican canoe transports, low levels of transatlantic Roman reinforcements, cities that can be fortified, pillaged or destroyed, slave workers, supply and attrition, cavalry (Roman player only) and human sacrifice (Tikal player only).

By necessity almost all of the forces and characters represented are fictional, however the map is a realistic representation of the actual Mesoamerican terrain and the city states are those that there is evidence for at this time. The game represents the importance of food and river transport to the Maya and the key influence of superstitions and festivals. Celestial markers for the Moon, Venus, Mars and Jupiter are moved on a night sky track causing increasing unrest or even rebellion and changes of allegiance amongst the regional powers and city states, especially when 2 or more markers stack together.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Worker Placement

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): High Elves
description:
Warhammer: High Elves is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 104-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect High Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivial Pursuit: AMC – The Walking Dead
description:
This edition of Trivial Pursuit features 600 questions from all 7 seasons of of AMC’s The Walking Dead, including characters, locations, events and episodes.

Players score points if they answer a question correctly. A colored die tells you which question to ask.

name: Catacombs Conquest: Qurru promo card
description:
Promo card for Catacombs Conquest.

Sword Team

Protector - Climb: Place your Character Disc on top of any Obstacle Disc. Must be knocked off to be damaged.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Glücksfee
description:
