Young adventurer, this excursion will not be without danger! Sandstorm hike, deadly scorpions and poisonous snakes ... Whether you are a lucky Prince,
Assassin or Illusionist, you will have to surpass yourself to get your graduation. After the dungeon, after the Lost Forest, it's time to test your skills in the heart of the desert. Have a nice trip !

Game play and components :
You embark on the exploration of 4 different floors: at each start of the round, randomly create a level by rolling 16 dice to obtain a square of 4 out of 4 dice. Armed with your Adventure sheet and the specific abilities of your character, draw your journey through the level while respecting travel constraints. Try to earn glory points and defeat small and large monsters. And don't forget to collect life and mana potions to stay alive! The fastest will have more choices when selecting their treasure, at the end of each level, and will thus be able to acquire more glory points, ensuring you victory ... and the graduation.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time

name: Banana Hammock
description:
Banana Hammock is a fast and frenetic game, set as a day in the life of a Banana Grabbers Packing Co employee. You'll make bunches of bananas and put them into your crate. Make the most bunches and you just may end up as the employee of the month. Watch out though, because even the best laid plans can fall prey to monkey business.

Game Flow:
A player's turn is broken into phases that determine what actions can be done:
Start of Turn
Draw
Play (Choose Banana cards or 1 Monkey card)
End of Turn

If multiple effects take place at the Start of Turn, they will resolve based on the player and location of the card. Start with effects played by the player whose turn it is and go in turn order. Effects of cards in the Crate resolve before effects of cards played from a hand or Hammock.

The goal is to score the most points! Players score points by putting Bunches of Bananas in your Crate. The game ends when the Barrel Full of Danger's conditions cannot be met and the player with the most points wins!

-description from designer

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Psychic Awakening – Pariah
description:
Book 9 of the Psychic Awakening Series

When Battle Group Kallides of the Indomitus Crusade reached the Nephilim Sub-sector, it encountered a silent zone, appearing to the group's Navigators as a shimmering psychic veil that even calmed the noise of the warp beyond it. Upon entering what the region of space that henceforth became known as the Pariah Nexus, the Battle Group encountered even stranger happenings – including the Geller Fields failing on a number of ships, which would otherwise have been instantly filled with Daemons from the warp, but with no such catastrophe ensuing. What new devilry was this?

In the ninth instalment of the Psychic Awakening, you'll read what happened when the secretive agents of the Inquisition began investigating haunting reports of the absolute silence detected in the Nephilim Sub-sector. Meanwhile, a vast set of rules expansions enhance your armies of the Inquisition with name generators, updated datasheets and much more besides.

Inside this 80-page book, you'll find:

Riveting background that reveals the audacious plan being enacted by the Necrons in the Pariah Nexus
Missions that allow you to recreate some of the most pivotal battles that took place when Battle Group Kallides moved to combat the strange goings on in this mysteriously silenced region of space
A full rules supplement for armies of the Inquisition – including datasheets for Inquisitors Greyfax, Coteaz, Karamazov and Eisenhorn
9 sets of Theatres of War rules including the following environments: The Webway, War-torn Shrine Worlds, Devoured Worlds, Daemon Worlds, Hive Worlds, Forge Worlds, Perilous Jungles, Derelict Worlds, and Necron Tomb Worlds
Datasheets for Illuminor Szeras, Kyganil of the Bloody Tears and the Daemonifuge, Ephrael Stern


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Fifth Edition): Codex – Space Marines
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Pocket Investigations: Alchymia
description:
Pocket Investigations is a series of "escape boxes", i.e. cooperative board games that are based on escape games, but playable at home.

In the scenario "Alchymia", the players try to make the recipe for the Philosopher's Stone.

name: Victory at Sea: Merchant Convoy
description:
Preventing attacks on defenceless merchant ships is the other main role of the navy, and it was her that the war was fought, day in and day out, by the humble corvette, frigate and destroyer escort, and later by escort carriers. Commerce raiding formed a critical part of the strategy for several nations – Germany’s Kriegsmarine almost brought Britain to her knees whilst the US Navy similarly strangled Japan’s movement of industrial goods, materials, troops and supplies.

Grouping ships into convoys meant there was more expanse of empty ocean out there – hopefully raiders would not even find the convoy. It also made escorts more effective, but in the event a convoy was hit by a surface raider, such as a heavy cruiser or battlecruiser, the target would be devastated in short order. Nevertheless, the convoy system helped a great deal. It would fall to the escorting ships to defend them until either a heavy covering force could come up in support or the merchants could make their escape. Some of the most heroic, and worst mismatched, actions of the war took place in defence of merchants convoys or troop ships.

–Description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Armada: The Game of Epic Naval Warfare Rulebook
description:
Armada is a tabletop game for two or more players. Choose your side and then command a fleet of Mantic miniatures to represent powerful navies such as the stoic and pious Basileans, or plot carnage and destruction with the rampaging orcs. With a range of beautiful ship models to choose from and many stories to tell, Armada is truly an amazing spectacle to play and witness.

The 96-page rulebook contains the core rules, 10 action-packed scenarios, and advanced rules for potentially devastating weather effects.

The rulebook is also contained in the Armada: Two Player Starter Set

—description from the publisher

name: Bob's Your Uncle
description:
Bob’s Your Uncle is an Australian themed version of the popular game Time’s Up! It is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players (and is best with teams of two). Before the game begins, each player looks at several cards featuring famous historical or fictional characters and chooses some of them. Each player's cards are shuffled to form a deck, and this deck of famous names is used for each of the game's three rounds.

In each round, team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many names as possible in 30 seconds. In round 1, almost any kind of clue is allowed, and the cluegiver cannot pass on a card. In round 2, no more than one word can be used in each clue (but unlimited sounds and gestures are permitted); the cluegiver can pass on any card he likes, and the teammates can give only a single answer. In round 3, the cluegiver can use no words at all and can pass as often as he likes; again, teammates are allowed only a single guess. Give good physical clues in round 1, and they'll pay dividends down the road when you need to keep your mouth shut and gesture like a maniac before time's up!
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Unsullied Pikemen
description:
Adding fearsome weapons to the unshakable Unsullied makes for a truly unbreakable center to any formation. Despite their armor rating a "light" classification in the western sense, and Unsullied spear wall, advancing in lockstep according to doctrines laid down in the Old Empire of Ghis, can move on virtually any position without fear of counterattack from the flanks or even the rear. While such a formation might seem immune to cavalry, a commander would be wise not to let them march forth unsupported, but if any unit can weather a short-term encirclement, it's the Unsullied Pikemen.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
‣ 12 Unsullied Pikemen
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement

name: Hostage Negotiator: Expansiones #7 y #8
description:
This item combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Abductor Pack 7 and Abductor Pack 8).

It includes 33 cards.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Super Tiny Skirmish
description:
Super Tiny Skirmish is the ultimate pocket combat game.

In just 8 pages you'll find all the rules you need to build, arm and battle with your own fantasy warriors, plus a system for leveling up between games and growing your forces from a single angry dude to a whole rabble of vicious fighters.

As well as the game rules you'll also find 2 cut paper miniatures to cut out and play with, as well as a one sheet copy of the rules that can be folded into a super tiny chapbook for on the go gaming.
Super tiny skirmish is the ultimate game of pub table combat, just add dice!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Catan: Starfarers – Space Jump
description:
Do you dare to jump in space?

With the Catan: Starfarers – Space Jump promo encounter card, you expand your deck of cards in Catan: Starfarers and can now compare your friendship cards in order to jump through the galaxy with one of your spaceships.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Disci
description:
In Disci, you want to move your pieces across the board and into the opponent's starting zone before they can do the same. You can move pieces individually or jump over a piece to land on the empty space just past it. In doing so, however, you may not enter the large space in the center of the board. What's more, if you end up on a space marked with an "X", you must vacate this space in the next round, even moving backwards toward your starting area, if necessary.

The opponent cannot block you by leaving pieces in their starting zone as those spaces count as filled and will make it easier for you to win.

name: Hero Mail
description:
Hero Mail is a cooperative or solo playable push your luck and resource management game in which you play local superheroes who must protect their city from a villain with sinister plans. The whole game fits on a postcard and there are different postcards for different cities with unique mechanics.

The game runs in 2 phases. In the first phase the heroes try to stop the villain's plans before he becomes too strong. The villain first collects threat markers based on the behaviour of the heroes in the last round and the current scenario. These are distributed to the different plans. Then the Heroes can recharge and use their abilities by forming 2 pairs from 4 dice rolled and taking an action marker with the corresponding number. If the number is no longer available, it cannot be taken. And if no available or already taken number is rolled and the dice cannot be manipulated with the hero's abilities, the hero loses all markers collected in this round. Heroes can decide to end their turn at any time, in which case they may use their markers to prevent the villain's plans, reduce damage or recharge their abilities. Once all heroes have finished their turn, the villain's unresolved plans are handled and his power increases according to the heroes' behaviour.
When all plans have been foiled or the villain has become too strong, it comes to the grand finale, in which the heroes must defeat the villain. The heroes must complete tasks based on the action markers they have placed during the course of the game.

This game was designed during the second corona wave and has several free to download scenarios, to bring some boardgames to everybody during the social distance time. You can also send the postcard with game to your game playing friends and Relatives. You can also support your local game store with this game, as there are several special scenario postcards, which are exclusive available in local game stores.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Line Up
description:
The purpose of the game is to compose a hand of 11 "footballer" cards and lay them out on the table as if they were a football team, trying to obtain the highest combination value, and win the "championship".

The 104 "footballer" cards are divided into 4 roles: goalkeepers, defenders, midfielders and strickers; and each card (except for goalkeepers) has three values: left wing, centre and right wing.

At the start every player draws 1 (from 6) "Line-up" card: this card shows the number of footballer for each role and their position on the field (left, centre, right).

A player's turn consists of the following phases:
1- draw 2 cards from the "footballer" pile, or take the top card from the discard pile
2- swap footballers with other players (not mandatory)
3- discard 1 card (only if the player drew 2 cards in phase 1)
Whenever a player has 11 cards in his hand at the end of the turn, he must declare it and from then on, he can only draw 1 card.

When a player states that he wants to close, the other players have 1 turn to try to improve their team.

The player who has lined up the team with the highest sum of the values of the footballer, is the winner.

name: Twilight Struggle: Blame Canada Promo Card
description:
Tribute card created by Jason Matthews in response to South Park featuring Twilight Struggle in an episode (season 23, episode 07, hence this is card #2307!)

If the US Controls Canada, remove 2 influence and smack nearest Canadian.
Remove from play if used as an event.

Included with C3i magazine issue 33

name: I am Alias Junior
description:
In this children's game, the players together explain what a secret figure or thing a player is. You are not allowed to use the same word that is included in the word you are going to explain, so it is important to use your imagination. If you guess it correctly, you score a point but everyone can win points on each round. This first player to the blue dot in the center of the board wins.

The player in turn has no idea what the card in the headband shows - so you have to listen carefully and take help of the clues that your teammates give you. Maybe you're Robin Hood, a giraffe or even a pumpkin.

Components: 4 headbands, 200 cards, sand timer, game board, 4 pawns.

--description from publisher
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Communication Limits, Deduction, Track Movement

name: Trek 12: At Home – Semaine 2
description:
Trek 12: At Home - Semaine 2 is an official print and play mini-expansion, offered by the publisher in December 2020 (during the confinement in France).

It consists in a new player board and new ways to score (only multi players mode).

IN SUMMARY: the way you choose your results and fill out your form has not changed. We will always have to make "rope paths" and "zones" (especially zones).
You will manage to go on a small sporting outing by combining races and avoiding the police. ?
Can you resist the temptation of having too many glasses?

Last but not least ... be more careful than ever, because being forced to put a value greater than 12 outside the scope would send you directly to Zonzon, synonymous with immediate elimination. And to lose the game without even counting the points.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Chaining, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Vengeance: Hero Pack – Selena
description:
Selena was dating Johnny Silver’s daughter, Manu, when the bastard Tengu-Kai kidnapped her to get leverage on Johnny. What they didn’t anticipate is that her girlfriend would turn out to be such a hard-arse, athletic fighter that would give them yet another headache, on top of Johnny Silver’s tactical onslaughts. I guess they messed with the wrong punk-bar

Selena’s ability, perks and solo mission focus on the acquisition and manipulation of Wild Tokens on dens. Like Napoleone her stats are slightly weaker than the rest, but her ability more than makes up for it.

Hero Pack Includes:

• 1 Selena Miniature
• 9 Montage Cards
• 1 Hero Player Board
• 1 Solo Mission Card
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Mafia, Miniatures, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Subbuteo: 5 vs 5 Indoor
description:
Reimplementation of the classic soccer flicking game with a smaller playing pitch of similar felt-like sliding surface. The playing field comes already mounted on a very light foam-like material surrounded by walls. Goals are attachable plastic made frames with nets. Comes with teams of five players each painted with the colors of Spain and Brazil.

—user summary

name: Champions of Shaleria: Core Deck
description:
If you like card games, you’ll love Champions of Shaleria! This non-collectible modular game is a complete game in a single box. Each core deck supports 2-4 players and is designed for quick gameplay (10-35 minutes each).

Easy rules, fast gameplay. This non-collectable, fully modular card game lets you take on the role of hero; gathering equipment, casting spells, battling through fierce creatures, and questing your way to victory. Everything you need for 2-4 players in a single deck.

This is a competitive game about earning equipment, slaying monsters, and completing quests. On your turn you choose an action to take, primarily either buying equipment or attacking a monster. The player who slays the correct monsters for their quests first wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Fish! Dash! Cash!
description:
This game "Fish! Dash! Cash!" Starts playing games as players become stray cats and gather fish. Sometimes the fish may be snatched and targeted by other cats. Of course, myself may sneak fish from other cats and run away. The ultimate goal is to convert the fish to "cash". You can eat fish, but you can not keep it as food for a long time. But if you can afford it, you can buy it whenever you like, "cat can" or "crispy." Huh! What? Do cats be interested in money? The proverbs are already old like "cats small-size". Even now even cats are doing business ... ....

Each player is dealt 5 cards from the deck. One card is put into the "field" from the first player, and each trick is processed.

Cards are color-coded "blue" and "red" and three types of "role". And cards has a number from 0 to 9.

The card issued by the first player becomes "the lead card", and only the cards that match the color are effectively processed. Cards resolution processes "roles" in descending order of numbers.

These cards are three types of "roles". "Fish", "Cat", and "Money". If you put out "Fish", put it in your "Feeding Area", and if it is "Money", put it in your "Feeding Area". To cash. A "cat" can steal a "fish" from the "feeding ground" to its own "feeding ground" or block another player's "cat" who has come to its "feeding ground". "Cashed fish" cannot be taken by "cats".

When the deck runs out and all the cards are put out, the person with the most "cashed" money in hand wins.

-description from designer

name: Cthulhu Storming: La Casa Stregata
description:
A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with three or four players by combining the two sets of Cthulhu Storming!

Strange killings are verifying in the city of George Town, a policeman and a nurse go to investigate in a strange house that seems to be linked with the apparitions of beast-men.

In each turn, a player can move its miniature by a space on the map, and do one of this action:

explore: if it's the first time a space/room is entered, roll one die and place the monsters listed from a table,
attack a monster: roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is higher than the level of the monster, the monster is killed; if all the monsters in a space/room are eliminated, roll one die and take the treasures/money listed from a table,
use a special ability/object.


After the turns of the players, the monsters attack every character in their space; a player roll a die, add the bonuses, and if the result is lower than the level of the monster, the monster inflicts a damage (physical, mental, or both) on the character.
The players can leave the house and go to the city to buy additional equipment, but the time spent is added to a track, and the game becomes harder if too much time is spent in this way. If a character is defeated (the inflicted damage is equal to its physical or mental resistance) is forced to go to the city.
The game is lost if all characters are defeated in the same round, instead the game is won if the players finds all the clues, runes and keys that open the way to the final boss (Abor-Kandra), and succeeds in defeating him.

name: Coloma: Long Shadow Promo Card
description:
A promo card originally available as part of The Secret Cabal's 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

A new Pioneer Specialty Card. This character can discard Barrel tokens from your supply to remove Outlaws from the Shootout. For each barrel you remove, you gain 1 VP.
categories: American West, City Building, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Gutterfall: Bounties
description:
Gutterfall is a massive underground city teeming with a wide variety of diverse lifeforms. Ranging from bipedal lizards to hulking sentient mushrooms and everything in between. The streets are alive with ancient magics and futuristic technology that mixes together in a state of barely controlled chaos.

You take the role of a skilled bounty hunter, who after losing their soul to a demon has a chance to redeem themselves by finding and capturing an elusive bounty from amongst Gutterfall's leading criminal Supremacies.

To accomplish this you must first guide your character through Gutterfall's many districts collecting smaller bounties and fighting other players to earn money, upgrades and clues that will help you identify your true target. The First player to identify and defeat the Supremacy will collect the bounty and free their soul, winning the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Hand Management, Targeted Clues, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Mad for War: Essentials
description:
The core rules for Mad for War. This is a pre release version enabling players to get used to the system.
Everything you need to get Mad for War on the tabletop including templates and overhead plans of ships which can be cut out and used to play the game, and lots of dice!
Mad for War is a new rule system covering miniature gaming with models ships. It focuses on the 17th century when world domination depended on having a powerful navy.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Secret Room: Mord in der Villa Dornbirn
description:
NOTES - Detectives, your help is needed! Searches 35 paper documents for clues, motives and alibis and finds out together why Mr. Luger had to die.
TENSION - The victim's video message and other digital web content turn the detective game into a multimedia puzzle game for the whole family and friends.
INVESTIGATORS - Thanks to the involvement of real murder investigators and real locations, the parlor game promises an exciting story and a unique adventure.
INTERNET - The crime thriller game is suitable for up to 8 players, ages 14+. You need internet access and an email address to solve the murder case.
INSTRUCTIONS - You can immediately follow the trail of the perpetrator - without any instructions! The exciting Escape Room game is also perfect as a gift for crime fans.

name: Brutal Quest: Fantasy Narrative Skirmish Gaming Based on the Planet 28 Rules
description:
Brutal Quest is a fantasy narrative skirmish game, built on the Planet 28 rules engine.

Brutal quest is designed to provide you with a set of simple wargames rules, allowing for fast and exciting games of miniature combat with warbands of kitbashed characters.

These rules can also be expanded with the in-depth campaign and narrative systems included, allowing you to add roleplay sessions, individual warband goals and long form story archs to your battles.

This book contains all the rules you need to play a game of brutal quest including custom character creation and advice on running campaigns.

Also included are a set of paper miniatures to allow you to get playing asap.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Traveller Customizable Card Game: Central Supply Catalog
description:
Finding the right tool for the right job can mean the difference between making the big score or gasping for air in the black of space. All the hardware the savvy captain needs can be found in the Central Supply Catalog, the fourth Expansion Pack for the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

These 60 cards provide new gear and ship upgrade options designed to support both contact and piracy decks!

Central Supply Catalog is not a standalone product. A Ship Deck is necessary to play the Traveller Customizable Card Game.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Aventuria: Kickstarter Promo Pack
description:
This promo pack (released during the first Aventuria Kickstarter) contains 4 new henchmen cards and a new adventure (7 cards):
2x Streunende Katze / Barn Cat (henchmen - KS01)
2x Krähenschwarm / Murder of Crows (henchmen - KS02)
1x Hexenreigen / Witch's Dance + cards - KS03-KS09 (adventure pack)

All cards are marked with "KS" and consecutive numbers (KS01-KS09).

name: Fou Fou Fou!: Plaisir d'offrir!
description:
This game use the same mechanic as "Fou Fou Fou !", but add a new twist:
When a player draws a pink card, he gives it to another player of his/her choice. This increases even more the interactions.

The present game can be played independently from the previous opus, or can be combined with it.

name: Kopparhavets kapare
description:
In 1991, the expansion module "Kopparhavets kapare" came out for the Swedish role-playing game "Drakar och Demoner" and the module takes place in the Swedish fantasy world "Ereb Altor". Included in the expansion where rules for naval combat, which can be played together with the role-playing game or as a separate board game.
You can play different peoples such as humans, "Svartfolk" (Greenskins), "Gråalver" (Sea elves), ducks etc. Why not have a sea mage on board who is a wind weaver. Participate in "Det felisiska piratkriget" (the Felician Pirate War). Enter or ram other ships in large naval battles. Fight against the black pirate ducks of the Copper sea. Or why not attack one of the greenskin's Kyrakher with galleys that ogres and trolls are rowing.

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Amazing Spider-Man & Black Cat
description:
In the years since being bitten by a radioactive spider, Peter Parker's life has been one constant adventure after another. From battling super-powered foes of every size and description to saving New York City more times than he can count, Peter has seen it all. Still, he continues to put everything on the line using his experience, his long list of friends, and sometimes even his longer list of enemies to protect the innocent. Peter Parker is the Amazing Spider-Man, and he wouldn't have it any other way.

Felicia Hardy is a world-renowned cat burglar with the latent ability to manipulate probability, causing her enemies to suffer unpredictable luck. After a chance encounter with Spider-Man, Felicia gave up a life of lawbreaking (well, mostly) to become a crimefighter. Despite an on- again, off-again romance with Spider-Man, she remains one of his closest allies, occasionally even giving up large scores in order to do the right thing. Felicia Hardy is the Black Cat, and the odds have a way of always landing in her favor.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Amazing Spider-Man & Black Cat consists of 2 miniatures, 2 Bases, 2 Character Stat Cards, 3 Team Tactic Cards, and 11 Tokens.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Frank 'n' Stein: Star Player
description:
Finding out about this Star Player’s early career can be tricky, because once you go back far enough he starts appearing under two different names. That’s because it wasn’t until an unlucky run-in with an ambitious Necromancer that decidedly average players Franklyn Smyth and Steiner S. Scottward became more than the sum of their parts.

After an illustrious career with his ‘repossessed’ team, Frank ‘n’ Stein was chased away from the Blood Bowl pitch after an unfortunate lightning strike sent him into a berserk frenzy, killing four players, a referee, and scores of unlucky bystanders. In a shocking twist, after his hugely popular Cabalvision commercials for Lightningade Electrolyte Drink, fans put down their pitchforks and he now plays for whoever can pay him the most.

As if his huge and powerful frame wasn’t good enough at stopping the opposing team dead in their tracks, the big lug’s brutal play style often rears its head when an unfortunate soul he’s grabbed gets an extra-large kicking.

Combined with Steiner’s size and Franklyn’s keen tactical mind, Frank ‘n’ Stein is an extremely dependable rock around which many Blood Bowl teams have been built – at least the ones able to pay his 250,000 GP fee. The Sylvanian Spotlight and Old World Classic teams that take him on will be glad to know he’s sticking around for the long haul, what with the Regeneration and Thick Skull abilities keeping him in the game.

The sky’s starting to look a bit cloudy, and I don’t want to be around the next time a lightning strike finds him, so it’s back to you in the commentary box, Jim and Bob.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Tannenberg 1914
description:
Description:
The game covers the initial stages of World War I, on the northern part of the Eastern front. It is divided in four scenarios, covering different stages of the battle. Each stage has different objectives, marked by victory points. Supply plays a key role, when planning offensives. While Russians enjoy numerical advantage (at least initially), Germany is well fortified and has access to rail transportation.

Rules:
The game is using the WB-95 system, which contains additions related to the time period. This rule-set is the base for WB-48.

Rules available in Polish and English.

Original game description from publishers site:
The 1st Army of General Rennenkampf attacked from the east and the 2nd Army of General Samsonov attacked from the south. The numerical superiority of the Russians seemed be a guarantee of success, but shortages of supply and lack of cooperation between both high commanders led to the complete defeat. The Germans managed to destroy both Russian armies in the separate battles.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: The Partizan Press Guide to War Gaming The Crimean War
description:
So why wargame the Crimean War?

Colourful uniforms, organisations and tactics which are comfortably familiar to the Napoleonic war gamer, with just a hint of the technological advances to come. All this and the chance to fight along side different allies and to take on the might of Russia in the process.

So it’s not quite Napoleonics, neither is it the American Civil War. The Crimean War is its own conflict and one that can be almost as far reaching as the war gamer requires.

With an increasing number of figures and rule sets becoming available, perhaps the Crimean War could become ‘the next big thing’ in the world of war games…

Includes historical background, war gaming guidelines, full colour campaign maps and details of the forces that participated.

With scenarios for the following battles complete with full colour maps of the battles & orders of battle:

The Battle of Kurudere - 5th August 1854
The Skirmish on the Bulganak - 19th September 1854
The Battle of the Alma - 20th September 1854
The Siege of Sevastopol September 1854 - September 1855
The Battle of Balaclava - 25th October 1854
The Battle of Inkerman - 5th November 1854
The Battle of Eupatoria - 17th February 1855
The Expedition to Kertch - 1855
The Tchernaya River - 16th August 1855


Includes 17 full colour Bob Marrion plates representing the numerous forces involved in the conflict.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Coral Sea: Defending Australia
description:
A Campaign Study

In the Battle of the Coral Sea in May 1942, the U.S. Navy thwarted the Japanese attempt to seize Port Moresby on the south-east coast of New Guinea. From there, Japanese planes could have ranged over the Coral Sea and supported landings on the north-east coast of Australia.

That didn’t happen; the Americans would win again at Midway a month later and bring an end to Japan’s offensive capability. Coral Sea: Defending Australia looks at how the Imperial Japanese Navy might have proceeded in the Coral Sea following a victory in the battle of the same name and a draw at Midway, and how the Royal Navy might have responded to this threat.

Coral Sea: Defending Australia is a Campaign Study: a short book including a dozen scenarios (four operational scenarios, eight battle scenarios) in which the British Eastern Fleet defends Queensland from the Japanese. You’ll need Coral Sea and Eastern Fleet to play the scenarios.

(from the publisher's website)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Châteauguay
description:
To win, you must connect at least three board sides with your counters. To place counters on the board, you must win tricks whose cards correspond to tiles on the board, which are randomly distributed before the start of the game.

However, you have a limited number of counters. If you've played all of your counters and haven't created a winning formation with your counters, you lose!

—description from publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Connections, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Set-up

name: Mini House Flipper
description:
Winner:
Most thematic game category
2021 9-card Nanogame PnP Design Contest

Run a successful house renovation business. Choose projects to take on, buy and sell materials at the right time, and employ specialists to help you complete projects on a budget. Can you keep your customers satisfied while maintaining a profit?

The goal of the game is to achieve the maximum profits and at the same time keep your customer satisfaction level high.

The game is played in 2 rounds. Each round consists of multiple turns. Start your turn by drawing 2 cards and place them on your player mat. The first cards drawn is project side up and represents your ongoing project. The second card is your project specialist.
Purchase materials to allocate them to your ongoing project or in anticipation of future price hikes.

To complete an ongoing project, you must allocate first the required resources then pass a quality check using your specialist card and your customer satisfaction level.

You may also complete company objectives which would allow you to gain abilities to aid you in completing ongoing projects.

The game ends as soon as you have drawn and resolved all the cards from the project deck on the second round. After which, you calculate the total profits made from each project.

name: Alpujarras Express
description:
Alpujarras Express is a super quick adaptation of Alpujarras. The game consists of 30 game cards that are laid out in a path. It also contains 2 "farmer" cards which, when folded, can stand up and act as pawns.

Players move their farmers along the path and pick up fruit, coins, or market cards. The market cards are used at the end of the game to "sell" the fruits acquired, so players are trying to pick up market cards that match their fruit cards, while also trying to prevent the opponent from doing the same.

The farmer with the most coins at the end of the game, wins.

name: Årets Chef
description:
Meteors, zombies, strikes in the coffee industry, and African killer bees. Your company has had it's shares of wild scenarios. But how is the boss going to solve the problems? By having a crisis meeting? Or how about a pet pig for the employees? That should fix everything.

In "ÅRETS CHEF" ("Boss of the Year") players take turns being the boss of a fictional company, which is facing a series of wacky challenges. The boss has to – with the help of the employees – find the best solution.

In the game the boss can be one of four types, which all makes decisions based on the characteristics of the given type. The boss can be the good boss, the bad boss, the nutty boss, and the burned-out boss. All four boss types are created as archetypes and are meant to spark some fun discussions and good laughs.

The game is perfect for your company's next social event, or for a good evening with your friends.

The game is played over 8 rounds in which the players take turn being the boss.
In each round the player goes through the following phases:

· The boss is secretly dealt a boss type card.
· The boss draws a challenge card and reads it out loud.
· The employees play a solution card from their hand face down.
· Solution cards are shuffled and read out loud by the boss.
· The boss picks the solution that fits the boss type the best (the boss is always right in his/her choice).
· Players secretly guess what type the boss is.
· The boss reveals his/her boss type.

Player who guessed the correct boss type, score their solution card (worth 1 point).
If a least one player guessed the correct boss type, the boss scores the challenge card (worth 2 points).
The player who played the solution card the boss choose, becomes the boss in the next round.

After 8 round the players with the most points wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Judge, Semi-Cooperative Game, Storytelling

name: Opacity
description:
A "legacy trick taking" game of advocating under an owl-igarchy.

Fight for shape representation as advocates with intersecting shapes. Play across multiple generations, starting with one built by star ⭐️ bellied owls. Can you guide your hand of owl cards towards acceptance?

Each generation consists of about 4 games, and each game is made up of about 6 tricks. Each trick, players will either closet a card to remove it from their hand, or reveal a card. Revealed cards add to their shape’s visibility score, with shapes in parliament giving a bonus each trick. All cards of the winning shapes are ✅ accepted, and all other cards are ❌ rejected.

The player with the most accepted cards adds one to parliament as the winner, which will shape the rules and bonuses for future generations. What legacy will you leave behind in your fight for opacity?

Opacity was designed as part of the Small Game Big Theme Game Jam and also a Break My Game Jam.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Chicken Challengers
description:
Chicken Challengers is a strategic turn based card game that deals with chickens and their constant shenanigans. With over 70+ unique chickens to collect, use their special abilities to help you gain even more chickens!

Take turns drawing or playing chickens to help you collect or make your enemies suffer! In addition, there are other cards like action cards that make others lose chickens, and Challenge Cards to battle other players' chickens and make them your own! But hold on! Other players may also stop you from playing those cards using counter cards.

Be the first person to collect 8 chickens in your hand to win while making sure others don’t collect 8 before you do!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Highest Adventure: The 1953 British Mount Everest Expedition
description:
Highest Adventure is a solitaire game of exploration set during the 1953 assault on Mount Everest. You will lead a team of seasoned climbers and attempt to be the first to summit the greatest peak on the globe. You will need to wisely equip your expedition with the supplies, choose your climbers and assault teams, map out your route, and then start up the mountain for death or glory.

This is a print-and-play game, with two main decks of cards, some tokens and a series of location cards. Before the game, players will need to carefully select supply cards to give them the best chance at success because the mountain is an unforgiving place that will throw dangerous Encounter Cards at the expedition. Once on their way up the mountain, how well the player balances these cards with the expedition's health, endurance, and strength will define the razor thin margin of success and failure atop Mount Everest.
All components (and some alternatives) are provided in the PNP files. Expect your first expedition to take around 30min, with follow up games lasting around 15-20min. Mount Everest is a dangerous place, so carefully choose your supplies and read the rock face well, and you just might secure the coveted prize of being the first to reach the roof of the world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Death Gate Sentinel
description:
Mission: To the Gates of Hell - The dead are restless, haunting the nearby villages and settlements throughout this region. From those that have ventured into the shadowy hills, tales have been told of massive stone statues that act as gate keepers to the underworld, binding the spirits of the dead to some dark purpose.

A local holy man that has been tormented by the screams of the dead and the damned, implores you to seek out these deathly Sentinels and destroy them, freeing the bound spirits.

This deluxe resin terrain piece depicts a giant stone statue - the Death Gate Sentinel and comes with an all-new scenario set piece for Shadows of Brimstone and a new Mission themed for the new piece!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Shadows of Brimstone: 4th of July 2020 Sale Promo Cards – (P331 & P332)
description:
There is a set of the two promo cards P331 & P332 for Shadows of Brimstone.
It exists of 2 gear cards:

Promo-331 - Gentleman's vest
Promo-332 - Lady's fancy corset

They were available at the 4th of July 2020 at the Flying Frog webstore for orders over 100$.

name: Backyard Birds: Wetlands
description:
In 2018 we decided to include a waterfowl expansion for Backyard Birds. Originally we planned on adding about 20 different waterfowl species; however, we quickly realized that the expansion could easily be made into its own standalone game. We added an additional 20 species and significantly changed the game mechanics from the original Backyard Birds.

Capture as many wetland territory cards as possible using carefully assembled flocks of waterfowl birds. Territory and waterfowl cards award victory points and the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

On your turn, a player can perform one of six actions, acquruing territory, enabling abilities or events. If none of these can be done, the decks can be shuffled instead.

The game will end after the last wetland territory is revealed from its supply pile then all players play one more round.
Add up the victory points for your wetlands and the waterfowl on the wetlands. Remember to make any adjustments from event cards. Waterfowl in your game area will not score.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Unserjass
description: UnserJass (OurJass) is a 2 player Jass game that brings together elements of Bela, Handjass, Jo-jotte, as well as some new ideas. The goal of the game is to score game points (1-2 per hand) by bidding for the trump suit and then successfully carrying out your bid during the hand.

name: Desde el Banco: Fútbol de Tablero
description:
Desde el Banco ("From the Bench"), Tabletop Soccer, is a sports strategy game for two players, where each one is the Coach of a fantasy soccer team. Select the team, build your squad, raise your formation and take them to the field.

A board game that undoubtedly awakens the passions and mischief of soccer, accompanied by the chance of the dice. The components are soccer player and team cards, big-headed soccer player miniatures, ball miniature, interlocking colored rings to identify the teams, energy tokens, dice and a flexible fabric printed board, all in a very colorful and eye-catching box.

During the match, the Coach must put together their best strategy, use the special skills of the players, and the special abilities of the team players to score the goal.

Each Coach take the victory by scoring the most goals.

name: Silex and the city
description:
The year is 40,000 B.C. The entire world seems to obey the laws of natural selection. Well, not entirely... One small valley of indomitable cavemen still holds out against the idea of progress.
Having no idea is the best idea!
Progress is fake news! Evolution is what's leading humanity to its demise, and that's a fact! Thankfully, a small group of enlightened cave-dwellers sees things as they really are... Help the Dotcom family avoid the plague of new ideas, the fate of humanity is at stake!

Make the best use of your cards... to invent as little as possible!

name: Pez
description:
Pez is a card game made up of 48 cards of 16 species of fish from our La Plata basin.

The complete deck represents the food chain of the river. The general idea of the game, with variations depending on the modality chosen, is to equal or exceed the numerical value of the card played by the immediately preceding player or by the opposing team (there are hand-to-hand modalities, individual up to 9 players and by teams in duos and trios). The player who plays the highest card takes the trick.

The winner or winning team is the one who manages to obtain more than half of the total possible points: there are 50 in total, as a reminder that the river is a living being and that the fish populations are not infinite.

name: Oceans Eleven
description:
Two players each get a conventional 52 card deck of their own, with 2s considered wildcards. Players compare the highest five card poker hand amongst all the cards they've turned up. (If fewer than five, the empty spots are considered worthless cards of a zero rank and no suit.)

Each turn, the player with the lowest hand among their best five cards then gets to either Fold or Take another card. Folding results in a point for the opponent and all the cards on both sides being discarded. If instead the player added a new card, hands are compared again. And again, the player with the lowest five card poker hand from the cards exposed gets to either take another card or fold.

When a deck runs out the other player gets a point and can keep playing, and scoring pts till their own deck runs out. First to six points wins. If both decks run out game ends also, and scores are compared.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Domowe zwierzaki
description:
The little ones we care for, quickly become our best friends. We love our pets - we feed them, we take care of them and play together. It does not matter if it is a cheerful dog, purring kitty, cute hamster or a kind turtle. Take care of your four-legged companions and see how worth it.Your pet will surely appreciate it!

Domowe zwierzaki is a new game from the child-friendly world award competition! Game series for preschooler. In Domowe zwierzaki, the youngest players will have the opportunity to learn about running a farm. The game includes several gameplay variants, so everyone will find something for themselves.

Variant 1: Animal caretaker

Where you take care of your animal and you meet his needs, by completing quests.

First you spin the arrow and see what exactly needs
your pet in this turn. This will create kind of minigames. Feeding, Care, Cleaning, Play, Care. When you succesfully do the task you willtake the price token. Game ends immidiately when player collects five price tokens.

Variant 2: Walk with a dog

Where you go for a walk with your dog, this is a kind of race, mode.

First you Spin the arrow and move your pawn to the next square in the drawn color. If the pawn stops
on the special field. (Toy. Bridge, Ball) You will get some additional or lose pawn moves. Whoever puts a pawn at the finish line first, wins the game and wins the cup!

Variant 3: Zoo-mino

This is easy version of domino game, where you also train your memory.

Your task is to add chips to those on the table (from first
or second end of the row). The player may add a token to which is on the table, provided that it has the same background color or there is the same animal on it. After a player adds a tile, he draws one from the pile. If there is no suitable tile to be added, he also draws one from the stack. When the stack is empty, players take the final turn without drawing. If the player cannot play the chip, he says "pass". The winner is the player with the fewest chips.

name: Magic Maze: Zwischengeschosse
description: Promo tiles A, B and C to expand the mall. None of these tiles require the expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Real-time
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Modular Board, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Dropped Weapons Pack
description:
This is a 4-player expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition that allows you to add dropped items to your car builds. Now you can litter the arena with devious gadgets and deadly weapons!

The expansion includes the following:
-One counter sheet (four rectangular slab tokens and one with 16 rectangular foam tokens, as well as 32 circular mine tokens)
-108 game cards
-Rule sheet
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Race, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Grindhouse!
description:
Grindhouse! is a beautifully weird card game for two to four players set in the world of seventies B-movies. By collecting and playing production cards with the requisite values for the genre you're aiming for—and whatever review you're aiming to get—you complete a production and rake in bucks at the box office. Earn more money than your competition and you win the game!

Players collect and play Production Cards onto productions, in separate horizontal rows on the table in front of them, and can work on up to two at a time. There are four different "roles" for Production Cards: Directors (yellow), Actors (blue), On Set (red), and Post (green). Each card has a numeric cost indicating how many cards you must discard to play it on a production and most have one or more value symbols: afros, blood, boobs, buildings, explosions, fists, wheels, and reels.

A production that contains all four roles can be wrapped (completed) by playing a Genre Card and Review Card onto it. Both cards show a value cost—met or exceeded with the value symbols on the Production Cards—and a box office haul for your completed film.

Once a player has wrapped two productions (three in a two-player game), the game ends and box office receipts are totaled and the highest score wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Spike! Journal #13
description:
The exceptionally fierce Terrence "the Butcher" Iansson wipes the blood off his hands just long enough to guest edit this issue of Spike! Journal packed with eightfold treats. That's right, it's a Khorne special, focusing on those who play to appease the god of skulls.

Featuring 36 crimson-hued pages, this magazine covers the history, rules, and rosters of the Khorne team. Alongside all the tales of violence, violence, and more violence, you'll find the fantastic fun and essential commentary you've come to expect from Spike! Journal. As such, this magazine is the perfect companion for the savvy (and bloodthirsty) coach.

It includes:

Blood for the Blood God: delve into the background and history of Khorne teams, the various player positions, Star Players, and a team roster.
Famous Khorne Teams: what do Khorne's Killers, The Bloodsoaked Bruisers, The Flesh Hounds, and The Khornate Cripplers all have in common? They all donated an overwhelming number of skulls to Khorne this season, and they feature in this section covering the many teams that play for blood.
The Skull-tribe Slaughterers Team Spotlight: a special in-depth article focusing on one of the few Khorne teams to reach the epiphany that winning games means more chances to claim better quality skulls. Includes a team profile featuring team colours, honours, Spike! team rating as well as the roster of their famous 2497-2498 squad, and loads more.
Star Player Spotlight – Grashnak Blackhoof: a renowned Blitzer known as "The Great Black Bull" often considered one of the most violent players to ever grace the gridiron.
Chat With the Rat: everyone's favour-best rat Hackspit Quillchewer takes the time to talk to the owner of the Khornate Cripplers, Overlord Kolgan Bloodrage, about their storied rivalry with the Slaaneshi Sidewinders.
Star Player Spotlight – Scyla Anfingrimm: a wrecking ball of muscle on the pitch, Scyla's unique brand of violence has given him heaps of adoring fans and sponsorship deals despite no one knowing where he came from.
Chaos Leagues: all-new rules and advice to help you run Chaos Leagues – a variant on the standard Blood Bowl League Season. The Cursed Skull Goblet is open to all teams, however each team participating must select one of the four Chaos Gods or Chaos Undivided as their patron. Includes rules such as a Wrath of Khorne Weather Table, Khornate Kick-off Table, unique post-game sequences, and special rules for the Altar of Khorne Blood Bowl Pitch and Khornate balls.
Dirt From the Dugout: Mindy Piewhistle delivers another steaming hot pile of gossip, this time focussing on the underhanded means the Crimson Butchers have been using to convert rival fans into Khorne worshippers.
Eviscerate and Exsanguinate: this is your guide to getting the most out of your skull-loving Marauders. Includes an overview of the strengths of the Khorne team (violence) positions, tactics (enacting violence), how to start out, and how to develop your team over a league, as well as examples of offensive and defensive set-ups. Surprising no one, Khorne teams prefer offence.
Star Player Spotlight – Max Spleenripper: innovative and skilled with a chainsaw, Max has become a must-have player in Khorne teams and a household name. Find out how he earned the name 'Spleenripper' right here.
Ask Lord Borak: curious Blood Bowl fans have their questions answered by the fearsome Lord Borak.
Coffin Corner: plenty of players have lost their heads over the years, pleasing Khorne greatly. This regular column remembers those who died, willingly or not, in tribute to the Blood God.
Mighty Blow! – New Brawls Please: this comic takes a look back at one of Bob Bifford's games against a Khorne team.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Rory's Story Cubes: My Neighbor Totoro
description: Create new stories featuring the characters from the animated film "My Neighbor Totoro" using a new set of 9 dice. Roll the dice and let your imagination wander.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Storytelling

name: Conveyor Rummy
description:
Conveyor Rummy is a Rummy-style game for 2-4 players played entirely with dominoes.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their dominoes by playing melds of runs and sums.

The game requires either a double-9 or a double-12 domino set to be played.
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Princess Heroes
description:
Help the Princess Heroes race to the castle! The castle has been cursed and all of the princesses must get through the enchanted forest and make it to the castle before the last leaf from the tree of life lands on the ground. Work together to help the princesses defeat all the obstacles and make it to the castle before the leaf reaches the ground to break the curse.

In this cooperative game, kids ages 4+ will work together to help move all of the princess heroes across the board and into the castle. Players use their item cards to move a princess onto a matching space on the board. The princesses don’t share spaces, so players can get the princesses really moving by playing the same item card twice and jumping over the other princesses. Mixed into the item cards are obstacle cards. These obstacles take time to overcome and when a player draws an obstacle card, the leaf token falls one space closer to the ground. Players must get all of the princess heroes back to the castle before the leaf token reaches the ground and the castle curse cannot be broken.

The bright and colorful image-based gameplay makes Princess Heroes easy to learn and fun to play! Once players know the rules there is no reading required, which makes this a fun way for kids to use basic strategy skills and reduces competition by having the players work together to beat the game.

-description from publisher

name: Conflict of Dreams
description:
Players build a deck of cards and duel against their opponent's deck. Players are champions attempting to reduce their opponent's life total to zero. The first player to reduce the opponent's champion to zero or otherwise destroy the opponent's champion card is the winner..

First off, the game has a deck construction element to it, which is done before to the actual game by choosing what cards are included in a deck. This must include 1 champion card, no more, no less and 50 other cards of the players choice, although a player cannot have more than 3 copies of any card.

The game has four major factions, all of which use champion, cast and reaction cards, besides that each faction has their own special types of cards they can use:
The Meritus uses equipment cards (such as swords and shields) and equipping these cards allows their champion to use them as an extension of his/herself.
The Sortis has enchantments which have over time effects and they also have spell cast cards.
The Divitiae have construct and upgrade cards so they can build machines and improve them.
Diogeni have creature, plant and force of nature cards to gain bonus resources and grow stronger over the course of the game.

Players gain resources and draw cards from their deck to determine what they can play each turn. Many cards have bonus conditions or options which allow for advanced strategies. There is a good list of game mechanics, including a mechanic called "the conflict" which lets players respond to each others action and allows more skilled players the opportunity to pull ahead while remaining easy enough for new players to learn.

Though the game is intended for a two-player duel, there is room to allow more players to play.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Take That

name: Pacific Rim: Extinction – Slattern
description:
The cruel behemoth Slattern emerges from the breach! An immense living arsenal, Slattern is equipped with triple armor-piercing tail, used to tear through the metal armor of its Jaeger prey!

Contents:

1 x Slattern Kaiju Model
1 x Slattern Kaiju Signature
6 x Slattern Action Cards
3 x Mutation Cards
1 x Rage Counter
1 x Kaiju Blue Counter
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Eendracht Maakt Macht
description:
An Afrikaans co-operative game about the Anglo-Boer War.

Set in 1899, Eendracht Maakt Macht is South Africa’s first ever co-operative game in which players will learn about one of the most challenging periods in our history, the Anglo Boer War! Players need to work together, accept challenges set by historic leaders and travel all over the South African war landscape to achieve legendary status. These challenges and game mechanics were well researched and based on some of the water-shedding events that changed our country forever.

Players turn their Boer characters into commandos, build on their own unique skills, and are led to collaborate with others to a common goal by accepting challenges ranging from large battlefields, such as Magersfontein and Spioenkop, to secret missions, such as spying on the enemy's operations. These challenges require them to travel across South Africa's war landscape in pursuit of legendary status.

If the players gain enough "hero points" before the war calendar runs out of time, the players win.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: 1814: The Norwegian War of Independence
description:
During the Napoleonic wars, the Kingdoms of Denmark-Norway and Sweden found themselves on opposite sides, and fought several skirmishes in the border areas between the countries. This game deals with the 1814 campaign (a 1808 scenario will be provided later).

The game is a low-complexity wargame, with units representing battalions of infantry (about 350-400 men), batteries of artillery and squadrons of dragoons and cavalry (about 75-100 men). The Swedes have regular cavalry units like hussars, the Norwegians have dragoons and mounted jaegers. The Swedes enjoy better training, better supplies and more fire power, the Norwegians have advantages in mobility and skirmish ability, employing ski troops and light infantry (jaegers/sharpshooters).

The game map uses point-to-point movement and covers the border area between Norway and Sweden from Frederikshald (Halden) to Trondheim. The Swedish objective is to break the Norwegian lines and capture Christiania (Oslo), the border forts, (and perhaps Trondheim if they choose to try. The Norwegian objective is to prevent the Swedes from winning by inflicting enough casualties and delay the Swedes long enough to force negotiations to start.

The game was originally released in 2018 as a zip-lock, hex-based system with a print run of just 100. (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/300929/norwegian-war-ind...).
The game has been completely redesigned and is in reality a completely new game on the same topic, rather than a new version of the old game.

This is the first game in the Scandinavian Wars Trilogy from Pantero Games.
mechanics: Minimap Resolution, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Greyjoy Heroes 2
description:
The Kraken’s Many Arms in the Fight

A Kraken’s many tentacles can seemingly act independently from one-another, but always for the greater good of the creature. So, too, do the various individuals within House Greyjoy. Though they sometimes are at odds with one-another, each one feels what they’re doing is best overall for the House.

The Greyjoy Heroes 2 box set for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Greyjoy players lots of new options for their forces. The set contains new unique characters, including both UAs and NCUs, with several new options for army Commanders as well. Each one has their own goals, but all are working for the greater good of House Greyjoy.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Pacific 1941-45
description:
Pacific 1941-45 covers several land battles fought at the islands of Pacific Ocean during the World War 2. There is big variety of battles, from very small ones, through medium, to the biggest clashes.

Navy and air force are present as well, but mostly as a support forces of both sides. Games are focused on the land units. Most of the battles are fought between US and Japanese forces, but there is a battle of Shumshu, were Soviet units landed in the middle of 1945.

Game was released in B-35 system, which is company/battalon scale, but smaller units are sometimes present as well. Each day has two turns, day and night. There are special units, like snipers, combat engineers, anti tank units, mortars, anti air and so.

Some more battles were released as expansions in the publsher's magazine.

Battles in the box:
- Betio
- Green Island
- Roi Namur
- Kwajalein
- Angaur
- Peleliu
- Saipan
- Shumshu

Battles released in the magazine:
- Wakde (44 issue)
- Wake (45 issue)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Role Order

name: Zoot!
description:
If you enjoy Scrabble or Wordle .. Zoot! is here to make your word-nerdy dreams come true!

Object : To obtain the highest number of points by combining the 7 cards in your hand into a single word. Re-arrange your cards until they come close to forming a word. Start your turn by drawing either the face-up card or the one at the top of the draw pile. Then discard one of your other cards to end your turn.

The first person to form a word and yell Zoot! wins the round, and adds 10 points to their score. Their opponent then has one more chance to make a 7-letter word. They pick up one additional card from either draw pile and add a wild card to their hand for a total of 9 cards. Game continues until all cards in the deck have been played, usually 4-5 rounds - and the highest final score is the winner.
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Move Through Deck, Set Collection, Spelling

name: SHASN: UK 2019-20 – Brexit
description: This Campaign deck with the Brexit referendum in the UK theme, changes the ideology cards included in SHASN base game to immerse the players in the politics of the modern UK.

name: Ghosts Love Candy Too: More Ghosts Promo
description:
This four pack set features new ghost card options that can be used by players.

The four ghosts (Chloe, Heather, Beckett, and Graydor) each have a set of 9 cards with each of the 1-9 values, for a total of 36 cards in the promo pack.

name: Dungeonrunner: Zoltar's Sanctuary
description:
The heretic has been diving into forces unknown. Strange happenings and disappearances have been noted in nearby villages. The only way to end it...is to end him.

Dungeonrunner is a solitaire card game inspired by classic pen and paper fantasy RPGs. The player takes a hero on a quest through one of nine adventure decks. Each adventure deck is filled with danger and peril as the player guides the hero through hazardous traps, countless monsters, and dreaded curses.

Each deck of 54 cards make up ten separate adventures with varying difficulty. Infiltrate Emperor Zinn’s castle with the Lowly Thief, trudge through Muck Elf Swamp with the Amazon Warrior, or if you dare, confront the Demon Queen, Lawnadynn with the Paladin of Truth!

Each turn, you play a card from the adventure deck. It may be a monster, trap, event, or item. Once that card is resolved by combat or your decisions, you draw the next card. If you can make it to the quest card for the given scenario, the hero completes the adventure!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Twinkle: Kickstarter exclusives
description:
A pack of 24 extra cards given to backers of the Twinkle Kickstarter campaign.

The pack includes 14 new event cards and 10 new mission cards.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Sigil
description:
Sigil is a two player, abstract board game, along the lines of Mancala.

In it, both players move the same pieces around the board in an attempt to leave their opponent unable to take a turn.

—description from the designer

name: Hope Lost
description:
Hope Lost is a 2-4 player cooperative choose-your-own-apocalypse game, featuring 6 different apocalypses to play through, each with their own objective and unique spin to the game’s common mechanics. Players will need to fight the apocalypses as well as time itself, all the while trying to make sure the survivors at the base have everything they need. Will you survive the apocalypse, or is all hope lost?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Kaukaz 2020
description:
Zapad 2020 is a small game released in the World War 3 system, published in the 43 issue of the Taktyka i Strategia magazine.

Game covers hypothetical operation of the Russian army at Ukraine 2020, where Russians are trying to seize the important dam in the New Kachovka city, that controls the water supply to the Crimea.

Kaukaz comes with new counters (of Russians and Ukrainians) and small board, covering the battle area. Some additional markers are included as well. Set of the rules of WW3 system is needed.

name: Articulate!: New Zealand Edition
description:
You all know Articulate, the fast-talking description game, now get ready for the New Zealand Edition! With adapted playing cards, including Kiwi towns, wildlife and celebrities, this is the ultimate local gaming experience!

Try to get your partner to say as many words from a particular category written on the cards within the thirty second time limit, you may only pass once. Move your team pawn forward a number of spaces on the board equal to the number of words you got correct.

If you land on an Orange or Red space, spin the spinner for a chance to move yourself 2 or 3 spaces forward, or move an opponent piece 2 or 3 spaces back. If you land on a spade space, try to get you team mate to say the word on the card before any other team can say it. Whoever answers correctly gets a turn immediately.

Categories include Person, World, Object, Action, Nature and Random. First team to make it around the board and successfully answer a spade category (chosen from any of the above) wins the game.
mechanics: Action Timer, Real-Time, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Dinositters!
description:
Dinositters! is an entry weight worker placement puzzle game in which players take on the role of two teenage dino-siblings competing against the other families to keep the newly hatched babies fed and entertained until your parents return.

Each turn, players will place or move one of their siblings to gather resources or add hatchlings from the nursery to their nest. Players earn happiness by feeding hatchlings their favorite foods, finding friends for them to play with, and completing lava goals. Whenever a player adds their ninth hatchling, a lava space is empty, or three nursery spaces are empty, every other player gets one last turn before adding up final scores. The family with the most happiness wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Connections, Race, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: The Phantom: The Card Game – Stamus Contra Malum
description:
A side-mission where the player gets the chance to unlock 6 new allies and the Jungle Patrol headquarters. This adventure is thematically suited to the adventure Diana in The Jungle Patrol, but can be played along with any The Phantom: the Card Game adventures.

Side-Missions are mini-adventure that can be played in parallel with adventure, they unlock new cards for the player and add one more thing to take care of.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ed & Wolf
description:
Ed and Wolf accidentally invent a magic potion that turns the plants into moving, talking creatures. From that moment on, their new friends need special elements to stay alive. Every night, Ed and Wolf sneak out to gather all the important ingredients. The time is short and the locations can only be revealed one by one. Help them in their nighttime quest: find everything the plants need and return to Ed's room before it is too late!

—description from the publisher

The players have to consider every movement and situation as a puzzle to solve. The goal is to cross the garden, walk through the house, moving from one tile to another, meanwhile you have to spare your Time Cards, collect special ingredients and save as many plants as you can. …and: return to Ed’s room before your Time Cards run out.

—user summary

name: Dragonbond: Battles of Valerna
description:
Dragonbond: Battles of Valerna is a fantasy miniature wargame that brings the vibrant world of Valerna to life; players field magnificent dragons, legendary commanders, mighty heroes, powerful monsters, and brave soldiers in a desperate battle for victory.

Battles of Valerna utilizes a unique fatigue system that encourages players to make the choice between pushing their units to exhaustion or saving them for a perfect opportunity.

Players take turns activating units by placing fatigue tokens on them (the more fatigue tokens a unit has on it the less effective it becomes). Units move and attack, competing to score objective points dependent on the scenario. After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

There are three types of dice for attack and defense. If a unit is in an advantageous position they upgrade their dice to a stronger one. If they are in a disadvantageous position for example if they are flanked or exhausted, they would use a weaker dice.

When building their army, players can choose to dragonbond their mighty dragons and generals, making both even more powerful - this comes at a cost. If either unit is killed, both units are lost!

The Wargame is completely modular. By changing the captain you can change the rules for the unit and the generals impact upon the behaviour for the entire army.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Marks of Legend: The Spire of Deren'nuk
description:
In this solitaire storytelling bookmark game, craft a legend from the pages of a book!

Choose a place in any book, and search for words on those pages to fill the blanks of a heroic legend, chapter by chapter. The words you use affect which words you must find to perform a series of feats. Perform every feat before you run out of words to finish your legend.

This game was developed as an entry in the 2022 In-Hand Game Design Contest.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Book, Fantasy, Humor, Print & Play, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Open Drafting, Paper-and-Pencil, Resource to Move, Storytelling, Variable Set-up

name: Blazing Skates
description:
Blazing Skates is a sport game that recreates short track races of winter Olympic sport.
The game is played along a printed rink divided in sectors and boxes.
From 2 to 5 skaters can skate in a single race.
2d6 dice are used to move skaters and tables help to resolve any aspect of game.
Each skater is represented by individual cards
A set of Ladies and Men skaters are published: World Championship 2021-2023 and Olympic Games Beijng 2022 500m race.

It's a free print and play game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ナゼカヨメチャウ (Why can I read this?)
description:
ナゼカヨメチャウ (Nazekayomechau) (Why can you read this?) is a party/action game from Japan. The idea came to the designer whilst editing rules for games and looking for typos. It is based on the internet meme Typoglycemia.

In the game, players take turns asking the question. They read the answers to two texts and then show the texts to the other players. But certain parts of the text are blocked by round images, so the players must work out what is really being said. When they have solved two sections, they must perform the action being instructed. The player with the answer declares the first and second winners to perform the action required, who get points.

The first player to reach six points wins the game.

The illustrated texts show examples such as round ladybirds, fairy lights, koi, lanterns, a baseball, and an owl on the branch (the publisher being an owl).
user summary

This is a new, easy party game that combines "quiz" and "action".
Players are divided into contestants and respondents.
The contestant chooses one question from the list of questions and checks the answer. Afterwards, the answers are published for the respondents to see. Respondents look at the published hole in the text and try to guess what it says.
As soon as they have an idea of what it says, they move on to the next question. As soon as they know what it says, they take action.
If one of the respondent's actions matches the answer, the contestant points out, "Correct!" The first correct answer is unconditional.
The first correct answer gets one point unconditionally, and the second correct answer gets one point if it matches the answer to what they read in the text. The game is repeated in the same way, switching contestants.
The game ends when one of the players scores 6 points.

「クイズ」+「アクション」 の新感覚お手軽パーティーゲームです。
プレイヤーは出題者と回答者に分かれます。
出題者は問題リストから1問選び、解答を確認します。その後、回答者が見えるよう公開します。回答者は公開された穴空きの文章を見て、なんと書いてあるのかを予想します。
こうかな？っと内容が分かったらすぐに行動に移します。
回答者のいずれかの行動内容と答えが合っていたら、出題者は「正解！」と指摘します。
1人目の正解者は無条件で1点、2人目の正解者は文章をなんと読んだのかを答え、解答と一致していれば1点獲得です。出題者を交代し、同じように繰り返します。
いずれかのプレイヤーが6点獲得したらゲーム終了です。
publisher's summary
