categories: Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Au pire, tu meurs !
description:
This is a bluffing game as well as a party game.
The goal is to eliminate every other member of the Death family by reducing their life expectancy to 0 and become the last one standing.
At the beginning, each player draws secretly a Role card with a dedicated life expectancy as well as a starting hand of seven cards. There are two category of cards: attacks and other effects for managing other players' attacks.

Since everyone's life gauge is secret, the only way to eliminate a player is to call them out and say "You DIE!". They secretly show you their role card and the damage they received. If you were right, they are eliminated. If you were wrong, they retaliate by giving you one of the Attack card that stacked against them.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Thunderstone Quest: Rotten Roots
description:
A new Quest for Thunderstone Quest, This Deck Builder, will take your party to an adventure on a new level!

A new guardian, Filleath has always felt he was destined for more, but it seems he’s always lived in the shadow of greater creatures, none greater than Ashbrow, the great tree guardian of the Deepwood. But a new pact with a being from the Abyssal lands will bring an end to all that. Now armed with dark powers, he will spread a blight that puts the entire forest in jeopardy.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Aventuria: Der Regenbogenfall Teamherausforderung
description:
Face the forces of nature with your friends! With the blessings of the twelve gods, together you can prevent a catastrophe. Walk together on sacred paths and discover the legendary Rainbowfall on the Cyclops Islands. Don't let evil rule the fortunes of this miracle!

Together with the Aventuria basic box, this cooperative challenge can be experienced with up to 20 players. If you want it particularly exciting, you can also play this adventure with several groups at the same time.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Madera contra Acero: La Conquista de Canarias
description:
Masqueoca NAC wargames in its project to promote games with a national theme has been kind enough to include in its programme one with a hitherto unpublished and original theme, and as a Canarian designer it is a great satisfaction for me to present it. Wood against Steel, The Conquest of the Canary Islands. Already the title gives us a small clue of the inequality in weaponry on the sides involved in this war. The wooden and stone weapons of the Guanches against the iron and steel of the conquerors of the Crown of Castile. But make no mistake, even though it was a very unequal struggle, the conquest of the whole archipelago lasted no less than 94 years, practically a whole century of fighting, precisely in the 15th century, which is enough to show that it was not a military stroll. By way of comparison, the conquest of America took about 40 years. It should be noted that the clash between the indigenous Canary Islanders and the Castilian troops was brutal.
This war involved the Canary aborigines, called Guanches, and the conquistadors, on the one hand sent by the Crown of Castile and on the other sent by the Crown of Portugal. Both kingdoms coveted control of these islands, which were so strategic in their overseas territorial expansion.

It is a wargame for two players, where the Castilians slowly but continuously land on each of the 7 islands through the arrival of ships loaded with conquerors and the Guanches try by all means to stop and expel the newcomers to their earthly paradise. The game is played by secret and simultaneous orders and with the help of two decks of event cards, so the turns are a lot of fun and with variable strategy adapted to the moment.
The battles are resolved on a Battle mat with special rules for mountain regions. There are also naval battles. The Castilian player wins if he has conquered the 7 Canary Islands in the last turn.

—description from the designer

Masqueoca NAC wargames en su proyecto de fomento de juegos con temática nacional ha tenido a bien incluir en su programa uno con temática hasta ahora inédita y original, y que como diseñador canario es una gran satisfacción para mi presentar. Madera contra Acero, La Conquista de Canarias. Ya el titulo nos da una pequeña pista de la desigualdad en armamento en los bandos implicados en esta guerra. Las armas de madera y piedra de los guanches contra el hierro y acero de los conquistadores de la Corona de Castilla. Pero que no llame a engaño, aun siendo una lucha muy desigual, la conquista de todo el archipiélago duró nada menos que 94 años, prácticamente todo un siglo de combates, precisamente el siglo XV, ello es un indicador suficiente para entender que aquello no fue un paseo militar. Como comparación la conquista de America duró unos 40 años. Se hace necesario destacar que el choque entre los indígenas canarios y las tropas castellanas fue brutal.
Esta guerra en la que intervinieron los aborígenes canarios, llamados guanches, y los conquistadores , por un lado enviados por la Corona de Castilla y por otro enviados por la Corona de Portugal. Ya que ambos reinos codiciaban el control de estas islas tan estratégicas en su expansión territorial de ultramar.
Es un wargame para dos jugadores, donde el castellano mediante la llegada lenta pero continua de barcos cargados de conquistadores va desembarcando en cada una de las 7 islas y los guanches intentan por todos los medios frenar y expulsar a los recién llegados a su paraíso terrenal. Se juega mediante ordenes secretas y simultaneas y con la ayuda de dos mazos de cartas de eventos , con lo cual los turnos son muy divertidos y con estrategia variable adaptada al momento. Las batallas se resuelven en un mapa de batalla anexo con reglas especiales para las regiones montañosas. También hay batallas navales.
El jugador castellano ganará si en el ultimo turno ha conquistado las 7 islas canarias.

—description from the designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Ordering, Zone of Control

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Düstere Zeiten – Der Marsch der Trolle
description:
Der Marsch der Trolle ("The march of the trolls") is an official free print & play legend for the expansion "Düstere Zeiten" to the base game Legends of Andor.

This tricky bonus legend is chronologically set between the second and the third Düstere Zeiten legend.

The heroes fight for the kingdom of Andor in the Troll Wars while trying to recover the two stolen shields of power. Their many opponents are lead by three big trolls.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Cosmic Clash Starter Set
description:
Marvel's First Family the Fantastic Four and their greatest foes face off! In Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Cosmic Clash, you and up to 3 friends can battle it out on the tabletop with tactics, teamwork, science, and sorcery!

This brand-new starter set features Mr. Fantastic, Invisible Woman, Human Torch, The Thing, Silver Surfer, and Dr. Doom, each with incredible poses and multiple points lines to play with for maximum flexibility when building teams! Team up the Fantastic Four against Dr. Doom, play 4-player games with Mr. Fantastic and Invisible Woman vs. Human Torch and The Thing vs. Silver Surfer and Dr. Doom, or play any other combination you like!

Additionally, this starter set comes with special scenario and campaign gameplay to explore, dice with the Fantastic Four logo that you would normally only find in a Dice & Token Pack, and 4 full-color maps featuring iconic Fantastic Four settings like Mr. Fantastic's Lab and Doom's Castle with location gameplay abilities!

This boxed-set is a great way for 1 to 4 players to learn HeroClix! Play with the contents of this starter set or combine it with other HeroClix figures for even more fun!
This starter set contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix (Exact game components subject to change): - 6 HeroClix Figures - 6 HeroClix Character Cards - 18 Object and Terrain Tokens - 4 Full-Color Maps - 2 Six-Sided dice with the Fantastic Four logo - 1 HeroClix Powers & Abilities Card - 1 HeroClix Core Rulebook - 1 Scenario/Campaign Rulebook
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Hotdog
description:
Hotdog is a two player trick-taking game. At the beginning of each round, players will have a chance to pick the card ranking, trump suit, and a special rank. Along with a hand of cards, each player will also be dealt a plate of cards. Plate cards count as part of the player’s hand, but they are visible for all to see.

What sets Hotdog apart from other trick taking games is the choice of rank. During the bidding phase, players can pick whether cards rank normally (Ace - 9), or with the 9 ranked low up through Ace. Players also have the option to play with "the works" meaning the order of rank will change each trick!

Points are awarded based on the outcome of the bidding phase and how many tricks each player captures. The first player to earn 5 game points wins.

-description from designer

name: Rollasaurus
description:
Take a trip back in time as you roll the dice and find the dinosaur that matches the colour and pattern that was rolled. The first player to fill up their scene with dinosaurs and do their best dino roar is the winner!

Not only is this game educational, it will test Colour, number and pattern recognition as well as coordination and reflexes.

The player boards feature simple facts about the dinosaurs in the game too, it also includes a golden dinosaur trophy to award to the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: Fortress of Terror: Maze of the Minotaur
description:
Due to your defeat of Bram at the Fortress of Terror and your destruction of the Temple of Despair, your name is becoming known to the neighboring lands. The fabled King Minos of a distant land has commissioned the construction of a labyrinth of unparalleled craftsmanship, and he claims to need your help in ridding the lands of a terrible, man-eating monster called the Minotaur. But there is something the king has failed to tell you...

In Maze of the Minotaur, you must navigate the ever-shifting labyrinth in search of the wandering Minotaur and defeat him in combat. The labyrinth is not only shifting, however - but also collapsing all around you. Additionally, the Minotaur has crafted the labyrinth to close in around you as you move, preventing you from retracing your steps! Once you have defeated the Minotaur, enter the tower at the center of the maze to free the labyrinth's architect Daedalus and his son Icarus and fly them to freedom!

Maze of the Minotaur is the third Fantasy Adventure Module in the Roll-With-It system, a modular, solitaire roll-and-write adventure game system with endless possibilities for adventure through an accomplish-the-task-and-escape-the-maze-style gameplay.

Gameplay is centered around a maze or map, through which the player must navigate, accomplish some objective(s), and escape the map under pressure from the enemy's attacks via the Doom die. The simple, puzzley, maze-style gameplay is approached differently in each adventure, building on the basic rules with new rules, concepts, and components that make each adventure feel fresh and unique.

-description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Velonimo: Legends
description:
6 promo cards to add to the game, offered at conventions and by board game stores.

Rules
5 Legendary Sports Managers
Each player receives a random Legendary Sports Manager Card at the beginning of the game and place it in front of them.
You may use it only if you don't own the Peas-and-Carrots Jersey. When you use your card, flip it face down.
The player with the fewest points may reactivate their Sports Managers Cards at the end of the round.

Broom Wagon
At the end of each round, the player who finished last takes the card and place it face up in front of them.
Once per round, they may play it to add +5 to their attack.
The Broom Wagon cannot be played with a Baroudeur (Hare).
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Ladder Climbing, Trick-taking

name: Rugby World
description:
Play a rugby union match with real stats (attack and defence rating at home and away).

The game system is the same that the well known The Beautiful Game which is also done by mr terry goodchild. Stats of the 2 teams give the number of scoring opportunity (chance or half-chance cards). Many expansions exist and it is easy to create new expansions
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Memoria Bluff
description:
Introduction
You and your fellows have reached the city of Memoria, this mythical territory where snatches of memories come back to the mind of those who come in. Unfortunately, only one of you will be allowed to leave the city with his/her « new » memories. To be the chosen one, you’ll have to tell a memory or a lie while messing up with your companions’ minds.

Goal
The goal of the game is to tell a memory based on random pictures. If you don’t remember any memory with these pictures, you can still bluff creating a false memory, but try to be convincing! Indeed, to score points when you are the Speaker, you have to mislead the other players (in other words you must make them believe your memory is false when in fact it is true, or true when it is actually false).

ROUND 1
IN THE HEART OF THE CITY
You penetrate the heart of Memoria city. Snatches are springing up everywhere. Choose carefully the ones you’ll associate to tell or reinvente your story.
1) Everybody has 90 seconds to remember or to imagine a memory with the six visible cards (you can use your phone timer or leave it up to players to decide when they are ready to tell a memory). You don’t have to include the whole six cards to your memory. It is possible to tell a memory using only one card out of the six ones you picked.

2) Once everybody’s ready, the older player is designated as the Speaker. Then, he places in front of him and face down his « Bluff » card if he’s going to lie or his « Memoria » card, if he’s going to tell the truth. Then, he declares the number of pictures he’ll use in his memory and then tells it.

3) Once his memory has been told, each player (beginning with the player who is placed on his left) can ask a question to the Speaker if he wants to, in order to gather more information, or to unsettle him to see how he’ll react (If the Speaker’s memory is true, he has to answer the questions honestly. If his memory is false, he can tell what he wants).

4) Then, each player has to decide if the Speaker’s memory was true or false, placing his Memoria or Bluff card in front of him (His Memoria card if he thinks it was true, his Bluff card, if he thinks it was a lie).

5) Then, beginning with the player placed on the Speaker’s left, each player reveals his card, explaining if he wants to, why he believed or not in the Speaker’s memory. Then, the Speaker shows his own « Memoria » or « Bluff » card et gives some details about his story if he wants to.

6) Then, you have to count the points (see the following paragraph « How to count points »).

7) Then, the player who was sitting on the Speaker’s left becomes the Speaker, and so on and so forth until everybody’s been Speaker once.

8) Once the round is over, the 6 used « Snatch » cards are discarded.

ROUND 2
ON YOUR WAY BACK
It’s time to go back. You and your adventure fellows are about to leave the city of Memoria. Some snatches are still springing but soon, everything will turn back to the way it was before entering the city... However, one of you will have the privilege to keep in mind his new memories. But who ?

1) The Speaker draws the first « Snatch » card from the deck and has 45 seconds to remember or imagine a memory linked to this card.

2) He puts his « Memoria » or « Bluff » card in front of him and tells his memory.

3) The other players use their « Memoria » or « Bluff » card to decide if the Speaker’s memory was true or false. Contrary to the first round, they can’t ask him any questions.

4) The Speaker scores 3 points for each player who was wrong about his memory. The other players scores 3 points if they were right about the Speaker’s memory.

5) The drawn « Snatch » card is discarded and replaced with another one. Then, the player who was sitting on the Speaker’s left becomes the Speaker, and so on and so forth until everybody’s been Speaker twice during this round.

6) The game is over ! It’s time for you and your fellows to leave Memoria city. The one who has the highest score keeps his new memories with him. In case of a tie, don’t hesitate to go back to the city to decide who is the worthiest time traveller.

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Events, Memory, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Secret Unit Deployment

name: SeaLiT: Mediterranean Ships and Trade in the Long Nineteenth Century
description:
SeaLiT the game is the fruit of a research project in Maritime History, the ERC STG 2016 project entitled ‘Seafaring Lives in Transition, Mediterranean Maritime Labour and Shipping, 1850s-1920s’(SeaLiT). The game is an entertaining and educational journey into the world of maritime history of the Mediterranean and Black Sea during the long nineteenth century, namely from the French Revolution to the World War I as defined by the historian Eric Hobsbawm.

In the game players take on the role of shipowners and must develop their business, upgrade their ships, and adapt their strategies to the changing circumstances caused by external factors. While playing the game, players will explore the universe of maritime trade, they will get a feel for its mechanisms and its historical evolution and they will learn more about:

The main types of sailing ships and steam ships used in maritime trade.
The important ports of the Mediterranean and the Black Sea in the nineteenth century.
The important commodities traded during this period.
The navigation rules that dictated the way ships sailed back in time.
The mechanisms of shipping industry like demand, freight rates, insurance, ship repairing etc.
The external factors that affected shipping industry like wars, epidemics, strikes etc.


Players acting like shipowners seek to overcome their opponents financially. Due to the long number of rounds (120) which coincides with each year from 1790 to 1910, players may choose to start the game at any year and they also may decide to finish it after any number of rounds. An average number of 30 to 40 rounds coincides with approximately two and a half to three hours of play. Thus, the game offers indirectly different scenarios corresponding at different periods (age of sail, 1790-1830, age of early steamships 1840 to 1860 and so on). The winner is determined by the player who possesses more value after counting money, value of ships and value of cargo, minus any loans he/she might owe to the bank.

The players move in the map through the navigation cards, which determine the speed of the ships/pawns, and various events that occur (gales, pirates, shipwrecks, fire). Players seek to sell the carrying cargo, to buy bigger and technologically more advanced vessels and to capture most of the Mediterranean market. In the age of sail period, 1790-1830, they also can buy one or more privateers to capture and convert other players' ships. They have to roll the dice only when they have to determine the demand (high or low) of the ten commodities of the game every five rounds, and when they have to face pirates or privateers.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Investment, Market, Multi-Use Cards, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Lidera tu Tribu
description:
Lidera tu Tribu is a fast and dynamic strategy game that invites you to have a good time with friends, family or even break the ice with strangers!

Each player must lead a match of 3 rounds. In each round, the leader must define a goal and those who meet it add points.

The advantage? If all Tribe members meet the target, the leader gets twice as many points as the rest. Can you make your Tribe follow you?

The game is a deck of 100 cards that allows you to take it everywhere, it is not necessary to use a table or board.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Unlucky Adventurers
description:
Unlucky Adventurers is a family-friendly card & dice game, where the aim of the game is to eliminate your opponents, while keeping as many cards as possible.

For 2-6 players, play against each other or in teams, using both strategy and luck to outwit your fellow players and earn yourself the lofty title of "Reasonably Lucky Adventurer".

From perplexing potions to awesome actions and everything in between, you'll find 126 cards in total across 3 decks to try your luck with on your adventures.

With over 90 unique cards, each with their own subtle (or sometimes blatant) nods to your favourite fantasy films, table-top games, pop-culture references and more, there is something for everyone to enjoy.

No fantasy adventure would be complete without the chance to encounter a whole host of weird and wonderful creatures, and Unlucky Adventurers is no different.

With 12 unique monsters to face off against, will you be able to fend them off and keep your loot?

Each player starts with 1 character card and 7 cards from the Quest Deck. Each turn you draw 1 card from the Quest Deck and play 1 card from your hand.

The aim is simple. Try to eliminate your opponent while keeping as many cards for yourself, but watch out for blunders and beast encounters!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: Sigil
description:
Sigil is an abstract strategy dueling game.

Place stones to surround and crush opposing pieces. A board of Sigil is populated by 9 random spells. If you fully control a spell, you may sacrifice your stones in it for a powerful effect.

Can you outwit your opponent and gain control of the Sigil?

A game of Sigil ends either when one player has a 3-stone advantage, or when either player casts their 6th spell. Whoever has the most stones wins.

-description from publisher

name: Calendra
description:
Calendra is a Celtic Themed Runic Card Game designed for 2-4 players. The game comes with: 120 playing cards, 4 seasonal rule cards, an 8 page rule book, and a sturdy cardboard box.

Players start the game by selecting a random rule card, which determines which suit they will be representing from the playing cards for the duration of the game. The mechanics feature deck-building and quick poker-like rounds of play, where each player puts one card face up on the table per turn in an attempt to form a specific combination of cards. If they form a round winning hand in a combination of suits they win the round, but if they can form a round winning hand using only cards from their own suit (in a flush) then they win the game.

Warning! Many of the cards allow you to swap cards with other players in the game. As such, the goal of this game is to outwit, trick, and deceive the other players while cleverly assembling a winning hand that cannot be prevented.

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Negotiation, Neighbor Scope, Pattern Building

name: Dice Theme Park: Promo Pack 2
description:
A pack of 7 cards that was originally available during the Dice Theme Park Kickstarter campaign.

1 card is for Dice Theme Park (Dice Theme Park: Medic Administrator Promo Card) while the other 6 cards (Dice Hospital: ER – Emergency Roll: VIPs Promo) are for Dice Hospital: ER – Emergency Roll.

name: Titans: Monuments
description: This expansion adds 15 unnamed monument cards and 15 monument tokens (3 for each of the nations). Each monument has a different effect (special ability) and makes each nation in the game even more unique. Monuments are built by discarding the indicated amount of support cards.

name: Tactigon
description:
Tactigon is a two player game with a simple ruleset and quick set up. Games typically run 10-15 minutes, so most players like to play multiple games in a sitting.

There are two basic concepts at the root of Tactigon:

Firstly, the geometry of the pieces are related to how they move. For example, the “Prism” piece resembles a triangle, so it is able to move up to 3 spaces in a turn.

Secondly, “slower” pieces are more powerful than “faster” pieces, so each piece has key strengths that can impact your strategy.

There are also two ways to win in this game, either by controlling certain spots on the board or capturing your opponent's key piece, the Pentagon.
You must always be on your guard while aggressively maneuvering in order to gain the advantage.

The rules are simple and the gameplay is intense.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, King of the Hill, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Single Loser Game

name: Imagenius: Extra Cards #1
description: Imagenius: Extra Cards #1 contains fifty new cards for use with Imagenius, with new formulas to be solved and new objects to be discovered.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Splendor: Marvel – Helicarrier/Hydra Base Promo Location Tile
description:
This was given out to participants of the Splendor: Marvel tournaments at Gen Con 2022.

A double-sided location tile for Splendor: Marvel with Helicarrier on one side and Hydra Base on the opposite. Both sides are worth 3 Infinity Points.

Helicarrier requires 4 Space (Blue) and 4 Power (Purple) to claim.

Hydra Base requires 3 Mind (Yellow), 3 Soul (Orange), and 3 Reality (Red) to claim.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game

name: Zone 25
description:
2048: The robots have taken over and the few human survivors are trying to hide.
You play as Carl, designated to search for a cure for the deadly epidemic that threatens.
Manage your food, limit your combat wounds, scan the environment for equipment, medicine and plants. Will you be captured by the surveillance drones? Shot down by the robots?
Make wise choices to save your community, because you are the hero!

Zone 25 is a comic combined with a game, one title in a series subtitled "The comic in which you are the hero". You embody a character in a immersive story in which your choices guide your progress. You have a character sheet akin to those used in role-playing games that tracks your possessions, your your coins, and your victory points. In general, gameplay consists in following the comic's panels — which contain clues, riddles and traps — and making choices about where to go and what to do, while using your visual perception to collect clues and be smart enough to resolve the riddles. As in any game, you can lose — sometimes really badly!

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ediciones MasQueOca, Makaka Editions, Van Ryder Games

name: B17 Twenty Five Missions: Pack I
description:
This pack contains 15 additional missions (31-45) that can be played seamlessly with the B 17 Twenty five mission base game.

—description from the designer

name: Fortress of Terror: Pyramid of the Mummy
description:
Deep inside an ancient pyramid lies a hidden tomb, well-guarded with traps, puzzles, and monsters that are no longer among the living. Find the secret entrance into the pyramid, explore to discover the tomb - and meet its terrible guardian.

Pyramid of the Mummy is the fifth Fantasy Adventure Module in the Roll-With-It system, a modular, solitaire roll-and-write adventure game system with endless possibilities for adventure through an accomplish-the-task-and-escape-the-maze-style gameplay.

Gameplay is centered around a maze or map, through which the player must navigate, accomplish some objective(s), and escape the map under pressure from the enemy's attacks via the Doom die. The simple, puzzley, maze-style gameplay is approached differently in each adventure, building on the basic rules with new rules, concepts, and components that make each adventure feel fresh and unique.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Line Drawing, Movement Points, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Lớp Học Mật Ngữ: Siêu Thú Ngân Hà
description: In Lớp Học Mật Ngữ: Siêu Thú Ngân Hà (The Classroom: Super Beast Milky Way), you become a physical incarnation of one of the twelve zodiacal symbols and need to capture galactic monsters and ancient super beasts.

name: Microchip
description:
In Microchip, 2 to 5 players compete to create a structure that looks like a microchip with tiles depicting paths and connections.

Rules overview (please refer to rulebook):

MATERIAL

• 5 boards
• Bag
• Box
• 60 tiles in 5 colours, with the same distribution for each colour.

The initial setup depends on the number of players.

Players draw tiles according to some simple constraint and place them on their boards so that:

- The tile colours must match colours of the spaces they’re placed on. The square colours are a bit lighter for clarity.

- The connections of the tiles must match with those of the adjacent tiles (if any).

- Open connections towards the board edge are forbidden.

They can test and re-arrange the tiles on their boards during play.

After all the tiles have been drawn, the players will enjoy a few minutes to build their final microchips. There can be some tiles unused.

The player that created the most valuable microchip wins. The microchip value is the sum of the connections of each of its tiles. Unused tiles are worth minus 2 points.

-description from designer
mechanics: Connections, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Mandale Fruta: Ampliación 5 Jugadores
description:
Adding the 5th player:

Someone takes the orange pieces, then the 5 new cards are shuffled into the bag deck and for each round 6 bag cards are put into dispute. If there are less left in the last round, it will not be necessary to turn the fruit cards face up.

name: Srpsko Carstvo: Vladari i Velmože
description:
Five years after the death of the Serbian emperor Stefan Dušan the Strong, regional lords are gaining strength in the empire. Some became independent while others were loyal to the young heir to the throne. How you will maintain power and which possessions you will unite is up to you.

Roll dice and gather an army to win the area over to your side. You can acquire "free" territories or from your opponents.But opponent defends with a defense dice. Whoever appropriates more areas and has more points at the end is the winner.

name: Warhammer Underworlds: Nethermaze – Deadly Depths Rivals Deck
description:
An expansion for Warhammer Underworlds, compatible with the Rivals format, which uses pre-built card decks so that you can get stuck into the game within minutes. Features 32 new universal cards which can be played with your Warband of choice or used to enhance your existing decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: 1812: The Retreat
description:
In 1812: The Retreat the players are captains of a company leading their soldiers out of Russia during Napoleon's catastrophic campaign of 1812. The players must survive the retreat by making it safely to Vilnius or the Polish border. A soldier that loses all his strength dies on the side of the road or freezes at the bivouac and is disqualified. They can also be captured by the Cossacks. At the end of the game, each soldier is worth a number of victory points. The player with the most points wins the game...but remember: there WILL be casualties!
1812 is a resource management/survival game very high in theme. It is fresh, daring and cutthroat...

The game is played in 3 phases consisting of a number of rounds: From Moscow to Smolensk, from Smolensk to the Berezina and from the Berezina to Vilnius. At the end of each phase, benefits lie in wait for the soldiers in the vanguard arriving at the location first. At the end of each round, a main event card will be drawn which will have consequences for all the soldiers on the board: this can be cold, snow, an attack of the cossacks or maybe a village in the distance that can be explored...

All players have a number of soldiers under their control: an officer, a musician, light infantry, heavy cavalry... Each of them have their own advantages. The loss of any of your soldiers during the game will always have consequences for your company for the remainder of the retreat.


—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Educational, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Negotiation, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Action/Event, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Events, Moving Multiple Units, Negotiation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Away Team: The Voyages of the Pandora
description:
AWAY TEAM: The Voyages of the Pandora is a game of exploring alien worlds in distant star systems. You command the Pandora, an interstellar survey ship on its voyages of discovery. Each voyage sends Pandora to a different star system where you assemble away teams from the ship’s crew and equipment to explore planets, moons and other sites of interest, with the following directives:
- Locate exo-life forms, and document their physiology and behavior;
- Collect exo-DNA, vital to genetic science and human adaptation to life in the stars;
- Identify and survey environments suitable for human settlement and development;
- Search for intelligent life and alien cultures; and if found, establish contact with goodwill;
- Don’t get killed.

AWAY TEAM has three modes of play.
- The solitaire campaign game, provides an epic inter-connected narrative experience for one player across seven star systems; providing over 80 hours of play time, exploration, and plot-twists.
- The solitaire star system game provides one player with a repeatable play experience commanding one Pandora voyage to a single star system. You set the experience level of your crew and the danger level of each voyage.
- The 2-player game puts players in command of competing away teams from Pandora in a voyage to a single star system, also a repeatable play experience.

Forty years ago, John Butterfield designed The Voyage of the BSM Pandora, the ground-breaking solitaire paragraph-driven game for SPI. Now John takes his branching narrative game concept into a new dimension with Away Team: The Voyages of the Pandora.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Bye Bye Dice
description:
This a card flipping fast pace card game.

Aim of the Game is to pick up and align in a row, numbers 1-8 followed by the winner card. You can play the game two ways, easiest is collecting 1-8 of any color you find first, or to make it harder, you must find match all your number cards with the color of the number 1 card you picked up first. You can also remove numbers to make the game shorter in playing time.

How to play the game
1)Place the Token cards to the sides so it is easily reached by all players. This is where used special cards will be placed.

2)Each player takes one My Turn card to keep until they wish to use it at any point in the game. The rest are put to one side.

3)Decide if you are collecting different colors or the same colors of each number.

4)Place all the cards face down on the table, mix them up, and spread them evenly.

5)Anyone goes first by rolling the dice and starts the game. Pass the dice around to the left until someone rolls the BBD a number 6.

6) The player who gets a 6 then starts to pick up cards to try and find a number 1 card, once found the No.2 then the number 2 card, and so on. You must pick up cards in number order. (so if you don’t have a 1, you cannot pick up a 2).

7) You can only pick up one card at a time and you must place it back on the table face down if not needed or not next in the sequence required.

8) While one player is searching for number cards, the other players take it in turn to roll the dice to try and get a 6.

9) When another player rolls the BBD a 6, it becomes their turn to search for number cards. The previous player searching for cards has to stop searching and join the other players in rolling the dice.

10) Game continues until one person has aligned numbers 1-8 plus the winner card

Special cards
1) My turn - Use this when you want to jump in the game
2) Steal - Take a card from any other player
3) Bye Bye Dice - If dice is on the table, pick it up and throw it anywhere you want
4) Any Number - This can be used as any number
5) Stop searching - If you pick this up you must stop searching for cards for five seconds
6) 5 Seconds - All rollers of the dice must stop for five seconds

-description from designer

name: Guadalcanal:  The Battle for Henderson Field, 1942-1943
description:
Guadalcanal: The Battle for Henderson Field, 1942-1943 is a two-player Operational level wargame.

Designed by noted wargame designer Mike Nagel, the game is a true homage to the classic Avalon Hill title as the Japanese and American forces fight bitterly for command of this small island in the South Pacific. It was the first American offensive against Japan in the Pacific, and the prize was the airfield at Henderson Field.

This design features 352 die-cut unit counters; two 19" x 27" map sheets; one 16-page rulebook; two player aid cards (one for each player); nine special event cards; and a die, all in an attractive box. There is no bookkeeping involved, as units are two-sided with reduced step-losses on the reverse, and the game features a very ingenious way of handling hidden movement. The introduction of special event cards adds realistic random events to the game, and unique victory conditions encourage players to consider the entire island and not concentrate solely on Henderson Field.

name: Letterpool
description:
What’s something you can’t do in public? Or something you can lick? A word that starts with a P that a 7-year-old can’t understand? Or a superhero that starts with L?

A game that tests your speed and creativity, Letterpool won’t leave you and your friends yawning. Show off your wit by being the first one to come up with words and grab letters worth points.

REMEMBER: Brevity is the soul of wit!

WITH 2 MODES TO PLAY: PARTY -OR- TRIVIA - for double the fun

—description from the publisher

name: Zombicide: 2nd Edition – Exploding Dice Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Text: Once per turn, you may select an adjacent zone and roll 1 die. If you roll a 6, eliminate all Actors in the zone. Then, select a new zone adjacent to it and make a new roll. if you roll a 1, discard this card.

name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Duck-Footed Pistol Promo Card
description:
Originally available in pack C of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says: If this attack eliminates any Zombies, deal 1 damage to 1 Actor in EACH zone adjacent to the attacker (survivors count as first in the Priority order)

name: Who Knows Where?: United Kingdom & Ireland
description:
Who Knows Where is the award winning game in which you race opponents to be the first player to travel around the UK & Ireland by locating famous places on the map.

The game has over 1250 locations to guess in 5 categories, including cities & towns, events & facts, famous tourist sites & beautiful images of many iconic landmarks.

Fun and educational with flexible rules which allow many different ways to play, making the gam easier or harder and thus accessible and appealing to broad range of ages and abilities.

Use Power Plays and your Clue Card to gain advantage and when you don't know you can piggy back on one of your opponent's guesses. However, choose wisely because if they are wrong you'll be the one going backwards.
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dobrões
description:
Dobrões is a fun game, very easy to play and easy to explain to people. In it, players are pirates who compete against each other to see who will be the richest of the seven mares.

In this delicious game, not even the most skilled pirate can afford to do without luck, as the other pirates won't let you open all the chests and accumulate their riches.

—description from the designer (translated)

All players start with 10 cards (chests) face down. The goal is to get 10 cards (chests) in numerical order from 1 to 10 before any other player! Every great card game has special cards and DOUBLOONS has 07 special action cards, which give greater gameplay and break the legs of other pirates.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Chamber of Wonders: Cinématographe Lumière
description:
Come on ladies & gentlemen, the cinema has arrived in town! Ready to compete for props from old and new films? The show is about to begin!

Cinématographe Lumière expansion homages to a series of cult films will allow you to take advantage of a special token every time you exhibit one of these wonders.
These tokens will give you a random bonus out of the 4 listed below:

Get £ 3
Draw 1 Wonder card
1 Fame token
Activate 1 Contact of your choice immediately.


Tokens are not tied to a specific card but will always be drawn randomly. Also, each card has different values than the others in this expansion

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Agents of M.A.R.S.
description:
Agents of M.A.R.S. is a hidden information abstract strategy game for two players.

Players create a secret objective for themselves assigning colours to certain multipliers.

Following that the players take turns drawing pyramids from a bag and placing them on a board with the goal of trying to either create or prevent the creation of clusters of certain colours.

The game ends when no more spaces remain on the board.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Coverage, Hidden Victory Points

name: BrainBox: Pictures
description: The object of BrainBox: Pictures is to study a card for ten seconds, then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes (or the deck is completed) wins.
publishers: Green Board Game Co., MEBO Games

name: Valour & Fortitude
description:
Valour & Fortitude (V&F for short) is a set of rules that you can download from this website and then use to fight tabletop wargames using the Perry Miniatures range of figures. The rules are complemented by a set of army sheets, that contain the information needed to use one of the armies from the Perry Miniatures range in V&F, and scenarios that provide all the information needed to set up a battle.

The rules, army sheets and scenarios are completely free of charge, and are designed to fit onto just half a dozen sides of A4 paper. All you need to do is download them and print them out and you are good to go! In addition a full colour printed version of V&F is available with the October 2022 issue of Wargames Illustrated magazine, and the magazine itself includes further V&F coverage. You can find out more by visiting the Wargames Illustrated website.

—description from publisher

name: 9D6 Quest
description:
9D6 Quest is a solo dice-management fantasy adventure game. To play you need the game book, 9 six-sided dice, and a pencil. Optional paper miniatures are available for print and play.

You play as a Knight, Bard, Rogue, Dragonslayer, Thief, Scout, Veteran, Witch-Hunter, Chaos Slayer, Cleric, Barbarian, Mage, or Ranger. You travel on one of six different hex maps trying to complete 9 different missions for treasure and glory. Completion of all 9 missions will complete the campaign and allow your hero to retire as a legend.

Each mission plays quickly (10-30 minutes each). You could easily finish a full campaign in one or two sessions.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Les Tontons: éparpillés façon puzzle
description:
Who will take over the Mexican’s business to grow the business?

Play as one of the eight characters from "Les Tontons Flingueurs" - "Crooks in Clover" universe: Fernand, Raoul, Me Folace... and turn around the places where the Mexican managed his small business to harvest the "grisbi" (Loot).

At each turn of the game, you will have to secretly choose the place of destination of your character with regard to the expected gain in it and provide it with a Temperament card to settle its accounts with the competition, show trickery or even increase the collection that you will not fail to make once you have arrived at your destination.

When at the end of the seven rounds everyone will have explained themselves and will have collected the money, it will be time to count their loot.
The richest player wins and Patricia marries the enraged Treble Clef!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Qui prendra la succession des affaires du Mexicain pour faire fructifier le business ?

Incarnez l'un des huit personnages de l'univers des Tontons : Fernand, Raoul, Me Folace… et effectuez la tournée des lieux dans lesquels le Mexicain gérait ses petites affaires pour récolter le grisbi.

Chaque joueur incarne l'un des personnages fameux de l'univers des Tontons. Il se déplacera secrètement vers différents lieux afin d'y récupérer le maximum de pognons tout en se débarrassant de la concurrence à l'aide de cartes tempérament qui lui sont associées ou en augmentant ses gains. L'interaction entre joueurs est permanente. Jeu rapide de bluff et de coups fourrés.

Lorsqu'à l'issue des sept tours chacun se sera expliqué et aura engrangé le pognon, il sera temps de compter son butin. Le joueur le plus riche l'emporte et Patricia se marie avec l'enragé de clef de sol !

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fatty Tuna
description:
In Fatty Tuna, players race to expand their sushi empires, gather ingredients, and trade with other players in order to be the first to complete their menu. Many of the game mechanics—collecting resources from hex-tiles, trading cards with other players, rolling to determine your move—will feel familiar to board game lovers, making the game easy to pick up. However, there are plenty variables and event cards that can make the game infinitely more layered and strategic.

Up to 5 people can play Fatty Tuna, and it can take anywhere from 30 minutes to 2 hours, depending on which menu you chose to play with and the number of players.

—description from the designer

name: Deadball Junior
description:
Deadball Junior is a tabletop game for one or two players that introduces children as young as five to the joys of baseball. Based on the bestselling Deadball: Baseball With Dice, Deadball Junior is lightning fast, easy to learn, and adaptable enough for any kid to make their own. Designed for kids to enjoy with the help of an adult—at first!—it does not require reading to play.

Deadball Junior strips baseball to its essence—hits, runs, and outs—and builds from there. Each at-bat is resolved with a single roll of the dice, allowing for half hour games between teams from the present, the past, or the child’s own boundless imagination. After a few games, a child will know the difference between a single and a double, between a double play and a fielder’s choice. They’ll know when to bunt and when to steal, how to cheer when they win and pick themselves up when they lose. Most importantly, they’ll have a glimpse of how fun baseball can be—and that’s a joy that will last forever.

- Deadball Junior requires only two dice—a d20 and a d6, which you can get online or at your local games store. Aside from the dice, this campaign will give you everything you need to play, including:
- The rules: a basic set for new players and advanced rules like defense and base stealing for kids to add as they master the core game.
Instructions for creating basic and advanced players, with Bonus Traits like “Speedy Runner” or “Power Hitter” that let the stars stand out.
- A guide for adults that includes advice on teaching the game and, when necessary, losing on purpose.
- Five simple rules for kids to follow: “Have fun! Be nice! Make up rules! Winning doesn’t matter! Always say, ‘Good game!’”
- A ten-team international league, the Global Circuit, that features the greatest young players the world has ever seen.
- A beautiful playmat that can be printed in three different sizes.
- All the digital supplements.

Grab the game and start playing today!

name: Squish
description:
Squish is an unification game with the theme of "condensation".

Players take turns moving one of their pieces one space at a time toward an friendly piece on the same line. If a player's piece moves to a space occupied by an opponent's piece, it is captured by replacement. If there is no friendly piece on the same line, the piece cannot move.

The first player to move all of the pieces on the board adjacent to each other or to prevent the opponent from moving wins the game.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal".

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Relative Movement, Static Capture

name: Unlace
description:
Unlace is a blocking game (a game of fighting for room to move) derived from Squish. Starting with the same layout as in Squish, players take turns moving one of their friendly pieces to an adjacent space. However, the moved piece must belong to a larger group than the one before the move.

The player who fails to move during their turn loses.

This game is included in Generic Board "Hexagonal" set.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Relative Movement, Static Capture

name: Mini Crimes: Copia Imperfetta
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: Copia imperfetta (Mini Crimes: Imperfect Copy), the owner of a camera company was found dead in his office. It’s time to zoom on all the details.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: B17 Twenty Five Missions: Pack 2
description:
This pack contains 15 additional missions (46-60) that can be played seamlessly with the B 17 Twenty five mission base game.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Wargame

name: 5 Years to Mars
description:
The space race is heating up once again, and governments have issued their challenge: develop a viable Mars program in five years. The catch, your government will only supply a fixed amount of funding per year. The rest of your budget, and the success of your mission, depend on the success of the projects you fund. But be careful, you’re not the only one in this race!

The winner of the race is the player with the most victory points. Points are awarded for progress in each of the 8 mission objectives. A bonus is given to the first player that completes the entire objective. The game is played over a series of five program years, after which the government funding ceases.

In the first program year, players spend their Space Bucks (Spucks) on funding research in their 5 space station experiment bays. In the following years, players fund projects to further their mission objectives and provide additional funding for the next program year. Research topics reduce the cost of corresponding projects. Action cards can be played to either help yourself or thwart your competitors. Random events are interspersed in the project deck and affect all players.

5 Years to Mars is card-based with a small board to track mission objective progress. The game can be played solo, cooperatively or competitively.

In the cooperative game, all players are working together to complete the 8 mission objectives before the end of the five program years. In order to advance a mission objective, players must work together to fund projects that create sets of mission objective icons. For example, in a five player game to advance your rover mission objective once, you will have to have a set of five cards with mission objective icons. Unlike sets for the competitive game, cards can be used for multiple icon sets.

In the single player game, the goal is also to complete the 8 mission objectives before the end of the five program years. But, some cards are removed from the market after every round so you must plan for the next year.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Crash Octopus: Pink Pirates
description:
Crash Octopus: Pink Pirates is an expansion to Crash Octopus that contains two modules:

Module 1: With the arrival of the Pink Pirate, who is plotting to steal the treasure, Crash Octopus becomes even wilder! If you add the Pink Pirate, up to five people can play. One player acts as a pirate and aims to steal the treasure of the other players.

Module 2: With the addition of the "Kid Octopus", chaos breaks out on the sea. When used in conjunction with the Octopus Head, the Kid Octopus Head makes the Octopus' attacking action even more threatening.

The Crash Octopus Pink Pirates Expansion includes the following components:
4 x Roses
4 x Wine Bottles
1 x Small Octopus
1 x Pink Pirate Ship
1 x Octo-Cannon
2 x Pirate Flags
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Pirates

name: What a Cowboy!
description:
What a Cowboy! is a set of rules for Wild West gunfights played with miniatures. It allows multiple players to have shoot-outs or play a campaign in which they may see their characters progress.

Players roll action dice and use them for moving, spotting, aiming, shooting or reloading. Bonanza tokens allow interruptions of other players' moves. Characters can have special traits that allow them to change action dice or do other things that give them an advantage.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random

name: Chaves: Confusões na Vila
description:
Chaves: Confusões na Vila, it's a fun card game that features 3 different ways to play, with the same components, all of them inspired by the characteristics of the characters from the most beloved village in the world.

In the first game mode, each player will receive 3 cards each turn from the deck and draft, passing 2 cards to the player on his left. After that, all players will place a card on the left and another card on the right, confronting them with those of the other players. Each card has an icon that shows which card it wins. In each space, it will be checked who won, and the winner receives the card as points. The first to score 25 points wins the round and scores points. At the end of 3 rounds, the player with the most accumulated points is the winner.

In the second game mode, each player receives 7 cards from the deck and wins the round by getting rid of all the cards in the hand. A card from the deck is opened in the center of the play area and, clockwise, players will try to play a card from their hand that has an icon related to the card in the play area. If not, he must draw 1 card from the deck. At the end of 3 rounds, whoever has won the most rounds is the winner.

In the third game mode, each player receives 2 cards from the deck. In each turn, the current player must perform one of the following actions: 1. play and apply the effect of his card; 2. Discard up to 2 cards and draw new cards from the deck. The round continues until one player reaches 25 points, thus winning the round. At the end of 3 rounds, whoever has the most accumulated points is the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: KHARMA!
description:
Once Kharma starts to accumulate among your friends and family you will want to give it back to them and you won't be able to stop playing. If you want to win, you will have to play your cards wisely, ally and betray other players to accumulate the lowest Kharma score possible at the end of each round and win the game.

Based on the mechanics of the classic Middle Eastern game Tamalou, it combines scoring based on set collection, easy gameplay and cards with special abilities.

name: Jungle Taquin
description:
It's party time in the jungle and all the animals have scattered. Now you have to straighten them out!
It's like a game of tangram where you arrange the tiles to replicate the shapes on the game cards and earn as many points as you can.

—description from the publisher

name: Overboss Duel: Void Tile set
description: A limited bonus terrain set (comprising tiles, monster, crystal), offered with preorder of the game directly from the publisher.

name: Grand Prix Re-Run 2000
description:
Grand Prix Re-Run provides a quick and clean way of replaying seasons of Formula One, producing accurate and realistic results and offering the excitement of Qualifying for each race, it takes about an hour to play each race.

Driver and car combinations have different potential and varying degrees of reliability both in terms of breakdown and crash propensity. The driver/car combinations are each given a Seasonal Rating reflecting their performance over the season, together with Crash and Reliability Ratings.

name: Majestic 13
description:
Majestic 13 is miniatures-agnostic tabletop wargame where you command an elite team of alien hunters in a secret war to protect the Earth. Designed to play solo, co-op, or as an adversarial skirmish game, Majestic 13 is created by Adam Loper and Vincent Venturella for 1-2 players.

From the book: "To the public, the modern era of alien encounters started in Roswell, New Mexico, on July 8th, 1947, with reports of a downed alien craft, which were quickly retracted and replaced by the story of a weather balloon. The public remains suspicious but accepts the story and moves on. Conspiracy theorists claim the government absconded with alien bodies and technology and hid everything from the people. Both stories are, of course, wrong."

Use any modern soldier miniatures you'd like for your team, and any kinds of weird creature models for the alien monsters you'll fight. Enjoy a deep campaign system with random mission generation and planned special missions, too. Keep upgrading your team members that survive each mission, and bring out new clones for the ones that don't.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Small Railroad Empires: Achievement Cards Promo Pack
description:
Pack of five promo cards available as add-on during the Freight on Board Kickstarter.

Included are:

Unlocked Potential: I have used both of my locked tracks.
Forest Route: I have constructed tracks on 5 forest spaces anywhere on the board.
Idyllic Route: I have constructed tracks on 6 farmland spaces anywhere on the board.
Through the Desert: I have constructed tracks on 6 desert spaces anywhere on the board.
Connection Master: I have constructed tracks or trains on 6 city spaces anywhere on the board. (Does not have to be deliveries)

Cards come in a small paper box with an explanation sheet.

name: The Arkham Asylum Files: Panic in Gotham City
description:
The Arkham Asylum Files: Panic in Gotham City is a first-of-its-kind game that seamlessly blends state-of-the-art AR technology with immersive storytelling. This epic new form of at-home entertainment combines the best elements of collaborative play to immerse players deep inside Batman’s universe in a way that revolutionizes game night.

The Arkham Asylum Files literally “comes to life,” overlaying digital content on physical elements using a free app on your iPhone or iPad. Hosted by The Joker, the easy to use app unlocks animated and live-action story scenes, 3D graphics, gameplay, an original score and other fun surprises. The box holds over one hundred game elements, including top secret Arkham Asylum files, classified Gotham City police evidence, custom game boards, mysterious artifacts, and collectibles. The adventure will also have expansion packs and downloadable content to extend The Arkham Asylum Files experience over time.

In Panic in Gotham City, there’s a new threat in town and it’s up to you to solve the mystery and save the day. The story unfolds over 7 action-packed chapters, which can be played separately or binged like your favorite television series in one session. Players join forces with HARLEY QUINN to unmask Gotham City’s most infamous villains by digging deep into their Arkham Asylum files. Working together with family and friends, players will build Gotham City and solve mind-bending puzzles to match wits with The Joker and unravel a brand-new, visually stunning epic story behind Arkham Asylum’s most notorious inmates.

—description form the publisher
categories: City Building, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Team-Up Miniatures Game – Teen Titans Go! and Scooby-Doo!
description:
Looks like we have another mystery to solve! Two of the greatest clue-crunching crews make their HeroClix debut in the DC Comics HeroClix: Batman Team-Up Miniatures Game!

For the first time ever, help Mystery Inc. work up an appetite as Scooby-Doo, Shaggy, Fred, Velma and Daphne go head-to-head with ace detectives Robin, Starfire, Raven, Beast-Boy and Cyborg from Teen Titans GO! Pick a team and help them gather clues to come out on top in one of the most exciting crossovers ever to come to HeroClix!

Engage in up to 8 thrilling campaign scenarios for 2 players where the results matter from session to session, or sit down for a head-to-head single match of raw power! Each of the beautiful pre-painted figures comes ready to play with two different modes making this box incredible for both first-time miniatures players and HeroClix veterans!

Putting those sleuthing skills to the test, brand new Mystery Cards will bring an exciting layer of strategy to gameplay as players move around the map to gather clues and earn unique bonuses and rewards!

Complete with thick, double-sided map components and unique Batman Team-Up themed dice, this set contains everything 2 people need to play Heroclix. With so much exciting content in one box, it's no mystery that the Miniatures Game has been a massive hit with retailers and customers!

—description from the publisher

name: Ecologies: Solar System
description:
What happens when a biology teacher, a NASA JPL educator, and an award winning artist get together to imagine astrobiology in our neighborhood?
⠀
This new game puts a unique twist on the original Ecologies concept by including new “Life Requirements,” and “Celestial Bodies” instead of biomes.
⠀
It’s all about building healthy food webs on different worlds. If you create a healthy ecology you get the perks and powers of that Celestial Body. Each organism card lists what it eats and what it’s eaten by. You arrange them with plants on the bottom, predators on top. There is a trade mechanic where you trade with others based on what you need and what they need. It is a race to get 12 victory points and different organisms give different points. There are factor cards that can affect opponents and different strategies such as focusing on one biome, going for perks and bonuses, or attacking other ecologies.
⠀
—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Negotiation, Set Collection, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: The Massive-Verse Fighting Card Game
description:
A lightning quick duel between characters from the Massive-Verse. Powered by the Pocket Paragons game system.

Pocket Paragons is a quick deceptively simple game of big spells and big reads. Take their HP down to 0 or deliver a carefully placed Execute to take your opponent out in an instant!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Biohazard
description:
Biohazard is a competitive strategy game for 1 to 4 players.

During the game, players need to manage resources to protect the world from a spreading biological pathogen. Players are assigned different areas and objectives at the beginning of the game and, by turns, perform different actions to create synergies and score points.

Easy to learn but hard to master, Biohazard brings some innovative mechanics to the euro genre by adding a discrete level of randomness that forces you to collaborate with your opponents and adapt your strategy as the game evolves.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Territory Building, Travel
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Cards Against Humanity: Hot Box
description:
As the dawn breaks on a new era of Cards Against Humanity, an enormous new expansion emerges on the horizon. Bathing the world in its glorious light is the all-new Hot Box, featuring 300 scorching cards to set your deck of Cards Against Humanity ON FIRE!

300 fresh cards to spice up your deck of Cards Against Humanity.
Brand new for 2023.
Features a massive image of the sun.

—description from the publisher

name: Nerthania: Collapsing World
description:
Nerthania is a boardgame where players become a chieftain of one of four different archaic tribes which wage war against the other tribes.
247 years ago the world of Nerthania was hidden by an energy impact which lead to an burst and activity of the tectonic plates. Start your game with an individual formed world of water, grassland and rocky tiles. For the game setup you get a huge water map on which the grassland and rocky tiles where put on top. By replacing or removing the grassland and rocky tiles you create the boardgame map and change it during the game.

Game-play:
Players collect income. They invest in units, buildings, battle card upgrades and terraforming actions.
Attack adjaced areas with your battle units. Battles are solved with battle dice and battle cards depending on the involved battle unit types.
Establish military buildings to recruit stronger units or establish hunting buildings to increase your income. Develop your battle cards to improve your fighting power.
Random and player induced terraforming happens during the game so be on your guard.

Goal of the game:
Become the "Greatest Chief of Nerthania" by conquering predetermined areas and by reaching special victory conditions or form alliances and force your opponents to surrender.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Power Grid: Industrial Espionage
description:
Power Grid: Industrial Espionage is a promotional card for Power Grid.

Power Grid: Industrial Espionage gives a single player information about the topmost card in the power plant or technology draw pile. After buying a card from the market, the player must give the Industrial Espionage card to the previous player in turn order.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing

name: Age of Automaton
description:
In Age of Automaton, you are a robotics lab owner. You try to earn as many lab points as you can by building, developing, testing, and selling automatons; buying new equipment for your lab; and making relationship with mega-corps.

The game is played in five rounds, and each round consists of six phases: Data Sharing, Actions, CSR, Audit, Clean Up, and Adjust Turn Order. The most focused phase is the Actions phase, during which all players alternately play one action at a time in turn order. Players have three actions in the first three rounds, then four actions for the final two rounds.

The main actions which you can choose are Test-Runs, Equipment, R&D, Sale, Fund Raising, Building Automatons, Gathering Data, and Sponsorship. Other than these main actions, you can use specialist abilities and lab equipment, as well as play as many special actions as you can.

At the end of the fifth round, the player with the highest lab score wins.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: My First Adventure: The Infinite Library
description:
Today, a nasty wizard has stolen the Book of Knowledge of your peoples !
Today, you will have to follow him and fight in his infinite Library.

Which magician do you want to play?

Lilon the air elf, a flier and healer of all ills?
Camille the enchantress, the never chilly mistress of the ice?
Lucien the fire wizard, an everyday tamer of flames?

Choose your character and enter a story like no other, a story where each of your choices changes your adventure !

The Infinite Library is the 9th book in the "My First Adventure" collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero.

—description from the publisher

name: Gossip Goose
description:
There's been a goose killing in Goose Village.
The first goose witnessed the incident.
But as geese, we can only send messages through body language
And there are some evil geese forces hidden in the Goose Village.
Can we help the police goose to find the last murderer?

name: 激闘！ロンメル軍集団 (Fierce Fight! Army Group Rommel)
description:
The Battle of Tunisia (1943), the last battle of the North African campaign of the famous general Rommel, is recreated with the "Fierce Fight! Army Group Manstein" system.
Will you be able to bring the German African Army Group to a glorious end?

Published in Game Journal #88 with 激闘！マッカーサー国連軍 (Fierce Fight! MacArthur's Last Battles)

name: King of the Dice: Junior
description:
King of the Dice: Junior is the new junior version of the successful board game from HABA. Children aged 4 and up try to build a castle as quickly as possible for the coronation of their new king of the dice. To do this, they must use three dice to achieve the most varied conditions on the playing cards. As a joker help with unsuccessful throws the crowns made of wood. These can be helpful to get hold of the 5 playing cards as quickly as possible and thus close the castle courtyard! Who in this imaginative world full of elves and orcs at the end of his castle completed first is the winner and dice king!

—description from the publisher

name: Deleted
description:
To win the game, the player who plays after you must no longer have any cards in hand.
During each turn, each player must play one card. As soon as a player has emptied his hand, they are 'DELETED' and the game ends, offering victory to the player before them in the current direction of play.

name: Terraforming Mars: Amazonis Planitia
description:
Amazonis Planitia is a fan-made board designed to make 4-5 player games more interesting.

It comes with additional 14 City/Greenery + 2 Ocean Tiles and.

name: Final Girl: Hell to Pay
description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

You're not perfect. You've made your share of mistakes. In fact, maybe you deserve to be in this shifting Hellscape... but then again, maybe you don't. Razorface is a killer that will force you to reckon with yourself and deal with your "afflictions." He draws power from them and horrible mutilation and suffering await you if you find yourself unable to do so.

The Hellscape is a maze that is ever-changing. The sights you'll see may draw you in with ecstasy one moment and then horrify you completely the next. Will you stay in hell for eternity? Or will you be able to escape alive and get back to your normal life?

-- description by the publisher

name: Dibs!
description:
Join grandpa Jones on his annual family weekend into the woods. The player who collects the most treasure points wins a spot in the family trophy room.

DIBS! is an interactive, real-time speed matching card game that plays under 30 minutes for ages 8 and up. You play as one of 5 characters and try to collect the most treasures by tactically tossing cards from your hand on a shared pile.
The cards need to correspond to a number of dice that were thrown upfront.

—description from the publisher

name: Wandering Towers: Mini Spell Expansion 3
description:
This expansion includes 2 New Magic Spells for Wandering Towers. New Spells included are Fill a Potion Bottle and Extra Die Roll.

FILL A POTION BOTTLE: If you use this magic spell, you may flip one of your own empty magic potion flask to the full side.

EXTRA DIE ROLL: If you use this magic spell, you may roll a new movement value with the die after a movement card is played, instead of moving the value indicated on the card. If the movement card shows a die or dice, you may roll the die again. In both cases you have to move the result of the roll.

- description from publisher

name: LOOM: Portent of the Vale
description:
'LOOM' is a print and play fantasy adventure game. Using a map and character sheet, alongside procedurally generated paragraphs, you will explore a dark and twisted world of fantastical horror. Weave your own story as you play, find rare items, uncover hidden secrets, and use your 'Command List' to interact with the world. With nothing more than playing cards, dice and a pencil, you will generate and play through a story of longing, of defeat, and of a broken world. Deadly foes await, cosmic gods scheme, and the Vale darkens...

At the start of each game, you create a character from a predefined series of options. On your turn, move across the map grid of the Vale by using a movement point. Generate a story paragraph by using a 52 deck of cards and two dice. The story paragraph will dictate which actions are available to you.

Will you fight an enemy or search a building? Assist an NPC with a quest or pray at a shrine? Search for Tracks or Forage for Items? All outcomes and recorded on your character sheet.

Once your movement points are used up, set up camp for the night and hope you get some good rest for the day ahead.

The game ends when you reach the northernmost sanctuary, or your character dies - Only through death however, will you unlock powerful items to aid you in future playthroughs.
Each ending is dictated by the state of the world and your character as influenced by your actions and outcomes.

Which of the game's 30 Endings will you reach this time?
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Bier Pioniere: August Oetker Promo Card
description:
A new person card for Bier Pioniere.

Power:

Chose up to 2 different: remove 1 blocking stone/token / pay 2 coins for 1 movement of the cube/Pay 1 coin for 1 "brewery development"

name: Subtext Showdown
description: This is a game of wild associations and intuitive connections! Pick two or more cards from the deck, blend their concepts, and secretly jot down a word that perfectly ties them together. For instance, link “frozen” and “sweet” to guide fellow players towards guessing “ice cream.” Earn points for both correct guesses and matching wrong answers with others, as it’s all about syncing minds and thinking alike!

name: Operation Barclay
description:
Operation Barclay is a two-player game of low/medium complexity about the intelligence war between the Allies and their Abwehr counterparts in the Mediterranean theater in 1942-1943.

With the Axis powers ejected from North Africa, there was debate as to where the Allies might strike next. At Casablanca (January 14-24, 1943), Roosevelt and Churchill agreed the next target: Operation Husky, the invasion of Sicily, would begin July 9 1943 — but there was a problem. The Axis powers suspected Sicily would be the target, and knew there were deception activities in motion to attempt to mislead them about what they already knew.

On top of this, with Operation Husky already planned for early July, there was little time for Allied intelligence to work with. In these six months, Allied intelligence had to create sufficient disinformation to persuade their intelligence counterparts, the Abwehr, that the primary attack and a suspected secondary attack would be aimed elsewhere within the Mediterranean. This essential intelligence operation was dubbed "Operation Barclay".

Operation Barclay puts players in the shoes of competing military intelligence directors who are attempting to mask or learn the truth about the Allied invasion plans for 1943. The Abwehr must attempt to learn where the Allies intend to land next. The London Controlling Section (LCS), the core intelligence agency responsible for Allied intelligence, must prevent the Abwehr from discovering the truth.

The LCS player uses a variable set-up, placing tiles face down to establish where amongst the five geo-strategic options in the Mediterranean a primary and a secondary offensive will occur. Over the course of the six game months, the Abwehr player attempts to win sufficient evidence tokens to be able to turn enough of these tiles face-up to reveal where the Allied offensives will come. Every evidence token the LCS player wins prevents another tile from being revealed.

To win evidence tokens, players build hands of five cards to take tricks, similar to poker.
