While having the best hand will secure two evidence tokens, correctly betting after each player reveals the first three cards of each hand on who will have the best five-card hand is worth three evidence tokens. Thus, getting and bluffing and seeding disinformation is more important than being lucky with a card draw. In addition, each player competes for another evidence token by having the most raid or reconnaissance icons on their cards.

Further, players have ways to manipulate the decks from which they draw. They may create a double-cross deck, allowing them to leave cards useful to them face down in a deck to draw from when they choose later — unless the other player takes those cards instead...but perhaps the player who planted those cards was bluffing and hoping the other player would waste their draw on a useless card...

Alternatively, players may draw from their own dedicated deck to augment their hands with unique abilities inspired by historical figures, events, and capabilities. The LCS has access to Ultra — decrypts of German codes — but this alone will not be enough if it's not used carefully.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Spies/Secret Agents, World War II
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Set-up

name: Flaneur
description:
Welcome to 19th Century Paris, to the city of Flaneurs!
Flaneur is a 2-4 players tile placement game inspired by the 19th Century Parisian figure "the Flaneur" who strolls within the crowds with no purpose. He passionately walks through boulevards and passages, and spectates the city life. In the game you will place neighborhood tiles, create new city patterns, and stroll the flaneurs on boulevards. These Flaneurs walk and record the areas they have seen on their sketchbook, and you score points.

The game is played in turns. In your turn, you first place one of the two tiles in your hand to the 6x6 grid board in a way to continue an existing pattern. Then you move the Flaneur(s) into the newly placed tile and score points according to size of created city & greenary patterns multiplied by the number of flaneurs. Once all Flaneur's end their journey, the game ends!

—description from the designer
categories: Age of Reason, City Building, Print & Play, Territory Building, Travel
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: 18xx Checkers
description:
18xx Checkers is a simplified Print and Play version of Tresham's 1829 Mainline designed to use common gaming material that most people own. One or two players will buy shares in four different Railroad Companies, lay track and operate trains to collect revenue.

The playing surface is a standard checkers board and standard playing cards are used to represent share certificates. Other common gaming devices needed are checkers, a couple of 6 sided dice and play money.

The game itself includes rules, a one page Share Price Index/Player Aid, and a single page of custom square Track and Train tiles.

18xx Checkers has been described as "a really accessible introduction to 18xx but also a very interesting game on its own"

18xx Checkers is different from most 18xx genre games in that it uses square tiles, the game board is randomly generated, and like 1829 Mainline, available shares are drawn from a shuffled deck. Thus no two games are the same.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: CRYPTOLY: To the Moon and Beyond
description:
Cryptoly is a strategy board game that revolves around the world of Bitcoin, altcoins, NFTs and more. You can expect airdrops, ICOs, NFTs, mining, staking, exchanges, wallets and much more. The game can be played flexibly and can be scheduled in advance or by time cards.

During a turn, the player can take a number of actions. Exchange coins at the specified rate on the DEX (Decentralized Exchange), but also negotiate with other players. Buy and/or sell mining/staking cards or your NFTs. The turn ends when you complete the task on the action field.

The game can be ended flexibly. There are various ways to do this. By agreement after a certain time (e.g. one hour), by agreeing on your own rule (e.g. being the first to get 30 Bitcoins) or by drawing a time card.

The winner of the game is whoever has the most Bitcoins at the end. The altcoins are converted at the last valid exchange rate (exchange rate card).

-description of the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation, Trading

name: Podium
description:
In Podium, the serious flirts with the absurd to deliver unforgettable moments of laughter. With each map, you'll encounter two types of rankings: unusual rankings derived from official studies, and more comical rankings compiled from the responses of 100 people in a survey. To put it simply, you might find yourself trying to guess the TOP3 "countries with the most red hair" and, just after that, the TOP3 "objects that can be sucked".

Dynamic and hilarious, all players play at the same time. If you don't have the answers, try anyway! A little misunderstanding can go a long way. Bonus rounds add spice to the game and help you decide between the two.

At the end of the 8 rounds, it's time to add up. Who will be the grand champion of the rankings? At Zenagame, we're willing to bet that this title will soon be up for grabs.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Federation Faction Pack: Lost in the Delta Quadrant
description:
Explore the unknown Delta Quadrant with the newest Federation faction pack in Star Trek: Attack Wing! Add brand new versions of the Intrepid-class, Nova-Class, Aerie-Class, and Delta Flyer-Class to your fleet captained by Kathryn Janeway, Rudolph Ransom, Magnus Hansen, and Tom Paris. Add the crews of the U.S.S. Voyager and U.S.S. Equinox to your ships as you try to find your way home through the Delta Quadrant Campaign. Equip new weapons and tech such as the Gravimetric Torpedoes and Temporal Shielding to assure victory. 70,000 light years seems a lot closer with a little luck, some coffee, and help from Neelix.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Große kleine Edelsteine
description: There’s a great commotion in the Kingdom of goblins! Some of the valuable gemstones are missing from the legendary royal crown. The little goblins will help you look for them. Oh no! The same shape but a different size. Some of the gemstones are very similar with only minimal differences. You need a keen eye and a bit of luck to find the right gemstones for the crown while collecting valuable points along the way to victory.

name: Honeymoon Hotel: The Card Game
description:
Your wedding night at the Honeymoon Hotel turns into a nightmare when your newlywed spouse suddenly reveals their true nature. The hotel becomes a trap filled with booby traps from which you must escape. Honeymoon Hotel is an adventurous card game full of strategy that you'll want to play over and over again. Which bride will manage to escape, and who will meet a certain death?

Honeymoon Hotel – The Card Game is the first game in the world based on an existing escape room! In this unique card game, playable with 2 to 6 players, you return to the mysterious Honeymoon Hotel, but this time you are one of the brides trying to escape from the murderous maniac you've unwittingly married.

Honeymoon Hotel – The Card Game is not an escape room game with puzzles. It's a strategic card game that you can play again and again! If you dare, that is…

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Horror, Memory, Murder/Mystery

name: Disney Villainous: Sugar and Spite
description:
In Villainous: Sugar and Spite, each player takes control of one of two Disney characters, each a villain in a different Disney movie, specifically King Candy (Wreck-It Ralph) and Shere Khan (The Jungle Book). Each player has their own villain deck, fate deck, player board, and 3D character.

On a turn, the active player moves their character to a different location on their player board, takes one or more of the actions visible on that space (often by playing cards from their hand), then refills their hand to four cards. Cards are allies, items, effects, and conditions. You need to use your cards to fulfill your unique win condition.

One of the actions allows you to choose another player, draw two cards from that player's fate deck, then play one of them on that player's board, covering two of the four action spaces on one of that player's locations. The fate deck contains heroes, items, and effects from that villain's movie, and these cards allow other players to mess with that particular villain.

Villainous: Sugar and Spite is playable on its own, and its characters can also face off against those in the other Disney Villainous games.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: The Planets My Destination
description:
The Planets My Destination is a 1-6 player print at home roll and write game where players are competing to colonise the solar system. Each round three dice are rolled and players assign them to 1 of 5 tracks covering Expansion, Military, Science, Resources and Collaboration. As the tracks fill up they provide rewards which grant players technologies, allow colonising or conquering locations and resources that mitigate the die rolls.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Ownership, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Iceman & Shadowcat
description:
Players will ring youthful exuberance to the table with the Iceman & Shadowcat Character Pack. These two fan-favorite X-Men add new low-cost options to the Affiliation. With show-stopping affiliated Team Tactic Cards in tow, these rising stars are the jewel of any mutant Squad on the battlefield.

Fan-favorite original X-Men are beloved characters in any Roster
New Team Tactic Cards for Uncanny X-Men add options to the Affiliation
Synergies with existing popular miniatures up the ante for mutant fans
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Trek: Away Missions – Commander Scotty: Federation Expansion
description:
As the U.S.S. Enterprise’s chief engineer, Scotty and his team work away behind the scenes keeping everything running, even in the middle of a crisis or alien attack.

This expansion is ready to play straight out of the box and comes with pre-designed card decks that make the most of the characters abilities. Alternatively, you can mix cards and mission specialists from other away teams to customise your decks and add even more variety.

—description from the publisher

name: ContraBanter
description: ContraBanter is a Word-Smuggling game where you'll work as a team to sneak secret words into a conversation! Each turn begins with an opponent asking a question or using one of the provided prompt cards to get the conversation started, and from there the smuggling team will have 90 seconds to hide their words throughout their discussion. The other team will be listening closely and at any time they can pause the clock and use one of their three chances each round to try to guess your secret words. You'll get points from successfully sneaking your secret words by your opponents and correctly identifying and confiscating their secret words. Whoever has the most points at the end of three rounds is the winner!
mechanics: Deduction, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: Tír na nÓg: Subplot Expansion
description: The Subplot Expansion to Tír na nÓg add 8 new Subplot cards which give additional ways to gain bonus points (2 Subplots per game) based on your collection built and the order of players achieving the conditions.

name: Bomb Busters
description:
There is a bomb full of wires and the countdown has started... Who are you gonna call? YOU, the Bomb Busters!

To clear the bomb, you need to collaborate with your team of bomb disposal experts! Using the wires on the tile holder in front of you, try and figure out your teammates’ wires. Find and cut identical wires, but watch out, if you cut a red wire: BOOM! Use your equipment wisely to meet the varied challenges which get harder and harder.

Tick tock tick tock... Will you figure it out before it’s too late?

With 66 missions, there will be:

=> 66 different ways to play depending on your moods (in order, by level of difficulty, favourite configuration…)
=> 66 challenges to play over and over (even if you already blew your top!)
=> Plenty of tricky bombs which become more and more dangerous (but don’t get cut up about it!)

Gameplay
There is a set of 48 normal wires numbered 1-12 (4 of each value). Then, you add some yellow and red wires and deal them all to the players.
Each mission is different, but your goal is always the same: go through all 12 numbers without blowing up!
The players place the tiles on their stands and then take turns pointing at each others’ wires and guessing their values. If the guess is correct, the wires are cut. If not — the detonator advances!
If you manage to cut all wires without blowing up — good job, the mission is completed, but if the bomb goes off... Try again!
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Memory, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Real-Time, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Sudden Death Ending

name: Creature Kingdoms: Avian Trilogy Crossover
description:
With this ultimate crossover pack, true afficionados of the initial Avian Archipelago trilogy will experience a whole new feel to their favourite Creature Kingdoms games.
Unleash dinomeeples to wander on Kiwi Island or add dexterity to the game with Dodino racers.
Play with chicken leaders to build special units in Dodos Riding Dinos or Kiwi Chow Down.
Pile on the lead racer with kiwi on Dodos Riding Dinos.
Deploy Dinosaur units in War for Chicken Island that get more powerful.
Encourage becoming enraged in Dodos Riding Dinos with some chicken characters.
Try kiwi leaders to use their pushing skill or to build outside of your territory in War for Chicken Island.
Or simply unleash madness and power in your games with Cluckthulhu, Yolk-Sototh, Aureus Fulmer and Kuxcoatl.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Race, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Rudiments
description:
Rudiments is a card game played with a traditional deck of cards in which a single player aspires to join the school drumline. The game is played over four rounds: the first three are called “practice sessions”, with the last known as the “audition”.

These rounds require the player to arrange their cards by color in certain sticking patterns, known as rudiments. If a player completes all the objectives for the practice sessions AND the audition, they win the game and are awarded a coveted spot in the school drumline!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Ordering, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Escape Deathrace 2182 Legendary Stratos Edition
description:
The year is 2182. You and your fellow Legendary Stratos League stunt drivers have been abducted by the alien Twisted foOk. A rescue helicopter is headed to the portal home, but only one of you can escape. Will it be you?

Escape Deathrace 2182 is a dynamic car-battling adventure through treacherous, alien terrain. You’ll have to drive and gun your way to victory through boss battles and against your previous allies, all in order to make it back home.

Create unique tracks from a deck of 20 Road Tiles.

Move through obstacles like Fire Zones & Hazards.

Seek & destroy 3 sub bosses before taking on the Final Boss.

Engage against your fellow racers in Drive-Bys & Battle-It-Outs.

Harness the power of 4 types of Weapon Drops to succeed.

Carefully utilize your Power Cards to gain the upper hand.

Watch out for special Event Cards that will help or hinder your progress.

Choose from 6 Characters with different Special Abilities and their own pre-painted cars.

This tile-placing, racecar-themed dungeon crawl board game is for 1 to 4 players and takes about 10 minutes per player to play.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, King of the Hill, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: J'emme
description:
At dawn, under the hot desert sand, a few lizards line up their offspring before they hatch. The lizards then engage in a tough competition to survive...

J'emme is a strategic game for the whole family!

The principle is simple, be the first to align your gems before having them swallowed and try to swallow those of your opponents to prevent them from triggering the end of the game. Betrayals and alliances will be there.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Similar strategic gameplay to 5-in-a-row (gomoku), but with major differences that make the game greatly addictive and replayable unlimited number of times!

Multiplayer (up to 6 players, each playing with his color and competing with others)
Multiple winning conditions (depending on the number of players):
First to reach a line of 6
First to reach X lines of 5 (X depends on number of players)
First to reach X lines of 4 (X depends on number of players)
First to reach X swallowed opponent's pieces (X depends on number of players)



—user summary

Dès l'aube, sous le sable chaud du désert, quelques lézards alignent leurs progénitures avant qu'ils n'éclosent. Les lézardeaux s'engagent alors dans une rude compétition pour survivre...

J'emme est un jeu stratégique pour toute la famille !

Le principe est simple, soyez le premier à aligner vos gemmes avant de vous les faire gober et tentez de gober ceux de vos adversaires pour les empêcher de déclencher la fin de partie. Trahisons et alliances seront au rendez-vous.

—description from the publisher (French)

name: Bardwood Grove: Spirits of the Grove
description:
The return of musical diversity to Bardwood Grove has awakened the artist spirits sleeping there. Overjoyed spirits now flit and flicker about the town, eager to offer their help to fledgling and established musicians alike.

Spirits of the Grove expansion is perfect for those who want more. In addition to the Spirits there are new Bards, skill cards and also a 5th player components.

At the beginning of the game, each Bard gains the support of three powerful spirits.
At certain points during the game, they can call in help from these spirits to gain powerful one-time effects. With the help of the spirits, a new of music begins in Bardwood Grove.

This expansion also contains components to introduce a 5th player to Bardwood Grove, as well as two brand new Bards, and a handful of new Events.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers

name: Escape the Rat Race
description:
A fast and furious set building card game that mixes just the right amount of strategy and luck. Repeatable, relatable, and just a little ruthless.

CAN YOU ESCAPE THE RAT RACE?

You have four decades of work ahead of you and the fear is real.

Your career counts. Whether an entrepreneur or a professional, money can’t buy you happiness, but it can pay for Botox.

Use your hard earned cash to collect experiences and race through your 20s, 30s, 40s and 50s.

Sabotage your opponents and further your plans. Is stealing really wrong if it sends you on safari?

In this race to retirement, the first player to collect three experiences from each decade will successfully Escape the Rat Race.

name: Khlor
description:
The legendary white dragon needs help. Demons threaten the white egg and you are the chosen ones to ride the colored dragons to protect it. Fly through the valley catching demons and nesting in demon free lands to restore the dragon empire. Best of you will become the next guardian of Khlor

How to catch demons

Each player, in turns, matches a polyhedral tile with a board's area close to a dragon egg to catch 3 demons. The player can also remove a dragon egg from the board and/or lay new ones - these new dragon eggs must all be the same color as the demons you have just caught.

How to get points

To get points for a color you must have more demons caught than anyone else in this color, only then:

You get 1 point for each egg on the board.
You get 1 point for each caught demon you take out the second with the most caught demons in this color.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Layering, Map Reduction, Tile Placement

name: Arcade Puzzle Ninja Nin-Nin
description:
After centuries of fighting, the ninja clans have merged into one, but for the new clan to work, they must be able to coordinate their training together.
Play as masters and organize ninja movements and attacks.
The future of the new clan is in your hands!

In this game each player acts as a ninja master and must face a board of 3x3 cards.
The goal in this game is to line up three ninjas with the same posture (4 types: pose, kick, smoke bomb, attack), either forming a row or a column. The color of the ninja does not matter to make these trios.

During their turn, each player can do one of these three actions:
1. Flip a card to reveal which kind of ninja or hidden action contain.
2. Swap two orthogonally adjacent cards.
3. Discard one of the 9 cards in exchange of a random card from the top of the game deck (training deck).

When a player lines up three ninjas with the same pose, the master must say the words "Nin-Nin". The master now can take and reserve the three ninjas to one side of the table (to count points at the end of the game), taking three new unrevealed cards from the training deck and turning over an already revealed card to each other players (masters).

The game will be over when the cards in the game deck are gone, and a master with all the cards revealed can no longer make any ninja trios. The player with the most ninja points will be the winner of the game.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Math, Memory, Mythology, Number, Puzzle, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action/Event, Chaining, End Game Bonuses, Memory, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Krosmaster: Arena – Hypergames Warriors
description:
Hypergames Warriors is an expansion to Krosmaster: Arena. It contains:

Four figures (Argon Gass, Arthur Bine, Count Frigost, Goultard the Barbarian) and four Sinistro miniatures
Four character cards
Four stickers with stats for the Sinistros
A code to play the characters online


At the moment the box is available only at Auchan Hypergames stores in France.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Epées Normandes
description:
Epées Normandes (Norman Swords)

Available in English or French
Covers the battles of : Val ès dunes 1047, Gué de Varaville 1057 and Hastings 1066

Contains:
1 rules booklet (8 pages)
1 scenarios booklet with historical notes (12 pages)
1 A3x2 map and 2 A3 maps- 356 counters

name: Psycho Killer: Z
description:
Psycho Killer Z is an expansion pack to Psycho Killer. With 15 new cards, including zombie weapons and infections, you’d better start preparing for the zombie apocalypse!

Cards:

1 Patient Zero

2 of each
Cure
Shallow grave
Supply run
Infection
Bite Swarm
Scratch
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Caracoles
description:
Caracoles is a two player game about two snails trying to reach the yummiest food in a Japanese food festival, while avoiding the "Saltmurai".
A playing field is set up from various tiles. Each player receives five movement cards and plays one of them in each turn. When moving to certain tiles, the snails can leave a slime trail, which claims points at the end of the game. At the end of each turn, the players move the Saltmurai as well, to block the opponent's movement.
When all five cards have been played, a round ends and the players note their points. The player with most points after three rounds is the winner.

name: Atlantis Rising: Orator
description:
A new Counselor for Atlantis Rising (2nd Edition)

Ability: The First Time Each Round that your Leader succeeds at an action in the Cities or a wild peninsula, each Atlantean on your Leader's tile may gain a volunteer.

Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Contenders Pack.

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game – Enter the Dragons!
description:
A Dynamic World

With every expansion to Fields of Eternia comes a wealth of new content to explore, and Enter the Dragons is no exception. This exciting new box includes its own unique scenario, quests, and bosses to keep players engaged and on their toes. However, the real highlight of Enter the Dragons lies in the addition of outpost tokens. At the beginning of each game, players will place one of these tokens face-down on each outpost on the map. When a hero enters an outpost, the token is revealed, revealing a variety of potential benefits. Outposts may generate extra Eternium, controlling it may earn the player extra Victory Points at the end of the game, or the outpost may provide a burst of inspiration to the heroes, granting them unique and powerful abilities.

Spark of Inspiration

Outpost tokens introduce another new mechanic: Inspiration cards. When a player reveals certain tokens, they may be rewarded with an inspiration card. These cards may not look like much at first glance, but don't let their unassuming appearance fool you. The power of inspiration cards lies in their ability to surprise your opponents. Since your enemies won't know what cards you’re holding, you can catch them off guard with unexpected moves. Whether it's healing your hero at a crucial moment, playing an additional card during an epic battle, or teleporting your soldiers across the map, thanks to these cards, gameplay in Fields of Eternia becomes even less predictable and even more challenging! We can't wait for you to try out these new tools and see how they change the course of your battles.

name: Puerto Rico (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
This is a print and play map that is not to be confused with the later Alspach map with the same name. This map is a multi-player map that uses Puerto Rico's coin mechanism, as unselected roles gain money which is picked up when that role is selected in later rounds. This makes even otherwise undesirable roles become valuable after a few rounds.

The map is detailed in this thread:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/130388
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Clank! Legacy: Acquisitions Incorporated – Shadow Council's Blessing
description:
Promo card for Clank Legacy given away in conventions

Event :

Each Player roll a d20 and gets the following :
1 : +2 clank
2-12 : 1 coin
13-19 : 2 coins
20 : 5 coins
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck
publishers: Dire Wolf, Lucrum Games, Penny Arcade, Renegade Game Studios, Schwerkraft-Verlag

name: Bull Rush
description:
From the rule book:

"The herd is on the loose! You and your opponents have found yourself right in the middle of a stampede, and it’s a high-speed race to escape with your life! Can you outrun the charging pack, or will you mess with the bull and get the horns?"

"Bull Rush" is an exciting game for 2-4 players. They assume the roles of unfortunate adventurers racing to survive a stampede. On players' turns, they can try to provoke bulls to attack other players, trip opponents to leave them in the dust, or even ride a bull, but they need to make sure they don't get trampled in the process!

With a variety of simple, yet clever mechanics, your opponents threatening to trip you at every turn, and the possibility that none of the players will survive at all, "Bull Rush" is a game with 20-30 action-packed minutes of high-speed twists and turns.

Try out the free Print 'n' Play version at www.bullrushgame.wordpress.com!
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Fairy Tale Files: The Cinderella Murders
description:
A grisly double-murder shocks Fairy Tale Land! Lady Tremaine and one of her two daughters are found stabbed at the manor. The prime suspect is the mistreated stepdaughter Cinderella - she had motive and opportunity. Could it be that simple?

Collect the clues and solve the puzzles to find out!

The Fairy Tale Files are lighthearted murder mystery detective games inspired by iconic fairy tales. We bring you the delight of your favorite childhood stories with an adult twist! Join the Magical Mishaps Agency to solve the clues and find the killer!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Hostage Negotiator: Expansiones #5 y #6
description:
This game combines two previously separate expansions to Hostage Negotiator (Abductor Pack 5 and Abductor Pack 6).

It includes 32 cards.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Darklands
description:
Darklands is a world in which you command the armies of man and beast that your ancestors once did for glory, power or simple survival.

What if dragons really flew and giants really walked the earth? What if berserkers actually were bear-men, man and bear joined together? What if all of the myths and legends we take for granted were real and our ancestors fought against - and with - creatures and beings and realms we thought were nothing more than the fantasies of our uncivilised selves?

Based in the Dark Ages in the year 650AD in Northwest Europe, Darklands is a Skirmish Wargame that allows you to field the men and mythological beasts of the time. This game will allow you to:
- Take command of Norse Trolls and Jötunn and conduct raids on the coast of Dark Age Britain.
- Lead the hosts of Baalor, the Evil Eye in the Ice, and the Fomoraic, a race of half men and beast along with hideous sea creatures under the thrall of Baalor in their quest to crush Dark Age Ireland.
- Defend Dark Age Wales with the Brythoniaid and their draconic allies.

The game will feature the following Kindreds (factions):
- Albainn (Picts)
- Angelcynn (Angles)
- Atalantes (Classic Greeks from the mythical continent of Atlantis)
- Brythoniaid (Welsh Britons)
- Byzantii (Dark Age Romans)
- Érainn (Irish)
- Fomoraic (Fomorians)
- Khthones (Escaped slaves of the Atlantes and all are Reptilian Anthropomorphs such as Snakes, Crocodiles, Hydras and Basilisks)
- Norse (Vikings)
- Ysians (An alliance of Kernow and the mythical city of Ys)

With these additional, smaller Kindreds appearing as allies to the others:
- The Vras (Greedy ratmen allied with the Ysians)
- Infernii (Daemons from Dantes Divine Comedy allied with the Byzantii)

Some features of the gameplay:
- Individual alternate unit activation
- D10s based
- Inches are the primary measurement
- Game turns are called 'Hours'
- Will feature weather and time of day
- A big mechanic of the game is that all warriors large and small, when they are wounded, become weaker for the rest of the game.
- Bows will be able to shoot arrows the length of the table and beyond - but their shots loose power with increased range.
- Army Standards and Army Musicians important to game play and orders
- Plastic round bases with arcs of visibility pre-marked
- Dark Magic will be involved. Using it will come “at a price”
categories: Fantasy, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame

name: World War II: Battle for Moscow, 1941
description:
Game description from the publisher:

World War II: Battle for Moscow, 1941 offers a new challenge to confront Soviet and German commanders on the Eastern Front: the deadly Russian winter! Fully compatible with all World War II Art of Tactic games and miniatures, this standalone starter set introduces new winter weather rules, boards, and terrain pieces, and features all-new sculpts for German and Soviet soldiers in winter uniforms and the new T-35 Soviet tank!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Faerie Chess
description:
' Faerie Chess' is a new take on Chess, featuring both the classic Chess units and 14 new unit types with new abilities/movements. The game offers a 2 in 1 experience, in that it contains all of the components for a classic Chess game, and the new components for Faerie Chess.

The new units added to the game include: Soldier, Chamberlain, Peasant, Tower, Catapult, Herald, Lancer, Courtesan, Thief, Pontiff, Inquisitor, Jester, Regent, Mercenary.

Included in the game are a deck of cards to illustrate each unit's movement pattern, to aid both beginners to Chess and the new game variant material.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Peanut Butter Belly Time
description:
You are peanut butter makers for Nerdy Nuts!

Decide what flavors you want to create from Chocolate Marshmallow to Banana Cookie and everything in between, then prepare your jars and collect the right ingredients for your special peanut butter creations. You can add mystery ingredients for extra flavor, but don't push your luck too far or your sweet treats might end up too salty instead!

In Peanut Butter Belly Time, players draft ingredient cards to create jars of peanut butter. Each card also has a scoring rule on it, but only one card will score for each jar. Players may take orders from a central display if they can fulfill them, and an order replaces a jar's normal scoring. Players can also compete for ingredient majority cards.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Rolling Realms: Sleeping Gods Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Sleeping Gods.

When playing this realm, you face 4 monsters. Use dice to damage the monsters. High numbers deal much damage, low numbers award resources. Defeat all monsters and remove all venom to gain all 6 stars.

-description from publisher

name: Waterloo Solitaire Board Game
description:
In Waterloo Solitaire you take the role of Napoleon commanding the French army against an opposing Allied autonomous player side, referred to as the Allied BOT side. And you take the role of Wellington, commanding the Allied army against a French BOT side. Each opposing BOT side is rated for its skill.

The game uses a similar system with Waterloo Solitaire Bookgame, except you will use cubes, and a hardmounted game board to track your movements and attacks in the game.

Players win by destroying enemy formations, normally 2 to 3 depending on the side.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Command Cards, Ordering, Physical Removal, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Timeless Journeys: The Italian Grand Tour
description:
Embark on a captivating journey through the Italian peninsula of the late 18th century. Inspired by the historical Grand Tour, this immersive board game invites players to delve into a world of art, culture, and intellectual pursuits.

The game blends hand management and building, resource management, map movement, and set collection elements.

As players travel through Italy, they explore the art cities, meet with prominent figures, and establish meaningful correspondences collecting experiences for their writings.

Drafting and buying new and more powerful action cards, they also build engines that unlock new possibilities and enhance their journey. With myriad combinations, players can tailor their strategies to achieve unique goals, whether writing books, surpassing all others in travel distance, or accumulating a wealth of immersive travel experiences.
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Exploration, Napoleonic, Travel
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #41 – Unique Nation Skills
description:
Warfighter WWII - Expansion 41 UNIQUE NATION SKILLS! - Adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Missions! This Soldier pack with nations from wave 1 of Warfighter WWII (USA, UK, Poland, Germany, USSR), adding in their unique nation skills and Soldier that come equipped with new Skills.

Cards included are:

10x USA Soldier Cards
9x UK Soldier Cards
11x Poland Soldier Cards
9x Germany Soldier Cards
12x USSR Soldier Cards
5x Skill Cards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Company Store
description:
Welcome to the great white north! Your camp is now part of the Company! You still get to chop down trees but now the bosses will pay you for your labors in wooden nickels, that you can spend anywhere you'd like. (only valid in the company store.)

This 2nd expansion to Flapjacks and Sasquatches contains a multitude of different cards. There are new Jack cards (cards that go in the main draw deck), new tree cards, new universal cards, and a full set of the add-on lumberjack cards (with new nickel rewards) previously unavailable in retail along with new never before seen lumberjack cards. You also get a brand new Company Store deck of cards which allows you to spend your wooden nickels on cards that could help you, hurt others, or possibly blow up in your face.

-description from designer

name: Converge: Aspects of Vision – Solo Mode
description:
The mercurial Creators are masters of light and sound, improvising entertaining displays to break through the gloom. Can you use these unpredictable artists to achieve your goals?

This 6-card solo expansion for Converge works with any combination of factions. With only 5 turns to play, it’s a race to achieve goals and earn stars before time runs out! On every turn, one of the opponent’s cards will be revealed, serving as both one of their faction members and a shared goal. Play 2 cards each turn to counter their steady advance to victory.

Each of the solo cards features an ability on one side and a goal on the other. At the start of the game, pair 3 ability cards with 3 face-up goals. You may use the ability at any time as one of your actions, or complete the paired goal to gain the ability to use as an additional action when you complete the paired goal, giving you an extra chance to turn the tides in your favor. By managing the artifact and shrewdly using your abilities, you might just save the day.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Frontline (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
It’s war. There is heavy fighting between whateverland and its southern neighbour. To support the war, a constant flow of supplies and fresh soldiers to the front is necessary. Railroads are construct to facilitate the supply, but like towns and cities may be lost if insufficient supplies and soldiers are delivered.

In this 3-player variant of Age of Steam, the players are responsible for building railroads and making deliveries to the war front. Depending on their success to do so, the frontline moves, and therefore, the map changes. Because its war, they can all lose, but only one player can win.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Sovereign Skies: Houses Rising
description: A set of 4 cards giving variable player powers to each unique house in Sovereign Skies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Import / Export: Captain Edition Cards
description:
These 3 cards were available at the Model Ships pledge level of their Kickstarter campaign.

The three included cards are:

Dark Flight Games (Illegal/Pirate)
Exotic Fish (Agriculture/Contract)
Exclusive Cards (Luxury/Supply)
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Industry / Manufacturing, Math, Nautical, Pirates, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Stock Holding, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Mord bei Tisch: Backstage
description:
Mord bei Tisch is a crimi dinner game in which 6-8 players can participate to find out who among them is the murderer of the found victim. In addition to that, every player gets a personal task to fulfil during the evening, which can include finding certain information via asking, hiding certain information during the game, convince other players to join them in certain acts or act in a very specific way during the game.

The backstage case is about the murder on the manager of the famous pop diva Miss Loco.

name: DropMix: Series 3 Discover Packs
description:
Expand your mix and build your music collection with DropMix Discover Packs. Each pack includes 5 DropMix cards that can create a full song mix and more music mixing possibilities with the DropMix Music Gaming System (sold separately). There are 30 DropMix cards available to collect in each series featuring songs from top artists. Each pack of 5 sold separately.

Dropmix: Series 3 Discover Packs is a collection of 6 such packs. While the packaging of each pack is identical, they can be identified by the card showing through the front window of each pack.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Music, Party Game, Real-time

name: Workers & Peasants: The Red Army's Rifle Divisions, 1939-1945 – A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
Panzer Grenadier: Workers & Peasants

Taken by surprise on the morning of 22 June 1941, the Red Army of Workers and Peasants reeled under Nazi attacks. By the end of the Great Patriotic War, 5.1 million Soviet soldiers would have been killed in action, and another 1.1 million died of wounds suffered in combat.

Yet it was the Soviet soldier who raised the hammer and sickle over the ruins of the enemy capital. The Red Army remained in the field despite massive losses, refusing to admit defeat until Berlin lay at their feet and Adolf Hitler's murderous Thousand Year Reich had been destroyed.

Workers & Peasants is a 64-page book supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series based on the battles of 1941 and 1942, when the Soviet Union appeared on the verge of defeat. There are 20 scenarios, or separate game situations, most of them much larger than those found in our Eastern Front or Road to Berlin boxed games.

There are also the background articles you've come to expect from an Avalanche Press book, this time focused on the Red Army's troops, weapons and organization. It's the perfect companion piece to our most popular Panzer Grenadier game, the huge Eastern Front Deluxe Edition.

This is not a stand-alone game; ownership of any Eastern Front Deluxe Edition is required to play some of the scenarios and Road to Berlin, Sinister Forces, Elsenborn Ridge and Battle of the Bulge to play all of them.

(text from Manufacturer's homepage)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Cthulhu Wars: Tcho-Tcho Tribes
description:
This expansion contains 12 spellbooks.
- 3 univeral spellbooks
Hierophants, Soulless and Terror.

- 3 Tsang Tribe spellbooks
Idolatry, Martyrdom and Tablets of the Outer Gods.

- 3 Leng Tribe spellbooks

Surprise! an action costing 2 Power. An enemy player has to choose one of his acolytes, and swap it out for one of your Proto-Shoggoths.

Dark Rituals Use it once per turn. When you play it, each enemy player with one of your High Priests in their Starting Area has to choose whether to pay you 2 Power or 2 Doom. (A player with less than 2 Power or Doom is immune.)

Fulmination A one-time post-battle effect. If Ubbo-Sathla was killed in the Battle, you can discard him out of the game permanently, and gain 1 Elder Sign for each unit killed in the battle (on both sides).

- 3 Sarkomand Tribe spellbooks

Otherworld Alliances this adds 1 to the Combat of all your Neutral Monsters and Terrors.

Doomsday another one-use spellbook. When you take it, you immediately pick any Independent Great Old One with a cost of 2 or 4 (only) and place it at your controlled Gate. Always fun.

Inerrant when you Ritual, gain 1 Elder Sign for each enemy-controlled Gate at which you have any Great Old Ones.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Middara: Dreamwalker Lymn Resin Kit
description:
Middara: Dreamwalker Lymn is a cross promotion with the mysterious Cherri & Lymn from Level 99 Games.

The Dreamwalker Lymn kit comes with a beautiful Resin miniature (that will require assembly), an Initiative Card, an Item Card, a Discipline Card, and an Adventurer Card.

The model kit is unpainted and must be assembled using your own glue and supplies. The cards that come with the figure are additional game content that can be used in the Crawl Mode or shuffled into their corresponding decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: AntaYagí
description:
Welcome to the city of a thousand hats! Where you have the same possibilities of winning great fortunes as of ruining yourself in the attempt...
You don't need to look out of the window of your carriage to know that you have arrived at your destination.
The bustle of the market and the smell of money is more than enough. You take a quick glance at your saddlebags, where a tail of smelly fish peeks over the edge, and you smile triumphantly, this is yours.
In AntaYagi, 3 to 7 players will become ambitious merchants seeking fame and fortune, although in the end only the best bartering master will achieve glory.
What are you waiting for, make the most... peculiar trades, and sabotage your competitors to become a true merchant?
The one who gets the most goods will be the winner!

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Humor, Memory, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Deduction, Negotiation, Victory Points as a Resource

name: "Get Smart" Card Game
description: Card game based on the TV Show "Get Smart". Includes a peg board that is similiar to a cribbage board for keeping score.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Stop Thief!: Jason L'Mean Promo Card
description:
Promo card given out from the 2017 Dice Tower Indiegogo campaign.

Jason L'Mean - When captured, All other investigators choose and discard a movement card (other than their lowest one) Value: $8,000
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dark Domains: Elemental Arcana Fortune Cards
description:
Kickstarter Exclusive! Perfect for those exploring elemental magic. There are four Elemental Arcana Cards in the set (Earth, Air, Fire, and Water).

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Near and Far: Bounty Hunter Character Tiles
description:
Two character tiles depicting bounty hunters, available as part of the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast 2019 Tabletop Media Bonanza Kickstarter campaign (2019 Promo Pack).

The tiles are double-sided with one side to be used with Near and Far and the other with Above and Below.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement
publishers: Lotus Frog Games, Red Raven Games

name: Stonespine Architects: Shrines and Fountains Mini Expansion
description:
Mini expansion containing 7 new chamber cards with new abilities.

Chamber types: Some chamber cards in this mini-expansion are both stone and cave type. During final scoring, each chamber card with multiple chamber types must be scored as either stone or cave, but not both.

Rules: Each card in this mini expansion contains a shrine or fountain at its center, which does not count towards the limit of four elements per chamber. Players may perform its effect once, immediately after placing the chamber.

Fountain: Move a market token or secret passage token to another chamber. Do not exceed four elements in a single chamber.

Shrine: Swap the position of and two chamber cards in the player's dungeon. Any market tokens on the card also move. Secret passage tokens do not.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Contracts, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pocket Invaders: New Challenges
description:
Pocket Invaders expansion pack:

-4 players board.
-2 new spectial ships.
-2 random asteroids.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Charlie Company: Infantry Combat in Vietnam, 1965-1972
description:
Miniature wargame rules for Infantry Action in Vietnam 1965 - 1968.
Charlie Company is designed to serve as an ongoing miniatures campaign game which reflects those peculiar circumstances that were a part of Infantry Combat in Vietnam. As such the rules are designed to focus on the Infantry Company and its supporting arms, and not on Special Forces, Riverine or Armored Cavalry actions. As a game system it can be played with anywhere from 3 players to as many as 20, with one person serving as umpire and being responsible for setting up and running the game.

Players take the role of a Company Commander, Lieutenant, or Sergeant in the US armed forces; the GM controls the VC and NVA. The players start off green and continue their “Tour of Duty” through scenarios and gain experience. Eventually, if they are lucky and skillful, they will become seasoned veterans. The game expects the players to complete 12 of these missions before their tour of duty has ended.

The book provides an overview of the Vietnam War and how the various militaries were comprised. Players may play Marines or the US Army and each is historically equipped. South Vietnamese units may be used as auxiliary forces as well as Ruff Puff’s, the CIDG, the Australians, the Koreans, and American engineers/special forces/LRRP teams. Terrain includes open, brush, elephant grass, forest, dense forest, jungle, rubber plantations, rivers and streams, swamp, villages, urban combat, bunkers and entrenchments, tunnels, rice paddies, hills, gullies, canals, roads, trails, and paths. Rules for booby traps like pungi stakes, claymores, etc. are also given. Helicopter assaults and air support rules (fire for effect, napalm, strafing, are in addition to all the typical infantry maneuvers usually found in miniatures wargames like direct fire, charging, grenades, sniping, forward observers, indirect fire, artillery, etc. Also includes rules for night vision, sappers, flamethrowers, engineers, riverine operations, beehive rounds, and prisoners. There is also a glossary of military jargon and a bibliography of suggested books to give Game Masters ideas for more scenarios.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Stwory z Obory: Wielkie Nordobicie
description:
Are barns and forests deserted and all highroads trod? Are there no beasts on the horizon cuz they were slaughtered in a hundred ways? Do you laze around watching the sack full of coins? Soon enough you will be awaken by fall breeze from north!

Take out your disguises, sharpen the pitchfork and ... watch out for the arrows in the knee! Here comes the Wielkie Nordobicie ("Grand North-brawl"), an expansion to Stwory z Obory (Beasts from the Barn) - original Polish party card game with black humour.

Wielkie Nordobicie contains 54 cards filled with Nordic mythology. Video games fans will also notice some easter eggs, eg. Wrzaski Mocy {Power Yells) or strzał w kolano (arrow in the knee). In this expansion you'll once again find characteristic Tomasz Bolik's arts.

This expansion adds new mechanics, eg. 6-players game, weapons and stuff crafting and temporary alliances in order to fight might Giants.

Wielkie Nordobicie is a perfect gift for teenagers looking for negative interaction party game with specific humour and for all those lovers of Stwory z Oboory.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Smash Up: Deepreef Crag Promo Card
description:
To promote their Kickstarter campaign for Dead Reckoning, AEG released free print-and-play promotional cards for several of their games, such as Tiny Towns, Santa Monica, Space Base, Cat Lady, and of course Smash Up. Physical copies of the promos are available to those who pledged it.

Deepreef Crag is the promo card for Smash Up. It is a base that reads: When this base scores, it the total power equals the breakpoint, the winner gains 1 additional VP.

name: Bunch of Butts
description:
Bunch of Butts is a real time simultaneous card matching game.

Each turn, players simultaneously flip up a card. Players can call out the butt card names if they see a match. The first player to call a match takes the matching pair of cards. However, if the silent but deadly card is in play they lose those cards. If a spank card is in play, the first player to spank the foam rubber butt can steal a card from another player.

The backs of the cards are of five types: “Bun”, “ch”, “of, “But” and “ts”. The first player to spell out “Bunch of Butts” wins the game.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Set Collection, Take That

name: Heroes of Normandie: Private Bryan
description: Kickstarter exclusive mini expansion with one new hero, Private Bryan. Contains one double sided mini punchboard.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: StarGuard!
description:
Starguard! (1974) by McEwan Miniatures. 2nd Edition 1975.

"In those glorious golden days of the 23rd Century, when the Terrian Federation was still in its infancy, long before the Peace of the Empire, when no ship traveled the Starlanes unarmed, all that stood between the fragile glassine towers of Terra the Beautiful and the ravaging hordes of Ralni, Dreenoi and other lurkers in the darkness were the men of the Starfleet Command. It is to the marines of the Federation Navy, the STARGUARD, that this record is respectfully dedicated."

Man to man (or alien) SF miniatures tabletop warfare.

Expanded by:

Orilla: 1st StarGuard Supplement
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Three Dimensional Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Harpoon 4: Player's Handbook
description:
From the Publisher´s web
The Harpoon Player's Handbook is a 28 page compilation of all the charts and tables contained in the rulebook. Use of this playing aid greatly assists the flow of play in multiple player games, as all of the data is right at hand, along with references to the appropriate section of the rulebook.


The Harpoon Series


Expands

Harpoon 4
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Puppet Wars: Multiplayer Expansion
description: Puppet Wars: Multiplayer Expansion includes two Master Puppets (Marcus, Pandora), four Sidekick Puppets (Joss, Nino, Baby Kade, Sebastian) and more colored tokens, allowing for up to four players in a game of Puppet Wars and more variety in a player's choice of Master and Sidekicks if only two are playing the game.

name: Die Legenden von Andor: Chada & Thorn – Die Treibholzbucht
description:
The Log Bay - Bonus Adventure for Chada & Thorn

In this 8 pages PDF file you will find a bonus adventure for Chada & Thorn, developed by Gerhard Hecht.

PDF file https://legenden-von-andor.de/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/And...
From the original site: https://legenden-von-andor.de/zu-chada-und-thorn/

name: Armata Romana: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
description:
At the moment German troops launched their surprise invasion of the Soviet Union in June 1941, Romanian dictator Ion Antonescu declared a “holy war” against the Communist regime. A half-million Romanian soldiers participated in these early campaigns, fighting fierce battles in Bessarabia, at Odessa and in the Crimea.

Armata Romana is an expansion for our Panzer Grenadier: Fire in the Steppe game, featuring 98 die-cut, mounted pieces displaying the Royal Romanian Army – the Armata Romana – in its own special color scheme. There are also 20 scenarios, and three “battle games” that link them together.

Armata Romana is not a complete game; everything you need to play all 20 scenarios (and the battle games) in included in the book and the boxed game Fire in the Steppe. No other books or games are required to play any of the scenarios.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Movement Points, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: King of Tokyo: Super Jump Goodie Card
description:
Promo Card for King of Tokyo created to advertise the King of Tokyo: Dark Edition. Distribution of this item was disrupted by the COVID-19 pandemic and is pending as of October 2020. Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

The card is same as the one found in the King of Tokyo: Promo Cards, only the artwork is new.


Shuffle the card with the rest of the deck.

Card cost "4"

KEEP

"On each player's turn, you may spend 1 energy to negate the loss of 1 damage."
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, King of the Hill, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: A nova roda dos alimentos
description:
The food wheel is a graphical representation that helps to combine the foods that should be part of your daily diet.
It is a circular symbol that divides into groups of different sizes and gather foods with similar nutritional properties. The purpose of this game is to form sets of cards according to categories of the new food wheel and thus acquire points and win the game.
With the mechanic of card drafting (pick one card from hand to play and pass the remaining cards to next player. Process repeated until last card is played).
Cards are played on the table, in front of each player. This table area it’s called "Kitchen".
There are three types of cards.
Food cards - 7 different colours. The number of cards varies depending on its category. The goal is to collect as many different cards in the same category.
In the end, the cards will also be scored for diversity of categories. Who have more colours gets more points.
Water cards - Light blue cards. The objective is to higher number of cards to gain water points.
Character cards (cooker, waiter and doctor nutritionist) - These are action cards that are played to affect the course of the game.
Once played, these action cards go directly to the trash.
Players canot repeat food cards in his kitchens (repeated cards are sent to the trash) and all the food cards that went to the trash result in an loss of points for that player.
In the end of the game the player with the most number of points wins the game.

name: Darkest Night: Tinker Promo
description:
The Tinker scorns traditional wisdom, determined to form his own understanding rather than rely on the teachings of others. Through constant experimentation, he gradually develops and refines his own tools, every one the first of its kind. Due to its unique origins, the Tinker's magic is not quite like any other in the world...

This package includes the Tinker, along with his power cards, plus a new event and an artifact. A must-have for all Darkest Night fans!
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Three-Dragon Ante: Legendary Edition – Giants War
description:
Long ago, dragons and giants fought a thousand-year war...and the human survivors commemorated these battles by adding the giants to their high stakes card game of luck and skill, Three-Dragon Ante.

Three-Dragon Ante: Legendary Edition – Giants War includes more than one hundred cards, featuring a new way to find legendary dragons, new giant gods, and new giant suits that let you split the stakes in two: the dragon stakes and the giants stakes. Players fight for the stakes where their flight is strongest, giving them new routes to victory.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Silent Death: Wings of Death
description:
From the back of the box:

Wings of Death contains 48 finely crafted silver-plastic space fighters sculpted by the renowned Bob Naismith. Designed for play with ICE's explosive Silent Death spaceship combat game, these ships can also be used with any other space combat game or RPG.

You get 4 each of 12 different designs, the same vessels included in the Silent Death: The Next Millennium Deluxe Edition. Each ship comes with its own black, hex-shaped plastic stand. They fly well and look great unfinished, but they are even cooler painted with acrylic or enamel colors.

This boxed set contains the same plastic ships which are included in the Silent Death: The Next Millennium boxed set. There are four of each of these ships:

Blizzard
Dart
Hell Bender
Kosmos
Lance Electra
Night Hawk
Pit Viper
Salamander
Spirit Rider
Talon
Teal Hawk
Thunder Bird

Expands:

Silent Death
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Special Forces
description:
(From the publishers website:)

The first installment in a series, which will focus on Special Forces from a variety of Nations, set in World War 2. Special Forces 1 focuses on the British SAS (Special Air Service) and LRDG (Long Range Desert Group) exploits against the Germans and Italians in the North African, Mediterranean and European theaters.

Contents:

Six tournament-style scenarios; 2 set in N. Africa, 2 in France, 1 in Greece, and 1 in Italy
Counters representing SAS/LDRG SMC, MMC, Crews and special vehicles allowing you to outfit two LRDG Patrols or an SAS Combat Section.
Applicable Chapter A rules and Chapter H vehicle notes.


Ownership of most of the ASL system are required to play this module.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Panzer Grenadier: DAK '44
description:
DAK '44 is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier system based on the potential battles of the continuation of action in the western desert after Alamein. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Afrika Korps, Beyond Normandy, Cassino '44 and Desert Rats games. There are 10 scenarios included.

There are 88 new German pieces in the desert scheme first introduced in Afrika Korps. They include Tiger, Tiger II and Panther tanks, Hetzer tank destroyers, Wespe self-propelled artillery plus the anti-tank guns, mortars and rocket launchers of Germany's 1944 arsenal.

DAK '44 is sold BOTH as a .pdf download and as a printed booklet with actual playing pieces.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight

name: Iconica Series #2
description:
THE COMPLETE ICONICA SERIES TWO

In a stunning turn of events, a group of noble Sarion have defied the tyranny of their government and the Legion Agenda. Now they are mortal enemies of their former kinsmen who consider them traitors. Taking up residence in a region known as Sanctum, these defectors (called Saraja or "a people remade") have allied themselves with the Protectorate and seek a new life living in harmony with the native races of Rynaga.

This new series features six Sanctum themed characters loyal to the Protectorate. Each is identified with a special shield which represents their values as a people. You'll also discover formidable new Legion and Independent characters to employ in your Iconica contests!

ABOUT ICONICA

Iconica is a game of turn-based strategy with RPG elements. You'll like Iconica if you:

1. like games in which you're faced with choices (and some chance)
2. want layers of complexity without reading 45 pages of rules
3. like teaming up with friends during games
4. want a NEW experience in fictional setting
5. want a game where there are no junk/duplicate/fodder cards
6. like games with a rich backstory
7. like games with RPG flavor

DETAILS

Iconica Character Cards are professionally printed in small print runs. The game is independently written, illustrated and designed by myself. The Iconica Series Two Box Set ships in a reusable box and includes the following:

> 22 Iconica Character Cards (character #23-44, depicted in the photos)
> 1 Iconica Quick Reference card
> 1 pair of dice
> 2 sets of game pieces
> 2-player and 4-player Iconica rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chain of Command: At the Sharp End – The Campaign Rules Supplement
description:
At the Sharp End is designed to provide all you need to play and create wargame campaigns with Chain of Command.

At the Sharp End allows you to follow the exploits of your force throughout a series of linked games. To succeed you'll need to keep your men safe, your CO happy whilst ensuring the effectiveness of your key leaders. Included is a complete campaign system covering everything you need to run a campaign with an absolute minimum of effort and paperwork (almost none in fact).

Three types of campaign options are presented so the gamer can select one to suit the amount of time he has available and the degree of detail he is looking for. The most simple option allows the gamer to start campaigning straight away, whilst the others allow the building of historical campaigns. It's all there, even down to gallantry awards so you can see your characters develop in action.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Unfair: Secret Cabal Promo Cards
description:
Sneak peek card.

Available in the Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast Kickstarter 2017.
Available in the Unfair ABDW Expansion Kickstarter 2018.
Planned to be available in a future expansion.


Shuffle these cards into the relevant deck(s) during setup and proceed as normal.
Add no more than one copy of any sneak peek or promo card.

Lockers & Coat Check (Upgrade - Guest Services)

Secret Base (Upgrade - Feature)
Active only when the attraction has a Lockers & Coat Check.
Park Step: You may use an action to draw three Event cards and choose one to keep.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Red Skies: Fw 190 Squadron
description:
This is an expansion set for the WWII aircraft miniatures game Blood Red Skies by Warlord Games and designed by Andy Chambers. This expansion includes a squadron of German Focke-Wulf Fw190 fighters and additional accessories to add to the core game.

The Focke-Wulf Fw 190 Würger, also abbreviated as Fw 190, is a single-seat, single-engine fighter used by the German forces after 1941. Alongside its counterpart, Messerschmitt Bf 109, it became the backbone for the Luftwaffe's Jagdwaffe. On its debut combat, the Focke-Wulf was superior to the Spitfire V, which happened to be the Allies main plane at the time, in almost every way. Mostly suited for low-medium altitude fights, the Focke-Wulf proved to be the superior plane until the Allies introduced the Spitfire XI.

Components included in this expansion are:
6 Focke-Wulf Fw-190 Fighters
6 Advantage Flying Bases
1 Set of Double-sided Pilot Skill Discs
1 Aircraft Card
1 Doctrine Card
6 Aircraft Trait Cards
1 Waterslide Decals Sheet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Hour of Need: Judge and Jury
description:
A stand-alone expansion for Hour of Need, giving you everything you need to play with 1-2 players ... or create a 1-6 player experience when combined with the Hour of Need core box!

This expansion adds 2 new heroes and their unique fixed decks to the roster: Judge and Jury! It also contains 1 new villain and their unique fixed deck, the nefarious Punchline! 2 brand-new issue decks await as well (complete with their own boards), providing you with exciting new locales to explore and schemes to thwart!

Also contains everything you need to play such as dice, clue cards and tokens!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: ORGANISM
description:
Your new awareness emerges all at once. You know immediately, before you even recognize your own existence, an all-consuming hunger. Hunger and also…. fear? Because somehow you know, you are not alone. Beneath these immediate drives lies something deeper, a spark, a joy, a hope. The glee, the audacity to split, to drive a wedge in your very self and become two. And through two, infinity.


ORGANISM is a game of growth, multiplication, and struggle for 1-6 players. Wielding the simple actions of EAT / GROW / MOVE / CIRCULATE the minimal ruleset is maximally integrated and generates a tight yet boundless decision space. Amplified by a set of mutation cards which expand the rules in countless subtle and not-so-subtle ways, it is really a family of related games in a single box that can never be truly exhausted.

Each player controls an Organism composed of three elements: EAT, MOVE, and GROW. In the beginning, each organism contains one of each element, which is a requirement for your organism to live. If an organism lacks one of these three elements at the end of the turn, it dies.

Players take turns either eating food, moving into new positions (possibly coming into contact with other organisms or even dividing into separate organisms), growing new elements, or circulating food within their organism. When any elements of opposing organisms meet, the conflict is resolved by removing one or more elements from the board. You win the game if you capture a certain number of the opposing player’s elements (or just eliminate them entirely from the board), or if you attain three separate organisms at the end of your turn, in which case they are well on their way to spreading across the globe.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Connections, Hexagon Grid, King of the Hill, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Set-up

name: Ranking!
description:
Ranking is a party game for the whole family. Each player must order the 5 options creating their own Ranking, trying to guess the actual order. To do this, players use 5 cards that shares icons with options.

Ranking es un party game para toda la familia. Cada jugador deberá ordenar las 5 opciones creando su propio Ranking, tratando de acertar el orden real. Para ello, los jugadores usarán 5 cartas que comparten iconos con las opciones.

name: Chamber of Wonders: Stranger Things
description:
Born from the fantasy of the Chambers Of Wonders community, this expansion will bring you the best oddities around! Make room on your showcase, the Strangers Things are coming!

Stranger Things expansion adds 12 new pre-determined cards to increase the replayability and variety in your Chambers of Wonders games!

—description from the publisher

name: Prowl: Clans & Cunning
description:
Prowl is a quick, competitive, highly interactive strategy card game for 2 to 5 players.

By manipulating the various animal factions, players scheme to ensure that the one they’ve secretly chosen emerges on top.

Do you favour the brute strength of Autumn, or Spring’s insidious magic? What of Winter’s corrupt officials, or Summer’s desperate sellswords? Every clan has a host of colourful characters, each with their own special abilities.

Pit the clans against each other, switch sides to keep your enemies guessing, and accuse your opponents to forestall their plans.

As conflict threatens the animal kingdom, your only loyalty lies with the victor.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval, Political
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Take That, Track Movement

name: Dangerous Space: Year-Long Adventure Set
description:
Jump into the far future where eager ship jumpers try their luck at salvaging derelict starships.

Introducing Dangerous Space, the followup to the breakout 2023 success Dungeon Pages.
Dangerous Space is a dungeon crawl experience in futuristic starships.

This solo, roll & write game has a tactical emphasis on dice management and careful placement.

With more puzzle-optimizing challenges than Dungeon Pages, combined with an all new tech tree, you’ll find yourself racing the clock, dodging enemy laser blasts and confronting some deep space terrors.

Year-Long Adventure Set
Every Friday in 2024 you will receive a new sheet. Each new sheet will introduce a new mission (Rescue, Retrieve, Commandeer, and Eliminate), and each month will introduce a new character with their specific tech tree, and a new ship. Each character top can be cut off and combined with a ship/mission bottom for a new way to play.
categories: Dice, Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Kickstarter Edition
description:
Back from the dead and better than ever! Run Fight or Die: Reloaded is a revamped and refreshed edition of the Richard Launius game Run Fight or Die.

In the game, you play a hero trying to survive wave after wave of zombies coming straight for you! You play as a unique character with your own character traits including a minor, major and super combo. You'll need them to fight off the zombies move closer to you every round. You run from location to location, searching for weapons and survivors in a desperate attempt to stay alive. Survivors may bring new skills to help you in your desperate fight for survival, or in some cases, new challenges to overcome. You'll also need them along if you want to win as every survivor provides you victory points.

This streamlined version removes several decks from the original game, including the Fleeing deck and Event deck. Players rolls six dice instead of five and there are now different combos to mitigate against tough zombie-filled rolls. Additionally, players can now use followers to soak damage coming in from zombies.

The game ends either when one player dies, the Town Line comes out of the locations deck, or when the Mutant Zombie has been put down once and for all. Whoever has the most leadership points among surviving players wins.

Run, Fight, or Die: Reloaded is a frantic first person experience for 1 to 4 players (will play up to 6 with the 5/6 player expansion).

Note: This is an exclusive edition that contains the following promos/exclusives, in addition to the content normally available in the Retail edition. (Source)


1 Mutant Zombie miniature
23 Mutant cards (plus 1 promo listed below)
1 promo Mutant card (Mutant Howl)

1 special edition event die
1 Event die results card

14 other promo cards
8 Loot cards (2 each of Barricade, Fireworks, Flashlight, Lawnmower)
4 Followers (Nervous Thief, Panicked Doctor, Prepared Survivalist, Punk Brawler)
2 Location cards (Cabin In The Woods, Crystal Lake)

2 exclusive Character boards (Soccer Mom, Wanderer)
The solo campaign
Contents as listed here
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Magna Roma: Deluxe Obelisk Monument
description:
This item is a kickstarter exclusive item that adds new game play. This includes:
- An obelisk miniature (for use with Deluxe core game edition) and
- Corresponding monument tile (for use with standard core game edition)

This monument costs 5 Coins. must be populated by 4 meeples in order to score 4, 8, or 12 victory points in the game, depending on each symbol under the Obelisk at the end of the game.

description:
Federation Commander: Briefing #2 provides ships, rules updates, and new scenarios set in the Middle Years of the Starfleet Universe (think the 1960s t.v. show era) for use with any of the base Federation Commander Products: Klingon Border, Romulan Border, or Academy. Includes 70 new ship designs in black and white to photocopy, 10 new scenarios from the border wars of the Middle Years, and a history of the Middle Years "when captains mattered."

Must have a Federation Commander Core product (such as Klingon Border, Romulan Border, or Academy) to play.

The "Space Cadets: Away Missions - Promo Scenarios and Illustrations Book" is a HARD COVER, LIMITED EDITION book that was originally published for Kickstarter backers of the "Space Cadets: Away Missions" project, but a very limited number will be available from the Stronghold Games website once the game is in retail.
